Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine views, cool place”
Reviews.Author: Nancy B
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 52nd floor. The view was stunning. The beds a W hotels are the best in the business. I think for an expensive hotel, 400 plus it was worth the price. Lobby was noisy at night where the bar was, but it just felt cool to be there. Other hotels in the area are priced about the same and I think this one is nicer. Cooler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very well located”
Reviews.Author: sheldon_region4
Reviews.Content: Although rooms are not that big, they certainly are nice and modern. The only thing we did not like so much was the bathroom, it had no bath tub and the bathroom was separeted from the bedroom by a glass wall so it was kind of weird. In terms of service, the staff at the front desk was nice but other than the check in, its was rather impersonal. The hotel is extremely well located and from our window we could see Times Square that was a nice experience as well. In general, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: morrismw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W Times Square for 3 nights from 8 March. The first night was windy and a cable from renovations was banging against the building near our room during the night. When I advised management the next morning we were relocated to a corner suite in a higher location. We had a view of the Hudson River. I would like to thank the staff and especially Nicolas for helping us and making our stay enjoyable. We also obtained advice on restaurants, shopping etc while we wer there. The location of this hotel is perfect for exploring New York right next to the top end of Times Square. You can walk everywhere as we did. Theatres are just nearby. Walk up Madison and back down 5th. For shopping visit Centuray 21. I will certainly stay here next time and again thanks to W staff. Michael .

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel and Staff are WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: quinnnuts
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in NYC for her birthday and our engagement. The staff at The W Time Square went out of their way to make our stay an experience of a lifetime that we will never forget. The hotel is obviously centrally located in Times Square, the Lobby Bar is a great people watching spot and place to grab lush cocktail away from the hustle & bustle of TS. The rooms have all the comforts you come to expect from The W and the view of this property are stunning on TS and midtown Manhattan. The Welcome team and their complete staff went out of their way to recognize our special weekend and if you check in with them personally, you should expect the same out-of0their-way service that made our trip to NYC a memory of a lifetime and one we will be coming back to relive soon!

Reviews.Title: “what a day...”
Reviews.Author: brunette76
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked a hotel room down the street at the Edison Hotel. Upon entering the Edison, we quickly changed our minds and checked out. We walked up to the desk at the "W" and Courtney (I hope I remember her name correctly) was amazingly helpful and accomodating. I explained our story, and she even offered a free upgrade for our horrible day. A beautiful hotel, friendly staff. Our room was stuffy and warm, I will say that. We have stayed at "W" hotels before, and will continue to do so. I just need to figure out what deodorizer they use...wow!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “W Times Square - We had such a great Time”
Reviews.Author: Danny W
Reviews.Content: We are big W Hotel Fans and spend nearly all our Holidays at W. Last year we had a unbelievable Time at W Bali and in September we stayed one week at W Barcelona. Never had such perfect holidays. We love everything about W. The rooms are very stylish and modern, the staff is stunnning and every trip outreaches our expectations every time. We also come to visit New York once or twice a year and every time we come to W at Times Square. This Year in March we spend 3 perfect nigths there and honestly that was the best stay ever. Our Room was on the highest Floor (57!!!), the view was unbelievable. We also had the chance to have a look to the WOW Suite at 57th floor. It was beyond description! Big, stylish, you have so much space and you can even see Central Park! The staff did a perfect job; very friendly, sympathic and attentive. A special thank goes to Patrick Armano (Guest Relation Manager). He made our trip perfect and we promise to come back!! Thanks W and keep it up! All the Best Danny & Ingo

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: arivest
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of weeks ago at the W Times Square. Check in was efficient and quick and the front desk clerk was very polite. We did not use many services so I cannot comment so much on them. We did ask a few questions to the concierge and to the doorman downstairs and they were all very helpful. I am a Starwood platinum member so we were upgraded to a corner room on the 55 floor. Room was spotless and decor was cool like it is in most Ws. Washroom is a bit on the small side, with shower only and not very private (basically separated from the rest of the room by frosted glass walls). We found the room pretty quiet despite the fact we were directly in front of the elevators. The hotel has a wonderful restaurant, the Blue Fin. We had lunch there one day and really enjoy it. You can sit and eat in the bar and have a direct view through ceiling to floor windows on Times Square. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travelers seeking downtime fun”
Reviews.Author: Scott W
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Times Square for 9 nights on a business trip, and I'm a very loyal Starwood Preferred Guest Member. While traveling on business or pleasure I always stay at Starwood properties as my first choice. This W property did not disappoint me in any way, and everyone was extremely courteous, friendly and caring during my stay. One night during my stay I was extremely sick. Housekeeping alerted Whatever/Whenever, and they sent up several selections of tea and a nice note wishing me a speedy recovery. Classy! I had an excellent corner view facing the Hudson River which was recommended by the staff as a better location for business travelers who required quiet time for working. I initially questioned this recommendation, but it was spot on. Times Square is directly outside the door of the hotel, which to be properly enjoyed, should be done from the street not from the hotel window! This property is located in a very central area of Manhattan with tons of excellent restaurants within walking distance or a short cab ride. I will be returning to NYC on business several times in April and May, and Jenna the "W Insider" has already made me feel like an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously people, its not THAT good”
Reviews.Author: cwb75423
Reviews.Content: Not sure how people are giving this place 5 stars. For what it cost, the level of service must surely make it a 3 at best. For starters, you'd expect the staff at a 5 star hotel to actually answer the phone - but the service number was NEVER answered when I rang it. The staff generally seemed disinterested, as if they were all aspiring young actors thinking that they were slumming it at a hotel while they were waiting for their big break. The room (and especially the bathroom) is basic at best - the fact that its got a unique color scheme doesn't change that simple fact. The lifts are so damn dark that it was hard to find the right button.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I recently spent the weekend at the W in times square to propose to my girlfriend and it went perfectly thanks to all the help of the W Staff. I choose the W because of its great reputation and ambiance and I was certainly not disappointed. The bar/lounge on the floor where you check in is great for a drink before you go out or if you just want to spend the night in. The room decor was amazing, we had a rain shower head and there was no detail forgotten. I also called ahead of the big weekend to look at rooms and plan the big night. I spoke to Jenna, their "W insider", and she was so incredibly helpful, i can't say enough great things about her. She helped set things up on the big day and filled in the entire staff on what was going on just in case they needed to help out. To summarize if you want to have a great weekend with exceptionable staff, book at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Petracca
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Times Square, location doesn't get much better than this, but it does come at a cost.    If you need absolute silence to sleep then this perhaps not the best hotel for you. However if staying out late, people watching, going to a late theatre show, mixing it with the people & drinking cocktails to all hours of the early morning is your thing then do not look any further. The W's funky chic design, dim lit lights & welcoming cocktail bar will be perfect for you.  I had 5 great nights staying here, the only downside was the noise of sirens in the early hours of the morning & the not so warm showers I had on three occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in a "Fantastic Suite" for my wife's birthday”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine_Mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Fantastic Suite for 3 nights over St Patricks weekend to celebrate my wives birthday and boy was the suite fantastic!! To start with I will give you a quick overview of the room then the hotel in general and finishing on the service we received, so here goes (this could be a long one); Room: We had a fantastic suite situated on the 53rd floor with views of times square and a view up Broadway towards the park. The views from this high up were unbelievable, you get such an amazing view of the skyline. As Times Square is really busy you do get some noise of traffic and people down below but we did not find this a problem and come on, you are in NYC not an isolated beach location… The room itself was really clean when we arrived and cleaned daily to a high standard, towels were replaced, dishes taken and bed made daily, our cleaner did a fantastic job. As you enter the room from the hall way you come into a large living room with a HUGE corner sofa and massive flat screen TV, there is a desk with some stationary which looks straight out of the window right up Broadway and it almost made me want to do some work from this desk just to have that backdrop… almost…. There is a closet and half bath in the living area as well and some drawers underneath the TV (I have read plenty of reviews saying that there is no drawer space, look harder as we found 4 drawers). The bedroom is through a separate doorway, the bed in here was the comfiest bed we had ever slept on and was just what you needed after a long day of shopping on 5th Ave, we had an iPod dock but didn’t use this, there was another flat screen TV slightly smaller than the living room but still large. As we were on the corner we had a window on two sides of the room which gave us views from our bed of Broadway and out over times square, there is another desk area in here and a REALLY comfy lounge style chair. In the bedroom we also had a closet with a safety deposit box in which was large enough for us to store two laptops and iPads the room had plenty of wall sockets to charge electrical goods. Through a sliding door was our master bathroom which consisted of a large walk-in shower, basin and wc, the water pressure from the shower wasn’t too strong but was fine it did the job. I have read reviews where people have said that the rooms are dark. Fair enough you do not have one main light which lights the room, but there were lamps situated around both the bedroom and living room, all of which give off adequate light. Hotel: The public areas of the hotel are really nice. When you come in through the front door you have a waterfall and water running over head which gives off a calming effect, you take the elevator up to the 7th floor to reach the lobby area which has a bar in there and is lit really cooly lots of purpley pink colours which gives off a fantastic vibe. Everywhere we went in the hotel had a really nice smell, which I did mean to ask what the scent was but I forgot. We had a drink at the bar on the first night, I think we paid $18 for a Corona and a sprite which is a little expensive but given that you are in Times Square and a really nice bar made up for the price. To use the elevator to the rooms you have to insert your card which we really liked, made you feel safer knowing that not just any random person can come up to the room floors. Service: Now this is the area that makes this hotel stand out head and shoulders above the rest. Any hotel can throw money at the décor and build really nice rooms but what money can’t buy is the experience that their staff give you and help to build on your stay. As this was my wives birthday I did contact Patrick from the Whatever, Wherever team and he added some personal touches to our stay which really made my wives birthday one to remember, the service we received from Patrick was amazing I have never stayed in a hotel which offered such a personalised stay to meet your needs. I had also contacted Jarrod prior to arriving to get some ideas for a dinner reservation to celebrate the occasion and he not only suggested the Marea restaurant but which he had the knowledge and experience to know that this restaurant books up a month in advance so he took the liberty to reserve a table for us and by the way, his recommendation was great, the food, atmosphere and night were brilliant. We also went to the concierge desk (in the lobby area) to get some directions and Jarrod once again gave us a top notch service. The girls at check in and check out were all really nice and polite, as I had forgotten my SPG card she found my details on the system to make sure I got my points. In summary I cannot pick fault with the hotel, like I said above it is the service and experience you get from the staff at this hotel which make it my number one choice for New York and in fact out of the many hotels I have stayed in for leisure or business this has been my best experience. I just want to say thanks to Patrick and Jarrod for their help and advice sorting out surprises for my wife’s birthday, you guys made our stay that extra bit more special.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica T
Reviews.Content: I recently took my 8 year old daughter to visit New York City for the very first time. As a special treat, I decided to book us into the W Times Square, figuring it would make the weekend just a little more special. In hindsight, it was the best thing I did. The location is perfect -- central and close to everything. The decor was really cool, both for me and my daughter. Our meal at the hotel restaurant and our one evening of room service were both great. However, what set this hotel apart was the amazing service that we received throughout our stay. Every request we made was happily accommodated, and a couple of minor (very minor) issues that came up were dealt with so quickly. The car service that the hotel provided to get us to our dinner reservation in the meat packing district was a complete bonus. On every level, the service was top notch. To top everything off, Patrick of the whatever/whenever went out of his way to make the weekend for me and, particularly my daughter, so memorable. On our last evening, we received a beautiful goodbye note from Patrick wishing us a safe trip home along with a gift bag full of goodies that we will keep for a very long time. Thank you W and thank you Patrick for making this first trip of my daughters to your amazing city such a special and memorable one. You went way above and beyond and we can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: dd123473
Reviews.Content: Our family traveled to NYC as our daughter was competing in a gymnastics meet. We decided to stay in Times Square so that we could conveniently take in other activities outside of the meet and the W Times Square was recommended to us. We cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location made it easy to get to the shows, shopping and museums we enjoyed. Most importtantly it was the staff's efforts to make our stay enjoyable that really set this hotel apart. We were warmly greated and offered assistance with activities. The wherever/whenever desk arranged dinner reservations for us (which was not an easy task considering there were seven of us!) However it was Alice Allare, the in room dining manager, whose kindness truly cemented this as the only place we will stay in NYC. When we returned from the meet, she engaged our daughter in a conversation as we rode up the elevator. About a half hour later, there was a knock on our door and Alice was standing there with a gift bag and a personalized letter congratulating our daughter on the results of the meet. Alice certainly made our stay very special and one I am sure our kids will remember their whole lives. Thanks so much for a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeff P
Reviews.Content: I recently made my first trip to NYC for business (3/12-3/15) and stayed at the W - Times Square. I had read good things and gotten a recommendation from a co-worker to stay at the W. Even before I arrived, I received great care. Patrick and Paola answered many of my questions before my arrival and from the moment I arrived, I felt so comfortable. They gave great suggestions for my wife to do during the day as she traveled with me and provided the utmost customer service. They truly believe in the Whatever/Whenever philosophy and were immediately responsive to any of my requests. I've never reviewed a hotel before, but they exceeded my expectations and were so attentive that I just had to post. I have no hesitation giving my full recommendation for this property.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING 5 STAR EXPERIENCE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tami3369
Reviews.Content: March 17, 2012 This is the first time ive ever taken the time to write a review.I had to take the time to do it because i was blown away by my experience at the W!!! Had a bad Starwood experience at another hotel, but Starwood and the W beyond made up for it!!! From the hand off from Starwood customer service to the W Time Square manager Patrick it just got more fabulous!!! The Manager Ricardo was amazing he made sure our whole trip and room experience was OUTSTANDING!!! From the bellhop Francisco to Francis the doorman to the front desk people the service was stellar 5 star!!!They all made you feel like you were the only guest at the hotel, everyone called you by name,all the way to house keeping who was sooo friendly and took time to talk to you and make sure you had everything you wanted!!! My best NY hotel experience ever, and ive stayed at what were considered some of the best..The W has beyond earned my business for life!!! The W is my new home in New York!! These people really got Whatever,Whenever..!!!! The location was great and the hotel beautiful, but the staff makes this hotel a must stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: clickonline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for a few nights and was upgraded to a Fabulous suite and it was "Fabulous"! We were in a ~700 sq ft suite on a high floor overlooking Broadway. The room was very nicely furnished and the bathroom was very luxurious! It was a great overall experience. The hotel is right on Times Square so you are in the middle of all the action. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: camfa70
Reviews.Content: Even before we checked into the hotel I received a very positive vibe about this place. When I called to make my reservation, I had a few follow-up questions and Patrick from the front desk cheerfully and kindly provided me with the information I requested. Then, from the moment we actually arrived at the hotel we interacted with numerous friendly staff members. Jenna from the W Insider department greeted us immediately after we checked in and asked if we had any questions. When she became aware that this was my teenage daughter's first trip to NYC, Jenna seemed as excited about it as we were. She also informed us that we received a room upgrade. (I am a Starwood Preferred Guest member, and depending on availability, such upgrades may be possible. I asked about this upon making my reservation, but made no assumptions.) Upon entering our room, we were blown away. We were upgraded to a suite which had an awesome view of Times Square, a separate living area with bonus powder room, an honor and mini wet bar with a small fridge. We also appreciated the box of chocolates and W shaped pretzels that were provided. As we were unpacking, we were contacted and asked if everything was ok with the room! Well, of course the room was more than ok; it was amazing. Although we greatly enjoyed exploring the city and doing as much as we possibly could, it was always a pleasure to return to the room because it was so fantastic. We could not have asked for a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Travelling to NY for work is always pretty fun but I wasn't too stoked on staying in Times Square. I chose the W because I have stayed at several (~15) W's worldwide and they are all pretty consistent, clean, comfortable, and trendy. Sometimes I think overall they try to hard but I appreciate that consistency and like that I don't have to leave the hotel to have a drink and socialize because the W bars are usually pretty fun and busy with travellers and locals. Overall I was very pleased with the W Times Square. As expected the rooms were well equipped, very comfortable beds, and good style. Surprisingly for a W in metropolitan area the room was actually quite large. I didn't feel cramped as you do in W Chicago City Center. Due to the unseasonal weather (75 degrees in mid-March) the first night I arrived my room on the 56th floor was pretty unbearable with heat. I called and a very nice maintenance man came up and tried to fix the problem. He did his best but I ended up having to sleep with the window open. The following night I had a fan brought up and it was still pretty hot. That next morning I was considering looking elsewhere for the remaining 5 nights of my trip but was very pleasantly surprised by an email from a rep from the concierge desk (Patrick A from "Wherever Whenever") checking in on me as he noted I had called for the same issue twice. He offered any assistance that I could think of and showed he truly was concerned for my enjoyment on the stay. That was enough for me, I very much appreciated him taking a few minutes to check in on me, and with the weather cooling off a bit there were no more issues. This great customer service has convinced me to try to stay with the property this time again upon my return in a few weeks. While it was pretty annoying that an expensive hotel couldn’t adapt to the weather, this level of customer service made up for it . Now on to the "above and beyond". Patrick had asked if there was anything he could help me with while I was in town. I mentioned I wanted to get some discount tickets from the TKTS counter in times square but could not do the line as I was there for work. Over the next several days Patrick let me know he was seeing what they could do. To my surprise/amazement/delight he did better than helping me avoid the line to buy tickets - he provided me amazing seats to an amazing show (Jersey Boys). Even though the customer service already displayed made up for the slightly uncomfortable first nights, this was something that I won't ever forget and kicked the stay up from a very solid B+ to an unquestionable A. Beyond Patrick every employee I encountered had a smile on their face and was more than willing to help in anyway they could. The front desk clerk was surprisingly cheerful for dealing with the throngs of tourists and the taxi helpers were also very cordial and helpful. If you want to stay near Times Square you won't go wrong with the W. Good gym, very good restaurant on-property (BlueFin), and as I mentioned great service. I left the location ranking blank as that is all dependent on what you are after. To me NY isn't Times Square and after checking it off the list I would want to stay elsewhere. on the other hand there is a ton to do around there, it is pretty cool just sitting out and watching the world go by, and you are close to a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Another Magnificent Stay at the W!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fausto P
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W with my family while we were in NYC for a short vacation/business trip. We always stay at the W, and this time was even better than last! All the staff at the W are excellent, and they truly care about your experience. My kids love it here, and everyone we interacted with was extremely helpful! The location is great because it's so close to everywhere we needed to be. I recommend the W to everyone I know staying in the city, and we will be staying there next time too! (A special thanks to Jim and Francis for their help and excellent customer service!)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lvnn
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing, but we saw only the back of an advertising panel; the rooms are very small, nosy and dark. Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reliable hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: london_travel_guru
Reviews.Content: The W as has been said before is a great brand experience and despite the chaos outside the front door (it really is on Times Square) there is a very relaxing calmness about the place that is very welcoming. There are some points about the W that I would change - I hate hotels that still charge for internet access.... I hate hotels that don't as standard provide coffee and tea (or Espresso in the Radisson Blu) making facilities, and I hate the clear plastic box of goodies for me to buy. But having said that there are still so many plus points, I love the darker atmospheric lighting, the staff were amazingly efficient and polite and helpful, and the bar is a great place to start or end your night and has an energetic buzz about it. If you can, opt for the highest room available, I was on 53rd floor and the view was fantastic, plus the ability to open the windows (even just a little) just makes a huge difference to a room. All in all, I would highly recommend the hotel and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at the W and incredible view!”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: The W experience began prior to our arrival at the W. I made contact with Patrick Armano, a Whatever/Whenever Talent Coach at the W in Times Square, and told him of my intention to propose to my girlfriend while we were in NYC and he took it from there. Patrick had the room set up prior to our arrival and my fiance was so surprised when we walked in to it. Patrick had added some personal touches to the room that he and I had discussed and it looked incredible. Patrick was extremely helpful with anything from the location of the room to recommending places to go within NYC. Upon arriving at the W you are greeted and made to feel welcomed. I loved the look of the interior of the W from the lobby area to the elevators it takes you away from the busy city outside of the doors. The view from the corner room we stayed in was incredible. We looked out over Times Square and were high up in the hotel so the view went very far. The room was extremely clean and set up very well. The bed was comfortable and the room was stocked well if you wanted any snacks or anything to drink. We ordered room service after midnight and the food was brought to the room very quickly and was very good. I highly recommend the W in Times Square and speaking with Patrck Armano is a must if you're looking for further assistance. Patrick was extremely professional and helped me to make our engagement memorable. I look forward to staying at the W in Times Square again! John

Reviews.Title: “Interesting, funky hotel in the heart of it all.”
Reviews.Author: aedrbf
Reviews.Content: The W would not have been a choice for us because of cost except for the fact that we had a free night. So off we went. The location is on the corner of 47th and Broadway in Times Square....right in the middle of it all. The lobby...or living room as they call it, is on the 7th floor. It is what I would call "bar dark" as there are no windows. Very modern in design. There is a bar in the area which was very busy with young professionals and a restaurant at street level The Blue Fin...we did not eat there. Our room was across for the elevators but was quiet...I was pleasantly surprised. Our room had a king bed, lounge chair, desk area, closet with one robe, shower but no tub, and the door and one wall to the bathroom were heavily frosted glass. The color scheme is a brown/taupe with burnt red and grey. The lighting was not what I expected but they do have a personal light on each side of the bed that is great as it gives light for reading without disturbing the other person in the bed. They charge for Wi-Fi in the room. If you want a coffee maker you need to call for it. There is a stocked refrigerator and a box full of snacks and other items you might need to purchase. The staff at the front desk was pleasant. We arrived by car and valet parked....the hotel does not have a space to pull in so you just have to double park and look for the valet person. Parking can set you back $70. This is an expensive hotel....NYC is expensive but this hotel can easily reach $500 or more. Glad we stayed for free.

Reviews.Title: “Cutting-edge grunge already a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: Cornheiser
Reviews.Content: The W New York Times Square has all the bases covered....good food, clean and well-appointed guest rooms, extremely helpful and friendly staff, fantastic views from the upper floors, central location for tourism, and one big plus...the guest-room windows are not sealed shut! If this was any other hotel, there would be nothing at all to complain about. Having said that, this is a W. Any W is all about grunge-chic impact and off-hand, hip cool. Here's where this W is getting a little tired. From the start, anyone could have guessed that the interior decor for this hotel had a short shelf-life. Even though the hotel is just over 10 years old, the decor looks 30 years old. The entry lobby's faux waterfall effect is still captivating, even though the mortar around all the stone and glass wall cladding is dirty and discolored - and for some reason, the space smells moldy and sour. The bar on the check-in lobby floor has no windows, and it looks like a druggy teenager's basement bedroom. Finally, slowly-but-surely, it seems this W is moving its retail store into the guest rooms. The room I stayed in this past week had a large plexiglas box near the door with all sorts of merchandise that I could purchase. If I want something, I'll go down to the retail store in the lobby, thank you very much. Overall, still a great hotel for the basics, but the W image is getting tired at this property.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway - Patrick Made all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Anddavis11
Reviews.Content: New York is a fantastic city, but sometimes its important to get away and the Hotel can be an oasis to get some quiet away from the hustle and bustle. Several months back I staied at the W-Times Square for the first time. The hotel is everything I expected. What I didnt expect was upon checking in was recieving an E-mail from Patrick from the Whatever/Whenever desk. Patrick was fantastic, he wanted to check in and make sure we had everything we needed, answered our questions and made us feel appreciated and very special. Ive been back multiple times and each and every visit Patrick has checked in and made sure that I recieved the same level of consistant service. The W Times Square isnt the the least expensive hotel in New York, but because of the treatment I recieve, the extra $50 or $100 is well worth it. Im actually going back this weekend and looking forward to seeing a few shows!

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: RogerRolfRoger
Reviews.Content: As a frequent hotel guest, I find the W to be very modern, clean and well appointed. This stay I got upgraded to a suite. Fantastic. I have not eaten at the hotel during prior vists, so I am eager to try Blue Fin. The only downside were the bright lights just in front of my window

Reviews.Title: “Whenever / Whatever in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Pat_Jon
Reviews.Content: What sells for this hotel is its close proximity to the oft-photographed/filmed Times Square. It is literally right there when you step out from the hotel. Located just off Broadway at 47th Street, it has a Starbucks just across the street, TKTS discount ticket booth a few more paces away, walking distance to the multitude of restaurants in Hell's Kitchen and, of course, the theatres for Boradway musicals. The rooms do not stand out for me. Room size is not impressive compared to other W properties in other cities and countries but I understand this is quite the norm for Manhattan hotels. Apart from the relatively small size of the room, I felt that the lighting of the room is a little too dim. It is probably an extension of the supposedly hip and loungy design of the hotel. Further, the walkway from the lift to the room is also dimly lit. As a matter of fact, I thought it was a little too gloomy with light grey walls and metal doors. If you generally prefer a room that is more cosy and cheerful, you will probably have to look elsewhere. But if you have a tight schedule in Manhattan, this is a sure bet for you to cover the quitessentials of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, superior service, great staff, quiet rooms with a view!”
Reviews.Author: 1oc
Reviews.Content: For the past couple of years, I've almost exclusively stayed at one of the other W's in New York. Then, I thought I would try the W Times Square. Well, I regret not trying this hotel before... this place is the best. 1. Perfect location on Times Square. 2. Staff are ultra friendly and helpful. Everyone from the bell desk, front desk and their Wow department was extremely helpful on my two recent stays. 3. Rooms are ultra modern, clean and hip. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are quiet. 4. The general manager actually responded to a couple of special requests personally... in today's world, I would never expect this, but him and whole staff went overboard in making me feel welcome. 5. Special mention about Raina-Rose Fernandes, who is the Director of Whatever/Whenever at the property. She coordinated something special for my wife's 40th birthday party, which was so far above and beyond my expectations. I don't really see any negatives with this property. I've now had two perfect stays and many more planned in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Whatever Whenever W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: corduroy
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the W times square the weekend of February 18th.  It was the occasion of our 15th anniversary and prior to arriving we contacted Patrick the hotel's Whatever Whenever Coach to let them know we were celebrating a special occasion.  Just to put things into context, we are both SPG gold members and we've had great upgrades and treatment from most of the Starwood properties we have stayed at. Needless to say, when we checked in at the W Times Square, we were blown away.  Thanks to Patrick, we were upgraded to a beautiful corner suite on the 55th floor, 5511,  with a great view of Times Square and the city (you could even clearly see central park from one of the windows) with a full living room a powder room and a large bathroom.  The room was also decorated with rose petals which lead from the door to the bedroom, and in the bedroom, the bed was decorated with more rose petals and bliss chocolates in the shape of the number 15, along with handwritten card from Patrick wishing us well.  Fantastic!  Upon returning from our first night out, we were again surprised with a bottle of Prosecco and a note from Jenna from front desk- again fantastic!   In fact all the staff from front desk to the bellman and doormen to the Living Room Bar were always helpful, affable, easy to chat with, and got things done.  The hotel itself is still a unique and great property.  From the cascading water on the glass walls and ceiling of the ground floor entrance lobby -a serene diversion from the frenetic vibe of Times Square-to the loungey atmosphere of the lobby and living room bar, to the great beds, super bliss products, cool contemporary design, fantastic views, central location, and seamless service, W Times Square can't be beat.  The hotel has a great informal chill vibe - not too quiet, but not too crazy either- while still providing a sense of modern luxe.   Don't hesitate to stay here if you're thinking about it.  You will not want to leave. Thanks to Jenna and Kelly at front desk,and especially to Patrick who made our stay memorable, incredible, and unforgettable. Some tips:  If you have brunch at Bluefin, you get a free good cocktail (mimosa, etc) and get the lobster club or the lobster benedict - good food and great view of the action at street level on Times Square.  Sit in the front room (the bar) for the view. The W Times Square has a great shop-W the Store-with some great cool stuff which may be hard to find - bought a great canvas backpack and cashmere scarf -make great souvenirs. For a view of Central Park go to Columbus circle and take the elevator up to the mandarin oriental and have a drink in the lobby bar-floor to ceiling windows and a fantastic view.   Carey car service was great for us - top of the line Escalade - took us from the hotel to a bar we wanted to go to one night, and to JFK when we were leaving for a great price - ask for Nancy.   If you're thinking of the Campbell Apartment at Grand Central  Station for a fancy drink in old school style grand New York, give it a miss take a pic and don't stay- the place is very dark and snoozy with uncomfortable furniture- try Bemelmans at the Carlyle or the King Cole Bar at the St. Regis.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tjm100
Reviews.Content: The Central location is great, easy for midtown, shopping and getting to restaurants. The rooms are functional but small and there is little room on the desk to work. The place is a little too cool for a business visitor but run efficiently and rooms are well isolated so you don't hear noises from the street. The bar

Reviews.Title: “Whatever, Whenever (and they mean it)”
Reviews.Author: Dean H
Reviews.Content: Summary: great rooms, amazing location, throughtful staff. I would certainly visit again. Just left the W Hotel following a 4 night break in New York and enjoyed every minute of it! As it was our first time in New York we had booked a Spectacular room as we wanted to soak up the views of the City however we were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a Corner Room that overlooked Times Square on check in. The room was well decorated, the bathroom was stylish but above all the views were amazing. The location of the hotel also means that you really are in the heart of the city. All the staff at the hotel we bumped into were pleasent and professional. The concierge recommended some nice restaurants that were in keeping with the style and feel of the hotel and made us reservations. By the time we left the hotel we really did get the impression that "Whatever Whenever" was more than just a cheesy slogan; nothing seemed too much trouble. It was our first time at a 'W' brand hotel and it impressed. Patrick (whatever/whenever talent coach), seems to have the best job in the world - Making people happy. The smile on our faces when we got back to our room from watching the Lion King to find the soundtrack playing in the background was priceless. When there is very little to differentiate between hotels, it is the thoughtful little things like this which count and that's the reason I will be recommending the 'W' to family and friends. In the interest of providing a balanced review, the only really minor negatives were that the Corner Room has very limited storage space, this made storing lots of clothing, luggage etc a bit difficult especially if you want to keep the minimialistic style of the room (that said you will spend most of the time looking out the window and probably not notice the messy room!) Second, In a world where you can get free wi-fi internet with your morning coffee I still struggle to understand why large hotels continue to charge for the service. However the charge isn't extortionate should you require the internet for whatever reason and I believe it is free for premier members so those on business should be looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Amazing staff and management.”
Reviews.Author: chickenfriedhummus
Reviews.Content: We had a girls weekend at the w - two moms and their 14 year old who were celebrating their birthdays. The w was fun and has fantastic location. The management went out of their way to make the girls' birthdays special. Upgraded our rooms, made sure they were connectin, sent us some bday desserts to the room, and gave us lots of great restaurant tips. Rooms are cute. A little worn but clean. All staff super helpful Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Just left the W Hotel after a 10 day stay starting 15th Feb 2012. We chose a Cool Corner room on the advice of the Guest Rooms relations manager and were really happy with the recommendation. Cool Corner rooms overlook Times Square and you instantly feel at the heart of NYC looking out at the views. One of the reasons we choose W Hotels is the comfort of the beds and after a day walking in NYC they absolutely make the difference. Around half way through our stay, some idiot above left the tap on in their room, which resulted in a leak into our room. We were instantly moved to an even better room and the staff could not have been more helpful. I wont go into detail as to what they did for us, but I can say it really did make it the most perfect stay. The Hotel itself is right in the heart of the action and is a close walk to the shops of fifth avenue, a 10 minute walk from Central Park and next to a subway station so onward travel around Manhattan and beyond is very easy. From the door staff, through to reception through to Whatever/Whenever it really is a personal level of service that I have not experienced from other bland hotel chains. We could not recommend this place anymore!!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the W a lot”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at an Amex Platinum Fine Resorts rate of $279 and was upgraded to a one -bedroom suite with a great view. - Room was modern, functional, clean and comfortable. Fruit tray, welcoming card, excellent cookies and complimentary water upon arrival. -The corridors are a bit dark an unappealing but the room shined. - You're right in the heart of Times Square so it's noisy but isn't that what you signed up for? - I needed toothpaste and rather than have to buy it at triple the retail price, I simply asked the registration desk and was given a tube free of charge. Sometimes it's the little things. - I like the ultra sheik lobby (7th floor) with the nice bar scene and trendy feel to it. Dark but well appointed and plenty of available, friendly staff. - Elevator banks to room floors are a little bit clunky - multiple sets of three lifts in two separate corridors that play out back-to-back. This can get a little congested. No big deal to me. - Hotel restaurants is large and you may be seated upstairs, which is beautiful but the stairs can be a chore for those not up to the task. Menu is heavy seafood. Food was good+. Service was average. - I don't care to stay in Times Square when I'm in NYC but if I do, the W will get the call again.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: Nfirst
Reviews.Content: Our stay began at check in. We met Patrice and Adam at the desk. Patrick was training Adam. They were such gentelman. I checked in with my husband and son. I was sick with a bad cold. We decided to get another room for me. Patrick told us they were sold out for that night but said he would see wait he could do. Two minutes later he was back with a room. We left to go to a show and when we returned there was chicken soup and tea. What a caring thing Patrick did for me. I've stayed lots of hotels and never was treated like this. Ive been coming to the W for ten years. The first time I was there was my husbands 40th birthday. They help me surprise him when we got there with 20 balloons and a cake waiting for us in our room. The service is amazing. I come into the city with my kids and husband a couple of times during the year to go to shows or just enjoy the city for an overnight stay. I highly recommend the W. you can't get better service or the nices people that work there. Thank you so much Patrick you showed me there are people out there that care. And Adam who Patrick is training. So the W will have another amazing man working there. Keep smile guys you were my angel this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the city.”
Reviews.Author: nkllkn
Reviews.Content: The W NYC is the best hotel in the city, hands down. Having tried just about every brand in the city I will not go anywhere else. This hotel is Wonderful and Welcoming. From the momement you get out of the cab and Warmly greeted to when you leave, everything is first rate. I have never had a problem, which I cannot say is the case for the Hilton or the Double Tree (mold in the bathroom is not attractive). Even more important is that I know everything will work properly, they take care of the rooms and are fast with room service or special requests. The hotel is central to everything and first class in all manners. Little things like the warm greeting you get, actually using your name when they talk to you and the positive attitude of the folks (go find Patrick and you will know what I mean). If you want a comfortable room, a great bed, then you need to stay there. You will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A tough customer surprisingly made very happy”
Reviews.Author: 637John637
Reviews.Content: When you get right down to it, you know that there is very little that differentiates one hotel from another. The rooms are all about the same size, they are all clean, generally located near one another and the food is consistently good. What makes this hotel stand-out is the people. While staying at the hotel this weekend, my son, who turned 11 on Saturday, became very sick with a fever and passed-out. The hotel staff jumped into action; they got our rooms ready early, took care of our bags and checked on us routinely. I am a weary, 47 year-old business travel veteran, but I teared-up when I saw The Directors of Welcome, Jamie and Alice, on their knees giving my son a cherry-sprite, pastry and banana as we checked-in. They made sure he got a birthday cake, a ride in the W car to Spiderman and cookies and milk on his last night. My wife, who stayed at home, was blown away by how friendly everyone at the hotel was to us. Stay here - you will be in good hands.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Gozo07
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay with beautiful rooms. The main floor lounge is a great place to meet and have drinks. Rooms are clean, nicely appointed, good size for Manhattan. Price wa fair for NYC

Reviews.Title: “I was pleased until I saw the reviews here!”
Reviews.Author: TMACC1
Reviews.Content: My two children and I had a wonderful trip to NYC! I was pleased with our experience at the W until I began reading some of the reviews here. I booked a spectacular room with a guarantee. When we arrived I was told that they didn't have a spectacular room available. They took some$ off the rate to appease me. When I inquired about moving to a spectacular room the next night, I was told they couldn't move us. Again, I understood and didn't push it. Now, I read how people were upgraded WHILE I was there! Our stays coincided. Furthermore, nothing was done to make my children's stay special, and I let them know I have a son with special needs. I am an SPG member, and a family member of a team member. SO DISAPPOINTED!

Reviews.Title: “unbeatable customer service”
Reviews.Author: kaseinsy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the W Times Square. Before we left I contacted Raina-Rose Fernandes who is the Director of Whenever/Whatever. I shared that although I was not a SPG gold or platinum member I would value her input on the hotels appropriateness for my children (ages 4 and 10). I honestly never expected to hear back more than a standard response regarding the suitability of the hotel for all ages. Instead I received a voice mail followed up by an email from Ms. Fernandes welcoming me and ensuring she would "wow" my children on their trip to New York. She asked their ages and likes/dislikes and booked us into a "room with a view". When we arrived to our Spectacular Room with 2 double beds on the 53rd floor my kids certainly were "wowed"....the view was breathtaking. There was a gift bag with a hand written note along with a Yankees mug, a statue of liberty, little leather notebook and key chain. Upon returning from an exploration of TImes Square (literally right outside the doorstep) there was a knock on our door and we were handed a big plate of fresh cookies and bottled water. My children certainly felt like "VIPs" and we were all enamored with the vibe of the hotel - the music, the lighting, the incredible smell on the elevators! What happened after we left the W is what will remain with me when choosing a spot on my next visit to NYC. I realized I had mistakenly left my 4 year old daughters "blankie" wrapped up in the bedsheets in our room. We called Ms. Fernandes and she instantly addressed the problem - with a prompt call back to us saying it had been found. We headed back uptown and she was standing outside in front of the hotel waiting for us to hand over the blanket so we would not have to be stuck waiting in the the crazy gridlock traffic of Times Square. She shared that she had a young child and knew the importance of the situation! This could have really ended our trip on a sour note but instead we were lucky enough to have made a personal connection with Raina-Rose. She absolutely took our trip to NY to the next level and left us with unforgettable memories (and a happy ride home with our daughter sleeping soundly holding her blanket). There are so many hotels to choose from in the area but the customer service we experienced at the W was invaluable and the location is certainly hard to beat. Thank you so much Raina-Rose!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Stay”
Reviews.Author: Craig B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Times Square for a four day business trip. I have stayed at this hotel at least fifty times over the past decade, and I always find the hotel comfortable, convenient and with a helpful and courteous staff. However, this particular visit was truly exceptional. Not only was I upgraded to an incredible suite on the 56th floor, but the staff went out of their way to be helpful and accommodating to attend to every conceivable need. I was frequently greeted in the hotel lobby by staff members who not only knew my name, but wanted to be sure everything was perfect during my stay. The gym at this hotel is great, and the room service is not only attentive, but offers several healthy menu choices. This is my home away from home in NY and I definitely recommend this hotel to business or leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravel1055
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W for a business trip for 4 nights. The hotel is very modern and ideally located in the heart of Times Square, making commutes to nearby offices, restaurants, etc. very easy. The staff was very friendly and prompt. The rooms were a decent size for NY standards and well decorated, but were very dark to effectively do any work. I had to turn on every single light and was still wishing for more light. To no surprise, the room service is very expensive for very standard items so be prepared. Overall though, I think this is a great hotel and would likely return for another visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Martina H
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing hotel upon arrival we got an upgrade to a spectacular room on the 33rd floor, very classy hotel location is great round the corner from Times Square, couldn't ask for better location, staff were friendly. the room was immaculate very clean view was lovely from our room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay this week at W NY Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Calvena E
Reviews.Content: Just spent a wonderful 4 days in New York attending Westminster Kennel Club. Stayed at the W NY Times Square and loved every minute of it. They promise to Wow you, and they did. Everything from the greeting when I arrived to the beautiful room and all my interactions during my stay with the staff were spectacular. If I needed anything, it was provided. And Patrick, the Whatever/Whenever Talent Coach, is awesome. He surprised me several times with special things during my stay. He is a great representative of W Hotels. The location was perfect with short taxi rides to Madison Square Garden, Starbucks right across the street, and always something happening in Times Square. Dinner in the Blue Fin was great as well. Concierge suggested a fantastic budget wise Thai restaurant which was such a winner - cheapeast meal I had all 4 days and one of the best. I would highly recommend the W New York Times Square for your stay in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, moderate quality”
Reviews.Author: bmarkhasin
Reviews.Content: The W is located in a great tourist location, in the heart of Times Square. It is close to all of the Broadway shows, as well as most of the off-Broadways. Decent dining options abound in the area, and they are all reachable on foot. The hotel is typically New York in style, trying to be young, modern and chic. It succeeds in some cases, but doesnt quite make the grade in others. The rooms are reasonably sized, perhaps a touch too small as is common in NYC. We found lighting to be a problem in some rooms, and had to change rooms as a result. Our first room had a single small recessed halogen light in the ceiling of the bathroom. You could barely see your hand in front of your face. No lighting in the shower or adjacent to the mirror. The second room was better, with reasonable lighting in the bathroom. The living area also suffered from a lack of sufficient lighting. We turned-on every light and kept the window fully open to take advantage of the daylight, but after sunset the room was dark and dreary due to the taupes and browns used decorate. The bathroom had a great rain-shower (no tub), and also had a cool frosted-glass wall which helped a bit with lighting. Sound proofing was good, and we had a quiet stay. The best thing by far was the exceptional bed. I had one of the best sleeps ever at the W. My wife was critical of the lack of closet space, which was almost fully used-up by winter coats. The Bluefin restaurant downstairs is quite good, and the bar on the 7th floor is always busy and is a great place to people-watch. Overall our experience was good, and since all we do is sleep at the hotel, the small nits are not as critical in this case. I would recommend the W if you want a decent hotel in Times Square at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Times Square NYC”
Reviews.Author: Ray S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been booking with W Times Square New York since 2002 celebrating every special occasion as the W Hotel experience is never disappointing and the most exciting, fun , romantic Hotel in New York City and the W Talent Coach Team of Francis and Patrick are main reason we continued to return to W Times Sqaure as they are truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Always chic and hip with great service (except in lounge bar)”
Reviews.Author: spgISLANDtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times and it is definitely the hipster spot in NYC. Views from rooms are incredible given over all the bright lights big city in Times Square. They cool lounge with great ambient lighting on the 7th floor, the entrance on ground level with the water coursing through the floor and ceiling, Blue Fin restaurant, Whiskey Bar....place is always rocking. Rooms are nice and crisp with trendy furnishings. I am Platinum SPG so can't comment what the room size is for standard since they always seem to give me some sort of upgrade so the rooms are not huge but good size for NY. Service is great except in lounge bar they are always non-observant and kind of float around expecting a decent tip b/c the price of the cocktails is staggering. Don't expect to be quickly served and you will go thirsty. Cocktail waitresses are useless if you are not a big party.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay and Best Service Ever - Patrick you are a STAR”
Reviews.Author: Kelly H
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square is now officially my favorite hotel. I booked a "girls" weekend with teenage niece and my mom and as a SPG Platinum, emailed Patrick Armano (Whatever/Whenever Talent Coach) to inquire about a possible upgrade. I also asked if he had any ideas how to acquire tickets to any fashion week event. Patrick delivered the kind of thoughtful service that I NEVER thought possible and certainly lived up to his title! First, he gave us a fantastic 50th floor King Suite upgrade - 2 bathrooms (good for 3 women!), gorgeous furnishings and to-die-for views of Times Square. He also gifted us tickets to a fashion show as part of Mercedes Benz Fashion Week - these are seats that cannot be bought - he just gave them to us! This kind of trip does not happen in real life. Patrick also went out of his way to create an amazing event for my 13 year old. He had a red carpet placed in the room, a disco ball and lights glowing and some other treats for Sara including a SmashBox makeup kit! Amazing, Patrick would not even allow us to show our appreciation. The overall service at the W was excellent. All staff were cheerful, professional and attentive. Patrick checked in regularly and offered additional helpful support throughout the weekend. I stay in hotels at about 200 nights per week. This is now my go-to property when in NY. Unlike the experience of some of the other reviewers, i found the room to be in excellent condition and very traveler friendly. Great amenities, awesome view and helpful staff combine to make this hotel a "5" in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms starting to show wear and tear, lower floors can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Verdensvant
Reviews.Content: Great location right by Times Square. I stayed here for three nights in February 2012. I was on the 52nd floor which is a good thing considering the windows do not insulate very well against the noise. The room had an OK size for New York, but what was once a very modern hotel about 10 years ago is now starting to show some obvious wear and tear. The bathroom has a frosted window to the bedroom, so you get a pretty good view of what your room-mate is doing in there. Also, since the sliding door to the bathroom didn't really close completely shut, you would hear everything as well. The bar is nice, busy and trendy, with great cocktails, and the concierges are quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “World Class Whenever Whatever Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rashida M
Reviews.Content: I recently surprised my girlfriend with a trip to NYC for her birthday. My decisions to select the W Times Square and to contact Patrick Armano, Whatever/Whenever Talent Coach, prior to our arrival were two of the best I have made in my entire life! We were welcomed with a special package full of food and beverage vouchers along with heartfelt birthday wishes from Patrick and other key staff members. Upon entering our room, my girlfriend's favorite wine, other favorites, and a fabulous dessert awaited us! We were on the 55th floor and experienced spectacular views of Manhattan. Carmen and the In-Room dining staff were extremely accommodating and professional. Jared and Jennifer at the Concierge desk were amazing, as well. Whether we were seeking directions to the Gershwin Theatre or a mouth-watering Mediterranean restaurant in Gramercy Park, they got us there! The rooms oozed sexy and chic as they do on internet photos. And the location was central to EVERYTHING I planned for this bday trip. I provided the instruments for Patrick Armano and he created the magnificent symphony that will play over and over in our memories for a lifetime. Our experience was first class. I will stay here again and again. The W Times Square and Patrick Armano are 'Simply Fabu!!!' R. Mathis

Reviews.Title: “Interesting choice”
Reviews.Author: cinclus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our base for a 7-days vacation in NY. As soon as we checked in we discovered our room wasn't available because the truck with the new stock of linen was still on its way to the hotel. We therefore got the breakfast for the whole week offered by the hotel which I found great. The suite was roomy and plenty of space with two bathrooms although one didn't have any shower. I tend to appreciate the W furniture but I found the lobby too dark and without a distinctive design but a blend of meaningless pieces. Unlike many other hotel, the concierge was helpful and able to spot my wishes (restaurant speaking) and made me avoid touristy places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Trendy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAEWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel over the past weekend and we really liked it. I wasn't sure at first, because it does seem a bit cool and trendy and I thought it would be uncomfortable for that. But it was great - the service was friendly and helpful, our room was exceptionally clean - and we LOVED the Bliss products - the store had some nice items at average prices. It was very quiet; the street noise did not reach our room on the 21st floor. The only drawback was arriving at the hotel by car - we drove in and had a hard time following the directions we pulled from the hotel Web site. Yes, the hotel is located on Broadway technically, but we had to turn just before the hotel on 47th (I think) to reach the valet. When we got to the valet after a few trips around the block, it was a bit disorganized and we had to wait, double-parked, for a bit too long before it was cleared out. Lots of honking behind us!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Views and Staff”
Reviews.Author: kidic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel in Time Square for a few days for business and vacation. The staff was top notch! We arrived early and they had our room waiting for us, and even put us on the highest floor (57) where the views of the city were excellent! The room was cozy and spacious for a NY room in that area. The concierge and the front desk staff were extremely friendly and were always there to help when needed. They provided wonderful dining recommendations as well as on the spot service when it came to needing an umbrella or extra toiletries (you can't beat the Bliss products!). Overall, we love the W Hotel line, and the location in Time Square met all of our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, in the middle of everything.”
Reviews.Author: Audi_yes_BMW_no
Reviews.Content: As a frequent hotel guest, I find the W to be very modern, clean and well appointed. This stay I got upgraded to a suite. Fantastic. I have not eaten at the hotel during prior vists, so I am eager to try Blue Fin. The only downside is the sirens from Times Square at all hours, even 31 stories up.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with the W!”
Reviews.Author: KarenL4u
Reviews.Content: Always enjoy staying at a W hotel! This is my first time staying at the W New York and it provided to be a great experience! Love the chic atmosphere, rooms, service and best of all Bliss brand toiletries provided in the rooms! It is a great place to people watch and you can easily embrace the "New York" scene just by hanging out in the bar. The Bliss spa was nice, but it didn't feel as "luxurious" as it should for the price you pay for services! Regardless, would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Patrick made my twins dreams come true”
Reviews.Author: OleMiss4Ever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have boy and girl twins who turned 4 years yesterday. We wanted to do something very special for them, so we decided to take them to NY to see Mary Poppins on Broadway. After we secured tickets on ebay (great 5th row orchestra seats at a super price), we went through American Express to get the special. Decided to email the W to let them know how special this trip meant for us. Patrick Armano replied that he will make sure it was special and wished us a safe trip up there. First, he gave us a better upgrade than AMEX gave us and the room was INCREDIBLY decorated in a theme of Mary Poppins, that our children were excited and the look on their face....PRICELESS! We called the front desk to thank Patrick for a great experience! If you want great service, great rates and great food, stay at the W. After this review, we will call AMEX to let them know how great the W is.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible expirence”
Reviews.Author: alex m
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, but the service is horrible. If you have any problems, they have great difficulty in meeting you. Especially in the lobby bar. The girl in the bar said to my face that would not serve me!! absurd!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, small, hot and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Rosie111965
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in Times square for the weekend. Room was so hot that I had to open the window in January. Thermostat did not work. Open winnow made the room very noisy in Times Square. Hair in bathroom, dirty desk area. Would choose another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better properties in NYC and the immediate area....”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Typically I like W.... Not this time. No service, small rooms....just not a great experience as compared to their Miami and other large properties. Everything about this property is 'average'. You want contemporary....try the Andaz Fifth Avenue? YOu want luxury in this neighborhood...go across the street to the Intercontinental. If you get a good value here, fine. Dont expect a real luxury experience though...more of a 3 star property in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Best Times Square Area Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dlp58
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W New York Times Square while on a business trip, and have stayed there previously when travelling with one of my children. Both times I found the room compact but well laid-out, clean, comfortable bed and the location simply cannot be beat. Being in the heart of the theatre district, it's incredibly easy to get to and from the show of your choice and a very easy walk to any number of restaurants. An added bonus is that due to the southbound traffic on Broadway having to turn west on 47th it's usually very easy to get a cab from in front of the hotel. Blue Fin, the hotel restaurant, is excellent if you like seafood. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Robokrugie
Reviews.Content: Every couple of months we like to stay overnight in the City, if we have an occasion or just catch a Broadway show.. this past weekend was our 4th stay at the W hotel within a year.. The location -middle of Times square is perfect if you want to catch a show or dine in any of the great restaurants nearby..But what we love the most about the hotel ,-besides that it's a beautiful boutique style design and the rooms are spacious,we always ask for a corner room if it's available-the view is magnificent..- is the customer service-it is by far the best in all the hotels we stayed.. anything you need, it's no problem, I have bad alergies, so they made my room hypoalergenic by the time we got back to the room .. I highly recomend this hotel, it will be our choice again for our next trip to the City..

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Marymanager
Reviews.Content: over the top friendly and helpful staff, blue finn is amazing, hotel is wonderful, very nice experience, location couldn't be better! the room next to me was having a domestic dispute in the middle of the night, I called the front desk because of the noise and by the time I hung up the phone security was up there to resolve the situation, very pleased, room service was super fast as well

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy A
Reviews.Content: Pros: my family was here for our thanksgiving holiday, it's an excellent location if it's your first time in nyc. even though times square is a very busy location, our rooms was very quite. the W bed are always comfortable so sleep is not a problem! Cons: the bathroom glass door is frosted so its a bit see through if you have the lights on, so if you are traveling with friends or family, its a little uncomfortable. i wish the AC can be lower than 65, because even when we turned it down to 65, the room was still quite warm. it took also the valet 30 minutes to get our car cause W parks it elsewhere. if you are driving into the city, its a pain trying to get into W times square and don't trust your GPS, you'll end up going round and round.

Reviews.Title: “High quality customer service”
Reviews.Author: CFeldman555
Reviews.Content: I recently made an error in my reservation and at other establishments it has often been met with irritation instead of compassion and empathy, not the case at the W. The reservationist suggested I get in contact with the general manager. I sent an email about my challenge and was met with kindness and consideration. It left me feeling that there really are other companies that care to the depth that I about the importance of service. Thank you Jim Mcpartlin and kudos to your excellence!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sginmd
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the W Times Square a few times and it is always very nice. The rooms are spacious by NY standards and the beds are comfortable. This past time we stayed on the 26th floor - there was still some noise from Times Square - which I don't think is avoidable. Other than that, the room was quiet. Location is great, front desk staff were nice and helpful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay/Incredible Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DavidPalmer310
Reviews.Content: I was recently in New York City for business and stayed at The W Times Square. From the moment I arrived, the bellman, the front desk and all the staff were incredibly friendly and so helpful. The room was beautifully decorated and the service could not have been more attentive. I really felt that they went out of their way to help. The concierge made several recommendations for dinner and all were incredible - not tourist but great food. From the towels to the linens, this was first rate. DAP/Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Danni0713
Reviews.Content: I really love the W Hotel. The rooms are modern and spacious for NYC. My friend and I were on the 54th floor which had an amazing view, the only small issue was the fact the room was super hot even after adjusting the temperature to 65, the room still felt like a sauna. I will say that the beds are heavenly, I actually thought about calling the hotel after I left and asking where they buy their mattresses. Also, because it was so windy outside the building of course is going to have some sway but it was actually making the door to the bathroom squeak. These small hiccups would not deter me from staying at the W again. The hotel is centrally located to everything you could ask for, the building decor is modern and serene. The living room bar is a great place to relax and have a drink. If you haven't stayed at the W before you must do so.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: candilturner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from July 4 - July 11, 2011. The location of the hotel was exactly were we wanted to be. The food was great and we could walk almost anywhere from our hotel. My only problem with the hotel is the room. I'm not really a fan of the hot pink, but I can and did get over that. My major concern was the bathroom. The bathroom walls and door were clearly see through. You can't go to the bathroom in privacy! Everyone can hear and see what you're doing without even being in there with you. Now, I was on vacation with my boyfriend so I wasn't too embarrased. But I saw a couple at the hotel with their young daughter (she couldn't have been more than 4 years old) and thought how are they handling this situation? If daddy goes to the to use the restroom, how are they handling this? I would not want my young daughter seeing her father using the restroom. This is a great hotel for couples, but I would not recommend this hotel if you have kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best W in New York!”
Reviews.Author: sexonthebeach150
Reviews.Content: You get the best of the W here - the trendiness, high caliber of service from the staff, and a good quality room product and overall experience. This hotel is trendy. The entrance is located right off Times Square, and you don't get the same pretension from the doorstaff that exist at other W's within the city. It's low key, but the doorstaff are helpful, and the Acura car ride service is also located here as well. The check in is located on floor 7, which is also the "Living Room," filled with young socialites. The staff at the front desk are fun, passionate, energetic, and welcoming. There's a nice store with W products off to the side of the check in desk. The elevators are super fast, per what you find at U.S. W's. They also have the distinct W smell, which is wonderful. The rooms are a great size for New York City (at least 300 square feet), with modern amenities, comfortable beds, waterfall showerheads, etc. I LOVE the sinks that the hotel uses...the design of the sink and incorporated faucet is so modern. Some minor cons about the rooms: the quality of the tv's is not great (may be more a function of the program quality than the actual hardware itself), and great views of the square are not found in all of their rooms. In terms of service, their staff is fantastic. The Whatever, Whenever line is courteous, prompt, and responds to your every need. The in-room dining folks take the time to answer your questions and remind you that they're available all night - couldn't be better! The managers are also present at checkout, and they're helpful, kind, and response. One helped speed up my checkout by taking my keys, printing me a bill, and sending me on my way. I also emailed the GM after checking out to share my experience with him, and he quickly and courteously responded. It really reflects the overall responsiveness of the management at this property, and their pride in their great product. I've stayed here a handful of times thus far, and any time business brings to or near Times Square, you can certainly bet that I'll be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time at the W!!!”
Reviews.Author: sophielew
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Friday Jan. 20th, we were let into our room by 10:30am, we were visiting as a Birthday present for our 17 year old daughter. The desk staff and concierge and the door men could not have been nicer!!!!! This held true throughout our stay, we were there for the weekend. Our room: We got a room on the 50th floor, which was way cool, of course the lobby, elevators, entrance, the boutique, just everything was quite swanky and totally cool!!! Our room was very cool as well!!! The beds of course were great, just as we expect at a W or Starwood hotel. The bathroom privacy issue some have was just not a big deal for us at all, I mean when my daughter was in there, we were on our bed (nearest to bathroom) and we couldn't even see it, there is a wall at that end of the bathroom and of course it was easy to work around, not a problem, I mean if you just don't look that way when you know someone is in there, then it is not an issue! It was all nice and clean just as we would expect from the W! The ONLY issue I would have with this hotel is that the lobby restrooms are not kept as clean as they should be, the bar area was "hoppin" on Sat. night, and it looked like on Sunday afternoon maybe someone forgot to look in on the cleanliness of the bathroom. Of course most of the time you wouldn't even go into the lobby bathroom, but our flight didn't leave NYC til 8pm, so we had ckd. out earlier, and I only went into the bathrooms as were we leaving and collecting our luggage which they stored for us on Sunday!! (another nicety) Overall stay was Terrific......BLUE FIN was terrific, service everywhere was TERRIFIC!!! Would def. stay here again, in fact we look forward to doing so!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: TravelEatPrayLove
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I checked in for 3 nights, ready for a few busy days of shopping and dining before heading home for Christmas. Our room was quite large for such a small hotel, with a separate living room area that could be closed off, plus an extra half-bathroom. So that was nice. We were starving, so we headed down to the main floor to grab a quick bite at the sushi restaurant there - great food, average service, but definitely worth checking out. Next, we went back to the check-in floor to meet up with a friend (who happens to be a W employee) for cocktails in the lounge. We sat down at a table and waited for service. And waited. And waited. We looked around for a staff member, and saw half of the servers standing by the bar, all tapping away on their iPhones. As a former server myself, I especially know this is super-unprofessional, but after my boyfriend went and informed them that we would love some service, all was well. This hotel is busy, loud and bright - our room faced Times Square directly and even with the blinds, it was still bright and loud all night. That said, if you live in the heart of a city (like we do), this won't be too much of a problem, but don't book here if you're looking for a quiet, romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jane01030
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a central hotel that is VERY trendy and the place to be seen ... then book to stay here. The staff we extremely friendly and nothing was too much trouble. One VERY useful tip given to us - when you go to Macys to shop remember to go up to the Vistors centre and get your discount voucher prior to shopping - you just need to take your passport. The Bed and Pillows are the most comfortable I have ever had in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
