Reviews.Author: Rich N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Times Square over 300 nights the last 10 years and it is perfect 10 on most stays. I have never had a bad experience. From the greeting and send off from big TJ or one of the other professional bell man, to Jenna and T or one of the other guest liaisons making sure my needs are met on the stay. The professional concierge always recommend the best places to see and visit. The free transportation around the city in the W Acura is always nice on a rainy day. This is also the only hotel that I stay at where you actually see the GM. Jim is always out and around the hotel. The hotel location, style, atmosphere and energy along with the very professional staff keep me coming back stay after stay. Th

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the W Times Sq”
Reviews.Author: William R
Reviews.Content: i stay in NY about three out of every four weeks every month for business...mostly 3 days each visit. I've been staying at this W now each visit for the past six months. What a great place! The staff are very friendly, including the reception, bellmen, housekeeping, and in room dining. The atmosphere is always upbeat and fun. The rooms clean and always in good shape. It's in a perfect location...right in the heart of Times Sq, and is convenient for me because my office is on the west side nearby. Many of great places for dinner nearby, or for shows if you are there for pleasure or entertaining. You really can't go wrong. I've stayed in standard rooms, upgraded rooms and suite too. All consistently nice. Room service is very good and always on time...and the restrurant downstairs...Blue Fin...is fantastic...breakfast, lunch or dinner...all have been great!

Reviews.Title: “Try the Lexington Ave one 1st”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: All ok, nothing wrong, just that there is a better W a few blocks away. That said, I had a great weekend, but that was more to do with who I was with :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - dark interior”
Reviews.Author: Bing375
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square is situated in a very accessible location in NYC. Overall the service is great and the rooms are clean with nice linen and great water pressure. I was relatively high up so I couldn't hear much noise from Times Square or the streets but occasionally you hear cheering in the middle of the night from TS. My main point of dissatisfaction is the decor/theme. This place is always under-lit, from the entrance to the lobby, and even the rooms, it feels like it's always evening and you're in a club. The main lobby and elevator have club style music playing from mid-afternoon into the morning. Apparently this is the W's decor style, so my comments are more about personal preference than about the hotel service and amenities themselves. One area that needs a complete refresh are their event suites which are very sadly dated.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad - overall average”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrs_snuffles
Reviews.Content: The location is good if you like mid-town and the hustle and bustle of Times Square. Room size was adequate although there appears to be a peculiar design fault with the bathroom. It is surrounded by opaque glass that leaves the person in the bathroom unable to see out, but remain entirely visible to anyone looking in - so if you want privacy from your travelling companion when in the shower or on the toilet, this isn't the place for you. Another design fault was the lack of storage space - a large closet, but an extremely limited number of drawers (only 1 drawer in fact). The bed was very comfortable, and no sign of bed bugs although the mattress could really have done with a vacuum - lots of hair and fluff. The carpet was a bit dirty, and was not vacuumed throughout our 5 day stay. Similarly the duvet cover was not changed (although sheets were changed every other day). The gym facilities on the 10th floor were first rate and the concierge was helpful in making restaurant reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Unusual service for Starwood property”
Reviews.Author: LSC1976
Reviews.Content: As a birthday present, my husband took me to NY for a little getaway. I was very excited to stay at this well known W. I've stayed at another W in the city, but never the Times Square. I was disappointed with our stay. Our biggest problem was that our room was always cold because our heater kept turning off. They sent an engineer 3 times during our stay and then we ended up with a space heater in our room. They did not have robes in the rooms so I would always request for one. The first time I requested no one ever came up. The engineer that was fixing our heater had to track one down for me. A couple days later, I had to request for another robe and no one delivered that either. I was also disappointed with the gym. I envisioned working out with a view of TS but all I got was a wall. Nothing spectacular. Our stay was so bad, they gave us vouchers to Blue Fin and points on our Starwood card. Manager handled it very graciously, but the stay was so far off from what a stay at a Starwood property should be. Highly disappointed, especially when the room cost $700+ a night

Reviews.Title: “Great New Year visit”
Reviews.Author: JCVan
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in New York and we stayed in both the Times Square and the downtown W locations ... actually a great tip as we had 3 nights downtown right next to ground zero and 2 nights in the Times Square location which was a fantastic way to explore the city without having to travel too far. Cool, funky, hip hotel. Great location right on Times Square. The lobby bar is quite small but intimate and fun. Overall a great chain I would recommend. The only disappointment was the poor service in Blue Fin - not what I was expecting from the reviews I have read previously.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Saralin
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that we have stayed at in New York City. Location right in the heart of the city was very convenient. Hotel staff very helpful at all times. Compared to other hotels in NYC, room was actually larger than we expected and very clean. The concierge was always available and very helpful in the living room area in front of the elevators. The hotel living room/lounge bar was always buzzing, great place to hang out before retiring for the night. This area is also where you can get the free wi-fi. At the main entrance there is also a great restaurant (Blue Fin) serving breakfast, lunch and supper. The only downside was the $65.00 a day to leave your car at the valet. I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at W Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: tina032003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the trendy W Times Square at the end of November 2011. The hotel, staff and facilities were exceptional! We had a great stay. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, and bigger than other NYC hotels I've stayed at. The hotel staff was very helpful and receptive. There are restaurants/lounge inside the hotel which seemed trendy and we're always packed with people. The location was in the heart of Times Square, which was a huge plus for us. It was close to everything, and we able to return to our room easily during the day if we wanted. One tiny drawback (for some) - the bathroom walls were made of frosted glass so you could see shadows of whoever was in the bathroom...not much privacy! Overall, I would definitely go back the next time I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable stay at an Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigapplered
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W Times Square to celebrate our anniversary. As avid Starwood fans, we have stayed at most of the top Starwood properties in NYC, and many of their top properties around the world. I have to honestly say that the service we received leading up to and during our stay were the best we've ever had. I put in a special request in advance to Patrick Amano, and he and the rest of the W staff far exceeded even my lofty expectations. How's this for a recipe in awesomeness: start with an amazing upgrade (the top-floor Extreme Wow Suite and the views were jaw-dropping, even for New York veterans like us), add a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries, throw in some rose pedals lining the pathway to the bedroom, and top if off with a hand-written note and some personalized amenities in the room from Patrick. Needless to say, my wife was overwhelmed (as was I) with our experience. We had dinner next door at Blue Fin - ask for a table upstairs along the glass wall for a good mix of privacy and energy. The fish was great as was the service, and the live jazz complemented the mood and feel of the night. Since our stay was just one night, we didn't get to experience all that the W has to offer. But I can say without a doubt that should we get a chance to once again escape for a night and want a hotel that provides an oasis of cool in the madness that is Times Square, the W is the top of the list. With a staff like this, who truly seem focuses on going above and beyond, prepare to be Wowed. As they say, Whatever, Whenever. You just have to ask.

Reviews.Title: “READ READ READ”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: OK,,,, i am a frequent visitor to NY as my brother in law lives there as well as it is a convenient overnight layover going to or coming back from London....I have stayed at most SPG's hotels in NY and have stayed at the W Times square before and didnt have a steller time but not a bad time either kinda mediacore.. This trip had a purpose.. My good friend Jim McPartlin just relocated from W Hollywood to W Times square and i had to visit to see if he was already starting to do the wonders he did in Hollywood at his new stomping grounds... 1) Was upgraded even "before" i got to the hotel and the suite was awesome and very convenient as it was next to the elevator (no it is not as noisy or loud as you woul think) 2) Jims staff was on their A Game and this was even before anyone new that i knew Jim...the curb crew was in abundance and very helpful and informative and told you exactly where to go just in case you have never been to the hotel before so you didnt look lost trying to find the reception...and also whenever you walk out the door to leave the property you have 2 or 3 people askig if you need directions...need a cab...need a limo etc etc.... they are very concerned you have a great impression when you arrive and leave the hotel...even if it is to go next door to the deli.. 3) Girl at the recption was VERY helpful and cute as a button...she was from New Orleans and there was not a quiestion you could ask that she didnt have the answer to....once she pulled my profile up she was very effecient and courtesy...they were VERY informed as to my profile and preferences....they asked about my fiancee and what type of wine we would prefer..(she loves wine but i dont drink),, so i informed them i was traveling alone this time....they asked about my dogs (when we stay at the W Westwood my dogs are very popular with the staff)...once again i had to inform them i didnt bring them this trip..(they had a complete Doggie set up for 2 dogs already waiting in my suite...aaaawww...my dogs appreciated the pics i took and the thought that went into the gesture)...and they had a massive fruit basket for me and refilled it daily... 4) after i was cked in i was introduced to the Dir of Ops for the hotel as Jim was not due back in town till the next day and he was very helpful and gave me his card and personal # in case i needed "anything" while i was in town,., great guy... My room was fantastic...very quiet...and every nite they brought me an amenity to take the edge off the day.... the 1st nite it was pretzels shaped like a W with either cheese or spicy mustard...next day was large bottle of Sparkling water and a bowl of mixed berries...they didnt miss a thing :) Lobby was very Airy and very friendly...a bit loud at nite as it turns into a lobby club...DJ and lots and lots of beautiful people....great place to people watch.... ONLY downside...hotel is wired for Sprint..so i had VERY limited ATT service...when you are in the lobby during the daytime there are lots of people there makeing calls n texting as that is the only place "in" the hotel you will have good service... its kinda funny...i didnt feel so bad when i reliezed i wasnt the only one who was out of contact with the world.. finally saw Jim on my second day and he told me about all the changes that were upcoming and i will definately be back to give you all an update...there will be a BIG change to the lobby and lounge so it will be even more atrractive and user friendly than it already is...cant wait...next time though have to bring the missess as she is from south beach and loves a good lounge or club... BTW...only thing i can really even complain about was that when i finally was going to take a nap i realized that my bed was broken...lol...sssooo loud...i called down to whatever whenever and explained ...literally within 2 min's 2 guys from engineering were at my door and 5 mins's later all was fixed...didnt have to wait forever for anyone to respond to my concerns and were extremely effecient and quick.. also...room service... FANTASTIC...food is awesome and room service crew was very very polite and effecient...food tasted great and follow up phone call to make sure i had all i needed etc etc... bottom line is that if you are heading to NY...you might as well go to the best hotel in the city that gives you access to everything and anything you could possibly need to do or see with little or no inconvenience...and a fantastic people watching perch... go and enjoy....if you have any concerns or problems i am sure that the W and Jim himself will bend over backwards to make sure that you are left with an Ultimite W Experience I am sure now that the new GM is on location they will only get better than they already are (will be hard but i am sure somthing can be improved...lol) Enjoy Mike

Reviews.Title: “Semi Regular Guest”
Reviews.Author: R_Gaffney_UK
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every time I come on business to NYC from London which is about 5-6 times per year, a week every time. Its location is fantastic and I love the lobby/lounge bar - a great place to hang out. The rooms are small (as per usual NYC standard) but nice. I think the colour scheme in the rooms is a little dated now. As an SPG gold member, I dont know that I could say we get any preferential treatment at check which I have to say is more forthcoming at other Starwood hotels. Overall the hotel really works for me and id recommend it. In fact, im coming to stay there for a week this coming weekend Jan 23rd 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, but fair warning...”
Reviews.Author: pamlvs2trvl
Reviews.Content: Location is in the middle of Times Square, so you have great access to everything that's a major plus. But it is the MIDDLE of Times Square, so if you don't like crowds, tourists, people standing in the middle of the sidewalk, all kinds of smells, lights 24/7, and noise, it may not be the spot for you. Once inside the hotel, the lobby is a bar/club, so you might be a bit surprised to come back to your hotel at night to find people dancing with a martini in front of the elevator (that's definitely real). I don't mind any of those things, as long as my room gets me away from all of that when I need to. And the rooms at the W are pretty quiet, and I was impressed with the decor, of both the common areas and my room. One big miss though is that they don't have blackout blinds/shades, so you still get a bunch of light coming in from the street (billboards/traffic lights/cars) even when the shade is down. Didn't stop me from sleeping though. Another off-putting thing is the bathroom. No real privacy there. I mean, the lightly frosted glass looks cool and all, and fortunately I was in the room by myself, but when I had friends over, I felt like a total creep because you could see shadows of them in the bathroom. If you don't mind any of those things, and your main concern is a perfectly located, clean, modern and hip, friendly hotel, the W fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “If you want trendy”
Reviews.Author: Fran W
Reviews.Content: Hotel is definitely trendy - guess I am not there - Room was clean - didn't see any of the problems others noted, but they were right about linens not being provided we had to call. The glass bathroom is not my style - and only one draw!!!! Come on trendy should still be convenient. THe smell in the elevators maybe trendy but if you have sensitivity to smells - it is not good to have the constant smell of perfume in the elevators. Anyway - if you like trendy great place but if not stay away. Also one other problem - rooms were horribly warm and you can't adjust the temp.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe”
Reviews.Author: linfer
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spotless and a very nice size. I would recommend this hotel only if you want to be in the busiest part of New York City. It is located right in Times Square -- perfect walking distance to all Broadway Shows. Has "The Living Room" lounge/bar in it with a DJ. Lively place to have a drink and mingle.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip became a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler_rmk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best hotels I've ever been too. It's right on Times Square where the lights and the people come alive. NYC is one of my favorite places in the world so there was an enormous amount of pressure for this hotel to be amazing. Truth of the matter is, this hotel went above and beyond my expectations. It was beautiful, modern, amazing, had great service, ambiance was great, rooms were high class as well as high tech, and the location once again was amazing! Truly one of the best hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lfarmwife
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights coming in on New Years Day. We made the reservation in October and were traveling with family. We had 3 rooms and they had us all spread out through the hotel. Disappointed they didn't try harder to keep us closer together. The view from our room was incredible and the location of the hotel is ideal for Times Square. We walked to everything very easily. Walked to a Broadway Show, walked to Rockefeller Center, walked to restaurants, and did lots of shopping on 5th Ave. Rooms were a little smaller than expected but this was our first trip to NY so we weren't quite sure what to expect with the rooms. No coffee makers in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The VIP treatment”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyFoe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is happening. Centered with some of the best views of Times Square and an atmosphere second to none. Cannot give enough love to my man Patrick Armano who went well above the call of duty to make this stay unforgettable. You really aren't going to get a more up beat ambiance than at the W Times Square. DJ in the lobby on the weekends and the hotel is packed with people looking to have a great time. Ran into couples, singles, and family with small children all having a blast. Staff gets an A+.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking Service & Bad attitude”
Reviews.Author: JXN48
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel is simply no where near four star - do not be fooled The rooms are basic at best with old shabby lounger chair, not particularly clean with the only highlight we found was the shampoo and soap! Trying to get served in the feature bar on a relatively quiet night, involved waiting at the bar for the lady bartender to finish a 10 minute conversation with her friend. The bad thing was that there was someone else behind the bar with her who told me when I asked him for a drink that he wasn't a bar tender and pointed to the girl talking. A further 5 minute wait without this man telling the bar tender she had customers waiting resulted in both my wife and I leaving! On departing others just struggled their shoulders The check out was not much better - when asking to pay for a late check out we were told the hotel was full so the price would be more than the rate we paid for a full nights stay I understand a hotel can be full but if it is full, it is full and no rooms should be available at all - when I pointed this out the lady manager she told me - well we always oversell so if you pay for the room extension you can keep it for the not justvthe 2 hours you need but the whole night - I am not so sure how the next customer would have felt if I had stayed and taken their room! I chose to spend the 200 bucks they wanted for an extra 2 hours adding to my stay on a nice lunch! At check out I raised my concern but again to no avail, like others seem to have experienced having now read their reviews on trip advisor - something I should have done before I booked! All in all Cusotmer service bad, staff attitude worse and not something expected from a Key Starwood property. While loving everything NYC has to offer and as regular visitors we will not be back to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and lackluster rooms with great customer service”
Reviews.Author: aks28
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with 2 queen size beds at this hotel for a girls night out for a friends birthday. I had expectations for a hotel of this price range and reputation. Our first room was an upgrade upon check in, but when we got in I wondered what the original room must have been like! The room was filthy including scratches and tears on the furniture and smeared handprints in something that looked crusty and white on the inside of the bathroom door. We called customer service and they immediately relocated us. The new room seemed a little better at first, but the bathroom had what looked to be shampoo spilled all over. We were in a rush and decided to get ready here anyway. On our way out we noticed that the view through on the door was not there and there was just a circular hole in the door! I felt violated. We talked to the manager at the desk and they were very helpful and apologetic, upgrading us to a suite and having our things moved. The suite was very nice and had a good view. Unfortunately there was what appeared to be a cigarette burn and hole in the duvet cover. Upon checkout I mentioned this and the hotel comped us our room service bill from breakfast. Overall I can't say enough nice things about costumer service, but I can't see myself staying in another W anytime soon. Three dirty rooms is just too many!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve 2011/12”
Reviews.Author: zimitry
Reviews.Content: We live in Central London and this hotel provided a home from home!! The view was exceptional; we were on the 37th floor. We arrived at the hotel shortly after midday, were greeted by the front door staff who offered to take our bags which we politely declined. Check in was smooth and the room was ready which we weren’t expecting. We’re both in our mid 20’s and the hotel’s vibe was perfect for us, music in the elevators, DJ’s in the living room at night, friendly bar staff who had quite a bit of knowledge on broadway show’s (I think her name was Asia). We booked a corner room and were not disappointed! If we knew the room’s view was that good I wouldn’t have booked the all access passes for New Year’s Eve to watch the ball drop (Waste of money they are too!). We watched Lady Gaga perform from our room! We’re used to the hustle and bustle of City life, but New Year’s Eve in New York is Crazy!! It wasn’t until the 2nd January when things clamed down and life returned to normality. I probably wouldn’t go to New York for New Year’s Eve again but I’d definitely go again. The only down side is the sirens the cops and fire departments have on their cars (Trucks more like!). With a bit of triple glazing I’m sure the noise wouldn’t have woken me up numerous times. Summary Would I stay in W Hotel again: Yes without a doubt! Would I recommend W Hotel: Yes! Can I get a discount on a return trip Jim?: Probably not!

Reviews.Title: “If you are SPG Platinum - never stay here”
Reviews.Author: scotth9494
Reviews.Content: Room upgrades or professional service. Forget it here.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, so-so room”
Reviews.Author: familyoffourNJ
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional but the room was small and we had to call for a privacy curtain for the bathroom. The location is ideal. Parking is $65 per day which should be expected in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but great!”
Reviews.Author: Chew B
Reviews.Content: Always loved that hotel. The only negative is the fact that the rooms are too small in general and the internet too expensive although u can have free access in the lobby. But location is unbeatable and views amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, with a chic twist!”
Reviews.Author: Hrima
Reviews.Content: Had all the doubts when we booked it, but from the moment, you arrive, door man opens your doors, takes all luggage out, and whisks your car away as you proceed to the checki in counter which was managed quickly and expeditiously. The lobby was adorned with a lavender aroma, and various frutty drinks were provided for patrons in line! Yes the pricing is high, but you are in NYC, of course. All personnel was great, all greeted us with a smile and a pleasant exchange. The bar, and restaurants all were above average, with the average drink at $15, and dinner at $50 pp, alchohol included for two.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dewpy
Reviews.Content: If you are after the centre of Times Square here is the place to be, great music 24hrs, but if you would like a relaxed surrounding W Down Town is great.

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the W (the only place to be)”
Reviews.Author: mrswade
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a long list of hotels we wanted to stay at for NYE. We narrowed the search down to two, the W and the Marriott Marquis. We chose the W for the "cool corner room" and the feel of the hotel we got from the pictures. When we got to the W on the 29th our room wasn't quite ready so we were offered drink coupons to enjoy some cocktails in the very comfy lounge. When we finally made it to our room, we were floored with the view. We were on the 38th floor and could here the hustle and bustle of the city when we cracked the window. Perfect room and very spacious for NYC. We could see Times Square from our room and watch Lady Gaga perform during the main event. The bed was very comfortable. I feel asleep in a matter of minutes, that doesn't usually happen to me. The concierge were always willing to help us and the doormen were polite no matter the time of day or night. It was a busy time of year to be in the city and I was very impressed with the customer service, convenience of location (close to Broadway plays, subway, Rockefeller and shopping). I wanted tom comment on the bathrooms since that seemed to upset some guests. The bathroom, I felt was large with great storage for my things. There is an opaque panel that you can see through, but unless you are brother and sister is doesn't really matter. I would come back to the W times square in a heartbeat. This trip was our first from our infant and we were blown away with everything. Thank you W for a memorable New Years.

Reviews.Title: “Central and with great views...dont be put off by the party that is reception”
Reviews.Author: jdain
Reviews.Content: We arrived late night on a Friday just before Christmas and the party was in fuill swing. Consequently it was difficult to hear what the check in receptionist was saying, and the atmosphere generally was unfriendly ( we were tired and wanted sleep). The wrong room had been booked (single beds on our wedding annioversary!) it was our travel agents fault and not the W. The recpetionsist handled it ok and promised us a king sized bed in 2 days time, not great but when they delivered the new room they had done us proud.. a corner room on a high floor. we gradually got used to the reception come party room but never wanted to linger there. The hotel is well situated for midtown and Broadway. One piece of advice, if you are travelling with someone you dont know well book elsewhere, the bathrooms are small,very open open and not sound proof!.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service From Hello Thru Good Bye”
Reviews.Author: Kenneth S
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our weeklong Christmas holiday on the 57th floor with a view of the Hudson River. The staff was extremely busy, yet they welcomed us into the hotel as if nothing in the world were more important. The room was extraordinary and impressive; we were delighted with the Bliss bathroom amenities and overall cleanliness. We used the hotel as a base and ventured into the other areas of Manhattan during the day. The hotel is close to subway stops,walking distance to the theatres, Rockefeller Center, and 5th Ave shopping. After a long day you can enjoy a drink in the living room, head back to your room, and do it all over again in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: NYCWTimesSquare
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the W annually for the past 10 years.From the minute we arrive, the doormen greet us warmly and professionally. All staff, from concierge, to housekeeping to folks you see in the elevators, are pleasant, all seem to truly enjoy working at the W. Our room is always very clean.Truth be told, we were once tempted by another hotel, but ended up transferring back to the W Times Square! The energy of Times Square is fun, and completes the NYC experience. The Blue Fin is a great plea to eat, bar is the best. We recommend the W Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: shrilka
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 8 nights during christmas time and it was chaotic! The things are were good: 1. My room was in 23d floor, and i didn't hear ANY noise, of course there is some noise, but its nothing that u cant stand. 2. Bedroom was comfy Negative 1. Luggage boys are very annoying, always wants money for everything, too friendly, too fake. Every single time he used to pick up the bag of shopping on the end would say his name and let us now that he deserves a dollar, totally annoying 2. The bathroom needed renovation, was really bad made, shower was broken 3. Cleaning was average: the cleaning lady just left shampoo, soap, body butter once in 4 days, although i had already finished it..had to call during 8 days 2 to the reception to ask to bring bathroom stuff. 4. very expensive minibar and food in the hotel. There is a charge of one thing, than another, on the end for the cup of coffee you put pay 10$ plus 10$tax, some other charges and so on 5. Location is really annoying..too many ppl, a big confusion, everyone pushing everyone

Reviews.Title: “Wow of a View on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: islandhopperx2
Reviews.Content: From the trendy water themed halls and walls to the comfortable bed and linens and an all glass bathroom with a waterfall sink, this hotel would have been a wow without the view. Now add a corner room (2401) with a view directly over Times Square 2 days before New Year's Eve and you've got one fabulous experience. Noisy, yes...but it IS New York at the holidays. Friendly, surprisingly yes! From door staff to housekeeping, everyone was friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the W”
Reviews.Author: Lucia C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Time Square. Enjoying Time Square at Christmas is simply amazing. Every staff member at this hotel went above and beyond to make sure that our stay was a great one. This hotel is beautiful and the Living Room Bar was such a comfy place to have a drink with new friends. I cannot say enough about how polite and professional everyone was at this place. The rooms were very cool and the view amazing. I have yet to have a bad experience with the W hotels, but this one was fantastic and went above the W's high standards. L.A.C.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LALAINFL
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at W New York Times Square the weekend of Dec 17, celebrating my birthday. I got a good deal online buy 2 nights get one free, so got a pretty good deal. Perfect location right in the middle of Times Square, close to Subway. Awesome Starbucks right across the street. Fun Lobby Bar, great DJ at night. Bartenders not very knowledgeable, very pricy drinks. Ate at Blue Finn for lunch, great atmosphere, good people watching overlooking Times Square, food was just ok, nothing special, but healthy. Service slow, but it looked like they were short staffed, but friendly. Room view was great, stayed in Spectacular room on 30th floor, heard some construction going on but not too bad since we were never really in room much. Rooms need a serious update, but were clean, decent size. Quick efficient check in/check out, not overly friendly, but did send up a bottle of Champagne for my birthday, which I thought was very nice. Good maid service and great Bliss products. Whatever/Whenever service was somewhat helpful. We rarely saw any staff/Valet in front of entrance, the whole weekend? Great place to stay, if you want to be in the center of all the action, not really a place for families or kids. Overall, a good experience, besides needing a update in decor, a Fun place to stay if you get a good deal, or else just check out the Living Room Lobby Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Like our extended family”
Reviews.Author: Frankthejar
Reviews.Content: The front door guys are so friendly and helpful they make you feel like your visiting old friends! Not to mention that everything else was awesome too! GREAT TIMES

Reviews.Title: “Smoke and mirrors.”
Reviews.Author: Travelerover60
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I am grateful to have had a room for the night. We were comped a room here by another Starwood property when we arrived at that property to find that the room that we had reserved (not a specific room, but ANY room) was not available. This property lives up to its trendy marketing and those travelers looking for what is advertised will not be disappointed. Travelers requiring privacy in the bathroom should stay elsewhere. The bathroom walls are translucent glass and offer no privacy unless the bathroom is completely dark. There is no curtain or shade on the window walls and no obvious way to improvise with a sheet or blanket. So, plan on using the bathroom in the dark if you are a mixed sex two generation family that is used to privacy in the bathroom. Travelers with aging eyesight, i.e. anyone over 40, and/or with depth perception issues, should also look elsewhere. The walls, carpet, furniture and glass are all the same color gray. There are no visual clues to help you find your way around the room and through the the hotel. Plan on feeling lost and/or walking into walls, windows, and furniture. Travelers who prefer to avoid elevators should stay elsewhere. The lobby is on the 7th floor. There are no escalators and the stairs, I was told by the "whatever" desk, take you through the kitchens of the restaurant complex that occupies the floors below. There are only three elevators, so plan your time accordingly. Be sure to ask for your coffee maker when you check in. And check to be sure that the paper cups they send you with it fit under the drip spout. Otherwise, you will be without your first cup of coffee while you are waiting for an elevator to get you out of the funhouse. Or, you could ask in total exasperation for a comped pot of brewed coffee and a real cup to be delivered to your room. I got the coffee and cup quickly, but do not know yet how much, if anything, I paid for it. The speed with which the coffee was sent up is why I gave the W a 4 star rating for service. So, if a trendy bar and trendy decor are what you seek, by all means put the W on the top of your list. If you want bathroom privacy, don't like elevators, like your coffee in the room, and prefer not to feel as if you are lost in a carnival funhouse, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly very kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jim C
Reviews.Content: When you think of the W, it's usually the bar scene and the ultra modern decor. Kid friendly is usually not high on the list. To my surprise, this W went above and beyond my expectations in making my kids feel welcomed. The guys working the valet were great welcoming our kids and joking around with them as my wife and I were tending to our bags and paying for the car. The front desk staff produced a W onesie for our one year old. I've been to a lot of W's but this was the first that went the extra mile to make my kids feel special. A special thanks to Patrick the WhateverWhenever coach for making the stay perfect.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE - NO EXCUSE”
Reviews.Author: Mark_aggs
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE- booked this hotel 4 weeks in advance for a 3 night stay - Dec 17-19. On the second day, 4 of us were woken at 8 am to a "hotel shaking" jackhammer noise and concrete saw noise. There was no advanced notice of this insane vibrating noise, although Francis Gorman (guest services talent coach) said a letter was in the room about the maintenance - there was no letter. Of course we immediately complained - the response was - the maintenance was out of there control and it was a city mandated job. OK, so why not tell/warn us before we booked? The admitted they already knew about the work at that time. The option was basically - if you don't like it, move to another hotel. NO, not an option since that means packing up 4 people, finding a suitable hotel, and wasting a lot of precious time. This action and service is totally unacceptable and the staff that addressed this was arrogant, cocky, and could care less. Low class wannabe hotel that is absolutely TERRIBLE based on my experience. It's not over yet......

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location andvery modern”
Reviews.Author: Marcus O
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the privilege to be located at the center of Times Square. Hence you are near many opitions of restaurants, stores, museums and art galleries. The modernity of W branch is very well recognized at this hotel. The service is good and the room amenities are very clean. Some could find the hotel pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Thinks It's WAY Cooler Than It Is”
Reviews.Author: BruinGirl21478
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the W staff training involves but I imagine it includes handing vanity mirrors to its staff members and having them recite "You are the coolest person ever" as they look at themselves lovingly. No one greets you when you arrive, no one offers to help with anything and everyone looks at you they are wondering why you're bothering them. The rooms are spartan and small and filled with way too many "for purchase" items cluttering up what little space there is. The whole vibe seems to be hipster but it's trying way to hard to actually be hip. The hotel is in the middle of Times Square and feels like you're literally in the middle of Times Square, even at 3am in your room when you want to sleep. The best thing it has going for it is the Bliss bath products, especially the Lemon Body Butter.

Reviews.Title: “Too colossal for a W Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dmptx
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just the location, but this place is huge and really impersonal. The rooms share a lot of furniture with the other W's, but somehow the vibe is just loss. The attention to detail that makes a W experience is somehow missing. The staff seemed nice enough, but nothing really stood out. Bland...thus 3 stars?

Reviews.Title: “Ok needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: mamayeti
Reviews.Content: Clean neat. Here is my problem...not greeted as we got out of taxi. Nobody greeted us first time there didn't know to take elevator. Room clean. Really my problem was for the price I felt like I might as well be a ghost. No personal service and expensive

Reviews.Title: “Modern to the point of inconvenience...”
Reviews.Author: FireFlyChick
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel brand tends to cater to a younger crowd by providing an ultra modern, hip atmosphere for its guests. I'm not necessarily a fan of this "modern" design but I've stayed at several W's before and knew what I was getting into but this W's attempt at an ultra modern, hip design was done so to the point of inconvenience. The rooms in W hotels are always super dimly lit and with absolutely no overhead lighting. The bathroom walls and doors are see-through. I'm not sure about other guests but I don't care who I'm traveling with, I don't want anyone seeing me shower or shadoobie. This trip in particular, I was traveling with my mom and grandma. I had to call the front desk for them to come to the room and put "screens" on the bathroom walls and door. Apparently, this is a pretty standard procedure for them... How about you save yourself the trouble and just separate the two rooms in the first place? Also, check in is at 3pm. I arrived at 3:05pm and our room still wasn't ready yet. We had tickets for a 4pm show and needed to get into our room to change, etc. The receptionist spent a few minutes on the phone with a manager and a few minutes later, a room was ready for us and we treated to breakfast the following morning on the house. Unfortunately, we ended up being charged for the breakfast but two phone calls later, the hotel was able to clear those charges from my credit card. Overall, it's a great location for being a tourist as you are in the heart of Time Square and can walk everywhere. Also, the staff responds promptly to the guests needs and the rooms were very clean and adequate size for New York standards.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JansTippp
Reviews.Content: The W at the Times Square is cool, but overpriced. Entering the lobby you feel like in a nightclub. The rooms are very modern; the lighting of the rooms is low till romantic – the perfect place to invite your girlfriend or wife. The view from my room on the 50th floor to the Times Square was an eye catcher. The rooms are quite small; the wardrobe is a joke. The bath was spacious, but the shower was disappointing and on the way to fall apart. The restaurant on the first floor is excellent for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The rates of the hotel are – like probably of most of the hotels in New York – much too high compared to what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Oasis in Frantic Times Square”
Reviews.Author: SarahM2011
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the "W" in Times Square several times now, and for the area it provides a nice respite from the surrounding chaos. The setup is a tad odd - the check in is on the 7th floor, where one needs to change to a different set of elevators. Room are comfortable and reasonably sized for New York, although you will be much happier if you can get upgraded to a room in the back tower area. The vibe in the hotel is an attempt to be hip and cool, and the staff dress accordingly. The breakfast, which is served, will take a little time. I haven't eaten at their restaurant the Blue Fin, but have had drinks there which were fabulous. I'm not wild about the gym - aside from being small for a hotel this size, it is very dark and since I like to read when on an elliptical machine this is a drawback. Requests of the staff are responded to promptly, there are ice machines on every floor, and the Internet works well. The rooms are pretty well set up for working. Subways are either at 42nd street or 50th, so a short walk, but the hotel is right across the street from the famous TKTS half-price ticket booth. Some of the upper floor windows have views to the river. That part of town makes me crazy because of all the tourists, but the hotel manages to isolate one somewhat from all the madness. Very convenient to shopping and the theater. All in all, I'd recommend it if you want to stay in the Times Square area.

Reviews.Title: “A real W hotel in Times square”
Reviews.Author: michelricci
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W new York at the times square last year. This hotel is new, modern and it reflects a hip atmosphere. Young sophisticated clientele, nice dj, cool drinks and funky food create a cool atmosphere. Room was nice with plenty of amenities, ok size for New York, the concierge was prompt and helpful, housekeeping was fine, the internet was fast and our breakfast was on time in our room. Times square is very busy and loud but once you are inside the hotel you don’t realize it; in addition to that we felt secure at this one, unlikely some other hotels in new York. This is a place we will come back when we are at the city and we recommend it (if you like upscale modern properties)

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay on girls trip!”
Reviews.Author: Tnbeachbum29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The W Hotel Times Square during the US Open in September 2010 and again in September 2011. Although the rooms are small, we weren't in them very much, but they were spacious enough for two women. Room was fully equipped with anything we needed. We ordered room service one night and their menu was easy and service was fast! Receptionists were very cordial - and we thought the price was great the first time we stayed in 2010 - thus the reason we stayed there again in 2011. If you're going to the US Open, it's an easy walk to Times Square, then catch the train to the courts. Also very close to Broadway and to shows and to amazing restaurants. No complaints here..... I'm sure we'll be staying at the W Hotel again for the US Open 2012!

Reviews.Title: “THIS is a COOL place !!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: If you are going to NYC for fun and you want to be at the heart of Manhattan in a cool hip place....this offers it all. Excellent Bluefin restaurant and hip bar in the 7th floor lobby....and GREAT location. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you like that type of thing”
Reviews.Author: Trev550
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in the W Hotel on Union Square when in NYC but was inadvertantly booked into the Times Square W on this trip. I wasn't too concerned assuming (wrongly) that it would be pretty similar in character to the sister hotel on Union Square. In fact the atmosphere was very different. Judging by the DJ playing in the looby when I arrived and the clientele in the lobby bar this hotel seemed to be aimed at the hip-hop 20-30 year old crowd. Not really my thing. On the bright side I found the staff to be both friendly and helpful, the rooms to be chic and clean and, of course, for those wanting to be in Times Square, the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel but rather small rooms”
Reviews.Author: malibumomof7
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated in bustling times square, this fun, safe hotel is well priced and full of helpful staff. The concierge is really helpful in arranging anything from theatre tickets to hair salon appointments. The door men were always looking out for my safety and easily arranged taxis.0 Even in the rain, they were there to make sure i didnt get too wet getting in to or out of taxis. Major subway lines are nearby, along with terrific restaurants. The bar scene is lively and the gift shop is unlike others at most hotels. not full of junky tourist items but really good things in case you are looking for a new item to wear out that night. My hotel room which overlooked the lights of times square was rahter small but not unlike other NYC hotels. good products int he bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W from guest Wendy A”
Reviews.Author: WASweet
Reviews.Content: I am now back in London, England. I would like to let you know that I had a fabulous time staying at the W Times Square (wish I could have stayed longer). This is just to let you know that I would highly recommend your hotel to the people I work with. Thank you for making my stay wonderful; your hotel is in the ideal location. Please can you also pass on your thanks to the reception staff, concierge and cleaning staff (especially Wendy Q) who were so friendly and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Times Square Isn't For Me”
Reviews.Author: camachomarie
Reviews.Content: Why does flavor flav follow me everywhere? I thought I could get away from him by traveling to New York, but nope there he is checking in right next to me at the W. I think he must live by me because I see him everywhere. Why can't I see someone like Clive Owen all the time? We checked in to the 49th Floor / Room 4902 - right outside the elevator. The guy at the front desk was pleasant enough. The room was very ordinary but for NY it was sufficient and comfortable. The views were nice. Then the problems began.... Mr. C went to use the restroom and first off you can see right through them, so hopefully you don't mind people watching you take a poo. I love him to death, but really this is not a wonderful experience. For the rest of the stay anytime he had to use the restroom he went to the lobby. Also, it would be nice to have the sink and shower separate because there were no mirrors to do my make up or hair while Mr. C took a shower. When looking at the toilet seat he noticed there was pee all over and then looked around the rest of the bathroom and it appeared to be very dirty as if it never had been cleaned. Disgusting! I am pretty easy going and know things happen, so we called to have it taken care of before we got back that night. Someone came right away to clean. We complained at the front desk and the woman was very apologetic and said she would give me 10,000 points for my trouble. Great. I am easy. I had forgotten something upstairs, so I went back up to get it and got to my room at the same time the woman who claimed to have cleaned the bathroom earlier had gotten there. Apparently she had gotten in trouble. I felt bad for her for about 2 seconds. She basically accused me of using the toilet and blaming her. She "knows how she cleaned it and now it is a security issue." I just kept saying that I wasn't angry I just wanted it cleaned and we can go on our merry ways. No... she continued....ehhhh I decided to use the silent treatment before my anger turned on. No cleaning lady deserves the wrath of Marie - she has to clean disgusting hotel rooms for a living. She did end up apologizing, but it is a little late I am pissed. I began to just look at her and nod as I bolted for the door to get out of there. We were both standing there for the elevator in awkward silence and in my head I just kept repeating "please don't get on my elevator. please don't get on my elevator *breath* she hit the up button. *Side note* My 10,000 points still have not posted. Honestly, I don't think our bathroom was ever fully cleaned through our whole 4 night stay. Concierge - My husband called down because we felt like getting some good Mexican food. He put him on hold and the phone went silent. My DH thought he hung up so he called back and the guy gave him a lot of attitude. He gave him a few places but when we looked them up they didn't look that great, so when we got downstairs we went over in hopes he forgot us. He didn't. At least he apologized for being rude. We ended up taking one of his suggestions and when we got there the place was closed, but in his defense it did look good and it took us a while to get there. Too bad. Speaking of being closed; the concierge also gave us directions to the Guggenheim. We went out there only to find it was closed every Thursday. Seriously - I don't expect the concierge to know everything but please know when a major museum is closed so I don't waste my time. Location - I wasn't a huge fan of the location. If it is your first time in NY you may like it. It is of course very touristy and there doesn't seem to be a lot of cool places to eat. If I end up staying at a W in New York again I think I am going to try Union Square. On 10/4 - they gave us what appeared to be our statement which I thought odd since we weren't checking out until the next day; it ended up being our neighbors. Shouldn't these be private. I basically saw how much he paid, what card he put it on and if he rented any movies. The good news is I got a better deal then him. Pros - 50% coupons for the bar As a Starwood Gold Member they gave us a late check out (4pm) which was very helpful. They renewed our Bliss products every day, so I was able to load up on them. Travelled 10/2009 - Copied my review from Yelp

Reviews.Title: “Another great W expierence!”
Reviews.Author: Daydreamer222
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at a W hotel and I am very pleased. The decor was very chic from the lobby to the room. Very clean and well maintained. We were upgraded to a corner room when we arrived which was nice. Like some other reviewers said it can be noisy even if you are high up ( I mean, hello, it is Times Square!). But we weren't there to sleep and it quiets down as you get late into the night. You are really in the center of Times Square which makes it very fun. The service was great and very friendly staff. Ate at Blue Fin in the morning for breakfast. Pricey but tasty. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: tidefan4
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the W recently on a quick weekend trip. We booked it using the Starwood website and got a good "internet only/no cancellation" price. I was a little concerned that the hotel might be noisy because of it's location, but found that it was quiet, despite the fact that our room was directly across from the elevators. Since the purpose of our trip was to see some Broadway shows, the location was ideal. The staff was courteous and friendly; the rooms were clean and provided adequate space. The only negative was the lack of drawers for putting clothes away. Since it was short stay, we just left things in our luggage, but for a longer stay that might be inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: logicalanswer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and had a fabulous time. We had a Fantastic Suite that was on the corner of the building and had wonderful views of Times Square. We had a large sitting room, separate bedroom - two tv's. The service at the hotel is top notch - extremely helpful and friendly all around. We relaxed at the Living Room Bar with some great music and enjoyed appetizers and martinis at the Blue Fin Restaurant. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to all the places we wanted to go to, including some excellent restaurants. Highly recommended - We will definitely be back soon! The manager,Patrick, went out of his way to get to know and please his guests and is doing a wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel but needs some renovation quite urgently to really deliver the W promise”
Reviews.Author: Mreckling
Reviews.Content: Very good location and very trendy, excellent restaurant. Service can be improved and the whole interior should be renovated to be truly W like. Nevertheless definitely one of the better hotels in new york. Alternatives could be some of the boutique hotels in meat packing or lower east side. But overall we enjoyed the hotel and ofcourse the city

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Contemporary Feel”
Reviews.Author: brunob00
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice contemporary hotel in New York, this is one of my favorites. The location is right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Times Square, views from the room are terrific, and you get a better than average W experience in the Living Room lounge. Note that this is a W... if you want a quiet, sedate, and bland hotel then select another! Positives: + The valet service for your car is excellent - fast and friendly... They even brought my car back for me when my wife forgot something... The garage is close so you won't wait forever. + This W has one of the best Living Rooms of all the Ws in New York (I think Union Square is number 2). The seating is great and it is often crowded in the evenings. Service is fast and friendly. This is a great destination even if you aren't staying at this hotel... You have to visit! + I've never had a view like this at any other hotel in New York. The views of Times Square are amazing and really make you feel you are in the heart of the city. + The rooms are larger than the other Ws in New York. I love the contemporary furnishings and baths. + As an SPG Platinum member, I have always received a good upgrade at this hotel... Unlike the other W Hotels in New York. + Excellent location for a Broadway show, Times Square, or to be centrally located for sight seeing around New York. + Starbucks is right across the street. + One of the better implementations of the W brand and experience. + The W beds are very comfy. + The Whatever Whenever service is fast and efficient. Negatives: - You are in a very busy area of New York so you will hear taxi cabs honking their horn in the square below into the late hours. - Check-in always seems to be understaffed so be prepared to wait if there are a bunch of guests checking in. - There are big crowds out in the Square sometimes, so be prepared! - Room and valet costs are high though comparable to other Ws

Reviews.Title: “Where are the grownups?”
Reviews.Author: phlashba
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel designed for teenagers and twenty-somethings it is apparently also run by them. I did not encounter one intelligent adult who could solve any problem or complaint during my entire stay. Their over-reliance on cutesy nomenclature is not cute or hip but simply annoying (I'm not going to call the elevator a lift no matter how many times you repeat it). I have concluded that this hotel is for rubes who think it's chic and/or hip; it's not. I would have to say though that my chief complaint was the use of cheap materials in the guest rooms. Bed covers with snags and holes and chipped fiber board and plastic veneer furniture does not wear well and makes the whole hotel look cheap and tacky. I really think this is the reason for the blindingly low lighting throughout. Prices for mini-bar or room service are laughably expensive. As far as the location --- I have only myself to blame; as a New Yorker I try to avoid that entire area. Never again for Times Square OR the W chain.

Reviews.Title: “Literally on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: NCinDC
Reviews.Content: The name says it all. The hotel is situated directly on Times Square, unlike many area hotels that make the same claim, but are actually located a few blocks away. I usually stay at hotels in SoHo or other neighborhoods that aren't so busy, but my Midwestern friend wanted to be in the heart of the Big Apple. His wish was granted. <grin> Overall, my stay was good. I requested a higher floor with nice views and my expectations were met. The size of the room was typical for Manhattan - no room for even a chair but enough space for our belongings. When I needed various items (silverware, extra towels, etc.), the housemen delivered them in a timely manner. The positive and negative aspects of the hotel (IMHO) are the following: Positive 1) I loved the decor (especially the ground floor waterfall) and high energy music. Stepping off the elevator Saturday night and hearing "No Diggity" (don't laugh!) blaring in the popular lobby bar got me ready for a night out on the town. If you're looking for Ritz-Carlton decor and Wilson Phillips/Enya/John Tesh songs playing softly in the lobby, this ain't the place for you. 2) The views, if you're in staying in certain rooms, are spectacular; especially if you're still a small-town boy/girl at heart and love seeing "big buildings". 3) If you want to see one of the countless Broadway shows in the surrounding area, you can't beat the location, natch. 4) The complimentary ride (minus gratuity) to Penn Station in the hotel's Acura was greatly appreciated. 5) The bellman who assisted us upon arrival was very friendly and didn't seem to pressure us for a tip. We still gave him one, of course. Negative 1) Minus the aforementioned housemen and bellman, most staff I encountered were aloof and rarely made eye contact. (example: upon arrival, a doorman grabbed one of our bags from the taxi; my $5 tip didn't even result in a simple "thank you" or smile) Maybe it's the hipness factor of where they work, but still, your main responsibility is to make sure each guest feels welcomed. 2) If you're sharing a room, I hope you're comfortable with him or her seeing the blurred details of you stepping out of the shower or answering nature's call. The sliding door wasn't really an issue, but the blurred "glass" wall-like partition led to a bathroom lights-off policy when one of us needed some privacy. 3) This isn't the hotel's fault, mind you, but if you want access to nearby affordable restaurants and convenience stores, this is probably not the best place for you. (examples: a pack of cigarettes at a Times Square retailer is $4 more than a nearby store; the Times Square locations of Olive Garden and TGI Friday's, places I wouldn't frequent anyway, mark up their food by nearly 50%) Despite the staff and exhibitionist-friendly bathroom, I recommend this hotel for first-time visitors to NYC or theatergoers. I'll probably choose the nearby Westin or Chatwal hotels on my next trip though. Full disclosure: I'm a Starwood employee, but my stay was not business-related, I don't know any of the W New York - Times Square employees, and no one has asked me to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Right In The Very Heart Of It”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting New York City for the first time, or the 100th time, it's never a bad choice to be right in the middle of it all in Times Square. Of course, it can be crowded, overrun by tourists, full of cheesy souvenir shops and overpriced chain restaurants. But it really does put you in the middle of all of the sights you'll want to see - or at least close enough to a subway station to get you there. The W Times Square is an especially good choice. The pros: Right on Broadway in Times Square, easy walking distance to all Broadway theaters, close to ALL subway lines. Rooms are modern, comfortable and large by New York standards. The hotel has the typical swanky W vibe that makes you feel like a movie star, if only for a weekend. Beds are comfortable, bathrooms have ample space (shower only, no tub), and there's a really cool chaise lounge right by the window to take in the Times Square views. Bonus - there's a nice Starbucks directly across the street from the front door (important to me!). It's a very busy one, but you can get your fix close by, nonetheless. The cons: Right in Times Square - so it can be noisy with sirens and honking horns. But even that quiets down by later evening. Also, room rates can be incredibly high. It's tough to find a deal at this hotel because it's so popular and in such a good location. If you can find something in the $200s, grab it. Normally this property is $300 - $400+. There are several W properties in Manhattan. Downtown is the newest, and it's very cool. But it's somewhat remote. The one on 49th & Lexington is the original and is in a quieter neighborhood. But there's something about this Times Square location that has a fun vibe and is in such a great location. Among W Hotels, it's my first choice.

Reviews.Title: ““Very disappointed with the cancellation policy, buyer beware.””
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: I have been trying for the past four days to cancel our prepaid hotel reservation at the W Hotel and booked through Orbitz. Both companies would not do anything for me except keep my prepaid $967. Our business meeting was canceled and both companies gave me the run around blaming each other for keeping the prepaid reservation. I did not even ask for the money back and just ask for a rain check for another day. I again was denied and said they would do nothinng for me. At the end Orbitz offer me $50 travel voucher. I would not recommend staying at the W Hotels no matter how nice they are in the future. This is the problem with America; most companies are so unconscious and have just lost their way in taking care of the customer. It is just all about the money, very sad.

Reviews.Title: “One of Best Stays in NY so far”
Reviews.Author: gokhanHk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many Hotels in Manhattan, This one is one of the bests. Modern and new rooms, Upgraded to a suite room thanks to platinum spg membership. Especially after a stay in Sheraton New York Towers , this felt really like a very good stay in all the ways:) And needless to mention the perfect location at the Times Square. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: Morgan B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for work in August and was very pleasantly surprised. The person working at the front desk when I checked in even came out from behind the counter and walked me over to the elevators-and this was after happily fulfilling my request for a quiet, large room. My room was indeed both quiet and large! I had left my yoga mat in my valeted car and asked the concierge if they had any in the hotel. They did not and this was when I was first told that the staff "had" to say yes to any request, so someone would go out and buy one for me if I would like. I ended up having my car brought back around to get mine, and everyone was very friendly about it. Later in my stay, the doorman turned me onto a restaurant in Times Square that was unique and not a tourist trap. Quite a find for the area! Overall, most of the staff were incredibly friendly. The size, view and decor of my corner room were better than I expect in NYC and even rarer, I had lots of light AND quiet. Hope to stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “Good, But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Brian C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a "spectacular" room with 2 beds. I have stayed at many W Hotels in the past and this one seemed to have much smaller rooms and overall wasn't as nice as others. The rooms were new and clean, however the walls were thin and we could hear everything outside in Times Square despite being on the 31st floor. The bothrooms had a tub, did not expect this of a W property. The service downstairs was great though. The location is great, but next time will stay at the London on 54th instead for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: advocateonwheels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W Hotel in Times Square NYC three times now, most recently this month. My rooms have always been nice, and pretty clean, although when the sun slants in, a lot of the glass furniture and dividers show some dust. Beds are very comfortable. I've always ended up with a shower and I'm not sure any of the rooms have tubs. Warning, this is a very expensive hotel and I wouldn't have stayed here if it had not been paid for by our corporate partner. The hotel is just off the north end of Times Square of 47th Street, and the area is teeming with tourists, so if you want a more secluded neighborhood don't stay here. This hotel is steps from the discount ticket booth at Times Square and walkable (just over a mile) from Penn Station if you take a train to NYC. W Hotels are very trendy in that they have a youthful modern vibe that makes many people who are older a little ill at ease to judge from remarks by my colleagues on our various trips. ("I don't think I'm cool enough for this place." "How do you turn on the wash basin water?") Each room has a great work area. On my most recent stay I got a New Jersey facing room with a partial river view and wrap around corner windows. The rooms also look down on the bill boards of Times Square, which makes for an exciting "I'm in the Big Apple" feeling. The rooms have Bliss soaps and shampoos which are lovely, and a robe and, if you ask, slippers, are provided. On one stay, I asked to have my room changed (it looked out on a cigarette strewn roof) and was accommodated immediately. I love the big bowl of granny smith apples at registration.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced "chic" dump of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: acksailor
Reviews.Content: The Check in lobby is horrible but pales in comparison to what W refers to as a "Spectacular" king room. The room was small, even for NYC, with a bathroom that barely has enough space to place a hair brush. The shower was a cruel joke as I had to crouch down to get my head under the shower head that spit out barely a mist. The walls shake when other guests closed their doors. The room lighting looks "cool", but you can't get enough light to even read a room service menu on the bed. I honestly felt like we stayed in low income housing. Things in NYC are expensive and small but this hotel is horribly overpriced with ZERO attention to basic services.

Reviews.Title: “Sad about the decline”
Reviews.Author: Bruce C
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and professional. But rooms have deteriorated substantially from my stay last year. Dirty carpets, non-functional fixtures, peeling paint, wallpaper and stained tile equals intentional poor maintenance. I asked for different room and it was worse....all that luxury for $600/night. I would strongly urge readers to steer clear of this hotel until they realize how badly theur reputation becomes when they don't maintain quality of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: The Good: 1. The assistant at check-in noticed we were staying for a while (10 nights) so gave us a free upgrade to a nice corner room on the 56th floor. He also gave us a complimentary drink voucher for 2 at the W bar 2. The view from our corner room was spectacular. We had a lovely lounge chair in the room from which to enjoy the view 3. Very comfortable bed and pillows The Bad: 1. On the very first night after checking in, the first thing my wife wanted to do was moisturise as we had travelled over 24 hours on a flight and her skin was very dry. But housekeeping had left us a USED bottle of Bliss moisturiser! This was disgusting! (To their credit though, housekeeping popped by about 20 minutes later and asked us if we needed anything. When we told them they left us with only used moisturiser, she gave us 3 new tubes immediately) 2. The blackout: the weekend of our stay there was a long power outage (at least 45 minutes). During this time we had no power in our rooms and no one could use the elevator. We had to get ready for a show in the dark, all the while wishing we had stayed at the hotel next door who we could see had power. In fact, as far as we could see all of the buildings around us had power. We then had to walk down 56 flights of stairs, taking pity on the people who were walking up and hoping like hell the power would come back on before our return that night (luckily it did). The worst part of the blackout was the way it was handled. Although we complained to reception, no apology was ever given, and there was no compensation at all. A few days later we received a note under the door saying there was some construction happening to the building and they apologised for any noise that may occur. They should have at least done something similar to apologise for the power outage. And have accompanied that with some compensation. We met other guests in the ensuing days all of whom confirmed that they had not received any apology or compensation and were also angry and disappointed. 3. Housekeeping: apart front leaving us toiletry products used by other people as described above, other aspects of housekeeping were hit and miss. eg, there is meant to be a nightly turn down service. But a few nights this just didn't happen. 4. The door men/women: they seem to hang out in groups of 2 or 3 at the front of the building talking to one another but never greeting guests. It's like a little gang meeting at the front of the building and they can look quite intimidating. One night I recall some of them meeting up with friends (at least people not in uniform) and talking loudly at the door so the "gang" looked even bigger and more intimidating. During our entire extended stay not once did we receive a polite greeting. 5. Little things you might expect from a hotel with the reputation (& cost) of the W just don't exist - like shower caps, or the ability to have your mini bar cleared at no extra cost so you can use the fridge for other things. 6. Check-out: at checkout, we had resolved to say something again at the poor way the blackout was handled. Whilst the check-out clerk asked the 2 guests in front of us "how was your stay" when it came to us he did not bother at all! He just told us our bill was settled, gave us a receipt, and that was that. This really made us feel less important than other guests. We started to walk away, but after everything we just needed to get it off our chest. So we turned around and told him how disappointed we were at how the blackout was handled. He then told us that guests had received a complimentary breakfast as compensation. We were shocked as this compensation had never been offered to us (or other guests we had encountered) despite us complaining earlier. It was like one last cruel joke on us. He then said sorry but there was nothing he could do to make it up to us now. OVERALL: very disappointing, especially when we paid over $500 per night. We really expected more. We would discourage anyone from staying at the W Times Square, and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel gets by on its name and location only”
Reviews.Author: yippee1999
Reviews.Content: I never ever stay in hotels when I travel. I always stay in pensiones or B&Bs or similar. Hotels are a huge ripoff and impersonal. And so I was once again reminded of this fact when I recently stayed at the W in Times Square, only because my sister was staying there on business. I live in NYC and so after a night out with my visiting sister, I stayed at her hotel for the night. First off, this hotel is a bit high on the "hip" factor (though I'm sure there are other hotels that try even harder). They've got the big 'bouncer' type guys out front, the house music playing in the elevators, the attempt at a minimalist lobby and check-in desk. And then in order to get to the elevators for the rooms, you have to pass by their lounge/bar area, which they try to make seem like a 'club'. As for the rooms, I understand that my sister's room was about $500/night. The bathroom was 'nice'...nothing extraordinary. As for the living area/bedroom, it was downright cheap looking. A poor attempt was clearly made at trying to look minimalist and modern, but to the discerning eye it was clear that everything was very cheap...the tables, the lights, the desk... The only good thing about this hotel is the central location. But for less than half the price, you could stay in an equally nice B&B in Manhattan or one of the other boroughs, and have a much more personal experience. I'll just never understand why people pay such outrageous amounts of money to stay in a sterile hotel, where all they do is essentially sleep there. In addition, while hotels will usually answer any questions you have about where you should go eat, etc., everyone knows that the staff are often told to direct you to certain restaurants etc. You might as well just ask a random person on the street for suggestions on where to go.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sub par service”
Reviews.Author: katertonks
Reviews.Content: This is a great trendy neat hotel in a great location right near times square. However, I received terrible service from the managers but not from all other low-level staff. I had called to ensure I could get a room with 2 double beds. I could not because they were sold out but was able to get a king bed for a very reasonable upgrade. This simple transaction involved a 20 min wait on the phone and being shuffled around between various different staff who didn't seem to know how to help but just kept passing me off. On top of this, they then double charged me for the upgrade. Given how expensive this hotel is, I thought they gave particularly poor service.

Reviews.Title: “NYC Nov. 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jumpstick
Reviews.Content: The best part about the W was it's location, on the corner of 47th and Broadway in the heart of Times Square, and their service, they were very willing to help. For the price, the rooms are nothing special. For $500+ a night I expected a little less wear and tear on the room and amenities in the room. The lounge on the 7th floor is OK if you want to watch people and hear some Boom-Boom. I'll probably pick a different hotel the next time I go to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: holidayskeepmesane
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W for a long weekend in September and found it to be very good. The location is central, very busy area though so if you prefer not to be 'in the thick of things' I would stay somewhere else. The other thing about Times Square is that it is tourist central, you find yourself constantly dodging the sightseeing bus trip PR people. We had a standard wonderful room. Yes the bathroom has glass walls but they are frosted however I can understand other reviewers comments that this could be slightly awkward if you were sharing with folks you dont normally get naked with ! The bed was sooo comfy, there is a nice relaxation chair by the window ..perfect for chilling after a busy day sightseeing. There was a plentifull supply of Bliss bathroom products. We didnt eat at the hotel restaurants at all but we did use the bar in the evenings, the cocktail menu was extensive (& expensive!) but you are surrounded by beautiful people & it had a great vibe. The only cons I can come up with are that if you have a lower floor room there can be some street noise and the elevators are worked with your room keycard, mine seemed to work inconsistently which was a bit of a pain. Overall I would recommend this hotel as its location is good for getting the most out of a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underwhelming...”
Reviews.Author: Ilimak
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for the first time and was sorely disappointed. The only redeeming points were the Bliss toiletries and that I was on business travel and didn't have to pay the ridiculous rate of $459/nt. (I would also be remiss if I didn't acknowledge the Concierge who gave an excellent recommendation for sushi in the vicinity.) When I arrived mid afternoon, the room wasn't ready so I opted to leave my bag with the bell staff who seemed to be struggling with the lobby full of other guests also wanting to check their bags. After a twenty minute wait, they finally took my bag, only to get a call that my room was ready two minutes later. Other challenges were the darkly lit lobbies, hallways and elevators (which I missed half of the time because there's no bell signaling they've arrived) and the incessant club/hypno music that follows you around the hotel. Perhaps the most disappointing was the baby roach who settled in on the pillow beside me as I prepared for bed. I was so tired that I threw the pillow on the chaise and tried not to think about the little roach (and his friends) partying up in my very expensive hotel room. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the W”
Reviews.Author: Sean J
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the W last weekend and am very disappointing in how they handled the situation.
