We got there early and our room wasnt ready to did some shopping and came back, but when we got back the elevators were not working. after about 30 minutes of waiting I checked with the front desk how old me they had a power outage and were working on the problem. we had a party we needed to get ready for and had to walk up 50 flights of stairs. My girlfriend had just had surgery and wasnt suppose to do any physical exercise when we get to the 50th floor see everything is pitch black, we are able to get in our room which had no power at all. we wait for about an hour and a half before calling the front desk who said its a city wide problem and nothing they can do. funny, were in time square and everyone seems to have power but the W. its frustrating to know that they use the back up power for the restaurant because they dont want to lose the revenue but for the people who have paid almost $500 per night are pretty much out of luck. we left an hour later, still had no power but at least the elevators were working. we ended up staying somewhere else so we could get some sleep. we took at nap when we got back to the room and received an accidental wake up call at 8am. when I spoke to guest services to try and get some sort of credit told me they decided not to credit any of the guests back that night. I don't see how that is fair to pay almost $500 and have to experience that. not to mention trying to blame it on a city outage but the W was the only hotel without power

Reviews.Title: “Tight but nice”
Reviews.Author: worldnreview
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of weeks ago with my mother, son and my husband. We were in NYC for two nights. The location of this hotel was very convenient for us. Sharing a room that had glass walls in the bathroom was a bit awkward. Also, the size of the room left very little room to move. We requested a cot and the furniture was wall to wall once the cot was in place. I have stayed in many W's and I will choose them again. Next time I'm in NYC I may pick another option.

Reviews.Title: “Strange experince”
Reviews.Author: marius20
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before departing on a cruise. The rooms are small but well appointed. I was sharing a room with my father and had to argue with the front desk to get a two bed room. They said that since we were father and son they thought we wouldn't mind sharing. Awkward. I believe they then sent up a bottle of wine and cheese platter. I called to ask who sent it and they said they would get back to me. They never did. The bathroom has translucent glass walls, even in the two room. You have to call down and they will put up paper screens.

Reviews.Title: “Yes and No”
Reviews.Author: Julia J
Reviews.Content: We (me and my boyfriend) stayed at W NY times square with another couple this past weekend. We stayed from Friday to Sunday and we were in NY for business and some shopping. We had originally planned to fly back home on Sat night but there was a freak snow storm (in October!!!) in NY and our flight was cancelled so we had to book another night here. The W is somewhat of a commodity and known as a destination in its own right. It's a famous hotel yes and being situated right in the heart of times square, it is a very busy place. And also since it was a weekend, you can only imagine how busy this hotel was. I was actually a little disappointed with the crowd at this hotel. There was a lot of families and lots of big travel groups which caused long line ups and noise in the lobby. We got in the city early and tried to see if they would let us check in early but the rooms weren't ready so we had to wait about 4 hours until 3pm to check in. And then of course at 3pm, bus load full of tourists arrived with their giant bags and large groups causing massive line ups and delays. The room was fine. Everyone says it's really small on travel advisor but it's New York. It really doesn't get much bigger than this. I thought the size of the room (i think i stayed in a fabulous room) was ample for two people although yes, the bathroom is a little tight. I found the room to be clean, modern and comfortable to stay in. The rooms do get all the street noise (I was on the 28th floor) but again, it's right at the heart of times square, it's expected and it's really not the hotel's fault. The staff at this W was great. My hair dryer was not working and when I called to have a replacement, there was someone at the door within 3 minutes which was impressive because the hotel was at max. occupancy this weekend. The concierge and everyone else from the door staff to maintenance staff were all wonderful. Everyone always held the elevator door open for you, they always said hello, the door staff were always more than willing to carry your bag and hail a cab for you. It was very pleasant to interact with everyone who works there. My true review is really a 3.5. But the staff really makes it a 4 I guess. Although modern, the hotel is starting to look a little tired... especially the bathroom (the lobby bathroom and the room bathrooms), also I thought the bar was really not all that great but the drinks were very over priced. (also the bottle of water in the room was 9 dollars). I think that for the same price, you can probably stay at a better boutique hotel. If you like modern boutique hotels, there are so many other options at a better price. Overall, it was not a bad experience but for the price I am sure we could have stayed at a cooler, newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip choice for a stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cj_minneapolis
Reviews.Content: I had been to the Living Room bar in this hotel a dozen times, but this is the first time I had actually stayed here. I would definitely stay here again - maybe just not for business travel. Pros: Cool/hip/chic One of the best hotel bars in the area - always hopping Very comfortable, nicely appointed and impeccably clean rooms Great location if you want to be in the heart on the action in Times Square Amazing service Cons: I spent $53 on a continental breakfast Feel like a club at night - if you are not in that mindset, it can be annoying Small rooms, but typical for NYC Can get loud, as the hotel seems to attract the rowdy type Can be expensive (we paid $399/night)

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Antonia A
Reviews.Content: We loved it! Great service! Extraordinary rooms! Amazing view! What else can I say!?

Reviews.Title: “Best location for people wanting to get the best!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: Wow location in this vibrant city. Come out of the hotel and step onto Times Square! We were upgraded and had a superior large room with great views. Rooms could have some attention.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jocelyn l
Reviews.Content: OMG, the moment my boyfriend and I stepped into the elevator at your hotel we were both WOWED! The bed was too die for! Each and every employee of your hotel, ALWAYS greeted us with a warm pleasant smile and was eager to help us in any way possible. Especially Casey at the Welcome Desk. She definitely earned an A+ in for her warm welcome to us upon our arrival. The room was just fabulous, and pristine clean! We could have stayed in bed for the entire day that's how comfy it was! We felt like movie stars. We look forward to staying at your amazing hotel real soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best Location for a fantastic vacation in NY”
Reviews.Author: Paolo_Yle
Reviews.Content: I've been to W Hotel Times Square with my girlfriend in June 2011. We choose that hotel because of the brand and, mainly, for the location. The hotel is located in the real heart of New York exactly in Times Square. It's really easy to reach all the downtown simply walking or by taxi. The reception is at 7th floor of a big skyscraper. The environment is absolutely modern and cool in typical W style. We choose a fabulous room located at the 39th floor. Was great! The room (not so big as every hotel room in NY) was modern, very well equipped and always clean. a big king size bed was in the middle of the room. the view was amazing: straight to the Hudson river. We decided to do not book the breakfast because exactly in from of the hotel there is a Starbuck shop where we went every morning of our stay. The staff was gentle and always in line with the expectation. I really recommend this hotel for who wants to live NY in the right way.

Reviews.Title: “You will not be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Searcher-1
Reviews.Content: We had a good time there. Staff is very friendly. If you need something, just ask them. Checking in/out was very fast. We've already stayed in other big hotels in Manhattan where this took a long time. Rooms are good, bed is comfortable and so is the shower. As for cleanliness, i'd give it a 9 /10. The location is excellent. At the heart of times square. The price we had to pay for this is that although we were in the 43rd floor we could still hear the noise from times square... al night! Room service was not very good but, again, you're in the heart of times square, so this is not a problem. For sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Chic or Bad Porn ?”
Reviews.Author: jamid6
Reviews.Content: I never considered myself to be ultraconservative, in fact I've been called a Metrosexual and have no qualms about wearing Pink or Purple or Red or Orange !!!!.....and I've lovingly stayed at W's in other major cities but I have to confess this place looks like a really bad porn in relation to the decor. To boot the "funky chic" furniture was very uncomfortable. OF Course this is the W so the place is ABSOLUTELY IMPECCABLE WITH REGARD TO SERVICE AND CLEANLINESS BUT this is NOT A GOOD HOTEL FOR BUSINESS TRAVEL. Decor can be offensive, furniture uncomfortable and of course in the City that Never sleeps I should have never stayed in TIMES SQUARE ! As my seven year old would say.....duh !

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes it”
Reviews.Author: piatty73
Reviews.Content: The location in Times Square is convenient for theater and shopping but during our stay there was a major construction job going on across the street. We called the desk at 1:30AM and asked for another room as even the earplugs did not drown the noise. We were put into a room facing the Hudson that was the suite we had but it was quiet. The managers on duty offered another suite on the 55th floor but all the suites face Times Square so we took a regular room facing the river which we preferred since you can see the ships docking and leaving and the square gets old fast. The hotel was very generous with the adjustments made in our bill. We will stay here again but will face the river next time unless we know the construction has stopped.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENCE”
Reviews.Author: richard p
Reviews.Content: Excellent situation, attractive price (Air France package) and confirmation that the reality is a the level of the description on website. Beautiful, perfect rooms, bathroom, clean, excellent service, G floor with sea food restaurant with an excellent breakfast served by very polite persons. Spent almost one week and we'll come again as we have enjoyed this hotel very much. Richard and his wife (french customers from Antibes).

Reviews.Title: “BEST location”
Reviews.Author: Croeh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and this is just THE best location for tourists. Everything is so easily accessible from here. Walk, subway, cab easily to restaurants & attractions. The hotel restaurant Blue Fin is really good too. Staff is always nice & helpful. The bar scene is lively. My teenagers love staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramsey G
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent for our family vacation in July 2010. Hotel was very neat and organized and was able to accomadate our required standards of a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Its Times Square, where else would you want to stay?”
Reviews.Author: Noheabill
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the W Times Square and we had a great time. The location cannot be beat if you want a modern place to stay right on Times Square (or is it two triangles end to end?) We loved the Blue Fin dining looking out at the square with pretty good sushi.(I am from Hawaii and get supper fresh fish, for NY they did good) Had the Maguro, Sake, Spicy Ahi and Ikura. The room was very clean and “modern”. It’s not the largest room you’re going to get but it’s the Big Apple get out there. On the 52nd floor the view was fantastic. The “Living Room” is an enjoyable place for an afternoon drink to relax before heading out for the night. Concierge was very helpful, got an excellent town car at a good price (no crazy driving and good service), was on top of all the shows and gave us four great choices for an evening of Jazz. We have been to the Blue Note previously (loved it) and this time went to Birdland, within walking distance for the W, and what a session we enjoyed. The doormen are fit and very courteous; you get welcomed and then go to the 7th floor for the front desk. There a vibe there, and even us 40 something’s caught it and had an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, little noisy”
Reviews.Author: ShanghaiPandas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week, great location but a little noisy. Staff at reception very helpful and as an SPG Gold member was offered an upgrade to a suite which was very nice and large - real treat for NYC. All the action of Times Square is right at your doorstep, so if you are looking for that it might be the perfect spot for you. Unless you have time on your hands, suggest to avoid breakfast in the cafe on ground floor, very slow indeed. On my visit waited some time and then even after asking the waitress if things could be sped up, was quite shocked to see my breakfast being delivered to the table behind me (must have ordered the same thing) and although the waitress told the server that it was the wrong table, it was too late... Overall hotel experience good but go somewhere else for a quick breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest W staff I've ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: texasex95
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The staff was so friendly and really seemed to genuinely care about me! No attitude what-so-ever. Casey at the front desk was so nice and cool. Such a wonderful welcome! This was the best W hotel I've stayed at and one of the top 10 hotels I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great job by the entire staff”
Reviews.Author: DMVA-11
Reviews.Content: Just spent the weekend there for my daughter's 16th birthday. The staff was fantastic and both Hillary and Patrick at the front desk made it very memorable for her! Thanks very much for all you did. BTW, the room and overall hotel were spotless. The whole family will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: wvumorgan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly on Times Square, but they go out of their way to make sure you can "get away" from the crowds and the noise!. First, the lobby is actually on the 7th floor, with a separate elevator to the room floors, which makes it very secure! The decor is European chic and very comfortable! The staff was excellent and friendly! The lobby bar was always hopping! One note - be prepared for the "see thru" walls of the bathroom in the room. You have to get used to it, but not a deal breaker!

Reviews.Title: “For the price...you don't get much”
Reviews.Author: mikeandglenis
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at any W hotel so the one in Times Square was such a great location, I decided to stay there for my birthday with my hubby even though it was 400.00 US a night and thank God it was only one night!! We were quickly disappointed. When we arrived, we had to take an elevator up to the 7th floor to check in then another elevator to the 46th floor to our room. The bathroom had mold in the shower, the bed creaked, the view, for the price, sucked...we looked at another hotel and not Broadway and the wireless was terrible(I was on the phone with someone trying to get it to work for 15 mins! and it was $14.95 for 24 hrs. It should have been free!!!) I would have been more happy at the Marriott, where we usually stay. I will never stay at this W again......

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Family”
Reviews.Author: Ed O
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel with my wife and 3 teenage boys. It is extremely convienent and close to many food options (includling affordable delis for some quick food). The hotel was very accomodating and helpful. I would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “BEST TIME EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Erin C
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Great location. Pure bliss. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Hobotraveler_11
Reviews.Content: The W is a fantatic hotel. It's staff are so compassionate about providing great service to the guests. I found all to be friendly, helpful and considerate. The W is a world within itself. Beautiful, calming, private, and welcoming. No matter what room we were in the views of Times Square were breath taking.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: musiclilac
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Times Square and the W was a perfect location to experience all that was there. I was able to walk or hop on the subway or grab a taxi very easy. The hotel was amazing. When you walked in from the street you were surrounded by a waterfall, beautiful orchids, a lovely scent and stepped into the lift which was always right there! All the staff were courteous and bent over backwards to do WHATEVER. I loved all the different names for the space at the hotel. The living room was a lovely gathering area. The lifts were around the corner and never noisy or crowded. The beds were divine. All the amenities you would need in the room. Newspapers and fresh fruit at the registration desk. Little touches that stood out from other hotel stays I've experienced. Lots of theaters close by with so many shows to select from. Restaurants, diners, delis, bakeries - you name it, they were just around the corner. I would definitely come back to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “W New York in Times Square - great experience”
Reviews.Author: Eileen C
Reviews.Content: Just want to share our fabulous experience we had in Times Square at the W Hotel. It was great. The W Hotel is so conveniently located in Times Square. The staff was pleasant, very helpful, polite and always asking if we needed anything. The hotel is so convenient to the theater and dining. Looking forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best W in NY”
Reviews.Author: kcanavan2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing staff, great bar , excellent fitness facilities and great views of Times Square. We stayed there for our anniversary and got special treatment, amenities and great attitude. The whatever, whenever concierge was very good at getting us restaurants, clubs and theater tickets . If you like the trendy type this W is definitely better than the first W new york

Reviews.Title: “ROCKIN' BUSINESS STAY!”
Reviews.Author: WendiHC
Reviews.Content: I just got back from NYC and had a WONDERFUL stay at this W. Here is my synopsis: 1. Service - friendly, efficient, bend over backwards to make you happy, approachable, and ultra accommodating 2. Location - busy outside, oasis inside!! I heard NO NOISE from my room and the blackout shades helped me sleep like a baby 3. Rooms - very spacious for NYC! 4. Bed bugs - there were NONE! 5. Smell - the elevators smelled like heaven, I don't know what they have in there, but it's delicious 6. Food - I ordered breakfast and it was delivered in 15 minutes - OUTSTANDING

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Lousy Location”
Reviews.Author: Jon M
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. It's the perfect place for people who don't want to be bothered by officious hotel staff. I was there for three days and hardly ever saw a staff person, unless I sought them out. I like that in a hotel. They leave you alone. They really didn't need to be there for us as everything we needed was in our very well appointed suite. It was lovely and spacious, and the comfortable as well. The bed was soft and large, the TV wonderful, and the bathroom was very well cleaned, and the shower was a pleasant surprise with a large spray head. I love that. The lobby is very discreet, and the front desk is sort of hidden, which I like. It doesn't dominate the entire floor. You don't feel like you are in a hotel. Nice. The one thing I hate about this hotel, which I assume is the reason many people choose it, is the location. You walk out the front door and you are immediately in the middle of the the awful mess they call Times Square. It is loud, bright, smelly and everything about the US that I hate. Commercialism run afoul. You walk ten steps from the front door of the hotel and who knows what you might find...a hooker doing business, a transient begging for a smoke from you, or god knows what else or who else. This hotel is literally a diamond in the rough, one better enjoyed from the within the confines of the hotel. It is not a relaxing neighborhood, and if you like your hotels to be set in a peaceful locale, skip this place. Otherwise, if you don't care about the area where the hotel is located, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: huvu2
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, well appointed hotel in the centre of Manhattan. I have only two complaints; the first is that when we arrived at 2.30pm after a long flight the room was not ready for us and we had to sit in the bar for an hour until it had been cleaned, this is not such a big deal but after such a long journey it does seem so at the time. The Staff are all extremely pleasant and helpful and will go out of their way to help. The hotel is very well equipped with everything from free internet in the lobby to magazines in your room. We had a room on the 43rd floor called a "cool corner" giving us a view of two sides of Times Square. The bed was really comfortable, probably the nicest I have slept in, and the mini bar is very well stocked. There are bathrobes supplied and an iron and ironing board.The bathroom is vey modern with a mini waterfall instead of a tap.Which brings me to my second complaint, although it may not bother some people the bathroom is only separated from the bedroom by slightly tinted glass, meaning that you are completely on show when you use the bathroom, lavatory etc... and when the light is on in the bathroom it is like you are in the same room. I am not a prude but I dont like using the toilet in full veiw and earshot of people, even my wife. If this minor issue does not bother you then i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay...”
Reviews.Author: eaamieva
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the W Times Square with my wife and 3 other couples, and I think I can speak on behalf of all of us saying that we do not regret it. I has hesitant on choosing the Times Square location because it is not one of my favorites parts of the city but the hotel itself makes you forget the crowds that you found down below. Rooms in great shape, small yes, but it is New York so, rooms ok. The only complaint could be lack of drawers for cloths but other than that, rooms are great and clean. The shower awsome. I believe we were upgraded to a corner view room on the 40th floor so the views are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Another disappointing W”
Reviews.Author: emjaytx
Reviews.Content: I thought they had it down, and up to a couple of years ago, I really enjoyed staying in their properties. Now, it's become a generic Starwood disappointment. No real difference. The decor is a bit more chic, but the place lacks warmth and service. The add ons, you never really get, so having status really means nothing and you have to ask for turn down, free water, and unexpectedly a shower cap, a coffee maker and a face cloth if you want it! Things that you would automatically get in most nice boutique hotels. Shame on you Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars if you are 30 something”
Reviews.Author: SJHNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This is a hip hotel for the 30 something crowd. From the time you enter the downstairs lobby, continuing on the elevators you are bombarded by hip music. Oh, I did not mention the 7th floor where the hotel desk and concierge are--loud enough for a big time headache! The rooms are slick, modern and small and all in shades of grey. There were no drawers for putting clothes away, but I guess you would have to say there was some open shelf space under the night table. Amazingly there were no free outlets in the room to charge my phone, but I did find one in the bathroom. But it was not all negative, the staff was great and the concierge gave us tickets to a travel exposition at the armory which would have cost us $55 each. Like I said if you are 30 something...............

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurenprince21
Reviews.Content: We were more than pleased with this hotel, we had high expectations after hearing good things and we weren't dissapointed! The location is perfect, walk out of the hotel and you are right on Times Square. Very modern and clean, comfy beds, good view from room, high up so heard no noise at night. When we come back to New York we will definitely stay here again and I would recommend this place to any one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Eric
Reviews.Content: Overall an excellent choice for those who want to be in the middle of all the action of Times Square. Staff is very attentive. Lobby is the usual ultralux W brand on the 7th floor. Rooms are quite spacious and comfortable. Heavenly beds can't be beat. Try to get rooms on the higher floors and even better with a corner view as you will have more expanded views and less noise from below. Good luck getting a ticket to The Book of Mormon!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Louise064
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are wonderful but it is in a very busy and noisy location. We stayed in a suite which was a very good size. The room was fairly clean and very plain not what I was expecting for the price we paid for the room. I agree with earlier reviews that the bathrooms are a little tacky considering you can see the person while they are in there. I think I was expecting a little more luxury for the price. The location can't be beat..Times Square is right outside your door. You can walk to many of the shows and shopping. The Blue Fin has great breakfast and lunches. If you love the crowds and nightlife this is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Runnergirl89
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W in Times Square in March of 2010. We came for the Big East Basketball Tournament Weekend. The hotel is fantastic. We stayed at a W in New York that was downtown a few years ago, but this one is definitely more trendy. When you come in, you have to take the elevator upstairs to the lobby to the check-in desk, which looks more like a club conceriege table. But despite the sometimes intimidating atmosphere, all of the staff were more than friendly and helpful. It rained almost the entire weekend and we were not prepared with umbrellas or raincoats. The hotel provided us with umbrellas when we went out on excursions for no charge. The rooms are small, but this seems typical for W Hotels. The rooms themselves are great, with nice toiletries in the bathroom and very comfortable beds. We were on a higher floor, so the view was amazing. We could see all of Times Square! I would definitely recommend staying here if you are ever in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: JETSETDLDK
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay right in the middle of action in the City That Never Sleeps, this is it! W @ Times Square is smack in the centre of excitement, lights, shopping, broadway ticket booths, restaurants etc. Hotel is very modern and staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are of a good size and we got a high floor room facing the Hudson River. Very nice! But be prepared to pay around USD$280 and above but this is money well spent! We didnt have to take any taxis as subway station is just around the corner. The only strange thing is that the concierge desk closes at 6pm everyday so if you need some help with information etc, you are on your own. The front desk staffs will try to help you but they are constantly busy with incoming & outgoing guests.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Matt196
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, cool rooms that are comfortable and a decent size for NY, excellent location, the staff are good, everything you expect from a W really. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beyond hopes and expectations for any 4 or 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianscot
Reviews.Content: This is the email I sent to the W GM: I would like to congratulate you on your wonderful hotel, and especially having such an amazing manager in Patrick Armano. He made our stay special from the moment we arrived for our 10 yr anniversary. He provided a lovely treat in chilled Champagne and chocolate-covered strawberries on our arrival. When one of my packages got misplaced (due to my error in name), he went out and repurchased all the items ordered. I had called down and asked if I could borrow a white noise machine, and when he heard of this, he went out and bought one for me (as the hotel no longer stocked these). Besides all of this, he came to talk to me personally- and is such a warm and wonderful person. Really, he went far beyond any hopes/expectations that I would have had for any hotel (including many 5-star ones that I have stayed in). I am still basking in the great memories of a fantastic trip, and much of it is thanks to the great stay we had at the W Times. And again, much of that is due to Patrick specifically!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A17ACR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location,staff very friendly rooms amazing got upgraded to a spectacular room on second to last floor if building was fab.Recommend this hotel for any special treat as no not the cheapest but a big WOW factor can be had at the W

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: danmiller3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost too hip for itself, given it's location in the middle of tourist central. The staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are very comfortable and well sized for NY. The bathrooms, in particular, are very generously sized for the NY area. Noise is kept to a minimum with good sound proofing and hallway noise is minimal. One minor complaint is that while the alarm clocks look nice, they aren't very functional given they don't light up and are completely invisible in the dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo M
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel, and it doesn't disappoint. It is a hip and trendy hotel and you get that feeling the moment that you walk into the lobby on the 7th floor with its dim lighting and chillout music. I got upgraded to a corner room and had a wonderful view over the Hudson. I was staying there the weekend that Hurricane Irene was predicted to hit, and never was worried about my safety, as management kept us informed on what to do. It has Times Square right at its doorstep, but since you enter from a side street you can actually avoid it if you want to. Easy to walk everywhere. Highly recommend this hotel! It also has a great fitness centre which is complimentary for guests (which is quite rare in NYC as most hotels make you pay to use the gym)

Reviews.Title: “most awesome hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Shelley A
Reviews.Content: This hotel more than lived up to its reputation! I travelled there with my daughter and a my close friend to celebrate my daughter's graduation (into grade 9) This hotel was recommended to me by a friend - he indicated that it was a really 'cool' hotel and that my daughter would love it - very young and chic - and he was spot on... Beautiful rooms - funky decor - very tasteful nothing was overlooked - attention was given to every little detail - even the carpets in the elevator were changed according to time of day...Good Morning...Good Afternoon...and Good Evening. The lobby was spectacular...I loved the 'smell' of this hotel - they actually used to sell the W' scent however it is no longer available... The rooms were immaculately clean...spa products and the coolest bathroom and waterfall sink...really a treat! The most comfortable beds and pillows I have ever slept on all down and the linens were very soft... The service was fantastic - friendly staff and very responsive to your needs I was there during the hurricane ( more of a tropical storm) when all of NYC was shut down - noone could get in or out of the city and people were being held ransom to the rates that hotels were charging as they knew there was no where to go... The W actually lowered their rates as I had to stay on for a couple more days then expected as my flight was cancelled - that is amazing!!! I will definitely stay at the W again and highly recommend this anyone that wants something out of the ordinary in a hotel. S

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: jbt872
Reviews.Content: We are a bunch of NY'ers and we had a surprise bachelorette party at the W in Times Square. We had an amazing evening and the staff was wonderful. The bride was blown away and totally surprised. We are all local NY gals so I was a little nervous to have the party in Times Square (the place all the locals stay away from), but everything was great and we had a fantastic time. I stay at the W when I travel to LA for work and its always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: trippingrickey
Reviews.Content: It was our first time staying at a W hotel and we were not impressed. Our room was supposed to be fabulous, but was lacking in all categories. Nice getting passed the facade of the glitz and glamor of the hotel lobby, you realize quickly that it is no more than a La Quinta in disguise. The room was dirty at best with dust on the window sill, fingerprints on all the glass/stainless steel and cracks in the glass trashcan. The room is very small for the price and the view isn't anything to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “A faded Star”
Reviews.Author: BambinaRosa
Reviews.Content: I used to bring Clients here 2002-2003 and often recommended this hotel to fellow Europeans who wanted a real New York experience. I remember it as being a cutting edge swanky place and the Flagship of W Hotels worldwide. I arrived at the hotel after a long transatlantic flight. The Bellman who showed me to my room basically just tried to leave me there without explaining the room's features to me (very un-W Staff). I was amazed to find the room had been cleaned but was dirty. The paint was chipping, the carpet was stained, torn, and had cigarette burns in it. One of the two bathrooms had no trash bin. There was only one small towel placed in the 2nd bathroom. It was disgraceful, I was so disappointed. In 2003 the rooms were totally spiffed out, modern, refreshed, and clean. I called the front desk to see if there was another room available but they were full. I asked to speak to a Manager on Duty. I explained my extreme disappointment and her response was "the problem is we are almost always full, this "is" Times Square" as if that were an excuse for the room being in shambles!!! On a positive note they sent up a Style Manager who commiserated with me and apologized and offered to bring extra towels and amenities to make up for the disappointment. He invested a lot of time listening to my constructive comments which was very professional and appreciated. I really wanted to check out of the hotel but didn't have the energy. Upon my request the room was cleaned much more thoroughly for the rest of my stay. Patrick the doorman was great... he remembered my name and was always smiling and in a good mood even though being a Doorman at Times Square is probably one of the most stressful jobs around. The concierge staff were very helpful before and during my stay. I will not be going back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: 2NIX
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Times Square is known as a trendy, fun,vibrant, and hip hotel. During my latest stay there, it was all that but more importantly it was home to me for three weeks while on a business trip in midtown Manhattan. While "home" may not be the first thing that comes to mind, when one first sets foot in the hotel, the service, enthusiasm, and friendliness of the staff exemplifies the high standard of service and professionalism that I expect, but not always receive, from the hospitality industry. My requests for a coffee maker and a mini refrigerator upon check- in were immediately addressed, and concerns about a malfunctioning lock brought concerned inquiries from Mr. Patrick Armano, Guest Relations Manager, who sent the maintenance manager to personally address my concerns. The housekeeping staff was quick to respond to my requests to clean my room at specific times depending on my schedule. In this regard, I would like to commend Connie, the housekeeping staff member assigned to maintaining my room (4311). Connie always greeted me with a smile and never failed to ask about my stay and to offer her assistance should I need anything else. She did so with never failing cheerfulness and sincerity which make frequent travelers like me feel that our business is really appreciated. I would also like to express my appreciation to the bell staff who were quick to respond to requests for assistance with friendly courtesy. Likewise, the door staff on the ground floor whose outgoing personalities exemplify the fun image of the hotel. The front desk staff has mastered the art of maintaining a good balance of friendliness and professionalism, which, in my opinion is a key element of good hospitality and service. A billing mistake regarding a late checkout fee was promptly resolved. The staff truly personified the W's signature "whatever/whenever" service. The W Hotel Times Square will always be my hotel of choice when I come to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “A bit special in a top location”
Reviews.Author: ViennaJohn
Reviews.Content: We had one night to stay in New York and having been there before a few times staying at average hotels wanted to splash out for something a bit different. The W in Times Square couldn't be closer to the action and it offers a modernist, colourful environment in all areas, with top service and friendliness. We were upgraded (which always helps admittedly) to a suite on the 51st Floor overlooking Times Square on one side and looking up Broadway to Central Park on the other. The room(s) were more than spacious with all the facilities you would expect in a well-designed space. Room service breakfast was top quality and despite the hubbub and 24 hour action on the street, we had a peaceful nights sleep. We had lunch in the bar/restaurant on the ground floor - OK but nothing too special and drinks in the bar late evening - nice environment but not much atmosphere. Only slight disappointment was the charge for wi-fi, so we couldn't use the web for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: josjax
Reviews.Content: Loved the W for it's understated cool vibe, it's roomy and oh so comfortable room and fabulously comfortable bed. It's location is perfect for being in the thick of the City, and within walking distance of much of Manhatten or a very short walk to the subway at 49th St or Times Square. The only minus was the rather lack lustre guys and girls on the concierge desk. Is much needed advice and tips to guests really such hard work? Not sure you've earned your angel wings quite yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and fab location”
Reviews.Author: worldcitizenindelhi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend on 19th till 21st August 2011 in Fabulous Corner room on 57th floor. I was traveling with friends on a shopping/partying trip to NYC. Room 5706 Good Location : Right on times square, always buzzing and walking distance to many restaurants, bars and stores Room : Great room with view of Hudson, Spacious as per big city hotel standards Service : Excellent as you expect of a W hotel Overall : The hotel lives up to the New York city buzz and you always have people in the lobby and at the bar which was great Bad Maintenance : I complained at the front desk about an annoying frequently occurring sound close to the room door (like water dripping) after the first night. Till i left it wasn't taken care of even though someone left a message in my voice mail that it was taken care of. I went to the front desk and they offered to move me to another room but warned that since it would be at a lower floor it would be noisy. So basically it meant tolerate it you don't a choice. Not a great experience if you are paying US$ 510 per night. Shower : Water Pressure was far from perfect. Very slow water flow. Overall excellent hotel but they could improve a few things.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing stay at the W Time Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: I cannot express how amazing our New York trip was and my apologies for expressing that so late after my trip, I am still having a hard time snapping back into reality. Our stay at The W was incredible, this was mainly in-part because of you and your wonderful team. Everything exceeded my expectations and we really appreciated everything you, in particular, did for us. From the letter that I will always appreciate and have, to the extraordinary room upgrade, to the piece of delicious cake that was given to me the first night I arrived. New York itself was amazing and I plan to come back this December and a few times through out 2012 because of how much input there is and how much there is to do and see, it's every thing my dream vacation was meant to be. Because of the great hospitality and wonderful experience I had a The W Times Square, I no longer need to search for a hotel to stay with during my visits to New York. I truly thank you so very much for everything and look forward to my future stays with you at The W. I will be sure to pass my comments on to Ms. Eva Ziegler, W Hotels Global Leader, and my friends and family so they to can experience the trip of a life time, as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: D A
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location for Manhattan. This hotel is walking distance to almost anyplace for the adventurous tourist-from Central Park to Battery Park. Sure, it'll take you some time to walk to either of those two places, but the journey is part of the experience! Plus, its within about 4 blocks of 6 different subway entrys, so that's a big plus! The rooms are appointed quite nicely, with very modern touches, but my room was amazingly small and cramped. Even for Manhattan standards, this was small. It was hard to close the bathroom door behind me without having to turn and step aside! Other than that though, this hotel is a super choice for anyone visiting Manhattan. Oh yes, and the bar in the hotel has a great vibe if you're in the mood for a nightcap!

Reviews.Title: “We had the most W-onderful time at the W!! :)”
Reviews.Author: Cowgirlr3d
Reviews.Content: Every staff member we encountered was very friendly and professional. Everything was personalized and not "stiff." Sara at check-in was very welcoming and friendly. It was like we had been friends for years. Complimentary drinks were a NICE surprise! (Now THEY were stiff!! :) ) It was the best hotel experience I've encountered! Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a hotel to sleep not to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dusault
Reviews.Content: Location is fabulous. Just around the corner of Times Square. Hotel interior design is trendy but as a result light is very dimmed and gives you the feeling to be in a cave. Rooms are okay (small and missed the coffee maker) but not great and the promised spectacular view is so-so. Service of rooms was very good. The staff was very helpful but as well very young. The facilities of the hotel are limited. The bar is not very inviting and the one and only restaurant rather small. As such a good place to have a bed down town in NY but not a hotel to spend much time in.

Reviews.Title: “Pure, Cheesy NY”
Reviews.Author: yudhisthira70
Reviews.Content: Times Square is reviled by New Yorkers, but for first time visitors like us you cannot beat the location: broadway at your steps, the park within walking distance... You could say the same about the W: my NY friends never set foot in it, but NFL rookies and out of towners are bound to love it. It is far from perfect, actually quite filthy (but so is the city), and it drools cheesiness, with neon lights and translucent toilets ( sexy until you have an upset stomach), but if you want the country chic of the village, why not visit Europe? This is NY, and you are a tourist. The view from our corner room screamed New York: a forest of skyscrapers, Top of the Rock, the Hudson if you try and, literally at your feet, Times Square (we woke up at the sweet voice of Jessica Alba starting a marathon). It is not cheap but with good promotions it places itself at the minimum price in Manhattan for some comfort and location. Service is good, including that disconcerting American habit of asking 'how are you' to complete strangers. I'd probably not get back: been there, done that, and I'd probably like to stay somewhere quieter, but for my first NY visit it could not be beaten.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and trendy, yet very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MatthewArnold
Reviews.Content: When I walked into the lobby, I wasn't sure if I was stepping into Avalon nightclub or the W Hotel. Neither option would have been bad, although it might be hard to get sleep in a nightclub. But after all, NYC is the city that never sleeps, right? I was on my way back from Europe and had a night to burn in NYC. I happened to be with my girlfriend. I figured, we've had a great trip so far, let's keep it going. So, we reserved a room. It is very trendy, incredibly modern and super fun. We had a great time. Yes, it is expensive, but NYC is expensive. What a great hotel to enjoy with your significant other. The accommodations are clean, service is excellent, we had a view of Times Square and the adjoining restaurant, Blue Fin, is amazing. Its expensive, but it really completes the NYC experience seeing as you are right in the action. I recommend this W Hotel Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: BellaGood
Reviews.Content: A group of five ladies stayed at the W Time Square to celebrate a 40th birthday. We loved it from the moment we arrived, although we were a little confused about where the lobby was and found it very dark as the lobby or living room as it is called is situated in the middle of the building on the 7th floor with no windows to the outside. The rooms are a good size and decorated beautifully. We wanted to all have our three rooms on the same floor but in the end it didn't work out. The front desk staff were very accomodating and apologetic and definitely made it worth our while. The bliss beauty products were a huge bonus. Love the foaming face wash. Blue Fin restaurant is beautiful and the food amazing. Will stay at W Times Square again and recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Why would you stay anywhere else?nd have stayed at nearly 30 luxury hotels within the city over the last 10 years. The”
Reviews.Author: nkllkn
Reviews.Content: Its a great location, great people and in the middle of everything. I am in NYC often and have stayed at over 30 hotels over the last 7 years. The W Times Square is now my home away from home. The people who work there care and go out of thier way to help, the rooms are well maintained, the service is prompt and they take care of you. for such a large property they have it together and are always improving. STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “cramped, trendy buy uncomfortable, overly impressed with itself”
Reviews.Author: SEWscout
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be very close to our meeting the next morning. And it was a handy location. But not a comfortable night. My room was almost all black, black wallpaper, black rug, black bedspread. It took forever to figure out how to turn on the artsy faucet in the sink, and the sink was so high up that it was difficult to use if you are under 6'. Room service took forever and the food was not tasty and not hot. Bed was hard as a rock, called for a new pillow which was promised but never delievered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first time tourist.”
Reviews.Author: Vbiles
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W Times Square for 2 weeks, we were extremely excited and the W exceeded all our expectations! The location was perfect for us 1st time NYC visitors. Riht on times square meaning we were extremely close to transportation and attractions. Service was some of the best that we had on our trip, although we did have to ask for extra towels everyday. The room size was bigger then I expected especially with three girls with too many bags and lots of shopping going on. We didn't have too much of an issue with the bathroom frosted glass but I can understand why some people might. Overall I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends because of its location and the helpful staff that helped three clueless girls around NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the WOW Factor”
Reviews.Author: Buns4vs
Reviews.Content: My wife chose this Hotel based on the location and the fact that we had previously stayed at a W Hotel. Having read the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor, I was a little anxious not to repeat our dire experience of last year at the Waldorf Astoria, where we were virtually ignored. How wrong could I have been - on arrival at the Hotel, we were warmly greeted by the Bell Captains who engaged my wife in conversation whilst I attended to the Cab fare before escorting us to the 7th Floor Lobby (where the check in desk area is, in my view, the only place in the Hotel that does not seem to live up to the chic image). The check In Agent was very effeicnt and friendly and recognised that we had booked through Amex and that as a consequence we were elgible for a room upgrade. Indeed, we had been allocated a very nice corner room on a higher floor and not only that, the Hotel had picked up from the booking that it was my Birthday and had put a Card and a small gesture in the room as a consequence. On this alone we will be back!!!! The room was more than sufficient for a weekend break - yes the bathroom screen takes a little getting used to and there is limited storage space, but then it is the idea when visiting New York that you get out and about We found all the staff friendly and engaging and quite liked watching the live TV feed of Times Square whilst sipping a cocktail at the Bar. We also had a meal at Blue Fin one evening and this was exceptional. We certainly will come back - the location cannot be beaten (although you must accept that being in the heart of Times Square you will have to live with the cab drivers using horns much more than is necessary) and all the staff there put themselves out to make our visit memorable

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: TravelChick17
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very chic and trendy, as expected from any W hotel. The time it took me to check in was long, and even though there were two front desk personnel, it took me a more than 15 minutes wait (there were 3 people in front of me). The room was spacious, bed very comfortable. The only letdown was that my room was situated right in front of the elevator (even though I specifically requested a room away from it) The staff should pay more attention to these kinds of requests. Make sure that when you're checking in, they are aware if you made any special requests or need assistance.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for a stay on Broadway”
Reviews.Author: Rekyes
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great. Walking distance, for our family, from Penn Station. Located in the heart of Broadway. We arrived before check-in, the desk clerk took our cell phone number to call us when a room was ready. We went to breakfast at a teriffic diner recommended by the concierge and while we were still having breakfast we received a call that a room was ready, hours before the check-in time. At other hotels we would have to keep checking back to see if a room was ready. We greatly appreciated the phone call. The rooms were exceptionally clean. We would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and will continue to be back”
Reviews.Author: Graywalds
Reviews.Content: Everytime I am in NY it is a Starwood Hotel and most of the time it is the W. Appreciate your service… love your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobloblaw6
Reviews.Content: I come to midtown often for business, and have become a regular Platinum member at the W because of its flawless service. Quick check-in/out, always reliable, and reaches out to me if there's anything I need. Two rooms for the workout area, comfy beds, and good business center. Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Girls' weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Sandra K
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect trip with the girls! Location was fantastic and the service top-notch. We had a "cool corner" room and loved the Bliss products! We can't wait to have another reunion soon.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: mike l
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square was an awesome place to go! Cool design, nice room, and outstanding service!!! We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in July for a short vacation. The staff is very friencly and accomodating. I recommend getting a corner suite that has an extra living room and powder room. The location in Times Square is perfect for sightseeing as well as attending plays.

Reviews.Title: “Style with substance.”
Reviews.Author: JPellet
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W Times Square a number of times for business. I've always left happy and well cared for. If your style is contemporary and sophisticated without being over the top, this is for you. The staff have always been welcoming and helpful, yet unintrusive. Very comfortable beds. This level of dependability inspires confidence--and loyalty. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: minnie456
Reviews.Content: I traveled for a girls weekend and the service was out of this world. Jenna and Jarrod of the Whatever/Whenever team really went above and beyond anyones expectations to make our great trip fabulous. I would highly recommend and can not wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for tourists - True W style and service”
Reviews.Author: Casey_Taylor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for the ING 2010 Marathon. I had stayed before for business and would recommend for both business and leisure. PROS: - Location, location - Times Square is hectic but prototypical NY. For sightseeing, it's close to Broadway and public transport. For the Marathon, it was close to our shuttle. Plus, the ING people weren't really checking to make sure you were on your designated shuttle... just that you had a number. - W Style - As an SPG loyalist, I love the W styling. The bar is more of lounge, but we got great service and the atmosphere is sheik but relaxed. - Service - As always, I found the W service excellent. We received a note and some complimentary gifts the morning after the marathon congratulating us. - Price - For marathon weekend, we were surprised that the W was competitively priced, lower than most other high end properties. CONS: - Times Square is crazy - If you're frequently in New York, I could see how one would rather stay in a more quaint location off the tourist path and closer to independent restaurants. - Rooms are on the small side -- ... but comparable with other places I've stayed in NYC. - Bathroom walls - Heads up, the glass walls to the bathroom are translucent. If you're staying with a total stranger who won't appreciate the shadow dancing show, just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “More touristy than business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Muppet50
Reviews.Content: The W is a good hotel, located on Time Square. In terms of location for both business and tourist, its ticks this box very well. It has the unusual entrance that is not on the street level so you need to ride one elevator to get to the reception area. Its a little dark inside but it gives atmosphere and has a good feel to it. Rooms are very modern, very clean with all the mod cons. You might say a little sterile.... There is generally a good buzz from the reception area, where there is music and a bar. I would have happily partaken if I wasn't there for business. The fitness suite was small and i was there for one week so this was a disappointment. Its an important feature for business travellers and its somewhat overlooked. I liked the hotel, and would happily stay there as a tourist or visitor to the city, but not as a hub for business

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.....Every Thing you expect from a W.....”
Reviews.Author: mcatrace
Reviews.Content: Times square can be a touristy place to stay but really you can't beat the location. It is a short stroll to some amazing restaurants. This W was great....the staff was friendly, the room was nice and well kept. If we stay in Times Square again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme WOW Suite suite was Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: bichoo99
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. First off, the location is amazing, right on times square! SPG Platinum status recognition is amazing...upgraded to Extreme WOW 2-bedroom Suite..likely the best hotel room I have ever stayed at! Hotel service was excellent, nothing to complain about. Don't hesitate to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: oceansunrise
Reviews.Content: Our adventure started with only one person at the front desk. (In New York City better yet Mid Town Manhattan)? Then our room was small and the "king size bed" was a long way from being a king more like a large double or small queen. The ice machine on our floor was out all weekend. We styed for tow nights but room service left a note like we were leaving after one so, we had to go to the desk to get a new room key. The place is very dark and feels cramped. Other than the location, right at Times Square and right in the middle of the Theatre district nothing much good to say. We will look elsewhere next time we go up to see a show.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic fun hotel in the heart of it”
Reviews.Author: GazLondon
Reviews.Content: Love the style of this hotel. Funky and stylish. The room is big and cool. Lots of amenities with a great gym and fabulous vibrant bar ( although vacuous female bartenders are a bit prissy and lazy, standing in the corner and doing nothing much but preen and chat to each other or text on their mobiles; the one male bartender is hardworking, professional and attentive). Desk and concierge staff are friendly and efficient, going the extra mile to ensure the guests are made to feel special. Breakfast in the Blue Fin is pricey but excellent. Great location with all you want to see not far away. Would recommend for couples, and young urbanites. Older travellers may not like the dark bar, lifts and pulsing music, but we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “NYU Stern Graduation”
Reviews.Author: AdelaideDuncan
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York for my son's graduation. The W hotel in Times Square was a really nice experience all round. It's location is easy for all amenities. Everything about it was elegantly modern as one can get. The restaurant and bars are a delicious treat of wining/dining. The staff in general were exceptional courteous. No doubt I'll be returning again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Wiskeylake
Reviews.Content: The W is in absolutely the best location you could imagine. Sit in the bar and you are watching the action in Times Square. Had an excellent meal at the restaurant and drinks at the bar were always enjoyable. Usually returning after a night out the lobby bar would still be very busy. Fashionable and upscale crowd. Excellent scotch selections. Rooms were just OK. Obviously trying for a very modern look but getting a little dated. Some peeling wall coverings and black in the showers. The front desk service and concierge were outstanding. Concierge assisted with choice of dinner locations and made reservations for us when we could not get in. All in all we would return as the service and location just cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: elopezso
Reviews.Content: I had an incident on my way to the airport of which I informed the W about. I needed a cab to the airport and first the bellman tried to get me to take a limousine. I declined after hearing the cost and insisted on getting a yellow cab. The bellman kept letting other cabbies go until a certain cabbie that knew him came by. The cabbie shook his hand and clearly gave him cash. That does not bother me. What bothers me is that when I got to LaGuardia, the cabbie asked me for $45. I asked to see the meter and it was just on $45 but not on. He insisted that it was a flat fee to LaGuardia. I know better as I grew up in Harlem and now as an attorney, travel to NYC all the time. I told him as much and he insisted I was wrong. Only when I told him that I was getting a police officer did he rush me out of the cab, accepting $30. I notified the W because clearly the bellman was in cahoots with this cabbie and an incident, like this one, sullies the W's reputation as the collusion was blatantly obvious. Within an hour I had a response from Patrick Armano at the W. He apologized for my experience and noting that I would be returning for another full week later in the month offered to upgrade the room to a suite. I told him that my wife would be traveling with me for the first few days. When I arrived at the W, we had been upgraded to a gorgeous suite and there was a bottle of champagne in the room for us. It is a response and service like we received from Mr. Armano that makes me an incredibly loyal customer to the W New York - Times square

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhencey
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location at 47th @ Broadway. Had a "FABULOUS" category room with view of Hudson river on 37th floor (appreciated the extra side windows for the light, but wouldn't pay extra for just that water view - isn't spectacular). Was as far from Times Square side of hotel as you can get, but still had a lot of traffic noise and general city din to overcome at night. The other windows looked directly at Marriott (so close I could see what they were watching on their room TV). Room was decent size, usual W styling. Didn't mind the frosted glass bathroom wall (you can see shadow of person in bathroom doing whatever) - but I didn't like the modern faucet at the bowl sink. More a wide waterfall type flow out of the faucet, made filling a glass, rinsing razor, etc. difficult to do. Rain head in shower, had a few different settings, but nothing that provided power water stream. And the choices for shower water temperature were very hot and scalding...could never get it down to just comfortable hot. Service was good (didn't wait for check-in, always a doorman to help with taxi, etc.) I'd stay there again if I am doing a lot of Times Square/Broadway activities, saves time and money for such easy walks. But for a more general NYC stay doing things all over the city, I'd probably go elsewhere so I can escape the madness of Times Square for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent design hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Michele1972_05
Reviews.Content: Design hotel in the middle of Times Square, good locations. Room clean, nice and silent. Bathroom large and clean. Free upgrade at arrival: from a room between floors 10 and 25 to a room at 53rd floor!. Nice and helping staff. Free internet access at reception, business room at disposal for airline check in. Good value for money. Really recommended. Quick check-out. Great beginning for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but in need of some personal attention”
Reviews.Author: 2SunSisters
Reviews.Content: The key feature of the W New York Times Square is access. There is no doubt that this hotel is in an excellent location. You are in the midst of a lot of action; about 10 blocks from Central Park; a little over 10 blocks to Penn Station; less than 10 blocks to the Port Authority bus terminal; walking distance from numerous local and express subways and best of all you can see the bright lights of Times Square from your hotel room. However, this hotel this hotel had some glaring challenges that cannot be overlooked the hotel was oversold and we were sent to the W NY on the eastside for one night then we returned for the additional nights. Though very inconvenient the agents at the front desk were pleasant and tried to be accommodating by offering a room on a higher floor upon return. The room was trendy and more spacious than the room on the east side and offered a great view. However, many of the details in the room were unacceptably worn. The bathroom floor was dingy looking and the sealant around the floor was peeling; the carpet was a little tattered; the vanity in the bathroom was scratched up; and the worst offense of all was there was a hole in the wall above the round mirror that extends out on the left side of the wall next to the sink. Absolutely unacceptable for this level hotel.

Reviews.Title: “felt like I was a dance club”
Reviews.Author: jvaleski
Reviews.Content: walked out of the elevator onto the main floor and the beat was bumpin'. not exactly what I needed on a business trip. nearly 24/7 the music was so loud I couldn't spend time winding down with a drink. the room had a great view of times square, but it was very run-down and small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: AlexTorres
Reviews.Content: One of my favourite hotels in NYC (the others are the St Regis and W on Union Sq). What can you say when you are staying in one of the most exciting areas in NYC? The check-in process went smooth; the room was spotless and my breakfast at Blue Fin was delicious (muesli and protein shakes if you want to go with the healthy option). It was also nice to receive an email from their customer service department the same day I was leaving. Great from beginning to the end.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: venicegirl05
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before. Nice comfortable rooms and bed. Bathroom has frosted glass but once the light comes on, the person outside the bathroom can see everything. The restaurant is very nice with good food and the bar is nice. Hotel is centrally located in the heart of Time Square and close to subways and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the Heartbeat of NYC”
Reviews.Author: A_hui_hou_lifeisgood
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel!! From the Lobby to the Guest room!!! We spent one night here on the 42 floor in a corner unit. It's the perfect location to explore the city. No need for a car. Let your feet do the walking :) visit the M&M shop it's so much fun, the officers on horse back are so friendly & the people watching is endless!!! The W Hotel has the best toiletries BLISS!! and the Front desk staff is NOT to be forgotten...they truly were pleasant & helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Fourforfun04
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Near all attractions. Very Clean. Safe area. Many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: judi5775
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W last weekend. We had been given a gift certificate and we decided on the Times Square W because of the location. We arrived at 3:30 on Friday and were told that our room was not ready even though it said that check-in was at 3:00. The receptionist told us that they would call us on our cell phone when the room was ready. I asked if it would be 15 minutes or 2 hours. She said she did not know. We proceeded outside even though the temperature was 101 in NYC. Finally after not hearing anything we returned to the hotel at 5:10 and were told that the room was ready and had been. We never had received a phonecall to alert us and they were sorry about that. When I had made the reservation I was advised to ask for a room on a lower floor since we had upgraded to a "cool corner" room. We were given room 3401...EECK. Once you exited the elevator bank our room was 3 feet straight ahead. The room was lovely and the view down to Times Square was nice if you leaned way over the counter. We left at 6:00 for a dinner engagment and returned at 11:30 after a show. When we returned there was a cheese tray and white wine in the room. The wine was in warm water and the cheese obviously had been sitting there for HOURS!!! All night long we heard everyone that got on and off the elevator. Finally I got up and asked a group of people to please move. That was at 3:30 am. Since I was up all night I decided to confront them at the front desk about the entire experience: not being alerted our room was ready and having us outside for that duration, the cheese and wine and the floor that we had not wanted. The front desk was very apologetic and knew the person that had not alerted us and assigned us the wrong room. I requested that the cheese and wine NOT be charged to our children who had sent it to us . It was suppose to be in our room when we checked in at 3:00 but it had in fact arrived sometime after 6:00 and sat there. We were given Starwood points to make up for all the inconvenience and I really did think that was considerate of them. I told them that we would try to return another time so that we could eliminate this bad experience from our mind. We had never stayed at a Westin before and would not have hurried to return based on our initial experience. The attached restaurant served a fabulous breakfast. There is a bar in the lobby that had a DJ until 2 am...yes we know because we heard the people talking about it as they exited the elevator!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: kjtravelingmomof2
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our three year old, and had a great time. Room was very clean. Our daughter loved paling in the closet. :) the rooms are colorful, and she liked that too. The view of times square is amazing. The elevator situation was slightly annoying. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice choice in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: mannequin70
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the W times square - Mom and 2 kids. We had a corner room on the 29th floor (299$/night); we did not find it very noisy and had no problems sleeping. The kids (15 and 9) thought the lobby and decor were really cool and we all enjoyed the convenience of the location. The staff were quite friendly and we appreciated the sno-cones offered at the hotel's entry, with the heat wave going on. The room was very clean and comfortable and we loved the decor and the bath products. The only thing we had issues with was the frosted glass bathroom walls. I fail to see in what case this would be appealing... my poor teenage daughter would only shower in the dark! They should put shades inside the windows for privacy. Seeing someone squatting on the loo through the frosted glass is not great even when it is your own kids. We did not try any of the restaurants; we ordered room service one of the nights and it was expensive but fine. Also, it would be nice if they had a pool/spa. All in all a good stay and we all appreciated it but I don't think I would go back unless I was traveling alone, because of the see-thru bathroom walls. If bathroom privacy is important to you choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay... but felt a bit nickle & dimed”
Reviews.Author: JV14
Reviews.Content: Cannot rate this hotel high enough. I have already talked to my wife about bringing the family to this hotel for vacation next summer. Great property. Positives - Staff was friendly and attentive - Hotel was well kept and clean - Location, location, location - Bar is very well stocked and the bartenders are great to talk to - Rooms are a good size for Times Square Negatives - No free internet (for a business trip this is a HUGE negative). This may keep me from staying here on future business trips. For a hotel in this price range, I would think they could provide free internet access in the room. - Some fixtures in the room were falling apart - DVD player in the room did not work (seemed to be a cabling problem

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: fettuchi
Reviews.Content: I hate Times Square and was not looking forward to staying right in the middle of it all, but the location ended up being rather convenient if horribly congested. Not a surprise though. Check-in was very warm and welcoming. The hotel room was very comfortable by New York standards and, of course, stylish. The Bliss products in the bathroom were very nice. They also had a nice shower. The bed was the best part. It was incredibly comfy (especially the pillows). It made it very hard to get out of bed in the morning. It was a much quieter evening sleep than I was expecting for Times Square. The room also had a very comfy lounger. I also appreciated getting a phone call from their "Wish" folks asking if there was anything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel if you are traveling with kids or teen.”
Reviews.Author: soriao11
Reviews.Content: Small rooms,no extra beds for kids.The music is playing the hall day. Very bad time in this hotel.We will not return to this hotel.During the night it is not possible to sleep.Times Square is illuminated the hall night. The staff is very friendly but they are not ready to help,whenever you need some help.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: BarbL99
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful - from arrival through to check-out. We arrived early and our room was already available. The front desk staff were helpful and provided great suggestions for restaurants in the area. The manager of the hotel was also terrific and assisted with my airline booking for my return flight. The staff went out of their way to make sure that all of our needs were met and there was no request that was too small. It was clear that they were committed to ensuring that their guests enjoyed the entire experience.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: bainzjat
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. You are right in Time Square. We walked everywhere, Macy's, Forever21, Saks, Apple store, Central Park, Harlem... Staff are unbelievably friendly and helpful. Gym and yoga room are top notch. Rooms were comfortable. Only thing lacking was storage space in room. ie. drawers and shelves for unpacking your clothes. Only hotel i will stay in if i go back to NY again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: jolivierl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is litterally "on Times Square". The parking fees were $55 per day. We stayed three nights at the W, and we really liked it. We were in New York City to see the Cirque du Soleil's show Zarkana. All the staff members we dealt with were really nice and helpful. We enjoyed the young and trendy atmosphere, and we really loved the design of the hotel, except for one thing: the bathroom inside walls are made of frosted glass! I love my wife, but sometimes, one needs privacy... Besides that, everything was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Hotel right in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: bryan_m11
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay, just off of the North end of Times Square. Close to all the transportation and Theater stuff. This area is always packet with people so be warned, it's sometimes difficult to get around but walking into the hotel is bliss. They also have really amazing beds. The W beds and sheets are so nice that you almost don't want to get up and leave the bed. Hotel staff was friendly, I was locked out one night due to a malfunctioning keycard but it was quickly resolved. Everything you would expect from the W Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “wow,wow,wow !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Virginie50
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the w Times Squares for a week-end with my nieces end nephew, we booked the " suite fantastic".....but the suite wasn't ready and we complained at the desk....Finally the manager came and he upgrade us to a better wonderful suite!! It was amazing, beautiful.....everybody, so kind and helpfull. We definetely return to this hotel. The food at the restaurant was delicious, thank you for an amazing trip W !!!!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely stunning”
Reviews.Author: Ullo
Reviews.Content: The W - Times Square was an absolutely stunning experience! It is obviously perfectly located and a nice hideway in the middle of the most vibrant places of the Big Apple! Yes, they try to be cool and they are! But casual appearence does not exclude professional and first class guest relations!!! The Suite on top floor are the most tasteful and stunning I ever had! GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING.....Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jonnienola504
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Times square for my B-Day weekend and could not have been more pleased. This hotel is in the heart of it all right in times square. Rooms were bigger than i expected and were SPOTLESS....i stayed in a wonderful room and it was just that WONDERFUL......Nice big window. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful....Jen the concerige was AMAZING would have been lost without her. She helped us with EVERYTHING she was my go-to person at the hotel......Kelly and Casey at the front desk were both a breath of fresh air........among lots of stuffy people (in the city) not the hotel. If i ever come back to NYC (this was my 1st time) i will stay here and only here..This hotel is WONDERFUL....Jen made my stay one to remeber....Thanks to the cake she sent me on my B-BAY the w hotel is lucky to have such a wonderful person working for them and makeing memories for the people who stay there....

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, but kind of like staying at a Club! ha”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper_fl
Reviews.Content: We took our 16 yr old daughter to the W for one night as we were passing through NYC on an East Coast College Trip. We wanted to stay at our favorite (Doubletree Times Square) but they didn't have any discounted rates available. We read the great reviews on here and booked the W. It's simply an amazing hotel. GREAT location btw. Could not have asked for more when spending a night seeing a Broadway Show. However, be prepared.
