The hotel is VERY modern and between the water in the lower lobby, the unconventional seating areas in the main lobby, the hot pink neon lights everywhere, and the techno music being played in the elevators, it does give one the feeling that they are at an exclusive dance club rather than a luxury hotel. Bathroom is one of the weirdest things I have ever seen. Separated from the room by a sliding 'plastic' type door. Whole thing is like a giant plastic cube. Our daughter just LOVED it - great view, great ambiance (for a youngster like her,) but hubby and I agreed, we're happier at the Doubletree where it feels like home. Major kudos to all of the staff at the W. They made our stay completely painless and very enjoyable. Also - if you are concerned about security - elevators neat because they will only go to the room floor that your key is key-carded for. If you stay on the 52nd floor, you're going to the 52nd floor. Very good system to prevent 'just anyone' from getting in the elevator and roaming the various floors.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY!”
Reviews.Author: alr1984
Reviews.Content: I had a Wonderful stay. The W Times Square staff was very accommodating...TJ, from the bell service was a tremendous help! And most importantly the beds were extremely comfortable. Not to mention that the location is great; and that they were able to check me in early at a 7:30am arrival. Best, April

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldb4ureyes
Reviews.Content: I agree with most reviews here. You can't get a better location. Literally in Times Square and if that's where you want to be I would definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel itself is fairly modern but it could use some minor attention. Carpet was a bit worn inside room, bedding had holes from cigarette burns, shower tiles slightly worn, but these could all easily be overlooked if your not "super" picky. Cleanliness is always a big concern for me, but no complaints there. Service was great! Experienced valet service, front desk service, bar service and all were top notch. Any request I made was fulfilled right away. Awesome amentities, such as snack bar, stocked mini fridge, and bliss products. Comfy beds but pillows are way too soft. Room was quiet for NY hotel and it had a partial view of Times Square. Would suggest corner room on higher floor if you want a really good view. I found the elevators to be the worst part of my experience. The doors close way too fast. My 4 year old almost got her fingers jammed in and I saw alot of other people trying to stop the elevator doors from closing and almost getting there hands caught in as well. So take caution of the elevator doors especially if you have small children with you. Overall I had a nice experience at this hotel and would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, minimalist, no or super weak wi-fi, no ipod music player”
Reviews.Author: lilzeppelin
Reviews.Content: We are staying at this hotel for one night, but wi-fi signal in the room is on and off. When it is on, it is very weak. Even if iphone connects to wi-fi, radio streaming is impossible as their Tivoli radio has a stand alone ipod dock that does not work. Usually at W hotels, you cannot listen to ipod and charge it, but once in a while these docks do not work. So do not bank on using a wi-fi or playing "Seductive" music as "provocative lighting illuminates subtle textures on the wall" (see their room description).

Reviews.Title: “Fancy and Hip Hotel With Incredibly Professional and Hospitable Staff”
Reviews.Author: KYR00907
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Hotel New York Times Square location and I could not be happier with the accommodations. I had a one bedroom Corner Room on the 48th floor. The view was amazing, especially at night when Time Square literally lights up. The staff from the door men (Jose and Company) to the incredibly professional ladies working in the check in area. The room was amazing and spacious enough for me and my boyfriend. Kudos to the Housekeeping Department because our room was cleaned and re-cleaned after each night and we were provided with extra towels every morning without having to ask. This is especially noteworthy because when you pay for upscale, you should receive upscale and the W Hotel New York Times Square delivered! To top off our romantic excursion we were provided with chocolate covered strawberries and Champagne!! I have no doubts that this will not be our last W experience. Thank you W staff for an enjoyable weekend with no drama!

Reviews.Title: “Really wow experience!”
Reviews.Author: Patricksworld
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room with amazing views all over central park and Hudson. Loved bar, rooms were bit old here and there, but great place on average

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: pineapplegal
Reviews.Content: The W Timesqure is literally 10 steps from Timesqure! Great location, great service, clean and reasonable rate! It is a trendy boutique hotel in the heart of NYC. It's near lots of convenient cafes for quick bites and close to theaters, shops and major attractions like the Rockefeller Center, Central Park, also close to Metro stations. The only complaint I have is that the hotel doesn't provide shuttle service to and from airports and you have to take 2 elevators in order to get to and from the street and your hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION, ROOMS AND SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: debolsen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled in from LI for a relaxing night out without our 2 children before our newest baby arrives. I was 8 1/2 months pregnant and staff went out of their way to upgrade our room, give us some new baby gifts and make us feel special. Amazing views of the Hudson and so convenient to restaurants, theaters and Time Square! Looking forward to the next time we can sneak out for a night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected.”
Reviews.Author: Mouzouris
Reviews.Content: The room was larger than expected but overall not as good as expected. The bathroom had a see through wall/door, so not a lot of privacy as you can imagine (depends who you are staying with, could work for or against you). The shower did not drain properly the first two days but was finally fixed on the third day when the cleaning lady saw the water on the floor-which was not thoroughly cleaned. Extremely modern with a fantastic entrance a few steps from Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great”
Reviews.Author: Rayrachz
Reviews.Content: I was not impressed by this hotel st all!!!! Bathroom was dirty!!! So grose for a suite! I have stayed at other Starwood Hotels in NYC, such as Four points Chelsea, Four Points SoHo and W Hoboken. I would go back to any of those! They were way better and didn't have a suite!! Oh, and staying in times square forget it!! Too many people!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reiney21
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great location right off of Time Square. The rooms are very modern,platform beds,cool furniture sleek,lots of big windows to see the city. We were on the 57th floor and views were AWESOME!...service was great,replaced our iron,brought us a coffee maker.Since it was my birthday the manger gave us free drinks at the bar. Just a very cool hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business space”
Reviews.Author: CassidyWeathersby
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the W on a business trip, the room was wonderful with a great view of Time Square. We rented out meeting rooms for two days of briefings, the staff was above and beyond spectacular. The space was very nice and we had plenty of room. Only downside was how thin the walls were. During our meetings, we could hear when other meetings were dismissed with great clarity. Overall I would recommend the W for their rooms and front desk experience and also for meeting space.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff and fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: CartQueen61
Reviews.Content: This W Hotel is everything that the W Brand stands for; unique design, excellent location, extra special attention and care to it's guests. I always stay at the W New York Times Square when I am in the city for business and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: IrishOrls
Reviews.Content: After our stay I feel compelled to write my first review. After a fantastic cruise, I thought our stay here might be anti-climatic as rooms in NY generally are! The staff on check in were so friendly and welcoming and our room (lead in type) was so big with wonderful views over the river for 4th July! Will look no further then this hotel for next trip to NY

Reviews.Title: “Passable”
Reviews.Author: rssa
Reviews.Content: I like the W brand, and the feel of the hotel lived up to it. Service was generally not as good as others that I have stayed in, concierge had a slightly dismissive manner and the cleaners literally waited outside my door for me to leave (late checkout).

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Funky Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsider
Reviews.Content: Only had the opportunity to stay one night, as I was in for a business trip. In my comments, I'm going to consider that the hotel just was not my style, and I really don't see it as being very conducive to business. Employees were excellent. I think overall the lobby and elevators were a little worn, but the low lighting and loud music distracted me from that. The room was very nice. Shower head was too low, a pet peeve I comment on when I get a chance. Both the bar area (in same area as the check in) and the ground level restaurant had constant music that was too loud and just not my style, but if you are young and not trying to conduct a business conversation, it might be the place for you. Overall, I don’t think there was sufficient value in the price, even with the nice room and excellent service. Certainly is an excellent location for travelers looking for fun. One other pet peeve – the bed had a sheet and a heavy comforter with nothing in between in the room. Not conducive to a summer night with the AC going. It might work in the winter though.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Crusin-Momma
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and found the hotel a very nice place to stay. Although the price of the room was a little more than most, the views and hotel staff were great. The Fabulous room had a great view of the Hudson River and overlooked many of the other city buildings. The location is a great place in Times Square - although at night - even on the 48th floor you could still hear sirens, horns honking, and people yelling in the street at times. We didn't eat any of the room "munchies" because they were too expensive and we didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant due to its prices. I would not recommend the room for families with children due to the glass walls in the bath, but it is a fantastic room for couples looking for a romantic get away. I would recommend to anyone wanting a private and upscale stay in New York.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: smaguy
Reviews.Content: Great room (a suite) and great service. TImes Square is a little nutty, but you can't beat the mid-town location. We'll be back. Thanks W.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, once again!"”
Reviews.Author: TravelPlanner97
Reviews.Content: I returned to the W Times Square for a business trip in early June and once again was impressed with the excellent service. Gilmar at the Concierge desk was able to recommend and secure a same-day reservation at Bobby Van's for a large party of my associates, and all of the staff was very accomodating for the entire length of my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jbrown829
Reviews.Content: I booked an overnight stay this past Saturday at the W Hotel in Times Square and tickets to Wicked as a surprise graduation present for my daughter. I made arrangements many weeks earlier for chocolate-covered strawberries to be delivered to the room as a treat for her. I made other requests when making my reservation (extra towels in the room and turn down service). I also requested that craft paper be taped to the glass bathroom walls and doors (at their suggestion, after reading reviews on TripAdvisor about this weird, unappealing design) to insure our privacy. I informed them of our arrival time and confirmed with them a few days before and was assured that all of my requests would be taken care of. Well, not one of them was! Upon arrival, the front desk clerk was extremely abrupt and rude. I asked a couple of questions about the hotel but she was clearly not interested in answering them. When we got to our room, there were no chocolate-covered strawberries, no extra towels, and no craft paper on the bathroom walls. After 30 minutes of waiting, I finally called the Concierge and inquired about the chocolate-covered strawberries - my daughter heard the whole conversation, which completely ruined the surprise. I was told that there was no request for any "amenities" on my reservation. I informed the Concierge that I was holding all of my e-mail correspondence with hotel management which clearly stated my requests, their responses, and management confirmations. About 15 minutes later, the strawberries finally arrived. The lining of the bath robe that was supplied in the room was completely torn and, no surprise, when we arrived back at our room at 11pm that evening, no turn down service or extra towels. I called the Whatever/Whenever desk to complain (again) and was told (again) that there was no indication of any "special requests" on my reservation. I repeated that I was holding a printed confirmation with my reservation information and the special requests were clearly there. The craft paper was finally installed on the bathroom walls while we were gone. The hotel lightening is very dark, so much so that it is difficult to see the buttons in the elevator. The hotel is also quite noisy. My daughter and I did not get any sleep that evening. We were in a room on the 40th floor near an elevator so we heard everyone's loud comings and goings, even at 4am. Definitely not the "spectacular" room we thought we were getting when we booked. All in all, a very disappointing weekend. I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Hip & Modern”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeW1111
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Times Square was a very unique and modern hotel. The moving water ceiling when you first enter on the ground floor gives you a taste of things to come. The lobby was very colorful with lights and images projected on the walls and columns. The room was done in a minimalist style, but provided great amenities and comforts. The beds were extremely comfortable. The staff was very accommodating, and responded promptly to requests for foam pillows and wake up calls. Although on Times Square, the room was very quiet. We enjoyed our stay at the W Times Square very much.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and close to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: rowatwork
Reviews.Content: If you are going to New York City for the first time, this hotel is for you. Ideal location right ON Times Square and less than a block away from Broadway shows. Both our kids enjoyed all the wonderful sites and shopping without having to go far; just next door. Shopping until 1am every day. A few blocks away from 5th Avenue for more attractions- Central Park, St Peter's Cathedral, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, etc. Hotel itself is amazing, modern with great Lounge area as you check it. We were on the 50th floor and our friends/families came to visit US so they can enjoy the view. Love, love, love this hotel, its location and NYC. Definitely will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Why there is no WOW at this W”
Reviews.Author: dooburt
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in W's all over America, this was my first time at a W in New York. After this stay, I wished I had booked the cheaper Tuscany or Courtyard, because unfortunately this W is just a disappointment. Check-in was where the disappointment began, with the typical 100mph New York whirlwind. Staff were in such a rush to get onto other things and other customers, there was no personal touch. We were given a room on the 34th floor and told we had been "upgraded". The room was poor. Considering the amount this W costs a night, it was dingy, tired and small. We immediately returned to the reception to have the room changed. At this point we were told that we hadn't been upgraded and that another "upgraded" room was given to us. This was a corner room on the 43rd floor (4301). This was a better room, but considering, again, the cost of these rooms it still wasn't "wow". We asked the concierge during our stay for some help with which gate to use at Port Authority bus terminal for a trip to Six Flags Great Adventure. Utterly useless. We knew more than she did. Having taken the bus before we explained that we knew the bus went from Port Authority and it was a NJ Transit bus. She simply didn't listen to what we were saying because moments later she said the bus went from Penn Station and was a Grey-something bus. We explained again this wasn't the case, at which point she gave up. Not very "whatever/whenever" is it? She was far too eager to get rid of us than help and this unfortunately was the impression we got from all the staff. We had some billing issues, with the incidental card being charged for the room, despite explicit instructions not to do so. Paying in travellers cheques also seemed to be a fight. Staff need to not pull a grimace when someone doesn't wish to pay by credit card. We visit New York a lot for British travellers and despite my loyalty to the Starwood group (Westin, W, Aloft etc.), I won't stay at this particular W again. For travellers looking for a better W service, try the other New York W's, because this one is too big for its own good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the value....”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only. Got the booking from Starwood's website for almost $ 400 a night. Very expensive considering just ordinary services, very small space of bedroom, tired room's carpet & decor. Also, it was very expensive to dine here. Paid more than $ 100 just for a cheese burger, a cheese pizza and 2 glasses of diet Coke. They charged 19% of service charge on all food bills plus local government taxes of about 8.5%. So, I paid almost 30% to my food bills. Also, it's not the right place to stay if you come with your children because the lobby turned into a "temporary" disco place at night. However, it was located in the heart of times square which was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but questionable service.”
Reviews.Author: NatC33
Reviews.Content: Hip hotel and bar is good but it's like walking into a nightclub every time you come back to hotel. Not suitable for older travellers. Bathroom wall is see through so nit suitable for those timid, families or sharing. Check in staff friendly but concierge. Ok but overall disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SJA in PA
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our three daughters (6, 10 & 13) to NYC for their first visit and we stayed at the W New York Times Square. Rooms were clean and we had a good view of Times Square. I have to say, I've stayed in NYC several times & this hotel did not make the top of my list. We needed two adjoining rooms.....neither of which were available to us until long past the hotel's check-in time. This was very upsetting as we had a pre-paid-in-full reservation! Also, had a hard time getting hot water during a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic, Beautiful, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jasruble
Reviews.Content: I read through hundreds of reviews and decided on the W at Times Square for my wife and I to celebrate our anniversary and make our first visit to NYC. It was a great choice. The hotel and the people who run it are fantastic. The atmosphere is part electric, part serene, and all exciting. The people are so nice and accomodating, the view is phenomenal. The room is not small like some wrote (we had a cool corner room) but actually a perfect size and very sleek. You almost hate that you are not in the room more. Did I mention the location? You walk out the door and are right there at all the shows and things to do. Highly recommend this hotel and I am very critical and observant to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but that was about it”
Reviews.Author: jase369
Reviews.Content: The location is great...out the door and you are staring at the TKTS booth. Other than that...very expensive, room was not that well maintained, and service was lacking to say the least. Without going into everything that was wrong with the stay, I was given 1/2 off my stay as well as a bunch of Starpoints to compensate. I must say the manager handled the resolution promptly and professionally, but I would probably look elsewhere in the Times Square area if staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: derby12360
Reviews.Content: The W hotel in Times Square is an AWESOME hotel. Fantastic location near Broadway, Hard Rock Cafe and great restaurants.It is very clean and it very well staffed with lovely, friendly people there to help you day and night.The ambience creates a chic and relaxed environment. It was a great experience I would stay there again and so would my family and friends. The beds are so comfy!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel that matches the energy of its Times Square location”
Reviews.Author: netwerqq
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely my favorite hotel in New York. I like staying in Times Square because of the energy and heart of the city there and this hotel feeds off that energy. It's exciting to check in at the Living Room, where I've always been greeted quickly and sent on my way without a hassle. They provide the fastest check-in of any hotel I've ever been in. The rooms are very modern and an excellent size for New York. If you want a cool experience -- for either business or fun travel -- I highly recommend the W Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “3 Days Two Nights In the City with my Husband!”
Reviews.Author: MzGizzmo50
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right in Times Square. The front door is a few steps away from the marques. The hotel service is excellent. The theme is whatever, whenever and they mean it. We ordered free dvd's that were delivered to our room in a snap. Bliss toiletries are wonderful, and the bed was very comfortable. Location is fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre - Lots of other great options”
Reviews.Author: xchr1583x
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for three nights a few weeks ago. The hotel is in a central location (which can be quite busy, so fair warning), but if you want to be able to walk right out into the heart of times square this is a good place to be. The hotel staff at the front desk were courteous (once they took note that I was present). Usually, they seem to be focused on their computer screens and when hotel guests walk up - they are usually seen standing there for a few minutes before someone will glance up and call them over. I stayed in a basic 'Wonderful' room. The beds were comfortable, and the room was cleaned daily. I didn't like the semi-private glass enclosed bathrooms, so unless you're comfortable with seeing the silhouette of your rooming partner taking a shower, or going to the bathroom - this could be an awkward moment for the both of you! Upon checkout our hotel room was charged an extra $9.18 for incidental charges that upon further inquiry was for the snacks located in the hotel room. The problem was though, that we never took anything! I promptly called the hotel who said they would refund the charge, but this was completely unnecessary. We didn't even open it up to look inside - yet we were charged. Strange. On our last morning at the hotel as well, they appeared to be doing construction or repairs either on our floor or quite near to it as we were awoken numerous times in the morning from the noises of power tools and banging which was quite unpleasant. This was not disclosed to us though at all. As a Travel Agent, I would likely not recommend this property to many until they focus more on their guest experience approach. Although the stay wasn't terrible - for the prices they charge, the service is far below where it should be and the ameneties are average. I will be returning to the city within the next few weeks and haven't considered staying at the W Times Square again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get it - won't be returning.”
Reviews.Author: jemfor
Reviews.Content: After much research we decided to book this hotel in December 2010 through Expedia. As we were staying with friends who have a three year old daughter we thought that the W would be a great place to stay as it is "central" to most of the big tourist attractions. We arrived at a busy time 5pm on Memorial Saturday, as the taxi pulled up the three or four doormen stood around talking and laughing with each other as we struggled out of the taxi with numerous bags, and a stroller. No help was offered AT ALL!! We checked in, we asked for a room with a river view but the receptionist could not accomodate, fair enough - but as she only briefly looked she then gave us a room overlooking Times Square, the complete opposite direction. She didn't seem to understand that we wanted a view of something other than Times Square. Got to room with much difficulty as key cards took an age to swipe in the elevator, this was a common problem throughout the week. Now ....Memorial weekend was extremely humid and we were staying 6 nights, the air conditioning was very poor, maintainance did come to fix the control but the system wasn't very good. Throughout our stay at the hotel we had no interaction with the doormen - until the very last day when one doorman hailed us a cab after we had been hanging around for 10 mins, everytime we saw the doormen they seemed to be socialising with each other and not with hotel guests. The only time we visited the concierge he was helpful, and did get us the website address for The Lower East Side Tenement Museum, which we could have done ourselves really. he told us he could not book tickets for us as the hotel did not have a credit card machine!!!!! (The last time we visted NYC we stayed at The UN Millenium Plaza and they had no trouble booking tickets for this museum.) BEWARE!! The policy at the W is that you book your own tickets in their Buisness Centre, which costs $ 12 to log on! ( there is a free Mac in the lobby - but it does not have the option of printing) To print any booking confirmations costs 45 cents!!! Unbelievable!!!!! Overall the W Times Square is a rip off, over priced and over rated!! And don't even get me started on the fact that on our first night our friends wallet was stolen in the hotel bar and the card used twice in the hotel illegally!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in a Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: danyelle1986
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay at the W on Times Square and I can honestly say I have no complaints whatsoever. It was our first time in Manhattan and we chose the hotel due to it's fantastic location, and it didn't disappoint, Times square is practically on the doorstep. The majority of attractions from the Rockefeller Centre, The Empire State Building and Central Park are all within walking distance. The hotel itself is fab, all of the employees that we encountered were extremely friendly, welcoming and eager to help. The lobby and entrance hall, along with the room we stayed in was very clean, tidy and immaculately decorated with a chic, modern feel. The room we stayed in was on the 40th floor so we had a great view of Broadway which was really pretty at night. The room was also quite spacious and cleaned daily, it had everything you would need for a short break in the city, the bed was especially comfy too which is a rarity in some hotels. The Living Room bar on the 7th floor is also worth a visit, a little pricier than other bars in the area but definitely a good place to relax and people watch after a long day of walking around Manhattan. Overall I would recommend this hotel, we had a really enjoyable stay and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to see a Broadway show!”
Reviews.Author: Ebabybaby
Reviews.Content: My parents and I stayed in 2 rooms here to take in NYC and see a Broadway play. I usually stay at the W Hotel on Lexington for work, but wanted to try Times Square since it is walking distance from all the Broadway shows! My parents had never stayed at a W Hotel and loved every minute. The staff here is very friendly and cheerful - from the front door, to check-in, housekeeping, the concierge and the bartender. People went out of their way by anticipating our needs, suggesting restaurants, printing maps, offereing tips and making our stay easy and fun. We are planning a return trip next Spring!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the heart ot it all”
Reviews.Author: campbellf2008
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the W Time Square. We were greeted warmly at the front door and directed to the reception on the 7th Floor. Check in was quick and effortless and the reception staff were extremely courteous, answering any questions we had. We have been lucky enough to have visited New York on a few occassions and I can advise that the rooms are generously sized by NYC standards and that the beds offered a great nights sleep. We were located on the 56th floor in one of the 'Spectacular Rooms' which is quite a height up from the the chaos of Times Square and with the exception of the occassional siren during the night we could hear little of the noise below. Our room was spotless (with one little issue that I'll get to later) and modernly fitted out. The bathroom was well apportioned and while the shower was not overly powerful it provided a more than adequate level of water pressure. The Bliss bathroom products are a very nice touch. As our flight home was late evening, and having made the most of the beautiful NY sunshine, we were looking to freshen up before departing and reception kindly organised access to the fitness suite on the 10th Floor where we managed to shower and change before transferring to the airport. A couple of very minor points on the rooms - while storage in the rooms is pretty good a couple of extra drawers would help enormously. Secondly we did find a piece of a previous occupants underwear under the chaise longue, but as this was the evening prior to checking out we did not mention it. Overall an excelent hoteland we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Location and Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: NEWYORKFAN2011
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a few days at the W New York - Times Square with family. The hotel is chic yet surprisingly warm. I was extremely impressed with the staff. From restaurant staff to management, everyone was fabulous and extremely helpful. The location was great, even for kids. Easy access to incredible shopping and several tours/tour buses available just a few steps away. I highly recommend to singles, couples and families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelCalif
Reviews.Content: We planned our stay at the W through American Express Fine Hotels program. This program entitles the customer to a room upgrade if available. We booked a room with 2 beds. Upon check-in, we were informed that a double room was unavailable and also that there was not an upgrade available. We were informed that the hotel would provide a rollaway bed and would try to get a double room the following day. Upon entering our room, the small size was the first thing we noticed. And then we found out that the frosted glass on the bathroom walls and doors afforded very little privacy, if any. Once the rollaway bed arrived, we could literally not move around the room. We called the front desk the following morning to see if a double room was available and was told by Michael that he would try and would call me. I never received a call. I followed up with him and he said he still had nothing available. Feeling ignored and frustrated, I phoned American Express who contacted the hotel directly and was able to get a double room. Our double room had 2 beds but was still extremely small. And the bathroom was filthy! There was hair on the shower walls and dirt on the floor! Needless to say, our next stay in New York will not include the W Hotel or any affiliates.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: dmurray71
Reviews.Content: Visited the W for a short break with my husband to celebrate my 40th. First time in NYC so we wanted something special.. Check in was so quick and efficient I thought i'd missed it. We were given concise instructions on how to get to the elevators (reception on the 7th floor). Delighted with our Cool Corner Room on the 47th Floor. Great view of Times Square from one window and we could see the Hudson in the distance from the other. Bed was soooooo comfy. Had great sleeps. Massive bed and soft fluffly pillows. Bathroom was great and toiletries superb. Room was pristine throughout our stay. The Whatever Whenever desk was a godsend and Gerrard who helped us twice was extremely courteous and efficient. Recommended a lovely Italian place nearby and advised us of cruise schedules. On our departure he also helped us with getting to Newark and even checked us in. Exceptional service. Living Room bar cocktails were fantastic and our waitress was lovely. Overall had an amazing time, never felt rushed or harrassed. Staff were courteous and helpful. Wouldnt hesitate to go back or go to another W.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city that never sleeps!”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaToni
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the W Times Square, was an absolute delight. It was fun, hip and exciting. The rooms were extremely quiet even though we were smack dab in the middle of all the Times Square activity! i was blown away by how fast room service was!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tbrown_48
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I treated ourselves to the Jersey Boys (excellent!) and an overnight stay in the City. We chose the W Times Square because it was central to everything we wanted to do. We were able to walk comfortably from Grand Union to the W and from there to the Theatre and shopping surrounds. I had read on TA that the W is primarily geared to a young, trendy crowd and we are all in our 50s and 60s but we felt up to the challenge! I have to admit the vibe was young, trendy and very cool. Having said that, we felt completely comfortable. The hotel is lovely, the staff was friendly and helpful, and though 4 of us shared one room with two double beds, we didn't feel particularly crowded and the beds were VERY comfortable. It was a an expensive stay but we knew that and were prepared for it and, for my money, we got what we paid for and more. I love the Whatever, Whenever approach the hotel has. I would definitely stay at the W again!!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable First Wedding Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: nordiegirl11
Reviews.Content: We traveled to the hotel May 5-9 to celebrate our one year wedding anniversary. It was also my husband's first trip to NYC and I wanted to ensure it was a fantastic trip for him. I started communicating with Molly Megargle, one of the wonderful concierges, several months in advance to make the trip extra special. Molly made planning our trip easy and effortless with her friendly and fun personality. She went above and beyond our expectations by having a bottle of sparkling cider (since I'm newly pregnant) and a plate of chocolate covered strawberries waiting for us in our room upon arrival. She also had some baby gifts for me in a beautifully wrapped package on the bed. We were blown away by her attention to detail and her gracious generosity. The rest of the team was fantastic and they always made us feel welcome and accommodated any request or questions we had. Two other concierges, Amber and Jarrod, were especially helpful. We were located on a corner room on the 42nd floor overlooking the Hudson and a small street. I found the location to be ideal as it was very quiet and peaceful versus a room facing Broadway. We saw housekeeping several times as we were leaving our room and they were always very kind and professional. The room was adequate size and we had no issues with the frosted bathroom doors being too opaque. In summary, we could not have been happier with the location of the hotel or the outstanding service we received from the staff. Thank you to the W New York Times Square team for making our first wedding anniversary such a wonderful memory!

Reviews.Title: “Fab”
Reviews.Author: Snoppy07
Reviews.Content: We stayed in different hotels in New York but this one is my favourite. We had 2 fabulous rooms facing one the Hudson river and the second one the Hudson rive plus Broadway. The rooms were very clean and huge as far as New York is concerned. Very clean as well. Reception people very friendly as well as the concierges. I can only recommend this hotel and be sure I will be back next time I am in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great vibe and location”
Reviews.Author: fernandf
Reviews.Content: In the middle of Time Square, on the of the livest corners of the world, you drop your car at the valet and you go up to the 7th, floor where the action starts! It smells so good and plus they change the carpets of the elevator 3 times a day: each one saying either Good Morning, Good Afternoon or Good Evening according to the time of the day. Wonderful. Free WiFi at the lobby and also a beautiful lounge and bar at the lobby, don't worry this is one of the most soundproof hotels I've ever seen. The you check in quickly (fast service). They give you you room key and number, I've stayed here twice, the first time on the 57th. floor and the latest time on the 33rd. Elevators are fast and secure since they don't go up unless you have a hotel card. The rooms have spectacular views no matter the floor, even though I didn't get any landmark sight view, my room was facing broadway and the vibe is great! Great value for the price and the concierges and the Whatever Whenever services they have are outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: Eatlaughtravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at an amazing location if you want to see Broadway shows. I was pleasantly surprised that the street noise wasn't too bad at night. The hotel was close to eateries and some shopping. The subway was close as well. The rooms were nice and modern. All in all, will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW --”
Reviews.Author: NYC_lover2011
Reviews.Content: WOW! This hotel is the best! The whole atmosphere is great. The staff is soo helpful and kind. Our wish is truly a phone call away with W. The room was beautiful. We had a great view, being on a higher floor. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Electric”
Reviews.Author: Lilycat63
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel location brilliant bar over pricey but we were on a special trip, sheets and bed were gorgeous. Only down side was static shocks we kept getting ... Funny but made you wary of touching anything!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: travelledswede
Reviews.Content: Travelled with some friends for a weekend in New York. We arrived quite late but the staff were all very nice and greeted us with a big smile. (Saw the que to the check-in desk the next day but I never had a problem with it.) The hotel are located in the middle of NY. I don't think you can get any more central that this. Both good and bad... I tend to enjoy being a little bit away from the tourist area but you know what, the hotel was great. I slept like a baby so the bed must have been great.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: ManiBagga
Reviews.Content: Platinum member with starwood. I usually dont care for suites. Front desk saw i was with my wife and daughtery. Went above and beyond to get us a nice room. Got us a suite for 8 day stay. Very nice. the hotel is clean, happening and great for times square. a little expensive but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever Whenever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 4somePictures
Reviews.Content: What can I say!! Everything was so Perfect! Before we arrived I receive the help of Patrick Armano to create the dream weekend for the birthday of my 17 years girl. He was so helpfull and did all our wish come true!!! When they say; whaterver whenever, believe me that is true!!! The Hotel is wonderfull, classy and modern, on the right spot in Time Square to shop all night, and the restaurant in the Hotel is so good, I will definitly go back there for my next visit in NY. W staff are incredible!!! Thank you to all of you, because this will be a weekend to remember...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Londonloyal
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in and around Times Square. From the moment we arrived until we left the staff were amazing and could not do enough to make our stay amazing. Ok so the drink prices are steep but so are drinks in all hotels in Manhatten and we expected it. This hotel exceeded every expectation we had and our "cool corner" room on the 55th floor was incredible with views over all parts of the city. The rooms was quiet and the housekeeping staff were exceptional every day! I wish i could have stayed longer but i will be back and without hesitation i will be staying here again. Well done W Hotels on an amazing Hotel with brilliant staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Fantastic Suite was FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: HowieLA
Reviews.Content: I want to commend you and your staff at the W Times Square on my recent visit (April 5 - 12). The W has once again exceeded my expectations! The Fantastic Suite was fantastic! The view from the 40th floor was outstanding. I am a very light sleeper, and I was pleased how quite the suite was, and how comfortable the bed was too. The nightly turn down service was an extra plus; it was nice to come back and have had housekeeping visit and find the room straightened up. The gym on the 10th floor also exceeded my expectations. The equipment was up to date and I was impressed on how clean the facility was. One of the reasons I choose W Hotels is because of the hip vibe. I love the dramatic lighting and club feel of the hotel. I travel so much for business, staying at a W makes me feel like I am on vacation from the moment I enter the lobby. The W Hotels has been my first choice when I travel, and I can't wait to return the the W Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Uber cool and VERY KIND”
Reviews.Author: BeaMarie
Reviews.Content: Every employee that I encountered was pleasant and helpful. I especially noted that a chambermaid who happened to be on the elevator with us make a point of addressing us and asking us how we were doing and if we were enjoying our stay. The hotel was all glitz and glamour - not really my style but fun to experience, especially when coupled with great service. Our morning coffee arrived less than 10 minutes after I requested it!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool! Already recommended to friends!”
Reviews.Author: GarethBeck
Reviews.Content: From check in the service we received was excellent. Upon arrival in the room it was apparent that the sink pug wasn't working properly. I reported this to reception and it was rectified immediately. That was the only negative (which in my opinion isn't even a negative). Lobby Staff and Bar Staff great. Whatever Whenever (which we used a couple of times) was fantastic! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “unwelcoming,too uber cool to be kind”
Reviews.Author: isabella2008
Reviews.Content: Hated the see through bathroom walls -Who wants to watch their partner using the toilet?no bath-only in "handicapped rooms" The room -one big retail opportunity,what a rip off-but top of the list the bar-this was my birthday and my big birthday surprise after flying thousands of miles.The bar staff were horrid.They were young women,I was old and didnt they make me feel it ,smirking and laughing at me.So thank you ladies for making me feel ugly,old and ridiculous on my 60th birthday-I'll never forget it .

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class”
Reviews.Author: wmship
Reviews.Content: If you've never been to NYC, and you're excited to go, and you're planning it out..... this is the joint to book. It might cost a few extra bucks, but ditch the fanny packs and white socks up to the knees and stay in one extremely cool hotel. This property is the prom queen of Times Square... jus sayin. /wm

Reviews.Title: “For the Young and those Ready to have fun!”
Reviews.Author: MalikZara
Reviews.Content: I've been to New York many times, and this is the only Hotel I would recommend. It's super hip, and very central. The White room is incredible. It's pretty common to run into someone famous or meet a model when you're hangin out in the ultra trendy lounge. The guest rooms are quite small so I would recommend one of the larger suites. The average New Yorker however will try to avoid Times Square, but the average tourist wants to soak it all up, and everytime I come to NYC, I want the bright lights and lively atmosphere. What's pretty cool is when we went they had this Acura Test drive deal where they would drop you anywhere in a 5-7 mile radius in an Acura MDX to show it off so we also saved some mula on cabs, atleast going to the destination, but walking back or catching a cab wasn't a big deal. The service was pretty good but nothing to rave about. If you're a young couple lookin to party this is a great place because every night the lobby/lounge area has got something or another goin on. W hotels are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: brsnation1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for the first time during Spring Break and it was a wonderful experience. The staff was very attentive and helpful. Their attention to detail was very refreshing. Its the perfect location to be in the middle of it all, specially when traveling with a teenager. Great place to spot celebrities and athletes.

Reviews.Title: “Careful & caring service & great location”
Reviews.Author: slk12300
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite It easily accomodated extra people for sleeping especially because of the 2 bathrooms Great flat screen TVs perfect view of the action in Times Square Prepare yourself if you check in on a friday or Saturday evening. When you get off the elevator you are in their club its noisy & you have to shout to check in ...but thats new york at night It was great fun. I will definately return

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had read all the reviews first”
Reviews.Author: trip0ntheg0
Reviews.Content: The location was great, right in Times Square. My teenage son and I stayed here, and I have to say, I felt a bit out of place in this hotel. Not sure if this hotel is supposed to be "hip", felt like there was a "singles" atmosphere. The room was ok, a bit small but fairly clean. No drawers for clothes so whatever we didn't hang in the closet we had to leave in our suitcase. Bathroom has two frosted glass "walls" that are see through from the room, but not from the inside looking out. My son thought that maybe they were installed backwards. Definitely not appropriate for families. Dust on the bedstand, dirt on the wooden chair. Toilet had scratch/brown rust? stains in the bowl. For the money, there are better hotels in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable, excellent, first class”
Reviews.Author: Telegram_Sam_51
Reviews.Content: My wife celebrated her 50th birthday during our stay and all the staff helped to make it special. We asked the receptionist (Pamela) if she could recommend a special restaurant and she was very helpful and recommended The Place. The concierge contacted The Place to make a reservation and also notified them of the celebration as they greeted us with a glass of champagne each. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff who helped us. On each occasion we contacted the reception or concierge we were always greeted with a friendly smile and they were very helpful. All in all the hotel staff made our celebrations memorable. Thank you to everyone at The W.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trvl136
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. The hotel is in the heart of Times Square and in proximity to Theaters, wonderful restaurants, transportation and close to shopping. The rooms were the a nice size for a New York hotel and very clean. Our room afforded a beautiful view of the city. Hotel staff was very pleasant and extremely accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Most accomodating staff, amazing room, great bar, fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dmbowie
Reviews.Content: I came in for business on Monday morning, but brought my wife as we were taking a client and his wife to a show that night. Aline Urkumyan emailed me prior to arrival to see if I needed anything. I’m generally a very low maintenance business traveler, but because my wife was joining me I asked Aline if there was anything she could do to make the stay more exciting. She went above and beyond and was extremely professional, responsive, and accommodating. 1. She made every accommodation I requested, asked for feedback, made sure we had everything we needed. Phenomenal client service. 2. She won the loyalty of someone who is already a platinum member at Hyatt and Hilton. I told her and will tell you that it is because of people like her that I will now a be loyal Starwood guest.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable in Everyway......”
Reviews.Author: PatriziaG
Reviews.Content: I've been to NYC 100s of times. Stay at Ws most of the time because of their customer service, attention to detail and the most comfortable beds ever. This trip is worth a review. Booked the trip for my niece's birthday gift from me. She is 23 yrs and the W Times Sq is her fav. I got an email from Aline Urkumyan a WOW expert at the hotel, welcoming me and asking if I had any "wishes for her to grant." while at the hotel. I told her it was my nieces birthday and asked for recommendations for new restaurants, shopping etc. She went above and beyond. We checked in to a beautiful room decorated with balloons and candy!! She called to welcome us. The experience was amazing. Came back to work and shared my experience. Can't wait to go back.....Love this hotel. Aline thank you so much for putting the biggest smile on my niece's face.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Clean, Comfortable Room with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: saneb-traveler
Reviews.Content: I actually wasn't planning on staying at the W during this trip, but was able to get a last minute room due to a problem at another hotel. The staff were very prompt, attentive, and helpful during the stay. The room was exactly as promised and very clean and comfortable with a large window looking out onto Times Square. The only downside at all was hearing some of the noise from Times Square, but in my opinion the location made up for the noise. An excellent stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A trip with many memorable memories”
Reviews.Author: Cristy1916
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent selection by my sister. The location of the hotel is right on Time Square which was ideal, it was within walking distance to everything. The staff was hospitable and always attentive. The check-in process was quick and seamless. The room was clean and had all sorts of amenities. When calling for any type of service the staff was prompt and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel in Time Square and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The W at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: jfulgueira
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, excellent service, beautiful hotel, happening lobby bar. Highly recommend, my daughters and I will definitely go back. Thank you "W" for making my birthday a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Keep looking...this place isn't worth it”
Reviews.Author: MeVerb
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here for an annual business trip to Manhattan. After years at the Marriott Marquis monolith, a smaller place with personality seemed like a nice break. But the personality is not a pleasant one. First impression is at the curb. There are a number of doorpeople "working" but in 6 days, I never once saw one open a door for a guest, whether the guest had luggage, bags or other impediments. In fact one morning they laughed as a guest caught a rolling bag in the revolving door. The lack of smiles, or helpfulness, was remarkable, even for New York. The entry way is stylish, with a glass ceiling and water tumbling onto it, dance/electronica playing in the entry/elevator/7th floor and clean lines and moody lighting. The 7th floor had the pretentiously named "living room", with dramatic styling (chairs made of logs and fabric sculptures, as well as the front desk to the left and the bar to the right. Registration went smoothly. The elevator is dark, and to go to any floor you have to use a keycard. Needless to say, on most trips, there was some poor schmoe having to fumble for the key card. And from the time you get out of the elevator, your world turns dark and colorless. I get the idea that shades of dark gray, silver and black is high style and stark, sharp angles are (literally) edgy. But the same color scheme is used in prisons, and after a short time, you get the same effect. The most notable aspect is the Formica-like boxes that are used as cabinets. Laminated pressed wood isn't what I expect in an supposedly upscale hotel (I know it was laminated pressed wood because the door on one drawer was missing a hand-sized chuck of laminate.) The rooms are gloomy, and dark, and the shades are totally light blocking, so if you want privacy you also get gloom. The desk area has random wires and jacks, but it looks like somebody swiped the electronics. Although they apparently expect you to bring a laptop, they also gauge you for wifi, at 15 bucks a day. Oh, and bring a cellphone since all the calls are $2 to $3 (local or calls to 800#s). And maybe bring a chair. The one at the desk is a vinyl chair like you'd find in a cafeteria -- no ability to adjust it, armrest or wheels...most places are springing for aeron chairs or similar. The other seating option is a vinyl "fainting couch" by the window. Housekeeping is also pretty sketchy... the $9 Fiji water, when I picked it up, shot water out of a puncture at the top. It was an odd defect, like somebody jabbed a hypodermic in it. Staff was good about replacing it but that was strange. Stranger still was the swiffer broom that was left in my room one morning! I put it in the hallway around 6 p.m. and it was still in the hall the next morning. Another day, the bed cover was left on the fainting chair instead of on the bed. I would probably not be writing this review, but mysterious minibar charges seem to be added to everyone's bill. At least two other people at check out were complaining about extra expenses on the minibar, and I had an unexplained $17 charge on mine. The $13.07 for a Corona was correct, although when I called to ask how much the beer was (I had no price list in my room) I was told $10. After seeing the charge on the bill that was slipped under the door, I called and the staff person told me it would be removed. BUT when I go to the front desk, I have to raise the issue all over again. So, bottom line, next year I'm going someplace else and I'd urge you to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “What's your Wish”
Reviews.Author: SashaLuna
Reviews.Content: W in Times Square is by far the best hotel anyone can stay in while a visit in NYC. Amazing eveything: The rooms are spacious and great for NYC standards. The Lobby is gorgeous and the bar is beautiful. The staff treated everyone I was with like royalty. They are extremely accomodating and generous. The best part is that the concierge does not leave early, like most hotels I've visited in NYC. If it is not obvious, I would definetly recommend the hotel. It is amazing with comfort, cleanliness and service. You can get good deals for $250 a night rather than $440-500 on some occasions on expedia or priceline so I would def recommend checking there.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like we were all that mattered to them”
Reviews.Author: kentschan
Reviews.Content: A couple of country people, my gal and I, both in our mid forties, ventured down to see the play LOMBARDI on Broadway. We booked 2 nights at the "W". The people working there, the attention to our questions, and the way everyone made us feel at home was amazing. When directions were needed, we were helped. Where was an affordable place to eat---"try this place". Our room overlooked uptown out of one window and the mighty Hudson out of the other. It was luxurious, classy, and a moment in our lives we will not forget. Simply a wonderful hotel. We were called by name as we came and went, and we have already planned to stay there again. Top notch all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Gates06
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days last year. Hotel very chic and classy with excellent facilities in rooms. Bar quite expensive and due to its locality hard to find reasonable dinig options. These were our only faults because the hotel is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Midtown Business”
Reviews.Author: Roncinante
Reviews.Content: Staff is first rate; rooms are well maintained and the property is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Montreal1642
Reviews.Content: The location of the hôtel cannot be better if you want to be in the heart of N.Y. Staff and service was much appreciated. The hôtel offert a modern style and all the services you'll need trought the consierge (service for your room, the booking for show, your travelling in N.Y....) All that is mention on the site of W, you'll find at this hôtel. Restaurant offer good food, the bar offer after 19h00 good music by a DJ.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lovetohavefun22308
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, until the moment we left the hotel the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They were able to recommend very good restaurants, including one in the Meat Packing District, where a well know movie star sat a few tables away. We loved the Living Room environment where we met very interesting people from around the world.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: oscar2510
Reviews.Content: A great location, great staff and a great time. Whether your goal is to relax or to party the W Times Square offers you both. You're at the center of everything that New York has to offer. I will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: patrickMontreal
Reviews.Content: Location is great, right in Times square, the views of the rooms are amazing. The lobby is nice and there is good music and nice people at night. The Blue fin restaurent down on the first floor is great, good food, good drinks and terrific views of Times square! The beds very confortable,the only bad thing was the shower, they is no pression, but I would definitely go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Remove the hookers from the lobby and bar area”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: WOW the W New York in Times Square is great!! The rooms are the perfect size and extremely modern. Everything in the room worked except for the hotel water in the shower. It took about 5 min to get hot. It looks like the W have some plumbing issues. I stayed three nights on the 25th floor. View from the room was not that great. It overlooked the Marriott across the street. I noticed the elevators are noisy. You don't want to stay opposite the elevators. The W uses Bliss products. This has to be the best hotel soaps which I have used. Make sure you try bliss tidy towel available from the Gym. Take one for the flight home. It's really refreshing when you get off the plane. Apples and water are available from the gym. One thing the hotel should add to the room is nespresso machines. TV and radio worked awesome. The hotel room also has a DVD player. The W New York in Times Square has a great bar on the 7th floor. This is the perfect place to get a drink after a long day. Just watch out for the working girls hanging around. I thought I would only see this in Las Vegas. I don't understand why the on the Hotel management allows hookers to hang around the bar and lobby area. Hotel wireless worked really well!! Also try Blue fin restaurant. Yummy!! I will stay here again if I get the opportunity. If you are looking for a quieter hotel I would recommend you stay the Westin Times Square. I arrived at 7am directly off a red eye and was able to check in!! Thanks W!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: saphire17
Reviews.Content: Very modern, chic hotel with great views in the best possible location! The room was clean, stylish and comfortable. The concierge and all staff are very welcoming, thoughtful and completely at your service- they mean it when they say "Whatever Whenever". Can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Gift”
Reviews.Author: sarashae
Reviews.Content: I surprised my boyfriend with a night at the W Hotel in Times square. We were warmly welcomed and felt right at home among the modern and very upscale atmosphere. At check-in, the guest attendant at the front desk was more than helpful when we were inquiring about our stay. She was polite and very friendly. The room was so clean, very quiet, and had some really great amenities (we sat in robes all day and ate the amazing pizza the hotel offers on their room service menu). Anything we needed was brought to us in a very timely manner just by the push of the "whatever/whenever" button on the phone. Overall, great weekend, great room, great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: vacationthirst
Reviews.Content: Wow..Whatever Whenever indeed. The location is perfect and so is the hotel and all the staff. We stayed for the weekend but we already feel it is a "must return "kind of place. At check out I mentioned a minor observation which was no big deal. Within 24 hours of checking out the Manager Raina-Rose Fernandes contacted me to ensure my issue had been resolved. Talk about pursuit of perfection! We will surely return and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marianjennings
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 great day's in New York stayed at this great Hotel.Front of house staff were very friendly and efficient! Our room on the 57th Floor was a good size and the bed was so comfortable and we couldn't believe it was so quite. We have stayed in other Hotel's in Time Sq before and they were very noisy! The only neg's I would have with the room is there's no place to hang your towel after a shower or to store your clothe's except in the wardrobe and a kettle to make a cup of tea or coffee would'nt go astay either! The Hotel is in a great location close to everything,and a great athmosphere in the bar-reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our First Choice”
Reviews.Author: mauiman98
Reviews.Content: Why do we continue to select the W New York Times Square for our getaway vacations when there are so many hotels to choose from? Its about that location! We enjoy walking to the theater each night and taking our time doing it. And we enjoy the easy access to the Subway for our daily excursions and then getting back in time for a change of clothes, a cocktail or three in our room, and sometimes even a quick nap before the 8PM showtime. And we enjoy splurging once or twice a year for this location and booking a top floor room where we enjoy wonderful views of the City, day and night. We enjoy extremely easy on line booking using the SPG Program. The 2 dbl bed room with top floor location will probably set you back $700.00/ night during the low season, and add about $55.00/ night for valet parking, so be prepared for sticker shock, but for a best of the best location in New York City's Times Square Region we think it a worthwhile splurge. To summarize- Likes- Location- The best of the best ; Room size- the on-line information will mention 288 to 365 sq ft This size is complimented by the W's incredible room design and deft use of chrome, glass and mirrors and an entire wall of window that opens just enough for fresh air to infiltrate. It is roomy for 2 adults and easily on a par with any other hotel at this location and price point; Elevator service- the W features express elevator service to your floor, secured using your room's key card. We have stayed at the W Times Square 6 times now and each time the elevator service has been flawless; Bathroom- great light, great ventilation, adequate toilet location (tough on lefties, though), decent water pressure and hot water supply (shower late or very early if you want to enjoy the rain shower). Our room came equipped with a bathtub/shower combination and a convenient shelf for bath stuff; Room amenities- nice size flat screen TV with free HBO, in room frig loaded with temptations, very comfy bedding; Valet parking- as mentioned, pricey but extremely convenient. For us, this expense is a big part of our splurge. General ambience- the W has an appeal that is elegant yet not uncomfortably so. The staff add to this feeling. Everyone that I have encountered, from bellhops to check-in clerks to valets have been friendly and a joy to chat with. This is always a sign that management has been successful in hospitality training. Dislikes- ok, nobody is perfect! Here are some of the dislikes from our last stay: only 1 drawer in the room; only 1 bathrobe in the closet; no grab bars in the shower/bathtub (an accident waiting to happen); room temperature- we like to sleep at 68 degrees but we couldn't get the temp below 75 in January, even with the windows opened the full 1/4 inch!; no coffeemaker (how hard could it be to add one of those 5 cup percolators to a room?); in room safe is not big enough to store a standard size laptop computer in the locked position- it was a disappointment to us that our room did not have this; envelope for the housekeeping staff- and why not allow tips to be added to the room (you can add a tip for your waiter to your bill at the Blue Fin Restaurant and add that to your room bill so why not be able to tip the housekeeping staff and add that to your room bill?); We do not take advantage of room service when we stay at the W. A big part of our vacation is to seek out new breakfast, lunch and dinner destinations and we enjoy the adventure involved in trying restaurants that are off the beaten path. The room service menu looked to have plenty of variety and is provided by the kitchens of the popular and beautiful Blue Fin Restaurant which has a great breakfast menu and a wonderful ambiance all its own. Get there early for prime window seats to the show that is Times Square. Sure it is pricey but it is located in Times Square, remember! There were 816 reviews about the W New York Times Square when I prepared this. The hotel had a ranking on Trip Advisor of 99 of 429 hotels in New York City. What the f does that mean? I don't understand the rankings business. I just know that we still shop around before selecting a hotel for our 3 or 4 night get away vacations in New York City every year and we always decide to go back to this W. We find it a nice touch of class and a great way to splurge. We deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel a lot!”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler14
Reviews.Content: It was clean, new and really cool! The location was perfect and I loved the bathroom in the room. Especially the shower and the free products. I also was very happy to get a free breakfast just for signing up to be a Starwood rewards customer!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Friendly, and Efficient”
Reviews.Author: HomeMike
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The W New York - Times Square for business. The doormen and bellman upon arrival were eager to greet and asssit me. My check-in was smooth and accurrate. My 14th flloor room was well appointed and quiet ( not easy to find in NYC). In-room internet was quick to connect and stayed connected - no problems. The bedding very was comfortable. The Bar on the 7th floor was cool and drew your attention to want to stay a while. From the moment you enter off the street - the wall of water and hip tunes piped in - whisks you off the city streets and into an oasis! I look forward to my return trip - next time with the family!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: ronilight
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at this hotel when I'm in NYC. The rooms are actually quite large, as are the bathrooms, and have everything you need. The beds are great and at night it is quite quiet. My friends love to come visit because the bar downstairs is very fun and hip. I also LOVE the restaurant on the first level. The location is good because you can walk everywhere you want to go. The staff is amazing. The guy who checked my bag the first day, remembered my name on the third day! The only issue is that depending on the time of day, it can be very hard to get in and out of there. Sometimes the cab is just stuck in traffic and can't get there. So, best if you are coming in early, leaving late, etc. Just be sure to leave lots of extra time.

Reviews.Title: “Standard W”
Reviews.Author: pprhh
Reviews.Content: I had to make an appointment in the vicinity of times square, where I rarely stay when I am in NY. I got the W standard, recognition for elite status and an upgraded corner room at a higher store. There is a nice -but expensive restaurant downstairs- which offers a great breakfast. I would recommend the hotel to someone who wants to stay next to Times Square but not in the middle of the crowd...and the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay EVER... WOW... Amazing Service, Best Location, Awesome Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: PabloUrVe
Reviews.Content: Ive been in Nyc lots of times, and this was my first time at a W hotel in New York and i gotta say its been waaaaayyy too good!!!!... I had one of m best experiences ever!!... The service was amazing, they are FAST, NICE and Proactive!!.... The beds are the best!!! i was in a 47 floor and my view was incredible... on top of times square!!!... The bar at the lobby is Awesome!!! The bliss cosmetics now im a fan of it!! u gotta try em!!! Love them!!! All is super clean!!!... The elevators are fast!! I just can say that if u go to NYC and Stay At W hotel Times Square u will have a Great experience!!..... Is Not the same to go to NYC, than Go to NYC and Stay at W hotel! Trust me!!! Cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, funky hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulmccbkk
Reviews.Content: If you want to be based in the heart of everything, you couldn't choose a better hotel! Views from the rooms are stunning. Rooms are designed well, with only annoyance being the extra charge for internet access that's still typical of too many high-end places. Lovely reception staff kindly gave free drinks vouchers on check-in, and we took advantage of the Acura transport offer thanks to the great door staff. You really feel like a star here, and with so much on your doorstep, don't spend the bulk of your time in your room - get out there and enjoy the city!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: CVO719
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so comfortable and is perfectly located in the middle of everything - Broadway, shopping, Central Park are all within walking distance. Then when you return to this peaceful oasis of a room you can get rejuvenated. The bar is also a very hopping place if you are interested in night life.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVEABLE”
Reviews.Author: TONIMEX
Reviews.Content: Wonderful ambiance, incredible staff, amazing bar..... You´re simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “#1 choice of hotel always for New York City”
Reviews.Author: cecfab416
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square is always my #1 choice when planning a trip to New York City. It has wonderfully appointed guest rooms and is well situated in the city that you can get uptown, midtown or downtown very easily when you hop on the subway station across the street. The Blue Fin restaurant has a great menu and is well priced for the area and food quality is very good. On my last trip to this hotel I had great chats with one of the concierges, Gilmar, so make sure you track him down for any questions when you visit this hotel b/c he's a wealth of knowledge and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You W..”
Reviews.Author: terryvaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Times Square and only one word can decribe our experience!! Wonderful. I travel a great deal and always look for a W Hotel they certainly do everything to perfection. Thank you W. You always make me feel special.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was friendly, efficient with check in and very helpful....”
Reviews.Author: Tralam9
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, efficient with check in and very helpful when I needed to check my bag prior to check in. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC over the years and while some hotels that have been around for years sometimes lose some sparkle, this can not be said for W Times Square. When I arrived this trip it was just as clean and updated as it has always been. The staff is wonderful, from the door staff to the check in desk to random staff in the hallway all greeted me with a friendly hello and offers of assistance. With all the choices in NYC this should be top of mind when looking for a place that has a great location, makes cleanliness a top priority, continues to make its guests feel comfortable and accommodated.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: strantz18
Reviews.Content: The staff at check-in were extremely helpful and courteous and the Room Service was excellent both in the food delivered and the fact that they called me to let me know that one item I had ordered was not available and suggested a replacement

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY HELPFUL”
Reviews.Author: LAFATHEROF4
Reviews.Content: Came into town expecting to stay a couple of nights. But with a snow storm coming I had to rearrange my travel plans. The concierge was amazing, workking to make sure I could get into the W in DC and the front desk was super accomodating. As a team they truly did all they could to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place In The Heart Of The city”
Reviews.Author: jdgn
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at The W in Times Square was great. From the time we entered the hotel everyone was friendly and helpful. The service was great the rooms clean and very comfortable for a New York city hotel. We could not have asked for a better hotel and the price was very good for New York.

Reviews.Title: “amazing service”
Reviews.Author: polksters
Reviews.Content: I have been an SPG Platinum member for the last three years and the service from this hotel is why i continue to support the brand. I was upgraded immediately when i arrived with my family and thanked for my level. They went above and beyond to make sure i was satisfied with the hotel. The concierge was very helpful in helping us organize our trip. The room was very clean and comfortable and you would expect from a W. I havent had a reason yet to question my preference for Starwood. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that's hyped is as good as billed”
Reviews.Author: Drakeboston
Reviews.Content: Although the aesthetic was pleasant the finishes felt cheap. The room was large by NYC standards but the shower temperature was difficult to control. The towels were rough to touch.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and its staff are fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: CFB19
Reviews.Content: Location, decor, service and attitute of staff could not be better. We were concerned about the noise because it is located in Times Square and our room was near the elevator. However, noise was not an issue at all. We stayed for four nights. Moms and teenage daughters in connecting rooms. The rooms are a good size for Manhattan hotels. Our stay was wonderful, and I would recommend this hotel to anyone visitng New York.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, top notch service, and beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EJarro
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is right in the heart of Times Square. The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. We felt at home during our stay here and are looking forward to returning there during our next visit to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SharonRutts
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I listen to Trip Advisor and this hotel did not fall short of expectations. The view over Times Square was superb. The central location was brilliant for access to all tourist locations and shopping. The hotel was clean and the beds were really comfortable. The only thing I would say is be careful of the expensive bar in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE W NOT ALL THAT”
Reviews.Author: carol072
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights in the W new york I have to say was very dissapointed on arrivial at the hotel was suprised by the outside of building which is up a side street, after checking in went to room opened the door to find a tiny room with glass partition at right which was bathroom with shower no bath. The decor was suppose to be boutique but was getting a bit frayed like example rust on vanity unit, ok i know you are probably saying you are only sleeping in room but at £320 a night i expect better staff were not helpful either when we went to bar on first floor my husband wanted to charge to room and was told they only take cash! 1 bottle beer ,1 small wine £20 robbery. Overall was not impressed with the hotel the standard could have been better new york is busy 52 weeks of the year and some hotels command crazy prices there are better less exspensive hotels nearby which were better the waldorf astoria was much nicer better location and a lot cheaper on this occasion it is a thumbs down for the W

Reviews.Title: “A fading star”
Reviews.Author: Boros
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square has for a while been the default choice for a New York Hotel and generally it ticks the right boxes - the service is pleasant, but not great; the rooms are nice and funky, but not luxurious and the general vibe is trendy but manufactured. Our business stay in December unfortunately ticked all the wrong boxes. In a connecting room, we could hear quiet conversations through the wall, let alone drunk screaming women arriving back at their room at 2am after a night on the town. The hotel generally seemed to be filled with groups of tweens from other states (is the W discounting heavily?) and there were sizable queues for virtually every facility - the lifts, the front desk, the bar. The Lobby Bar is usually a great place to unwind after a hard day, but business has evidently picked up - with a bar full of patrons being served by one waitress. I watched three couples leave after waiting 20 minutes to be served. Again, a funky posing space for tweens but not so great for hotel guests wanting to end their day with a pleasant drink.
