In conclusion, it appears W is very suitable for hen parties, stag dos and young pile-6-friends-in-a-room holidays but not so suitable for people on business trips hoping to be fresh in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “eh....”
Reviews.Author: BigBouncingBear
Reviews.Content: What is so special about the W Hotels? If this hotel is any indication of the service, style, or enjoyment of what Starwood claims to be the reason to stay at the W Hotels then this hotel really missed the mark. Rooms were gloomy and the average size of a Ramada. The Grey/Purple paint definitely needs to be refreshed. The bathrooms remind me of stalls you would find at a public beach restroom. The bed was ok but it wasn't worth the money I paid. Save your money and stay at the Westin around the corner. Rooms are bigger and you will get a better nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “We did not like”
Reviews.Author: RamonReig
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Times Square from Dec. 23, 2010- Dec 26. We Check out the Hotel and when we went to the Airport the Flight all the flights were canceled because of the weather. We call the hotel back telling them our problem with the flight, to see if they could offered us a fair price for an extra night and first they offered like $ 500.00 for an standard room. We move to the InterContinental hotel, a better hotel, a better price. The W hotel has very small rooms, there is not comfort at all, not even a Coat Hook. We had to call Front Office to cover the glass walls of the bathroom, becuase we had our daughter with us in our room. I would not recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “We love NY”
Reviews.Author: SGT_DAWG
Reviews.Content: The W is in a prime location. Our room view was looking up towards Columbus Circle. The Whiskey Bar was a great place for the wife and I to have a drink and people watch. The rooms were clean and very small , the lobby was on an upper floor and was dark and a bit confusing. This hotel seems to be more cut for the younger hip crowd ,we really did enjoy pretending to be young and hip. The location and quality of this hotel would allow me to recommend it to others. The wife enjoyed that our room overlooked the Heshey chocolate store on the corner the next block up.

Reviews.Title: “WOW - I <3 Newyork”
Reviews.Author: HollieHoliday
Reviews.Content: it was my first trip to Newyork for my 21st birthday! The hotel was perfect, the location perfect simple perfect! we did a bus tour which included visit to statue of liberty and to the top of empire state. the bus tour was hop on hop off. We did haggle a price so dnt be shy! we also used the tube i do advise carry a tube map with you as it can be confusing. its perfect for sightseeing and shopoholics like myself :) I will def be returning every year its a magic city

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: stillersLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Of course an expensive hotel, one of the top hotels in one of the most sought after locations in America if not the world. I was there the week before Xmas and stayed 5 nights longer as the snow in london forced my flight to be cancelled. The W chain of hotels is young, exciting and funky. The rooms have a certain style which I really liked with great decor. I didn't like the see-through bathroom door, that was my only gripe! Comfortable, warm room with nice robes made for a nice winter stay. Free internet next to reception (1 machine, busy) was a good touch! I like the reception and bar, great mood, lighting nice.... Would stay again if I could afford!

Reviews.Title: “What a ripoff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Absiddee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to New York for a few days and wanted to stay in a central location and the W looked like a beautiful hotel from the website description. When we got there, we were very impressed with the lobby and the hotel in general. The infamous lounge is beautiful and esthetically the decor is very nice. When we got into the room, we were horrified. The rooms were supposed to be around 288 square feet, but my husband's former bachelor apartment was 300 square feet and there's no way that these rooms were even close to that size. You could barely move around in the room, it was so small. All I kept asking was what are we being charged 350 a night for???? There are no bath tubs (shower only), unless you opt for a room with two doubles and even then this tub is tiny. I should also mention that our room was called "spectacular king", which was supposed to be an upgraded room, but instead it looked more like a dorm room. My husband said that he's stayed in youth hostels that were bigger than where we were staying. Our room was also adjascent to another family's room and we could hear their screaming children (because the rooms are connected by a door that stays locked, and the walls are obviously thin). You can also hear all the street traffic and nothing is included in the nightly price (only free internet is in the lounge and if you want internet from your room its $14.95/day). We were so disappointed. Out of interest we looked at other hotels in the area, and found that there was much better value in other hotels in times square. Overall we would never recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W at Xmas - Great service & location, expensive extras”
Reviews.Author: arnofio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W over Christmas 2010. The staff were friendly and helpful from the start and given it was our honeymoon very kindly upgraded us to the top floor of the hotel (57th floor!). The views are incredible - we had the Hudson RIver & Queens to one side and Times Square the other. The room was larger than other NY rooms I have stayed in and comfortable, although a little tired/frayed around the edges and the lift and air con unit were noisy and caused a couple of wake-ups. We ordered room service food & drink a number of times, and the quality of food was as expected but fries came wrapped in a cloth napkin for some bizarre reason? Now the prices are really really steep, so beware particularly when ordering drinks that you're looking at at least $10 per drink. We were horrified when we were billed $130 for an average bottle of red and 2 cups of tea at the bar!! Yikes. One of the real plus points was free wireless broadband, particularly as the snow storm hit while we were there. When we found we couldn't fly out to our next destination they checked us back in to another room without hesitation. This time we were on the 23rd floor and the room was identical to the original but sold at around $100 per night less - the view was amazing from the 57th and great from the 23rd but, if you want a view go for a lower level room and get yourself up a novelty skyscraper. Times Square is literally on your doorstep so if that's your thing this is a great place to stay, just bear in mind that you will pay over the odds in most transactions in this area. Overall, a stylish treat with great service (particularly Jenna at reception) as long as you're prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “W for What?”
Reviews.Author: ebbtide123
Reviews.Content: I would like to rate this hotel 4 stars however, I can't look away at issues guests would normally consider rating a hotel. Bellboy service- saw one at the main entry who help one customer who arrived before us. We waited for a few minutes after we unloaded our car but no one else was there. We decided to carry own luggages ourselves to the 7th floor "lobby". Concierge- unfriendly and nonsmiling male concierge. He seemed nonchalant and uninterested with his job. W hiring non people friendly staff? Bath- hairs on the floor, dirt under the sink table- stains on the ceiling. Was this room ever mopped or cleaned? Bed- king-sized with a hard mattress topped with a thin featherbed? I was expecting a very comfortable bed after staying in other W hotels. Floor- ripped carpeting at the edges, uneven caulking at the baseboards- this room is definitely not at par with other W's we've stayed. Fitness room- tiny and sparse- no showers or sauna. What a waste of space! No one is using coz it is not inviting for guests. Lobby- tiny and almost non existent since this is simply an extension of the lounge- and if you happen to sit in one of the lounge sofas- you need to order a drink! Guest Hallways- noise, noise, noise. Kids yelling and screaming and parents who don't care. It woke me up early after I have to deal with an uncomfortable bed. We were looking forward to a 5-star hotel stay here- as has been rated misleadingly by many here but this is simply a contemporary hotel incorporating high technology like water features and dramatic lighting to add a theatrical appeal to its otherwise obviously tourist class category.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location a Must Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisnPete7980
Reviews.Content: A great hotel right in time square. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left, all staff were very helpful. In particular the bar staff were great and the bar itself was superb. Our room was clean and comfortable with a great view of times square. We will be back to stay next time we are in new york and would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel = Great! Times Square”
Reviews.Author: mspik
Reviews.Content: I dont understand what people expect out of a hotel in TIMES SQUARE? People moan about the size of the rooms if you want a bigger room stay down near central park or maybe New City isnt for you! My girlfriend had bought me this trip New York as a suprise birthday present! W staff even rang my girlfriend up all the way in England when she mentioned it was a surprise for me and put balloons in the room for me as a Happy Birthday gift! The room was big enough for us to, great bathroom (I loved the sink) great bed, great location, nice chair to look out onto Times Square, People are mentioning about the noise. you booked a hotel in the middle of Times Square! Why would you expect it not to be noisy!!?!?!? If you dont like abit of noise dont stay in this hotel,its not rocket science, we didnt hear any noise as we were to tired when we got in from sightseeing and shopping all day!! the bar is good in the hotel, we didnt eat in the restaurant, people mention the lifts in this hotel for being abit of a pain, be we just thought its good just for abit more safety the 2nd lift so no one can wonder up onto the floors as you get a swipe card to swipe in the lift We are going back next July and will be staying here again! that will be my girlfriends 3rd time staying here! So it must be good

Reviews.Title: “a "for sure" address in NY”
Reviews.Author: woodardstefan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in W Times Square last month and will never try to find any other hotel next time when travelling to NY. Just superb. The bonus comes with your special treatment in the club.

Reviews.Title: “great stay..excellent location”
Reviews.Author: scottbre1
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and nice size as compared to other rooms on Times Square. The location is excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The W was offering a great rate for the Christmas season for advanced purchase, which was more competive than the other hotels nearby with the same star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great stay....but depends on whose paying and how much?”
Reviews.Author: jason31574
Reviews.Content: Overall I had no complaints on the hotel its self. As a Starwood Gold member, I was upgraded to a "Spectacular Room" on the 55th floor. Had a corporate rate of $289 which for mid week is quite good. A little taken away with some of the costs of the extras...$41 for a two egg breakfast, which was the only option first thing in the AM as the restaurant didn't open until 7 as most places didnt....$7.84 for a diet coke from the mini bar, again no other options so it is what it is when it is 15 degrees outside and didn't feel like venturing off. Bed was quite comfortable, nice shower with a modern waterfall type sink...little disappointed in the lobby...simple bar and no restuarant in the main part. Would I stay there again, depends on how much and whose paying. As a category 6 hotel requiring 20,000 points, in my opinion much better to stay at a category 5 hotel (Westin a couple blocks away or one of the Sheraton Hotels)....but for a reasonable corporate or weekend rate, would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff and ambience”
Reviews.Author: msdazey13
Reviews.Content: From Check-in, to the concierge, to check out, the whole experience was great. The staff is friendly and helpful. Especially the concierge staff . Also the bathroom door got off track and I mentioned it to the front desk and by the time I was back from being out (about a few hours) it was fixed. I really liked the decor and the bath products by bliss. The restaurant was good with great tasting food and drinks. I also enjoyed the living room bar area. Just loved the W!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay”
Reviews.Author: JohnC1946
Reviews.Content: Took Thanksgiving trip with large family group, including 6 children. We had three suites, plenty of room. My granddaughter, upon entering her room, said "this is the nicest hotel I've ever stayed at." I agree. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, great location, nice lounge for adults. Easy check in; beautiful suites. Would definitely stay at the "W" again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving at the W--”
Reviews.Author: Houseofwhimsy
Reviews.Content: The W staff delivers an amazing level of personalized attention in a busy city. From the first people you meet at the door to everyone we met throughout the hotel, the staff was attentive, truly interested in our visit and offered suggestions and strategies for getting the best of our holiday weekend. We were surprised with the offer of a complimentary car to the train station. In all, we gave thanks for a wonderful Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “Typical swanky W Hotel- loved the vibe- but ZERO AT&T service- not good”
Reviews.Author: Btw120
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers everything a W would offer- but probably wont find a hotel with such an electric atmosphere and vibe. Probably one of the best locations in ALL of NYC- the living room lobby is happening w/ locals, celebrities, and chic tourists- the place is see and be seen. The staff is all good looking, young, and nice. One MAJOR drawback- no cell service with AT&T's iphone at all. Had to connect with friends in city- it cost me $85 to leave 5 voicemails thru W phone. I definitely complained- there excuse is everyone in NYC has the iphone therefor clogging the airways. The front desk lady was nice and reduced bill by $50. As a Platinum member I thought more should have been taken off. The hotel lobby drinks = great!! Blue Fin was soso- food was just OK- i had a better tuna burger in DC. Rooms great. Overall- definitely recommend thid hotel for location and vibe but if you have an iphone- good luck!

Reviews.Title: “A truly wonderful stay with a truly wonderful person”
Reviews.Author: Nashers45
Reviews.Content: I was there with a truly wonderful person and the stay was made even more memorable by the helpfulness and professionalism of the staff. They were particularly helpful in recommending and getting us a booking at the Cipriani which was perfect and at all times we were made to feel special and a valued customer. Only smalll downside was the ice-machine on our floor didn't work for all the 3 day stay but on a number of occassions passing staff offered to go and get ice from another floor. Will definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very hip & loud meatmarket. Bathroom had some issues.”
Reviews.Author: TeamJK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Times Square for one night on business. On entering the elevator, one is hit with techno party music, which increases in volume on entering the 7th floor reception lobby. The bar is also on this floor, which admittedly is extraordinarily hip with lots of beautiful people. On my checking in, the clerk asked me how many keys I wanted. I said one, at which point he gave me two. He noticed my puzzled look, and said "well that's in case you get lucky at the bar". I politely handed the key back. Single-y types or scandalous types might think this is cool, I didn't particularly as I am married w/kids and wear my ring. So - the room is pretty nicely appointed, nice tv, good bed, there was this sort of "love-lounge" piece of furniture by the window. Speaking of the window, pretty good view of part of times square, although of course that means flashing lights coming into your room - not a big deal with the curtains closed. No robe, no coffeemaker (and the lack of a coffeemaker always bugs me). You can hear the noise from Times Square even from 25 floors up, which is a bit of a bummer. The bathroom had two big issues -- a) the door to the actual bathroom is frosted sliding glass. Being by myself, I didn't have privacy issues - but the door wasn't cleaned (there were spotlets of I what I presume was water over it). And b) there were some slight brown stains in one part of the shower floor. Ick. I didn't notice until the morning (I arrived late), so nothing I could do about it. BTW, showerhead is great. The "whatever whenever" theme is a little too cheeky for me (they actually say that). The W is, however, most of what you would expect it to be - it is a pretty cool place - but it's just a wee bit overdone for my taste. If the volume was just slightly lower, the overall theme just a fraction less garish, I think it would be perfect for what it is trying to do. If not for the bathrooms I'd consider bringing my wife to this hotel for a getaway. I moved to the Omni Berkshire the next day (which I really like and was much happier there). While eminently less cool, the Omni is a first rate property.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel! Was even better the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: xtos
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this swank Times Square Hotel Thanksgiving weekend and loved it again! The front desk check in was smooth and they were able to find me a room with a great view of the Hudson and part of Times Square. I should also note that this side of the hotel was defintely quieter than the other side I stayed on last time I was here. I hardly heard any noise and slept soundly through the night. The room was even nicer than the last time I stayed here, appears to have been renovated. The bathroom was very cool, with very modern features. I also loved the shower, so sleek and spacious. The Bliss bath products were also great, and you get plenty of them. From a cute little bar soap to moisturizer, shampoo, conditioner, and bath gel. Great stuff! The bed was also super comfortable and the room itslef was very clean. There's a cool little ipod dock on one of the night stands that charges your ipod while playing your music and the sound quality of the system was surprisingly excellent for a hotel room. I had to be careful not to turn it up to loud, but if I wanted I could have had a little party in this place. :) I remembered from my last visit that they had a DVD player in the room, so this time I brough several DVD's to enjoy. This really enhanced my visit, but if you don't remember to bring DVD's, no worries as they have an extensive DVD library available. There's also a minibar full of beer, wine, and sodas, and plenty of gifts you can purchase right from the room, as well as other necessities that might come in handy. The bar scene on the lobby level is really cozy and super cool, as it was before. It seemed to draw in the street crowd as well as hotel guests, which really makes this hotel feel like a destination itself. In my original review, I commented about the complicated lobby and elevator system, but this time I was full aware that the lobby is on the 7th floor and that the fitness center is in the middle elevator bank (on the 10th floor) and I knew which floors are serviced by which elevators, etc. So this time around it was much easier to navigate. Once you get that understanding down, it's a piece of cake. In hindsight, with all the floors in this hotel, I now realize it's actually more efficient to break the elevators up like this, that way you don't have 20 people waiting to get into one elevator. I also took a nice long walk through Central Park and to the MET museum on Sunday. It's only about a 15 or 20 minute walk to the entrance of Central Park, and about a 45 minute leisurely walk to the MET. The location really couldn't be better. You also have very easy access to subways, trains, and buses. I came in from Boston with the Bolt Bus (which was only $38 round trip!) and it dropped me off right at 34th St, so this hotel was just a short walk from there. A couple notes: They do have WiFi, but it isn't free. I believe it's $10 per day. It would be nice if they offered this for free in the future. They could also do with a bit more drawer space for your clothes, and the bathroom is only segmented off with frosted glass, and while this is very hip and cool it lacks a much needed sense of privacy, which is very important with bathrooms, so keep this in mind when planning to share the room with someone. Overall a really great place to stay when visiting New York, especially if you plan to see a Broadway Show and definitely one of the best places to stay in Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “For better or worse, it's right on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: AstroJunq
Reviews.Content: Being on Times Square is the main strength of this hotel, but also the main weakness. For travellers who want to be right in the middle of the action, it’s a great place, that’s why I voted 5 in location. But the action may be too much as the area around it is ridiculously overcrowded, to a point when it’s hard to walk on the streets. Much worse is the constant noise, mainly coming from cars honking like there’s no tomorrow and the non-stop ambulances/firefighters/police frenzy. To be clear, I was up on the 32nd floor and all this can be heard from up there (especially at night), even though the windows seem to have very good sound insulation. That aside, the hotel is all you would expect from a W. The reception area has constant loud music, lots of people at the bar and uncomfortable seating, but that’s all part of the W package, I guess. The front desk being on the 7th floor is a little odd, but it doesn’t affect the experience badly. I can’t say anything about the restaurant downstairs as I didn’t try it. The room was very comfortable and decent sized, and also spotlessly clean. The mattress was new, the LCD TV worked well and the shower was good. It’s a little tricky to figure out how to make the water work on the sink, but you’ll get it after 2 minutes of poking around. The internet on the room was very pricey, but the great news is that it was free on the lobby, so Kudos for the W on offering that option at least. And I must say, it worked pretty well for the when I needed it. There was also a Mac available for people to use. Finally, the service was professional and pleasant all around. They didn’t do anything out of the ordinary, but didn’t mess anything either. And that is a lot more than I can say about several other hotels. In conclusion, I would recommend this hotel if a) you know that’s the style of hotel you want, and b) you really want to stay in Times Square. Now I know I don’t.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated rooms. Great lobby vibe. Pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: UFMBA00
Reviews.Content: W New York - Times Square is a top of the line hotel. The only real negative was the fact that my stay was only for one night. There is an energy in the hotel lobby, that reminds you that you're in the heart of Times Square in New York City. However, the guest room floors were appropriately quiet! The location is unbeatable...you step out of the front door, walk 20 feet and you're right on Times Square! The decor is crisp, clean and high-end...but still very comfortable and relaxing. It was a true "upgrade" from the two nights I spent at the Sheraton New York Hotel & Towers (which was a very decent hotel, but the rooms were small). I'll definitely be checking the W first, for my next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as always”
Reviews.Author: vasweetpea
Reviews.Content: Wonderful as always - comfy room, great location for my work, helpful people. A friend came with me - she was "wow'd" by the room - but the frosted glass in the bathroom was a bit much

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay was WONDERFUL, WELCOMING, WORLDY, WARM-HEARTED....... PRICELESS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MnMFanatic
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to share with you the FABULOUS stay I just had with my 3 year old son over the Thanksgiving weekend at the W New York Time Square!!! Our Stay was WONDERFUL, WELCOMING, WORLDY, WARM-HEARTED....... PRICELESS!!!!! I had never been to your hotel and was a bit uncomfortable upon arrival because it is very chick, trendy, adult oriented, etc. It was in the evening so it felt like I was walking into a club with my son. It was just my 3 year old and me so it felt a little awkward.... Don't get me wrong, I LOVE trendy, modern, and chick!!!!! Loved everything, from the flower arrangements, the candles, etc. It is a gorgeous hotel!! Needless to say EVERYONE was so welcoming!!! I dont remember anyone's names I am so sorry because I would like to put a special word especially for who checked me in and who checked me out!!! They were great!!!!! We checked in and went up to the room. We had a GREAT view of Time Square and my son's own favorite, the M&M Store!!!! He was in Heaven!!!! The next morning we were getting ready to go down at the crack of dawn to see the parade and I realized that we just might be able to see it from the room window. It was so bitter cold that I didn't want my son to be out there in the cold for so long. All of a sudden I heard the marching band playing and there they were!!!!! We had front row seats from the comfort of our hotel room and could also watch it on TV!!!!! I don't know if it was planned that way by your WONDERFUL, WELCOMING, WORLDY, WARM-HEARTED front desk staff or just a coincidence that we got that room but it was PRICELESS!!!!!! My son had the best Thanksgiving Ever!!!! Thank you thank you thank you!!!! I plan to do it again I think for Christmas so I will be letting you know as well! : ) I am speachless at this time....... Happy Holidays!!!

Reviews.Title: “Why not put the toilet in the bedroom?”
Reviews.Author: travelisfun0
Reviews.Content: Hardly any counter space around the bathroom sink. The bathroom walls were frosted but very much see-through. There was no coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Aching cool lobby - tranquil in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: holiday500
Reviews.Content: We just had 3 nights here. What a view to wake up to from the 46th floor down Broadway . The Fantastic suite was perfect for us travelling as a family . The beds were sooooo comfortable after a hard days sight seeing. We loved being right in the middle of the action but in a tranquil oasis. Try the well priced diner for the all important American breakfast just 2 doors down on the left . Subway entrances very close, Broadway ticket booth very close. No coffee making faciliiites in the room which is a bit mean - you have to pay extra for everything . The bathroon was a fine but starting to look slightly shabby I thought. Bliss tolieties are a nice touch. Don't be fooled by the bottle of water on the side - its not free with no notice or clue that its $10 a bottle and we mistakenly drank 2 !!!!!!! I am pleased to say they did not make us pay but be warned given that we had just been to Italy and all hotels had water set out on the side included in the price. We are going back as we had the best fun & would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Sheek and fun”
Reviews.Author: caribegm
Reviews.Content: Although your in the fun and exciting chaos of Time Square, the Hotel W Time square allows you to escape and unwind. My wife and I, celebrated our wedding anniversary and we really enjoyed our stay. We really enjoyed staying steps away from excellent broadway show's..it was very convenient. The staff at the hotel was very courteous and the ambiance was absolutely great. Will strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: YuriRemedio
Reviews.Content: Very good Hotel, great location, great staff. Boutique style with modern room. Very good Bed. I got a room in the high corner and was an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “The W Times Square wowed me!”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl044
Reviews.Content: It was Marathon weekend and I expected the staff to be stressed and the hotel jammed and therefore less than stellar service. I could not have been more wrong! The hotel staff were welcoming and helpful from the doorman thru checkin, the concierge and room service. The corner room was gorgeous with a fabulous view of Broadway and NJ, restful furnishings and a great bed. Of course, I could not have picked a better location for subway access, shopping access and people watching. Had I enough time I would have used the Tkts outlet right out the door to get reduced price tickets to see a play, but, next trip. Room service was prompt and portions were generous, appropriate for the price. The only problem was a temperature sensor which knocked off my heat during the night. It was promptly resolved. While I often stay at the W Union Square, the W Times Square could be my new favorite. lcbavon@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest”
Reviews.Author: northwoods9
Reviews.Content: The staff here is super but the room was so anticlimactic... You sure can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a great location Midtown NYC”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgoingplaces12
Reviews.Content: I frequent W Hotels when I travel and was a bit concerned that the rooms would be a closet. I was surprised to see that for NYC the room was more than the usual box. Well appointed, clean and all the litlle things to make my stay enjoyable were at my disposal. Of course a great looking and fun lounge/bar in the lobby. Looking forward to my next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Lost it's charm.”
Reviews.Author: Pammy_4567
Reviews.Content: My colleagues recently stayed at the hotel while attending a conference. When we first stayed at the W Time Square it was the hippest and most happening hotel. This time around it just seemed average. With the other boutique hotels popping up around, the W has kept to its status quo instead of changing. The rooms are tiny and the beds are mediocre. If you're going to be sharing a room with your colleague, I would not recommend this hotel. The bathrooms have frosted glass doors - all the way around. It's okay with your signficant other; it's awkward with your colleagues or co-workers. The bathroom amenities are nice with the Bliss products. However with the kind of money you're paying for the hotel, it would have been nice if they would have supplied a hair dryer that wasn't incredibly tiny. We stayed on the 53rd floor which had a great view of ....another hotel. This is expected in NYC though so we weren't surprised. It was quiet on our floor and we were able to get a good night's rest. The bar downstairs serves awesome martinis. Our favorite was the Pineapple martini. It's also a good place to meet up with colleagues and clients. We didn't partake in the room service. When we saw $22.00 for an omlette we decided to pass and try to find somewhere else more reasonable. The best part about the hotel is the staff. From the luggage handlers to the front desk to the fellows downstairs handling taxis, the staff is just wonderful. For the money that we paid for 2 nights at this hotel ($1,500.00), we probably should have tried another hotel. For the next business trip I think we will. If it's your first time in NYC and you want a taste of the Big Apple, this is where to stay. If you're looking for additional amenities, aside from awesome service, you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YellowMel
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Perfect location to see Broadway shows, have dinner, and go shopping. Hotel is trendy, comfortable, and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: avelautham
Reviews.Content: If you like the hussle and bustle of Times Square then you should take a look at this place. It was my first stay at a W and I am confident that I will return. Booking was made through AMEX FHR so there were a few perks such as late checkout, free breakfast, upgrade upon availability. You enter on a ground floor, go up to the 7th floor and then there are lifts to the rooms. Separate lifts for floors 34 and above so there isn't that annoying floor by floor stopping on the way down. I was greeted by extremely friendly and efficient staff at check-in, all front end staff at the hotel were in their 20's or 30's. This complements the modern feel. Lifts smell great as do all communal areas. There is free WIFI in the lobby [7th floor]. I was upgraded from a corner room to a 'fantastic suite' which was as the name suggests - fantastic. Like 2 rooms stuck together on the Times Sq side on the 52nd floor. The views were breathtaking, the room was modern and stylish and most importantly new. The products were Bliss branded, I got quite hooked on the products so of course had to buy some from the Bliss shop on Lexington! The Location was so convenient for shows and tour buses, more importantly the central location ensured the ability to get a mid day shower after hours of walking. I went to the bar on lobby level a couple of times and was impressed that it appeared to attract people from outside the hotel too - but not too many that it would get annoying, just a comfortable number of people that would let you get a drink. The restaurant on the ground floor is called the Blue Fin which has great Sushi - you should go there if you want to have a nice meal pre or post show. It is a rated place to eat and has an upstairs level which you wont be aware of if you are simply passing through. Breakfast for me was a continental one, delivered to the room. The drawback of the hotel was not being able to have it in a hotel restaurant just for guests. It was not inconvenient for me since I had a separate reception area to the suite but if you are a couple it could be a little annoying if one of you wants to have a lie in. Overall, I loved the place and the staff - they have done a great job to get this hotel to a high standard and I look forward to going back there the next time I am in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy if overlooking Time Square”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneWoody
Reviews.Content: If you are a light sleeper, make sure you ask for a room that is quiet and away from Time Square. On Time Square it is very light (curtains do not block out the billboards) and the sound deadening is very inadequate. Ask for a room away from Time Square and you will find them sufficiently quiet and with adequate window coverings. The roms are decent size and nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be where the bright lights are, this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: traveljackmemphis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last visit to New York for a week and it was super close to everything that we needed in terms of entertainment and food. The decor of the hotel is funky and the bar upstairs has some great drinks. I recommend the caramel apple martini and arriving before 7 o'clock to get a good seat. The gift shop inside is always incredible and filled with great designer clothes, jewelry, and excellent CD's. It was difficult to sleep what with all the traffic and bright lights outside but the energy of the hotel is really fun and worth the experience. I especially loved the soap products they use. Overall, we had a fantastic view of TImes Square and I would recommend this fun, hot spot to anyone at least once.

Reviews.Title: “No better taste of New York”
Reviews.Author: DJS17
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the W Times Square to celebrate our 10th anniversary and had a fantastic time. As others have mentioned, this property couldn't be closer to the action - one step out the front door and you're amidst the lights of Times Square and many other sights are within walking distance. The W's rooms are modern and clean, its staff friendly and helpful, and "The Living Room" bar located right in the lobby sets the mood as soon as the elevator doors open. We'll definitely be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, ambiance, location!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyK007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary and we absolutely loved everything about this hotel. For starters, the hotel puts you right in the action of Times Square. Everything is within walking distance from here. The hotel staff was amazing, especially the concierge! They helped me set up the perfect experience for my wife and I. Also, the rooms are comfortable and the hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: BernieB68
Reviews.Content: Fabulous place to stay. Staff friendly and helpful - views amazing. Couple of minor points - I asked for an electric jug but couldn't get one in the room. A coffee maker turned up which I was charged considerably for. I then had to ask for hot water in a jug every day instead. Could also hear everything that happened in hall way - people talking, room service being delivered - alarm from next door which was annoying especially in the morning when we were trying to lie in on holiday. Location more than makes up for this as you can walk everywhere and have theatres, restaurants, museums etc on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “the hospitality was genuine :)”
Reviews.Author: jzchapina
Reviews.Content: well overall the room wasn't bad... I was on the 10th floor :( haha whatever. But what really made my stay were Frankie Shane and Jose the door guys. Those gentleman made my stay even better. They would say "Hi" " Good Morning" , had a smile and just were personable. They took that extra step, to make sure you where doing good! Those two gentleman were definitely 5 star in my book. If I ever decided to come back and stay at the W in Time Square it would be because of them!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Visit to W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: PreppyMom
Reviews.Content: We went to the W Times Square for my daughters 16th birthday. This was a very special trip for her as she chose this instead of a gift or party. She brought a friend and we rented a suite with a fairly resonable rate from the SPG website. It was truly a magical trip and the hotel was great. The location was absolutely worth the price of the room and was the best thing about a stay with lots of great things. You are literally in the middle of Time Square and we walked to eveything - the theater, dinner at Sardi's, all shopping. Saved us a bunch on cabs. Be prepared, the streets are an absolute zoo (as you would expect for the hub of the universe) on the weekends - you can barely move. Don't plan on using the Acura car service - it was never there when we tried and you can't reserve it. The view from our room was excellent and the room was plenty large enough for 4 people with a separate living and sleeping area with doors that closed between the two. Two separate bathrooms as well. Much has been made of the "see through" frosted bathrooms. I know in the master bath in the suite, the issue was easily remedied by pulling the sliding closet door over the glass (this works, we did it and it may be intended). All nice Bliss bath products, very comfortable bedding and very clean. No real complaints. Very modern feel and great for singles, and families with teens, but this is not a place I would have been comfortable bringing younger kids - too trendy, upscale and dark. The bar in the lobby is awesome, and when our room was not ready immediately at check in time, they gave us two free drinks (and considering how expensive the drinks are, this is saying something!) and the bartender gave us a complimentary soda for the kids! Also lots of cozy nooks to sit it and have the drink. All the people working there were young, hip and very nice. You could tell they were use to working with people with high expectations. I am a fairly seasoned traveler and have stayed at a wide range of properties, from 5 star resorts to little beach dives, and I feel the W was a great experience that lived up to my high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grainne1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W times square for 3 nights, really liked the hotel and the views were fantastic ! The rooms were lovely and suprisingly peaceful and quiet given the location !! The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was really clean. The only downside i would have was that we had booked a cool corner room which was advertised with panoramic views with 2 windows and we only had one and when we asked we were told that some rooms do and some dont? Also there is a lovely tempting munchie box but you would have to pay extra for any of the goodies and at a cost!! All in all we found the hotel lovely if a bit pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and vibe”
Reviews.Author: visitorLeics
Reviews.Content: We transferred to the W after being disappointed with our initial choice of hotel in New York. The front desk lady was extremely helpful assisting us to obtain the best rate possible. We booked into a suite and I was extremely pleased when shown the room. It was on the 37th floor with great views over the city. We did have an issue with this room but this was dealt with swiftly and we were assigned a suite on a lower floor which suited us perfectly. The restaurant is very good at the hotel and I would recommend dining there. Breakfast is expensive and we only ate there once during our stay preferring to go in search of pastrami on rye! On returning to the UK my husband responded to the hotels "satisfaction" survey and the manager has offered us a special rate on our return. I would definitely stay at the W again, it is pricey as are all the well located quality hotel in New York. I can't wait to go back, New York really is the city that never sleeps!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Amazing Atmosphere and the Best Place to stay in Mid-Town and Times Square”
Reviews.Author: diverdsk
Reviews.Content: I travel about 40 weeks a year, and I have been top tier on all of the major chains (Hilton, Marriott and now Starwood.) I travel to New York about 15 weeks a year, and I make my home at the W Times Square? Why? Because it's extremely close to my client. However, I can honestly tell you that the staff here, from the concierge, front desk, etc. are really a step above. I enjoy coming here, and being recognized, which is not common for a busy hotel in Manhattan. I will continue to stay there as long as I travel to New York. The nightlife and scenery on the 7th floor bar (where the front desk is located) is truly amazing. Grab a cocktail or two, and then head up to your super quiet room with an amazing view.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!”
Reviews.Author: chinofan1
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the W. Perfect location for my first trip to NYC. Accommodations, staff and room were all lovely. Would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone visiting. Definitely experienced the WOW factor!! Can't wait to go back:)

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hectic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saga_F
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of the hustle and puzzle. This was our first stop on our US trip and delivered what was expected but nothing spectacular. We didn’t dine in the Blue Fin restaurant so no comments on that but the following things were found positive(+)/negative(-): + Clean, Stylish rooms and beautiful bathroom + Bliss amenities + good hairdryer (not as good as I have at home but much better than in most hotels) + Check in and check out was handled extremely quickly + WhateverWhenever staff and check out lady were polite and fun - Our room view was very poor (opposite building, ventilators and some kind of roof below) - The place was noisy (and now I don’t mean the regular traffic or Times Square noise but the awful continuous noise from the ventilators) - No WiFI (this is the biggest negative point for such a hip hotel. If you want to be trendy, then please provide WiFi in the rooms free of charge. Living room was always so hectic that we couldn’t find a place to sit and surf). - The entrance is not very welcoming - The lobby and the bar were extremely noisy and crowded all the time. We didn’t get a relaxing feeling when we entered the hotel after sightseeing and shopping. You just wanted to escape the crowds to your room as quickly as possible (the room did the trick though). - “Free Acura ride”- card was placed into our card “case” but nobody introduced the service to us and we found the card during our last day… Our purpose for 3 nights in NYC was to do the basic sightseeing and shopping so the location was very convenient for that but next time I would choose a hotel that has more peaceful atmosphere and location. The hotel is very trendy and we liked the design but it feels that the only thing this hotel can provide to us is the great room. However, people who do not mind the hectic feeling of this hotel, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bojangles104
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square hotel is excellently located, 2 seconds off Broadway. We were able to walk to all the sites with ease. The room was quite small but expected for a midtown hotel, but it was clean, with a fantastic shower and Bliss products, there was a downside though, the food and drink were expensive. It was also quite noisy (which we knew it would be) but didn't think it would wake us up in the night, which it did. You can use the internet for free if you have a laptop with you in the reception but this is limited to an hour, there is also a kiosk which lets you check in and print off your boarding tickets which was very useful.

Reviews.Title: “great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: stevez102
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel. clean, new, very, very helpful people working her. they were ready to help any way they could!!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious night in the big city”
Reviews.Author: beachmom60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W for our 10th wedding anniversary, just one night. I loved everything about this hotel except the price. We would have loved to stay longer, but couldn't afford it. The service was impeccable. The room was clean and luxurious...love the brand new look! The bathrooms were particularly impressive. The heavenly bed is just as it states...heavenly. We stayed on the 30th floor, so no noise issues to speak of. The view down on Times Square was impressive. The hotel is conveniently located to everything we wanted to do...broadway show, times square, rockefellar center and the train station. I recommend it to anyone who wants to splurge!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay!”
Reviews.Author: Check9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the W on September 8th & 9th. We had stayed there around 5 years ago in one of there regular rooms with two beds. We loved the decor back then but remembered the room being very small and they had the somewhat see through bathroom then as they still do now since renovating the rooms. We decided to try one of their suites this time, we loved it. The master bathroom does not have the see through walls, but the small guest bathroom does. That was not a problem as we each used one or the other. We had lots of space, everything was clean and heard no noice from other guest rooms. We could hear the sirens last time so this time I brought along a noice machine which blocked that out. The only negative thing about the suite is the view. They advertise a view of Times Square and Broadway. Well, yes, we had both, but only could see a hair of Times Square and the Broadway street was the street going away from the action of Times Square. We saw a maid and asked her if any of the suites had a better view of Times Square as we were on the side of the building away from the main action. She said "no" and let us see a room that was overlooking Times Square that she was cleaning next to our suite. That room which is one of their "Cool Corner Rooms" had a super view of all the action in Times Square and came only with a king size bed. The room was small but bigger than the two bedrooms we had stayed in. I thought it was great for a single person or a couple. Everyone was very friendly in the hotel and helpful. We would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT, DEFINITELY NOT 'W' STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: sdelmonte
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several W hotels in major cities and always had an amazing experience, so we assumed NYC would be no different. We assumed incorrectly. For nearly $400 a night, we were given a room where you can see into the (very small) bathroom through a frosted glass wall. Toilet and all. There was no separate room for toilet, after asking it appears most rooms are designed this way. Even though I was with my husband, neither one of us wanted to be witnessed using the bathroom. So we had to turn off the lights just to go! That didn't solve the issue, only made us dark shadows sitting on a toilet. Not to mention there was only room for one in the bathroom and no counter space for toiletries, make-up, etc. No mirror in room so it made for getting ready very uncomfortable & inconvenient. Negatives with ROOM: ~NO privacy in using toilet ~Small room (to be expected in NYC) ~One small drawer for clothing ~No charging port for phones, etc. (we had this in the other W hotels) ~No place to put make-up & toiletries, no mirror to get ready in ~The shaving/make up mirror they install in bathroom was counter height so we had to bend down to look into it ~Walls are paper thin, we were awoken every morning by our neighbors conversations. You could actually hear what they were saying and they weren't yelling. This we found is a commonplace with every W we've stayed in. Negatives with HOTEL: ~$60 per day parking at hotel!! ~No personalized service. Not one employee knew our name, no one greeted us walking in or out. ~Employees standing outside did not hail cabs for us!! Only once on our last night did an employee hail a cab & then he had to tell another employee to get the door for us. ~Employees outside did not help or offer to help load our bags into car upon departure. ~Overall, we experienced no customer service. Very disappointing. ~No coffee & tea available in mornings! Our options were to either walk across the street to starbucks or pay $30 for in room service for a SMALL pot of coffee. You would think for $400 (plus parking) a night you could get a complimentary coffee. Even Days Inn have coffee makers in room. ~The gym was apparently converted from two rooms. Instead of removing the adjoining wall, you had two entrances for different equipment. There was no using free weights and machines in the same room. And you had to use your key to get in each room...very inconvenient. Positives with hotel: ~location. In Times Square, however it's very touristy, but if that's what you're going for then it's perfect. ~the view from our room. We paid extra per night for a corner room and it was on the 51st floor which was really nice. ~my husband called & the concierge recommended a nice restaurant & lounge to go to one night. We tend to stay in more luxury hotels when it's just my husband and I for a short trip, so we expect a little more service and luxury for the price. We were extremely disappointed. I am not in the habit of writing reviews (this is my 2nd ever), and certainly not such lengthy ones, but I feel strongly that no one else should waste their money on this particular W. There are too many other fabulous hotels in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel, Times Square brings everything together for the best stay in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: meprofbos
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the W Hotel Times Square for the discerning traveler to NYC. The W offers not only a great location in Times Square, but the property offers the total package in providing the utmost in service and accommodations. The rooms are spacious and provide the most comfortable beds in the City! Also the modern contemporary styles provide a touch of elegance and comfort throughout the property. As someone who travels significantly for both work and pleasure, I rate the W Hotel Times Square among the top hotel properties not only in NYC, but the US. It is a must for both the business and casual travel to NYC who are looking for a “sure thing” in accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “THE W Times square is a great jump off point in NYC”
Reviews.Author: cushmanscooter
Reviews.Content: I love NY for the action. In the middle of it all is the W Times square. Great suites, Great taxi and Subway access. Close to the all the action in NYC. The door staff is great, Fast check in. High rooms with fun views. I only stay there wile in NYC. I am fortunate to be able to afford the suites. And I love it!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: jimdcsi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. If you have never been to Times Square you will be totally amazed at the shear number of people who are continually in the streets here. The traffic was so tight coming into the hotel that my wife literally had to crawl into the back seat because she was certain that I was going to hit a pedestrian. They actually walk right out in front of you! The cost for parking at the W times square was higher than what they charge at a lot a block away so I parked it there. We paid extra for a fabulous view. We were on the 41st Floor so we could see pretty far. If it weren't for the building next door. However, we could see a good view of Times Square. And we could hear the sirens blaring almost all night as well. The room was really small. I felt uncomfortable. For the money you would expect to get a suite with a sitting room. This room was small and reminiscent of a cheap motel. Just a straight line with a window. And the shower was a smoked glass wall into the room. This might be good for couples but not for families with children. Very awkward. I asked at the front desk if they would put up a privacy curtain and they did. It was a roll of brown paper. We invited a friend to come up and visit. they worked in New York and were interested in seeing what a room in the W looked like. They were as disappointed as we were. In hotels like this you don't get breakfast and you have to pay extra for internet (Come on, Really?). Add to that the cost of parking and staying at the W New York Times Square is a bad choice for a family. If you are by yourself and the company is picking up the tab for everything, then maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Templarcrusader13
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay somewhere extremely close to Times Square and feel the constant beat of an iconic city....then please stay at the W in Times Sqaure, NYC. The walk to our Broadway show was less than 2 minutes and that includes the huge sea of people just walking around. Central Park is less than 15 minutes and Columbus Circle was in equal walking distance. The staff was helpful as well. Not to mention friendly. A very trendy and upscale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!! Love this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: LouHolt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here is for Thanks Giving in November 2009 with my mum as a treat for my 30th birthday and it was pefect. Firstly, location - Time Sqaure is either for you or it isn't. Simple. As 2 woman travelling on their own there were areas of New York that despite it's City that Never Sleeps rep were a bits too quite and intimidating past eleven at night. Located on the corner of Time Square facing the tkts ticket booth and well in the hustle and bustle mix of souvineer shops, bars and restaurants you are never threatened of too far from the action. If a trendy or quite location is for you, give this a miss. If this is your first visit to NY, this was our second, this hotel is ideal. The red Greyline open top tours are a must and all routes seem to radiate from this loctaion. With the good underground and it being Mid-Town you are central for all the loctaions you may want to explore. The hotel itself if located from the 7th floors upwards, accessed via a lift on the street level. Its a shiny, trendy place, very sleek and modern with dim lighting and a exclusive looking lounge bar. We stayed in a wonderful room which was large by any hotels standards let alone New York, with a crisp Kingsize bed, chais lounge, large plasma TV and a view over Broadway. The bathroom although lacking a bath housed a HUGE walk in shower/steam cupboard. Plenty of storage with a large wardrobe, bedside tables and a large draw for your clothes. Neither I or my mother travel light and there was plenty of room! These rooms although comfortable are not homely - they are ultra stylish, all brushed chrome, mood lighting and tinted mirrors.....not ideal for putting your make up on but very New York non the less. Room ammenaties were basic but extras like a coffee maker and suppliers were delivered to your room promptly on making a simple phonecall and was topped up everyday. All the hotel staff despite the trendy apperance were genuinely helpful and on hand whenever required. I will be visiting New York again at some point and would need a pretty good reason not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for itself”
Reviews.Author: molevin
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I like a hotel, sometimes I don't, and sometimes I just don't get it. The W falls into the last category. It's entrance is on 47th and consists of a tiny foyer with 3 elevators. You take one to the 7th floor where there is slightly bigger "lobby" where reception and some sort of a bar and gift shop are situated as well. There is always some sort of base driven music in the air. Haughty hotel employees seem to be around except when you need something. The room was nice with a good view of Times Square. The bathroom walls are see-through and there is no dresser (in the name of hipness I presume). But the room seemed clean and the shower was nice. The exercise room is spartan. An advertised feature of the W was a free ride in some sort of Acura limo. Alas, it is never there. I don't mean it was being used for some other guest. NOBODY got a ride (based on an informal survey I took of every guest I met there over 48 hours). It is a few steps away from TKTS but who needs that anymore with online discoujnts? Maybe the question is, if you cannot stay at the Michelangelo, is there really any reason to stay in a Times Square hotel? Another question: What is on floors 2-6? PS - the W is yet another hotel with an exhorbitant charge for wifi. That is just greedy imho.

Reviews.Title: “A great W in the center of the universe”
Reviews.Author: michael_portz
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but with awesome views on times square. Some rooms have a slope and we felt a bit like being on a ship... Expensive but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb from beginning to end!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidArroyo10
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the W at around midnight and was greeted by Marco at the Welcome Desk. He was very courteous, polite, and well-spoken. I felt like I was talking to a real person and not a robot like they have at the front desk of most other hotels. He very quickly also explained the amenities at the hotel and then directed me to the lift to so I could get to my room. The hotel is pristine..spotless..pretty much immaculate. The room, definitely one of the coolest rooms I have every stayed in. The layout and design was just amazing, super chic, bold, and clean. I feel like i was revealing hidden doors every few minutes i was in there. The Munchie Box is awesome, it's easy to sort through without having to worry about getting a charge for something you lifted off a sensor. The DVD player is a nice touch, not sure if it was supposed to have a movie in it as mine did, lol! Plenty of glassware in the room and fridge is fully stocked! The bed was so comfortable that I actually passed out and forgot to set my alarm before hand. The bathroom is very clean and modern, shower is the best I've been in(Besides my own). No gaudy drain cover or water control handle. Toiletries are bliss, not sure if anyone has notice the really funny directions on the body butter, lol! Overall, an amazing stay. Even housekeeping staff in the hallways are really really nice. All staff members truly acknowledge everyone on the property with a smile and such. Room was perfect size, well worth the price, and then some. Keep up the wonderful work W!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: dre_techie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many W Hotels and this is still one of my favorite properties as it combines the W style with the buzz of Times Square. During my visit we had a corner room with a nice view, service was good, the bar was nice as always - one of the things you can count on at the W hotels. For those wanting more privacy in their rooms, they should know that the bathroom will not give you much, since you can distinguish silhouettes in the bathroom, however it shares many features that repeat W guests recognize. The big walk-in shower however is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed by the W name”
Reviews.Author: MysticMary39
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the W in San Diego, and I loved it, great bed, great room, service, lounge, I loved it. So when we went to NYC on business I thought that the supreme quality would apply to this hotel as well, boy was I wrong. It is in the center of Time's Square, thumbs up for that, however... I was not at all impressed with the room, it had said on the website "newly renovated" it was like staying in a cheap plastic room in the Red Light district in Amsterdam, plastic tables with weird colored lights, condoms in the goody box, not really my style. I was not impressed with the bathroom either, very small, no privacy as is was all frosted glass walls, counter space was non existent, and every time someone flushed a toitlet the water pressure in the shower would cease to exist. Now the bed...not comfy, I have better linens in my own house with 6 month old baby. After staying our late, we were woken up a 7 am but screaming children running up and down the hallways, then after putting our two cents into that rambunctiousness, our breakfast arrive 45 minutes early. Very plain, not all that yummy, not a lot of coffee in the carafe. Bottom line, I rather pay the $20 cab ride downtown to stay at the Ritz in Battery park, far superior to this and about the same price if not less. I will say however, that when I complained the next morning they comped the breakfast and awarded us 2,000 points.

Reviews.Title: “The W is Worth It, But Not Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: Winghop
Reviews.Content: Some years ago I was on location at the W-Times Square, filming with a major super star. We were at another W in town, but he was at the hot, hip Times Square location. Ever since then, I knew that I must experience this place as a guest, and finally my time had come. I often visit the Ws in Brentwood, CA and the new Hollywood, CA locations, so I knew to expect a certain atmosphere and a certain level of comfort, convenience, and amenities. The only thing that kept this place from being 100% perfect is one single word: ANDAZ. Ok the proper spoiler is two words, Hyatt Andaz, as in the new uber-hip line of hotels that Hyatt has designed for the same discriminating customer as the W has attracted for much longer. Bottom line: at the Andaz, the snacks and sodas in the fridge are free. The internet access is free. The fit and finish of all the room's appliances, decor, furnishings, etc. are all meticulously kept spotless. The W had everything I could have asked for, including a DVD player, iPod dock, plenty places to plug and things to plug into them. However, at 15 bucks a day for the web, and a pricetag on even the bottled water ($8 bucks for a Fiji) PLUS having paid nearly $300 a night to get in the joint, it just seemed that I was paying a lot to look at things that I dare not touch, lest there be a touching fee! The room was gorgeous, and my room on the 30th floor was fitted with a spectacular view. I would not trade this for the world. All the accessories, toiletries and anything I had to touch were all sensual and made me feel special for being there. Here are the tough parts to digest: 1. The toilet cover did not fit the toilet. WHAA?? How is this OK? 2. So many long black stringy hairs all over the shower WALLS as well as behind the sink and other unexpected places. Since my hair is less than a millimeter long, I could not help but be grossed out by this. 3. The cordless phone and the DVD player needed connection help. While tech difficulties are to be expected when there are so many tech devices in the room, it seems that a tech-check should be as routine as housekeeping so that I shouldn't have the coverall guys in my room 2-3 times during 3 day visit. 4. The relationships between the hotels and vacation planning carriers should really benefit the customer. When I called to confirm my reservation and ask details about the hotel, the phone operator (not at the hotel) became very distant and almost nasty when she realized that I had booked third party. Traveling cross country required me to book the hotel and flight together, but it was as though my money and my business were no good to the W since I had booked outside their website. REALLY? Does the W parent company not get the money I pay to stay at their hotel? Do my incidental charges not get tallied? Since they do, then I should get all the few measly points due me for my stay. Thankfully the desk agents fixed the problem upon my check out. Bottom Line: The convenient location and the multiple perks of the W Times Square make it the perfect place to be in order to enjoy the perfect tourist's New York Vacation. The cool living room lounge had sexy folks in it almost 24/7, and although the Blue Fin restaurant is expensive, the food is phenomenal. My bed, the shower (even with the hair) and everything else in the room made life oh so Wonderful, even though i was paying through the nose for every minute. To the folks at W, take a page from the folks at ANDAZ - the little things that made you famous are now getting other properties bookings. I'll be loyal, but I'll also be comparing! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Not as Luxurious as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: cutemommy
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I decided to have a nice date night so I used my points to stay at the W hotel since I thought this was a high category hotel. Well even though this hotel is a category 6 I have stayed at better SPG properties at a lower category than this hotel. The rooms were just ok nothing to take pictures of or to brag. I was really excited about coming to this hotel but was quickly disappointed once I got my room. Inside the room the room didn't look as "clean" as I thought it would be we had to call to have new pillowcases because there was a stain on one of the pillows, fixtures on the wall would fall of if you touched it. The view is just ok you have to luck out to get a room with a view not looking into the marriott hotel across the street. The rooms are VERY small! I mean I was really surprised this hotel was a category 6 REALLY! The best part of the room was the bathroom sink and shower light! The bathroom is small but that looked way better than the rest of the room. When I stay at exclusive hotels I don't feel like I have to worry about dirty linen, here I was extremely worried, once I saw the stain on the pillow I was grossed out! Then when I was about to take a shower I looked on the floor and saw hair! So that tells me they didn't really clean the room as well as they probably should have. I read some comments before I came here and there were some that mentioned the torn carpet etc., that was also the case in my room. I just don't think I will be booking any more stays here, I can't seem to find a nice hotel in the city unless it is the Ritz Carlton! The staff was nice however I didn't get the warm fuzzy feeling when I asked about an upgrade or even the fact that it was supposed to be a romantic evening. I just really wish I could talk more about the hotel but I really can't it just isn't/wasn't what I thought it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Experience @ W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetruffle
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly, helpful and attentive staff!

Reviews.Title: “good in parts”
Reviews.Author: nje3006
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a party of 5, 2 adults, 3 teens for 4 nights in July. NYC was HOT and the air con in one of the rooms didn't work. The good bits - it's very stylish, rooms are good quality, beds v comfortable, public areas of the hotel, lounge area and 7th floor bar area very good. Not so good bits - the service was slow. Sometimes very slow. Every morning they weren't set up to cater for 5 despite there being numerous large families there every time we dined. Breakfast on the first day was ridiculously slow, it took 35 minutes to get a cup of ordinary coffee and a pot of hot water. The breakfast food was good when it eventually arrived. Breakfast service got faster over the 4 days but they never had a table ready. Maid service was barely adequate. The rooms were not cleaned til post 4 pm most days, the first day the carpet wasn't even hoovered. Trays from room service left outside rooms were left there all day, eventually we complained when one tray was still outside the room from 8 am til gone 10 pm. That really isn't acceptable in a hotel at this level. The breakfast offer we had through our travel operator was $5 per person per day. That was confirmed when we checked in but at breakfast I was given a $95 bill. WHen I queried that with the front desk they said they had never heard of the $5 offer but that our room was on an offer for $38 per person with a max of 2 people per room and it would be credited to our rooms when we checked out. Since we were 5 people in 2 rooms that meant $152 per day for all of us - more than enough. When we came to check out, every breakfast bill was on there in full. It took more than 30 mins to sort out with front desk staff who said they had never heard of the $38 per person offer but took my word for it. Because front desk staff couldn't understand the offer, no it was per person, no it only covered 4 people b/c we only had 2 room, no it was per day, it took a long time to sort out and I had to be very persistent (not to mention patient) Not really sure about some of their doormen who seemed to be in league with the limo drivers who will rip you off as soon as look at you. When we told the concierge what their doorman had told us about recommending the limo, she was pretty horrified. They need to keep an eye on what's going on out there. Overall the service (apart from housekeeping) was pretty good. The hotel is very central which has good and bad parts, the bad being the noise from the sirens even from the 30th floor. It didn't bother me but the kids found it hard to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “W-OW! Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Minnisnowda
Reviews.Content: GREAT Hotel; had a room with an lovely view. Experienced a few minor problems with a staff member at the hotel and the General Manager of the hotel went above and beyond to make sure I was happy. Great location for NYC, rooms are very generously sized for being in Times Square. I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: cheetah72
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to New York City periodically, as we live in the area. This was our first stay at the W New York Times Square. We have stayed at other hotels in the same area and would rank this hotel as just as good if not better than others. It is the most expensive of the hotels that we have stayed at in this area. We booked through American Express so although it was expensive we did receive some added amenities. Upon check in our room was ready, but we were told that if we were willing to wait that we could receive an upgrade. This was fine as we had theater tickets. The room was worth the wait. We were upgraded to a suite with a sitting area, bedroom, and 1.5 bathrooms. The room was modern and meet our needs. In terms of noise we did not hear anyone within the hotel or outside except an occasional police or fire siren. In terms of service we had no complaints. The front desk was friendly and we were comped two drinks at the lobby bar. We ate lunch at Blue Fin as we had a $100 credit at the hotel. For the money I think it was fine as we received an upgraded room, 2 free drinks, and a free lunch (excluding alcohol and tip).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for Times Square and the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here July 4-7, 2010. This hotel is a great place to stay and the customer service we had was wonderful. The doormen were VERY nice and the front desk people were great. One day our room did not get cleaned, because we where in and out of it all day, so we called down to the front desk to let them know we would like it serviced while we went to the Mets game and when we got back it was done. They also left us a message on our hotel phone making sure the room was serviced. GREAT JOB!! There is a small little store next door open 24 hours if you need ANYTHING!! The bed was ok and the room was typically small for NY, but I would have no problem staying here. The shower, no tub, did smell like mold & mildew, but I could not find the source of it. Very trendy and beautiful! Did not eat at Blue Fin in the lobby during our stay, but it was always busy. Would highly recommend this hotel! Happy Traveling!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Fun”
Reviews.Author: rrz518
Reviews.Content: My 2nd time here. Very kind, fun staff, but the real winner here is the location and facility itself. From the minute you walk inside, you're surrounded by great sensory indulgences. From the music to the lighting to the aroma of the candles, you're thanking yourself you didn't book at a cookie cutter property. Didn't have the opportunity to sample the restaurant, but I wil soon! The rooms are slick and sleek. W has become my favorite USA hotel "brand", and trust me, this hotel will not disappoint. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in the heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Bikramyogaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th wedding anniversary in NYC. We stayed at the W hotel in Times Square. This is a hotel that I have stayed at many times for business, but this was my first nonbusiness stay at the hotel. We had a wonderful time. We had a nice room on the 50th floor and the staff sent us a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. I really appreciated the extra attention.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced With Fatal Flaws-Young Families Beware”
Reviews.Author: lovejhu
Reviews.Content: I love New York. I do not care about outside noise. I don't care about cop sirens etc. But, the fatal flaw of the W is the paper thin walls. After a great evening at In The Heights, my family was awoken several times during the night from the noises of the couple staying next door. Even though the teenagers were mature enough to deal the moans and groans of love making from next door, it was unacceptable for the family to hear all that we did. Honestly it was so loud it was like the couple was in our room. After a night full of plastering pillows to our ears, we were tired beyond belief. We all took showers in the very public frost glass bathroom. When we were leaving, we walked down the hallway only to hear more moans and groans of people. After waiting for the elevator with the moans of couples in the background the teenagers of course were laughing. Even the adults were laughing. I have never experienced such lack of privacy in a hotel. What a waste of money. We always stay at Starwood hotels, however the next time we stay in Times Square we will save some money and actually get some sleep in the Marriott Marquis, a hotel we have stayed in before and liked. This is a hotel for young couples, not for families. The worst thing was when we told the front desk of the experience and suggested they should get white noise sound machines, the man responded, "Well we have them." Thanks buddy for not offering the machine when we checked in! On top of it all the rooms were small, and our view was not great considering the price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girly week”
Reviews.Author: lovelydubly
Reviews.Content: I have just got bk from five days at the w and am going to book again tomoro I found it so safe as their was just three girls the location Is the best u can get I found it all very clean and up to date the men at the front are amazin and so helpful the bus tour city sites ny is amazin n they pick up from the corner of ur street which is perfect can't wAit to book again I'll be seein you in January

Reviews.Title: “Another Great W Times Square Experience”
Reviews.Author: pmurphy1
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square never fails me. Great hotel, great staff, great location. I look forward to my next stay!

Reviews.Title: “The best location with great views but not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: iLoveTraveling4Fun
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here. The hotel and rooms are very modern. Expensive-yes but you are paying for the location. Rooms are small (typical for ny) but fairly clean. I didn't complain but I felt the bathroom wasn't all that clean. There is a liitle mildew on the grout and our fan isn't working. The hotel Is definitely geared towards young working urban types not families. The front lobby area is a neat experience with a great water feature surrounding the lobby including the ceiling. You have to take the elevator to the 7th floor to get to the front desk. The bar and living room is filled with people ready for action. You won't find jeans and sneakers here. Overall it's a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: sidhantjatia
Reviews.Content: great hotel amazing location, right at times square rooms are small but trendy.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Tricia_S1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit over rated and over priced. The decor is very chic but a little gloomy, and the drink selection in the bar was sensational! The front door man (and others) ware not very helpful, however the front desk did make sure to let us know we had celebrities in the lounge with their entourage. Our room was small and a bit dark too, although the view was amazing. It was loud and I would not stay here again. Parking was royally expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Design - in the heart of the Action”
Reviews.Author: shreddie97
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to the W for the contemporary design as well as the location. Pros: Right upon entry you notice the interesting design. The lobby with the water feature does an amazing job of immediately dulling the noise of times square and putting you into a more 'spa' like feeling.
