The room was also well designed and we were happy with the cleanliness and functionality of the room. We enjoyed a cocktail at the Living Room bar, nice laid back atmosphere and good martinis. The staff at the hotel that we interacted with were all very friendly and professional Cons - not too many of them Although I think it was a purposeful design decision, I did find that they could use some brighter lighting in the common areas and elevators as it started to be a strain to the eyes. The location can be a pro or a con, I think that we may try a location a bit further away from Times Square for a different vibe and a bit more quiet. A few times at night the noise from times square did make sleeping a bit difficult. We didn't eat at Blue Fin but went in for an afternoon cocktail, the service was a bit slow in the bar area. I know a few commented on the price, we actually had a very good rate from expedia so I think we paid a fair rate for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Urban, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: PassportandVisa
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. It was my sister's birthday so we splurged and got a suite. The room was fantastic (although was not ready upon check in and later called the wrong number to let us know it was ready). We later attempted to order a bottle of wine and were told that was not available. We would have to come down to the bar to drink it. We trekked down to the bar, bought the wine and then received a service charge for requesting glasses. What "service" was provided, I wonder? We called the "make a wish" line and complained so the service charge was reversed but thought it was ironic the W markets "make a wish" yet cannot seem to perform simple room service tasks... I previously had wonderful experiences at other W properties but have now reconsidered my opinion of the entire chain and would stay elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Standard only”
Reviews.Author: bruhlmeier
Reviews.Content: Stay 4 nights, everything seems standard.... The room is functional but no extra surprise, a bit dark for our taste. Luckily we got moved to the corner room the second night, higher up and had a bit of city view and better nature light. The window were not air tided, a bit noise to sleep. Friendly service, but a bit out of standard line is too much trouble....

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, over priced”
Reviews.Author: vtripsaway
Reviews.Content: The ‘living room’ AKA the lobby where you check in was nice. Smelled good (candles) and had a nice vibe. The ‘Whatever/Whenever’ concierge were brill. Gave good advice about steak restaurants, recommended bars to watch the world cup etc. Couldn’t fault them. Free internet in lobby was a bonus too and shop sold nice stuff but pricey. Big plus was the gym. Very small but free for hotel guests and a nice room next door to stretch and warm down. Real bonus to have a gym. Used it a couple of times. Machines are new and the area is clean. HUGE let down was the room. Room was dark and small. Toilets were ridiculous. See through bathroom walls meant whoever you’re sharing a room with can see you sitting on the loo! No privacy. I would not recommend the hotel to anyone, however it wasn’t totally awful... it was clean and in the middle of times square. What i would say is that the design and lighting is ridiculous and rooms are suitable for no more than two people. We were messed around with money... they still owe us for the deposit they overcharged us for!! We asked about upgrading.. girl at desk pretended that she already had upgraded us. This was a lie.. if our room was an upgrade i would hate to see what a basic room looked like. An average hotel charging 5* prices. Experience was 3*

Reviews.Title: “One to watch out for”
Reviews.Author: Diorlover
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in the w hotel new york for our joint 50th birthdays. Hotel is very modern, rooms are overrated but are clean with a good housekeeping service. The day before we left our bill was put iunder our door which was accurate and on checking out we paid up fully and took away the invoice with us. When we returned home we found that the hotel had taken a further amount of from our credit card claiming this was for items from the mini bar which we never touched. We contacted the hotel who did not really want to know, so we are now going through our credit card company. We loved new york and our holiday overall but this has left a little dampner on the whole experience so please beware if using this hotel as we now understand that we are not the first to encounter this problem.

Reviews.Title: “All form, no substance or function”
Reviews.Author: seeyalata
Reviews.Content: I came to the W through a recommendation, but was sorely disappointed. There's a lot of flash and attempts at innovative design, but it's without purpose. Add the fact that the staff were not particularly wonderful, and you've got the recipe for a disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W!!”
Reviews.Author: Beautyconsultant
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W hotel for one night for my bf birthday. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. The service in the hotel was impeccable from the bellmen to the front desk to the concierge. Francisco from concierge was extremely helpful, patient and courteous and helped me make an appt. The room was very modern and had a lot of amenities. Lcd tv, internet access, ipod station, mini bar including shots of johnny walker black, vodka, water and sodas. They also had a snacks in the rooms such as peanuts, oreos, snickers, souvenirs, fiji water etc. I also requested a late check out and they accomodated me. I was very happy with my experience here

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis with great location in NYC”
Reviews.Author: TCKTravel
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Starwood and have stayed in many of their hotels, including several other W Hotels and while I've always been relatively impressed by their service, the W Hotel Times Square was EXEMPLARY! We were so impressed. My boyfriend and I went for our anniversary and I contacted Rachel two weeks before our arrival and asked about having champagne and rose petal service set up in our room while we were out at the theatre our first night. She quoted me typical hotel prices for such services and was very helpful in keeping it a surprise. It turned out later we were not charged for this service. It was all complimentary and they even left a card in our room wishing us a happy anniversary and thanking us for spending it with them. The next morning they brought us complimentary coffee and again wished us a fabulous anniversary trip in the city. The two associates we spoke with at the Whatever/Whenever desk were EXTREMELY helpful, booked us discount seats to Lend Me A Tenor (best show of the four we saw on our trip) and recommended four delicious restaurants, all of which we tried and loved. Our room was immaculate our entire stay and clean every time we came back to the room. We originally had a lower level room, but when we checked in the man who took care of us offered a higher room with a view. It was beautiful. That reminds me, it wasn't just the service that was spectacular. The HOTEL is fabulous. The lobby has a great atmosphere for 20-30 somethings - great music, great scene, GREAT cocktails. Blue Fin, the restaurant on the street level, was DELICIOUS. Not to mention, how much we loved the waterfall entrance lobby where we waited for the elevators to take us up to the main lobby. Absolutely beautiful. The service, attention to detail and accommodations were fabulous and we will certainly be staying there again the next time we visit NYC. Thank you W Times Square for such a fabulous and memorable anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED! The W!! Will return!”
Reviews.Author: Memphisbelle70
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W times square was the absolute highlight of our fabulous girls trip to the city. We were a group of 5 girls from Atlanta staying in two joining rooms. Rooms were perfect, cannot say enough about the awesome view looking out to Times Square. The beds were the most comfortable EVER!!! We also heard NO NOISE from outside or in the halls What really made the trip was the staff. A young, hip, group of true professionals who seem to really enjoy their jobs and serving the guest. Whomever is in charge of the staff needs to pat themselves on the back!!! EVERYONE we encountered was superb-just to name a few, Adai (who sent a lovely welcome cheese tray with a handwritten note to our suite after arrival), Javier and Jonathan at the Living room. Jonathan makes the BEST drinks!!! The Living room is the place to be. A mix of professionals, celebs, sports teams (a pro baseball team stayed there during our stay-fun!!)We will make a yearly trek back to the W for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You can't find a better location than this”
Reviews.Author: natgoduk
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the W hotel Times Square. Where do I start? All of the staff in the hotel are very friendly and welcoming. The bar (which seems very popular at all times of day) is on the 7th floor the same as the reception area. There is free internet usage next to reception. You will also find a small boutique store on the 7th floor which has some very nice clothing, shoes, bags and accessories. We stayed on the 56th floor. If you don't like heights or lifts this is not the place for you. Our room was a good size as was the bathroom. We had a very pleasant stay and I would highly recommend this hotel to friends and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Service far beyond the expected!”
Reviews.Author: winecaddie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels over 25 years of international business travel. What sets the W in Times Square apart is the attitude of their staff. I think that Nick Riley and his management went way beyond was could be required or expected, to help me deal with an urgent problem while away from the hotel. When all others failed, they came through and did it with a smile. That is the kind of attitude that will forever standout to me and ensure many future returns and recommendations. Bravo W-Hotel Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for!!!”
Reviews.Author: Devildog2
Reviews.Content: I traveled with a group of girlfriends (started off as 12, but ended up just 3 of us!) I had the duty of finding the hotel for the group. I started looking for boutique hotels with what I thought would be a lot of girls. With just the 3 of us we stumbled upon the W. I had low expectations after I booked the room and paid in full up front. Low expectations because they were having trouble with their credit card system and kept charging me over and over and over again. Many phone calls later and it was all taken care of. PLUS we were upgraded to a FANTASTIC SUITE. Corner room on the 53rd floor. Absolutely gorgeous. This was my first trip to NYC and the view was breathtaking. We had a wonderful time, the hotel was gorgeous, the room was spectacular. Yes it was small, but it's NYC. We overlooked Times Square (and unfortunately the car bomb episode). Someone complained that the shades let the light in--not true. We were out till about 2 every night and were able to sleep peacefully in the dark until 7 or 8--or whenever we decided to get up. We didn't use any of the amenities--restaurant, bar, shops, gym. We used the room to sleep and shower. I may not pay that much again to sleep and shower, but for my first trip it was absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy; No tub”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: Consistent with the W way; the rooms are minimalistic and trendy. Low slung furniture; greys...I find a little depressing. Had a corner room with an amazing view of Times Square. Wasn't loud at all. I may be the last person in the world that likes to take a bath. Well, no luck for me. Decent shower but no bath tub. Lounge/bar area was trendy and made my friend and I feel old (think 20 year olds spilling drinks everywhere). But, it's the best deal of the hotels on the Amex Platinum list.

Reviews.Title: “Coolest hotel in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: travelguruguru
Reviews.Content: Staying at the W Hotel is an experience that I highly recommend. Right from the start you feel like you've entered a place that's different from your average hotel in which to spend the night in. In fact, to check in to the hotel you have to take the elevator up to the 5th floor where on one side you'll find the check-in counter while on the other you're feel a beautifully designed bar. Great house music is playing in the background while you're invited to sip on a drink or two and get to know some of the hotel's other guests. Now I should point out that for me the vibe in the room was great, but I realize that pulsating dance music and room full of people socializing might be a turn off for those looking for a more standard check in experience. Aside from the lobby, there's also a couple of trendy shops to check out, and even the bathrooms are a cut above your typical hotel lobby toilettes. The room itself in which I stayed in wasn't big, but then again this is Manahttan. People don't come here to lounge around their rooms all day long - you're meant to go out and explore the city! I think the hotel's design and ambiance goes well with the overall attitude of what Manhattan is about - upscale, trendy, unique, and exciting. Oh yeah, and the location ain't half bad either ;)

Reviews.Title: “Cool rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravisK71
Reviews.Content: The W Times square is a great hotel. Rooms are comfortable, clean and nice. Service is great. Very much a hipster vibe, so if you don't like electronic music in the elevator you would be better off somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: fralis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here for 4 days for our anniversary. Let me just say it was the best vacation we ever had. The W is a great hotel. When we arrived our room wasn't ready yet so the man at the check-in desk gave us a voucher to have a complimentary drink each while we waited. Our room was ready within 1/2 an hour. The room was clean and very comfortable. The hotel itself was trendy and well-decored. When we told the concierge that it was our anniversary, they sent us a complimentary bottle of wine to enjoy. Our experience was outstanding. When we return, we will definitely stay at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: bombay1536
Reviews.Content: Overall I was really unimpressed with the W. It has a great location in Times Square that's adjacent to dozens of tourist attractions, but it was really just an unpleasant experience. First, the ground floor lobby has a beautiful water feature, but it smells musty and stale. After the first few trips through the lobby the novelty of it wears off and all you can do is hold your nose as you run to the doors. The elevators are tiny - the only one that wasn't cramped was the far left which I can only assume is the service elevator. Judging by the smell it hasn't been cleaned in a while. I've worked in kitchens whose grease traps smelled better than that elevator. When you're relieved by the smell of NYC streets you know there's something wrong with your hotel. Additionally, hotel guests are required to switch elevators at the 7th floor to get to their rooms. Again, a great security feature, but it really gets annoying after the twelfth time you have to wait for the second elevator and cram in with guests and their bags again - just to get to your room or the ground floor. The entire hotel is decorated and lit like a night club - which would be fabulous if it wasn't also so cramped and tiny. I know NYC isn't the place to be looking for wide open, spacious expanses, but if the hallways on each floor rival the tight quarters of my upstairs bathroom hallway shouldn't you attempt to open it up with light colors? These hallways are painted dark gray with minimal lighting. I felt like I was going spelunking every time I went back to my room. The rooms themselves are about the size of postage stamp. I was staying at the W with my sister and brother-in-law and let's just say we got to know each other really well. The room has few amenities - no refrigerator (unless you crack open the Fort Knox that is the mini bar), no coffee, no tea. Essentially the amenities are capped off by the ice bucket sitting next to the $10 bottle of Fiji water. Another word to the wise, if you're staying there with someone who isn't your spouse beware of the glass enclosed bathroom. Sure it's frosted, but who really wants to see a silhouette of someone doing their business first thing in the morning? Combined with the toilet that would start running in the middle of the night so loudly that I had to get up three times the last night to fix it (removing the lid and working with the internal floating mechanism), the sliding bathroom door that should come with your own personal Hulk arms to close it (and sounds like screeching nails on a chalkboard when sliding), and the shower that lost most of its water before it got to rinsing your head by pouring out the bottom of the showerhead like a bucket (with a lovely and relaxing tone reminiscent of a pressure washer to perk you right up) - well, let's just say I won't ever be staying at this, or any other, W hotel in the future. I will point out that one person was great, though. Julian at the front desk was a doll and really helped me out of a few jams when we first arrived. He's an asset and they'd do well to retain him for as long as they can. I think he's actually the only person that saved this trip from being an entire wash. He gave great recommendations for local spots to eat and grab a drink, too. The other guy, whose name I can't remember but starts with an N, was polite but ultimately useless at getting my problem taken care of. The Acura Experience driver, however, is temperamental. So much for using this amenity to see a new part of town. He'd just gotten back from being stuck in traffic so he "didn't feel like taking that drive again," but he'd be happy to take us about fifteen blocks - of a 45 block trip. No thanks, buddy - I'll take the subway. Lucky for him he wasn't so tired and petulant the next day and actually was willing to take us down to Soho. Too bad we'd already been. I wouldn't have taken that guy up on the offer anyways, but I might want to apply for his job. Any job I only have to do when I feel like it sure sounds nice to me.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in New York and not the last...”
Reviews.Author: LadyBug1867
Reviews.Content: Just went to NYC to celebrate my spouse's 40th birthday, Stayed at the W Times Square and our stay was such a pleasant one. Service and attention from start to finish was just superb. The location of the hotel is simply perfect - Broadway and 47th Street - right in the action! Of course if your main reason is to rest and relax, the W may not be your best choice. It is noisy at night (street noise) but nothing that kept us from sleeping. The lounge-bar is a great place for a night cap and very fashion. Our room was great - 23rd floor, great view of Times Square, clean room, nothing to complaint. Overall, would definitely go back to the W!

Reviews.Title: “Bad view”
Reviews.Author: frederic80
Reviews.Content: I have book a room with a view over new-york which was marketed as "incredible" on my reservation receipt and have paid a premium to get a high floor high quality room. The room by itself was very confortable and nice but there was a large building in front of our room which was very close and larger than the W hotel, preventing us to see new-yorK ! Impossible to get another room

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Classy and Fun”
Reviews.Author: mhatz
Reviews.Content: We took our kids to NYC for the first time and stayed here. If you are going in to see a show this is a great spot, we walked everywhere (Rockefeller Center, American Girl Place, theater, ESPN Zone etc.) My son and daughter's favorite part was sitting on the chaise lounger near the window and watching the M&M World video sign. The room was clean, modern and a good size by NYC standards. The bathroom was interesting as it had frosted glass walls, it looked cool but not the best for privacy. Loved the basin sink! The check-in staff was courteous but not all that welcoming. The bell-men, valet and housekeeping were all friendly and address you by name (my kids loved that the housekeeping woman gave them extra chocolates when she came for turn down service). We had an issue that was outside of the hotel's control and the management went above and beyond to make it right, which in the end has made me a big fan of The W and Starwood Properties in general (we are usually lean towards Marriott's when we travel). Thanks to Lailani for handling things graciously. Since we had our kids with us we weren't able to enjoy the chic Lounge area into the late hours but we did enjoy having a cocktail there in the early evening and it was a fine place to be with the kids. I was concerned that the hotel would be loud into the night because of the Lounge but that was not the case at all. You can also access free Wi-Fi in this area, but you have to pay in the rooms. We had a room on the 52nd floor and then were moved to the 28th floor. The 52nd was amazingly quiet, the only noise you could hear were the occasional sirens from the street. The 28th floor was a little nosier form the street but certainly nothing that would keep you up at night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: KLS81
Reviews.Content: We booked the W for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon and were not disappointed. I had emailed ahead to tell them about the reason for our trip and got a lovely email back and phone call from the concierge with restaurant recommendations. On arrival we found our standard room booking had been upgraded to a suite and champagne was waiting for us. The hotel's location couldn't be better for exploring the city, and we found the rooms stylish and comfortable with a fabulous 27th floor view. We ate at the Blue Fin which although expensive ($200 for a 2 course meal for 2 with wine) was excellent, with live jazz music and great styling. The food was fantastic and the service quick and friendly. All in all we loved our stay at the W and would definitely come back

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: ARSeattle
Reviews.Content: This has to be the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in and absolutely no view of times square. There are limited in room amenities (e.g. no coffee or tea and they offer $8 a bottle water), I mention this because we had friends staying in another Starwood hotel just a few blocks north with coffee and tea service and a bath scrubby and multiple other toiletry items and they were paying a lot less. So I guess we were paying for the W name though I didn't really feel it was worth it. All in all as our first experience staying in a W, this was a very big disappointment. Housekeeping was the worst I’ve ever experienced in a hotel. It was as if they had the B team on staff during the time we stayed there. The first day we arrived and we had three sets of towels, the second day we ended up with only one set and had to call twice to the front desk to get a replacement. It happened again on the third day, housekeeping would take the towels but not replace them. And, even better it appear that on the second day when they changed the bed sheets they also took the bottoms of my pajamas. I hate to blame anyone especially service staff for taking things so in the back of my mind I just assumed it got stuck in our luggage somewhere but even when we returned home I never found it. There has to be better hotels in this area, in this price range…I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelinfamily
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms. Comfy bed. The whole "W" experience. We had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, great location, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: DenverCenter
Reviews.Content: I am usually a loyal Westin patron, so I was glad to get the opportunity to try the upscale brand in the chain. The rooms are lovely and very spacious for NYC. The location is great, especially now that Times Square has so much pedestrian space right out the front door. The view from my 24th floor window was right up Broadway - killer! And you are so in the heart of Times Square that you have to pull the blinds to shut out the bright lights at night. Very cool. You can definitely find something cheaper by at least $50 a night nearby in Times Square, but it is a cool experience to stay here. My only complaint - and this is totally a matter of taste - is that the place tries too hard to be hip - pulsing music and funky dim lighting at all hours of the day in the lobby, and a fairly aloof staff. When I'm in a place as crazy as NYC, I want my hotel - especially one at this price point - to be a fairly peaceful place to relax. The room certainly was, but the rest of the hotel spaces were anything but restful. Also loved Blue Fin downstairs. I had a scallop dish that I am still dreaming about!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Times Square”
Reviews.Author: RealHoop
Reviews.Content: Could not ask for a better location, walk straight out onto 47th & Broadway at the top end of Times Square. Hotel very trendy and modern probably not best for more traditional travellers. Facilities excellent in room. Be prepared for some traffic noise through the night, regular sirens, especially loud if NYFD. Don't bother with Grayline bus, use the subway. Empire State you have to do, but be prepared for massive queue even if like us you use the fastrack ticket, still 2 1/2 hours. Central Park brilliant day. Brunch at Nicematin 79th & Amsterdam 2 blocks over beside History Museum. The Gospel Trip is brilliant and would highly recomment, the tour guide was superb. The Irish bars are great, one grumpy barman on 5 days. ESPN Bar in Times Square is good for the sportsfans. Did not feel uncomfortable at any stage, saw no trouble. Take your walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly renovated hotel, poorly maintained rooms and mostly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: AndDeee
Reviews.Content: Arriving late at night during one of the big New York snowstorms after flying in from Vegas we were tired and just wanted to get to our room. Pulling up at the hotel downstairs, we were greeted nicely by the bellboys and they helped us with all our luggage, which is standard/expected of a "5 star" hotel. We were shown the lift and advised where to proceed to check-in etc. All good so far. There was one guy working at the check-in counter, very casually dressed and very "laid back". He finished serving the guest in front of us and welcomed us to the hotel. Then simply asked for my ID and credit card, then within about 30 seconds I had my room key and was told my room number and that was it. No mention of my Gold status, which while nothing special, every other SPG branded hotel at least mention it and say "thank you for staying with us again" No mention of a room upgrade or anything extra either, granted we were staying in the Fantastic Suite, so there are no upgrades possible, but at least spend a bit of time explaining the hotel! Also given we were spending 5 nights here I would have expected a little bit more effort. That being said, we were tired and just wanting to get to the room and warm up, so I didn't ask anything and we went up to the room. Baggage, was up within a few mins with no problems there. The room we assigned, at first glance was lovely. Then once we started looking around we realized we had been allocated a disabled/accessible room (more on that later). Added to that we were only on the 30th (roughly) floor and not anywhere near the top of the hotel. The view was blocked by a "lovely" concrete ledge, so we could JUST see times square if we were standing in the corner of the bedroom. It was probably one of the worst Fantastic Suites available, as no other room type like this had the ledge blocking the view towards Times Square. So back downstairs I went, and asked about a room change, of course the standard "Sorry, there are no other rooms available tonight, you can check back tomorrow and see if anything comes up, as someone SHOULD be checking out" Of course, before going down I had checked availability and there were at least 9 Fantastic Suites available as they were bookable. According to the bell boys the hotel wasn't even 50% full, as I did ask that when arriving out of interest. After pushing him with my information, he said all he can do it put a note in the system for a "room change", come back tomorrow after 3pm and we would have another room. He denied knowing that he was assigning me an accessible room with no view, so of course, he didn't say sorry. I then watched him check-in an older couple and he was just as fast and rude to them as well and they were left standing around wondering where to go next after getting their room key.... So I left it at that and headed out to get something quick for dinner. More on the room - The accessible room, had two bathrooms which was nice, the standard small bathroom, and then the accessible bathroom, which had an ugly seat in the shower, no shower curtain/door, no bench space near the sink. In the end we should have stayed in this room, as the 2nd room was in fact worse... Yes the beds were nice and the rooms were designed in a modern feel. Yes they were dark, and probably not good if you are over 45 years old, that did not concern us at all. What really lets this hotel down is the cheap renovation they did and it sure does show. Basically all the old cracking/peeling/damaged walls simply were painted over, and painted poorly. So you can see all the old paint/wallpaper/peeling and all the damage underneath it. There is probably a reason why they like the rooms being so dark. Lots of small maintenance issues as well, like the shower taps falling off, lights not working, weird noises from the air conditioning and just a lack of maintenance. The air conditioning panel in the living room of the suite, was falling off as was the air con panel in the bedroom. As a result the panels would rattle and make lots of weird noises throughout the night. Also the huge gap around them meant a large dark hole leading up into the air conditioning black hole. We did expect to see a rat in there at some stage, but we missed out on that. Basically the hotel has had a cheap and poor renovation combined with no maintenance really doesn't help. This hotel only around 12 months ago, and already it's falling apart. How they expect to get another 6-7 years out of this hotel I really don't know. They can't make the rooms any darker... Okay, so the next day after 3pm, I went down and asked about the room change, given that our room had not been serviced it must have been noted in the system. The girl who helped me was lovely this time, she said yes there is a request but it wouldn't let her allocate a new room. She went and spoke to the Manager, and we were given a new room only a few stories from the top floor, which was what I expected when we checked it. The girl said she would send up a bellboy to help with luggage and move us to the new room in about 10 mins and I went back to our old room. After a few mins the bellboy arrived, and I informed him we weren't ready yet, he was not happy about this and grumbled about having to wait around. I offered to call down when I was ready and he gumbled about already being upstairs and waiting.. So I said I'll be about 5-10 mins and he grumbled again. I then offered to take the new room key off him and move the luggage myself. He said that was not possible, so then I simply said I'll be 5-10 mins and shut the door on him. I am not interested in New York attitude when I am staying in the 2nd highest room category and I am changing rooms because of the incompetence of the hotel/staff. After a few mins I went to the door and he was around the corner on her phone sending messages or something, and simply said "You ready yet?" I said yes and he got our luggage and said he'd meet us on the new floor. We got to the new room and walked in and the view was perfect, he put all the luggage where we requested and was a bit friendlier at this stage. We tipped him well, and that was that. Okay, this room... Had the one normal bathroom and another 1/2 bathroom (toilet and basin) and a much better un-obstructed view over Times Square. Again the room had maintenance issues which we never bothered to report as no doubt the whole hotel has bits and pieces broken/not working. Firstly the nice little blue mood light in the shower just below knee level was not there, it was covered over with an old tile. The light switch in the bathroom was still there for it, but of course it didn't do anything. No biggie but you don't have those poorly repaired items in a "5 star hotel". The more annoying bit was that the air conditioning unit in the bedroom didn't work in this room. As mentioned above, the suites have an air con unit in the living room and also one in the bedroom. This was annoying as not much air makes it way to the bedroom and we like to have the bedroom cooler and the living room warmer. Again, we didn't report this as there was no point. In the 1/2 bathroom, the tap was broken, meaning it was hard to wash your hands, again we just let it go. This hotel was in the middle of a long USA trip involving lots of SPG hotels. After staying here I was very tempted to cancel the other 16 nights in SPG managed hotels, but I decided to let the other hotels have their chance and ignore the W brand. However, I won't be staying at the W New York - Times Square ever again. For those that don't read all the above a Summary - Poorly and cheaply renovated and maintained hotel. Mostly rude staff. Rooms have various bits and pieces falling off and not repaired correctly. Location is great, and the gym was nice. Rooms are dark, so if you over 45 you may not like it. On the surface the rooms appear great, but it is simply a cheap, fast and nasty renovation that was done. Considering this hotel will be operating for another 5-8 years before the next renovation cycle, I hate to see how the rooms are in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeeded our high expectations”
Reviews.Author: schplinky
Reviews.Content: Truly, this was a textbook hotel stay. We arrived obscenely early but were given a room. The room was clean, comfortable and relaxing. The person checking us in said hello when he saw us in the lobby later and asked if everything was fine, which it was. The lobby bar had creative drinks and a good staff. We requested and were given a late check-out. I cannot think of one way to improve the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozkay929
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our trip to NY, it is a very nice hotel. It's a W so expect the glam and chic parts. From the moment we got out of our cab service was great, our bags were taken up to the living room, the ambassador explained to use about the living room and bars, check in was very smooth and a room was available to us right away and the time was around 11am. We had an awesome cool corner room with a great view of Times Square. The room was spacious and bathroom was a very good size. The bed is super comfortable and shower was great, bliss products are awesome. We truly had a great experience, we got room service once and had drinks at the bar a couple of nights, the bar does get very busy at night. We also ate blu fin and it was really good too. It was over all really nice. Yeah it is Times Square so it can get noisy and crowded at times but you are in Times Square, so don't be shocked and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great W Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Maarten-JanV
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed @ W Times square for 4 nights for a business trip. And as usual I was very happy with the provided service and attention I got. After getting a room on the 18th I asked for a higher floor Immediatly they arranged a room on the 50th floor with a beatiful view. Also the Acura Service( a driver can take you to a restaurant or other place by luxury car!) they provide complimentary is a great. The rooms are not very spacious though and roomservice is quite expensive but hey you're on timesquare so enough to do outside. In summary a great hotel with dito service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ahpavlik
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay in New York. Excellent location. Walk out the door and you are in Times Square with several theaters close by. Starbucks across the street and great diners in walking distance. Tour bus picked up across the street. Hotel was very clean and room was quiet. Decor was contemporary. The lobby/lounge was very trendy with low lights, candles, and music. Great for having a drink but not for reading nor for teenages to hang out. Free internet service. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: recdapr
Reviews.Content: Miserable is what I can call about the service of this hotel. Totally unworthy the cost of this hotel. It does not matter that it has one of the best locations of the city..., its service is very bad. Cute room, that's it. I wil never ever stay at a W hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: babolat-blast
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square is a nice, trendy hotel. If you want to be very close to Times Square in a funky place, this one is for you. But keep also in mind that the location comes with quite some noise. I had a 'cool corner room' with great views on a very high floor, but even then there was lots of noise coming from the streets. One of the windows was not placed well in it's frame. They immediately came to repair it, but there was not such a big difference in the end. In the middle of the night some people thought it was the right moment to start a talk in the corridor which was also very easy to follow. So, you can't call the place 'soundproof'. While the reception area and bar are very dark, the rooms are fresh and modern. I had no problems with the design of the room, I liked it. The only thing that didn't work was the iPod docking station, but as I didn't spend lots of time in my room it was not a big deal for me. The reception staff was not so professional as they were continuously talking to each other about personal stuff during check-in instead of paying attention to the guests. So, in general it's a good and nice hotel, but a little bit too expensive compared to the service you get and the condition of the building.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTICAL!”
Reviews.Author: alr1984
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Hotel Times Square where I received excellent customer service from several of your employees, Ade and Julian, just to name a few. Everything was a breeze from the moment I stepped foot at 1567 Broadway, New York, NY on Wednesday, March 24th. I look forward to visiting this particular W Hotel in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Served it's purpose but nothing spectacular...”
Reviews.Author: scottp95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Times Square from March 26th - 28th. It was a weekend getaway with two adults and two children (3yrs and 1yr). The hotel overall needs a facelift. I think the dim lighting is used to cover up the outdated interior. We stayed in a Fantastic Suite, the only thing Fantastic was the view of Times Square, it was incredible. The room is VERY outdated with no drawers for storage and very small. Minimalist is an understatement and nearly everything in the room was damaged or just plain worn out. The room seemed dirty with smudge marks on the bedside tables and the shower was weak. We were on the 55th floor and you could still here the noise from Times Square and it seemed like the windows needed to be sealed or something. Overall, okay hotel, nothing special at all. It could have been an overpriced Howard Johnsons dimly lit...

Reviews.Title: “W - New York at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: tedferrer
Reviews.Content: Right next to the famous Waldorf-Astoria. Walking distance to the famous Times Square which is bustling with activities.

Reviews.Title: “It's all location, and then there's the hype”
Reviews.Author: KariL1
Reviews.Content: Ok, so it's taken me a while to write this, but received another "How Was It For You?" e-mail from W New York Times Square and decided to sum up my experience here instead of replying to the e-mail. All my experiences trying to contact the hotel staff have been bad, real bad. I had booked a colleague and myself in online for a three-night stay in two singles in December 2009. A month-and-a-half in advance of arrival, New York in December is a busy place. We wanted a central location and the hotel seemed to provide that. I received a confirmation for one room, on my name, from their automated reply service. I replied and got another confirmation, again for one room and this time for my colleague. I thought ok but decided to phone three days prior to arrival just to make sure we had two rooms, and a good thing I did because there was still just one room reserved. I confirmed two rooms and asked whether I could have a smoking room for myself. No problem, I would just be on a lower floor which was just fine with me. Fast forward to arrival. Taxi had to drop us two blocks away due to Times Square driving restrictions. Ok, this is Times Square. We look for receptions and apparently we are supposed to know they are by lift 8 flights up (doormen busy trying to fix taxis for giggling teenage MTV North Shore wannabes). We arrive at the claustrofobic reception with lounge bar pretensions from the 90's. After a half-hour wait we are told curtly: we have two rooms but both non-smoking. A discussion ensues, there is no record of my phone call. Grudgingly, I am allocated a smoking one and do not feel welcome at all. We spend three nights at the hotel and enjoyed the proximity to many of the locations for our business meetings. But not for one moment was I allowed to forget that the hotel was cool and I just had to accept that I needed to pay for the slightest semblance for service. I know this is true anywhere but to be reminded of it incessantly is a bomber. I guess this is their "Real Whatever/Whenever Experience", then. I've never in my life felt so exploited by a concept that is 95% hype and maybe the remaining 5% real (location, 90's cool interior which might have worked for someone else (aforementioned MTV North Shore wannabes...?). I would have left it at this if I hadn't gotten bombarded with these Starwood Hotels status e-mails (while I never registered for any program) and these messages from my "personal experience manager", whom I of course never met, but who still wishes to know urgently how "fabulous" my stay at W New York Times Square really was...

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but confusing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: XtinaY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at W Time square for work back in end of Jan. It's a very nice hotel and the best of it is, Location, location, location. Hotel is new, very nice service. Price: Can't really complain about price since it is business trip. But for W at a centralize area like this it's not bad. Hotel: The lobby is confusing!!! There are 3 elevators from Ground to Lobby, then another 4 elevators from lobby to rooms. Honest one thing that I can complain is you don't need your room key to get into the elevator, which is kinda, Ahm.. not safe? This security feature kicks in after 10 PM I think. No gym, free internet, etc and bottle of water there cost you 8 bucks. Watch out on your bill since my colleague didn't drink the water but she got charged somehow. She had to call the hotel to get that fixed. No complain what so ever with this hotel; in fact I am going back tonight. Room is chic, location is great...I am looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience minus check in”
Reviews.Author: alza1
Reviews.Content: We had booked a king room, but the man working at the desk claimed we had booked two double beds. I told him I had my confirmation printed, assuming he would take my word for it, but he stared at me as if I needed to prove it, so I had to dig through my luggage to get the paper. He told me we would have to be put in a handicapped room. Apparently the hotel had overbooked, and I felt he was unaccommodating and offered no apology for the mistake. There was NO counter space in the bathroom; the sink was literally a basin with no ledge at all. I had to keep my face wash and things on the toilet tank. The bathroom door had no lock and the frosted glass made it so you could "see" in, which was kind of strange. We watched one movie and were charged for two, but the staff handled the situation quickly and professionally. I loved the Bliss bath products, especially the face wash and body wash. The bed was comfortable and I liked the magazines in the room. The style of the hotel was very modern and the decor was cool. The wired business center was very convenient, and we were able to print boarding passes for our flights free of charge and very quickly. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the W, but the check in experience left me feeling unwelcome.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: HyfasBigB
Reviews.Content: Affordable luxury in a modern hotel, with style but still comfortable. The lobby is like a disco, the rooms are well equipped and clean. Superb location in Times Square near everything.

Reviews.Title: “Really Sexy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vivaladiva1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents 40 wedding anniversary. I frequent NYC weekly, but they never get to the city so I thought why not have them stay where all the action is. I asked for early check in (I'm a SPG plat starwood member), but room wasn't ready and there were no suite upgrades. Didn't bother us, we went and had an awesome brunch at Blue Fin downstairs. Staff gave us a comp roll away bed that was soooo comfy. Our room was gorgeous and my parents had a direct view of times square. The staff is so great and even brought chocolates to the room for me parents and a card that said "enjoy your special day". It was a busy weekend and most restaurants we wanted to dine in had no tables available. The concergie tried his damnest to get a table at a great jazz place, but no luck. My parents enjoyed our brunch so much they wanted to just go back to Blue Fin for dinner. There was live music and the food was great! My mom went down to the state of the art work out center. My father had a great time renting movies and watching television (free dvd rentals) The lobby is like most W hotels in NYC, CHIC! With beautiful people and hip music. My parents loved it and thats all that counts. I wouldn't stay at this particular W by myself because of location, but I will for sure bring my parents back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: AaronandAshleyR
Reviews.Content: Incredible ... worth EVERY penny! Amazing rooms, views, location, spa...just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LadyCrawford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with three friends for four nights. The hotel room was smaller than expected, but this seems to be the usual for New York. We had the most fantastic view from our window, looking right down a street with a building at the end, which had the time and temperature displayed on it. The staff in the hotel were all excellent, friendly, and always willing to help in any way. The location is fantastic for wherever you want to do really. The bar in the hotel seemed to have a 'buzz' about it too. Very clean. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel right at the centre of everything”
Reviews.Author: jambu583
Reviews.Content: Hip hotel in a great location. If you want relaxing and quiet ... do not stay here and head towards Central Park area. This is a hotel for the young and vibrant. Nice bar, cool staff, rooms are minimalist but comfortable (if a bit on the small side) and the food is good. At times, the fact that the lobby always has a nightclub atmosphere can be tiresome with the lifts always playing some sort of eclectic house music. However, this can also be fun. On the whole, I liked it as it represents the hustle and the bustle of NYC perfectly. If you want relaxation, head to the Bahamas :)

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location but incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: LisboaFiona
Reviews.Content: small room, but comfortable and modern; fantastic location; nice bar, specially friday and saturday nights; on a low floor (12th) you have view to the back of the times square screens (they look better from the other side!); 4 times we were told to have our things packed as we asked to be moved to an upper floor (after all, we were staying 5 nights), 4 times the staff was unable to do it, until we gave up! not very competent staff! you can come in and out of the hotel without ever being noticed; poor fitness room, no swimming pool or sauna; i would say for that price and service there are other options in the area; the "wonderful" room was totally overpromised;

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent service and a very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DPN19
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to NYC - W Tms Sq tops my list of places to stay.All the way from arriving at the hotel and being greeted by the bell staff, to check-in, bar and room service - the team is incredibly friendly, courteous, polite and helpful. I love entering the hotel lobby, it's always buzzin with people at the lounge across check-in, great music and modern styling. The rooms are great, clean and comfortable: set up with gadgets (ipod dock, flat screen tvs) and you can't beat the location. I always request a high floor and the views from every corner of the hotel are amazing. The location makes it convenient to explore and try great restaurants, enjoy broadway shows - the concierge does a great job with recommendations based on my needs. The limited room service experience i've had has been ok - comparable to most other hotels i.e. there's need for an improvement at all these hotels. And the HD channels may not work at all times :-) But they always pay attention to your needs and get it fixed. The Living Room is a great place to hang out in the evening, the staff there is fun, drinks are great and the ambience is very stylish and modern. I highly recommend the W. Happy traveling and njoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: live2travel42
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect! The little touches made it my new favorite hotel. The "insider" stopped to let me know it was raining and made sure I had an umbrella. The concierge making suggestions and then calling to make sure everything went well. I will definitely be returning...just booked a trip for later this month!

Reviews.Title: “the W”
Reviews.Author: brandl68
Reviews.Content: very zen-like set up in the rooms. comfortable and peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: AggerSmell
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the W. We chose it because of it's location in the iconic Times Square. From the moment we checked-in we were made to feel welcome and relaxed. The staff are approachable, friendly and always ready to help.The suite we stayed in was clean, modern and roomy. We went out for breakfast, (there's a very nice deli a few doors away). We had room service 2 evenings, the food was very good (if a little overpriced...but hey, that's all the extra taxes and charges) We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mother & Daughter Trip”
Reviews.Author: KAPF
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the W this past weekend. She turned 13 last week so her present was a trip to NYC, we live in Pittsburgh. Everyone and everything regarding THE hotel was wonderful. I must have commented when I made the reservation that my daughter was turning 13 because several of the staff said Happy Birthday and a wonderful gift bag and card were left in our room. Thanks to everyone for making a 13 year olds first trip to the City a great one.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel right in times square”
Reviews.Author: christine5302
Reviews.Content: my daughter and i stayed at the w hotel for the weekend, we booked a spectacular room which was on the 44th floor. the room was beautiful and had a fantastic view over times square and the east river and wonderful view of the skyline. the only thing we did not like was the glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom , if the light was on you could see the person in the bathroom quite easily but if you just leave the hall light on it was not so obvious. there was a lovely power shower and the wash basin had "waterfall" water which looked lovely. the staff on front desk and the consierge were very helpful and friendly as were the doormen who always said hello to us when entering or leaving the hotel. there is a great deli next door with a great choice of food at reasonable prices starbucks is opposite main entrance and tkts office right outside. we went to see mamma mia but booked it before we went and were glad we did as most people had to wait 4-6 hrs to get tickets at tkts office. fantastic weekend all round.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: roseoliver
Reviews.Content: I loved the location....right in Times Square!!! The service was great, especially the doormen. Excellent and very helpful. The room was quite small but for New York it was better than most. Cleanliness could use some work The dusting and wiping around the bed/nightstand area could use some work (hair and dust). And the toilet was very clean when I checked in. Also, I had a problem with the shower drain. Other than that I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Little_PrincessT
Reviews.Content: What can I say I have been to New York 3 times and this has been the best Hotel I have stayed in by far! Location is perfect and the staff could not be more welcoming or accommodating. From the minute we arrived the Doormen welcomed us and directed us to reception - once at reception the staff again where extremely welcoming and polite. When we arrived in our room what can I say amazing view of both Times Square and the Hudson River! Gorgeous Decor - Hot Pink accessories! Very comfortable and Chic room with plenty of space for the two of us and my clothes!!! (I tend to over pack!) Bar in Hotel was also very Chic and Trendy with very approachable and accommodating staff waiting to direct us to a table and take our orders. From Check in to Check Out I honestly could not fault this hotel or its Staff - I would like to thank them for ensuring we had a wonderful stay! Can't wait to visit next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay....”
Reviews.Author: xRhiannex
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with w hotel, the room was really big and modern, we were on the 26th floor and the view was good. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted by the door men who were polite and they helped us with our luggage. When we got up to our room i was really happy with the size and decor... i saw alot of complaints about the frosty see through bathroom wall but i was impressed by this :) i could not fault this hotel at all and i would most definatly recommend it to everyone.. Obviously alot of people want something for nothing reading through the reviews!!

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Times Square this is a great choice”
Reviews.Author: WWDWD
Reviews.Content: While Times Sqaure isn't our favorite location, the W proved to be a luxurious and hip choice. The rooms were clean and the staff was attentive. We were on the 28th floor and had a nice view. The lobby is great fun and you can get a sense for the energy that New York has.

Reviews.Title: “Paging zoolander”
Reviews.Author: l0st-aga1n
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC on a regular basis and usually stay mid-town east but we got a reasonable price through amex, so we thought we'd give this a try. Big mistake. Doormen are nowhere to be found, either on arrival or departure. There are plenty of guys hanging around the door but they all seem to be car valets. Be prepared to lug your own luggage and find your own cabs. On arriving upstairs in the "living room" you are assaulted by the techno beat of european dance music. All that kept running through my head was an 80's tune "I'm too sexy for my car, too sexy for..." and I kept expecting Zoolander to appear. Free wifi in this area but be prepared to pay $17 in your room. Check in was done by a young man in a rumpled shirt who was single handedly trying to cope with a line of more than 10 people. On the upside, our room was ready. On the downside, when we got up there, we had to manuver luggage around a housekeeping cart which was parked outside our door. It was there throughout our stay, covered with a case, so I assume that's where it's kept. The room itself, a corner king was - comical. The designers were clearly trying so very hard to capture the vibe of luxe modern European hotels, and failed miserably. They got the miniscule size right but everything else was form over function. It's a hotel, not an upscale boutique. One drawer, barely large enough to fit undies and accessories for one person, was the entirety of the storage provided other than a standard sized closet. Fortunatety, a luggage rack is provided so that you can live out of your suitcase. Low built-ins ran the perimeter of the room but all were sealed. Wall decor consisted of a rack of magazines featuring emaciated models. The other art consisted of two large abstracts in puce on grey which we dubbed "amniotic fluids". The walls are a dark grey/brown with hot pink acrylic nightstands. And then, there's the bathroom. It's glass enclosed, grey of course. Even with the frosting, if the light is on inside, it's just TMI. NOT recommended for friends traveling together. If you're with your sig other, hope you're really, really comfortable with each other. Also, no bathrobes and the towels are tiny. Views are great, provided you don't mind making eye contact with the guys in the office building across the street. There are no privacy shades, just a black out shade. So, it's either keep the shades closed (claustrophophic given the size and color of the room) or share. And, no, using the bathroom is not an option with the shades up, unless you do it in the dark. Check out - check your bill for errors, we had them. Also, leave yourself a LOT of time. There is no desk for preferred guests. In fact, the young man manning the desk, again, the only person there, didn't even know what SPG was. You get to wait on line with all the tourists, many of whom had lengthy questions. Billing errors seemed to top the list. The check-out kiosk - not working. TV check out available at almost every other hotel on this planet which provides a tv - not available. I guess this is all about expectations. I expected W level service/amenities. This W did not meet the standards. It was appalling. The location can't be beat for tourists or if you have meetings at Morgan Stanley, across the street. You also can't go wrong with this hotel if you want ammo for the next time you're in a "can you top this" competiton about awful hotels at some cocktail party. However, there are at least a half dozen hotels within a four block radius. Don't buy into the hype for this one.

Reviews.Title: “Loo With A View...”
Reviews.Author: JunkPileQueen
Reviews.Content: This place had an awesome location within spitting distance of the Times Square NYE ball. That was the only good thing about this place to be honest. I shared the room with Mom and Little Brother, and certainly was not enough room for three adults to move. The cot we were given needed to be replaced, as it was obviously well worn. We must be old fuddy duddies, because the design of the room made us extremely uncomfortable in so many ways. It was too futuristic and tried way too hard to be trendy, they forget basic tenets of human comfort and decency. I mean, see-through bathroom "walls" seriously? Totally gross. This is NOT a hotel to stay at if you are travelling with friends or colleagues and must share, or maybe even with a romantic partner or spouse. I mean, who wants to watch someone take a poo, brush their teeth or have a wash in the shower. Given that I was with Mom and Little Bro, we were all disturbed. The bathroom tap was kinda cool and I had fun rinsing my toothbrush. The free soap was nice too. Still, this room was not nice. We had barely any room to move and the bathroom was just awful and really disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to 4 star hotel - filthy room and rude service”
Reviews.Author: Seattrav
Reviews.Content: See picture for proof. Room was very outdated and and many things were not up to the level. Even though website and sticker on the mirror said that rooms were refurbished to bring new Wow, we felt it was the opposite. 1. There was mold in the bathroom in many places, black mold on the ceiling. 2. Air duct above our head was filthy - and I am 6'3'' so it felt very close to my head 3. Shower door was missing plastic flap on the bottom, so there would always be paddle on the floor after the shower. 4. Parts of the plinth were missing and there was small holes with rusty colors. 5. Shower head had pink mold on it. 6. Sink's fixture was missing 7. Rust under the sink were towels were placed, and on the soap bar mat. 8. Air conditioning vent fixture was loose and would make noises from time to time. 9. General large scratches throughout the room, loose wiring and loose back side of the lightening fixture. 10. On the 1st of Jan there was not hot water in the morning - we let the front desk know. 11. There was very loud noise all night long right outside of the room (sounded like large air conditioning). 12. Most of the time staff was friendly and accommodating, however on at least 2 occasions we felt they were very rude, without a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful staff, and great position”
Reviews.Author: kirra99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a wonderful room with our 3 year old twins for 2 nights. Upon arrival the service was with a smile, they made us feel very welcome. The reception staff were incredibly efficient and very friendly and helpful. The position is out of this world, all staff we came into contact with were really helpful (including the doormen who we often asked for advice). The only fault was the bathroom could have done with a good clean. There was mould around the tiles and under and behind the sink needed a good clean. That is my only criticism, and there was no way that would ruin the fabulous experience we had in this hotel. It is a must if you want a groovy hotel smack bang in the middle of the action (and yes it is still quiet, we weren't woken up once).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel room we have stayed in! Amazing views. Awesome interior.”
Reviews.Author: supachicnic
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Fantastic Suite for 8 nights in the W Hotel Times Square in September 2009. The room was recently refurbished and was very cool! Beautiful interior design! The best hotel room we have ever stayed in! Great location for your first time to new York. Close to the art galleries, 5th Avenue shops, Times Square (obviously), Central Park, Broadway and various other attractions. The Fantastic Suite has 2 main rooms- a bedroom, and a separate living room, and 2 bathrooms -one with a shower, toilet, basin, hairdryer etc, and the other bathroom is just a toilet, mirror and basin. The larger bathroom had cool lighting, a nice shower with adjustable head (different settings) and a very cool tap/ basin. Plenty of space to store stuff. There was a chaise lounge in the bedroom. 2 flatscreen tvs- one in the bedroom and one in the living area. There was a lounge suite with a chaise lounge and also a desk in the living area. We had a great view of Times Square from both rooms. We had no noise issues at all from other rooms, and you could not hear noise from Times Square either. The rooms were a good size- bigger than what I expected for New York. The bed was very comfy! The only thing that let down our stay was the service. I had contacted the hotel in advance to let them know that my boyfriend's birthday was during our stay and they said that they could offer him a complimentary piece of cake for his birthday. However the cake was never delivered to the room on his birthday which was disappointing as I thought that it would be a nice surprise. So we went through a long involved process to get it the next day. However we did get 2 drink vouchers left for us in the room before his birthday. The ice machine on our floor wasn't working, and we told reception who said it would be fixed, and it was never fixed in our whole stay. We found the doormen to be very lazy and unhelpful. They just seemed to be standing around talking. They didn't offer to help us get out of the taxi when we arrived at the hotel (our first time to New York), or get our bags, and laughed when I struggled with the taxi door instead of helping. Other days sometimes they would open the doors for us, but frequently they didn't. We got a very good rate on the room - a special suite deal $299 + tax a night which is a great rate even for a normal room rather than a suite. Great for New York prices! I used the phone to make a couple of international calls and was mortified to get a bill for several hundred dollars!!! It was the most expensive phone bill I've had in my life! It almost ruined our stay completely. If I knew that it would be even half that amount I would not have used it! Don't use the phone! The internet is very expensive too- they have a computer room but charge a fortune. They never told us there was free wifi in the lobby area and also there is a mac computer with complimentary internet access in the lobby area too (it's kind of hidden away). This would have helped us enormously if we knew this at the beginning of our stay as we were trying to keep in touch with friends, and needed to get information etc, and wasted a lot of time trying to find cheaper internet access around town. The concierge was very helpful with brochures, advice, maps and shopping discount coupons.

Reviews.Title: “way, way, way overpriced; mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: EricN99
Reviews.Content: There's nothing wrong with this hotel; except you can do better for 1/2 the price; rooms will really disappoint you

Reviews.Title: “Only for leisure travelers, not for business”
Reviews.Author: RobFromAtl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine, but it's noisy, night-time-daylight location makes it less than ideal for people who want to work in the rooms or get a good night's sleep. That said, if you want to stay at a hotel in times square where there is a lot of action, a good bar, decent food, etc., this hotel should suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NorCalGirl11
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend for two nights. We booked the second night half off promo and chose the cheapest room, so we got a Wonderful room for around $200 night. We thought that was a great deal for Times Square. I arrived at the hotel at 8:45am after a red eye from California. I was able to check in, was upgraded, and was in a Spectacular room on the 52nd floor before 9am. Looking out the window we could see a little bit of Times Square to the left, and the Hudson River and what seemed like half of New Jersey to the right. The room was great. We had two double beds, which were so comfortable. I had two issues with the room. First there was only one drawer in the entire room. There was a decent sized closet with about 12 hangers, but no other storage space. It was fine for two nights, but if I was there a week, I would have hated the lack of storage space. Second, the "frosted" glass door and wall to the bathroom. I really thought the previous reviews were over-exaggerating the see through glass, but they were not. I was there with my best friend, so we would just announce, 'I'm going into the bathroom, don't look' before we walked in. One thing to keep in mind, if the lights are on in the room, you can keep the bathroom light off, you'll still have plenty of light, but the glass won't be nearly as transparent. We went to the bar in the lobby, The Living Room, quite a few times in three days. We had wine and mixed drinks, all in the $10-12 range. Which I didn't think was overly expensive, especially for a New York hotel bar. We saw Rock of Ages at the Brooks Atkinson Theater, which is only half a block down 47th. It was really convenient, which was good since it was raining that night. We weren't able to use the Acura Experience. The few times we wanted to use it, the car was already out. But it does run every day from 12 to 8. The staff was fantastic. Everyone at the front desk was friendly and polite. Among other things, the concierge made a dinner reservation for us, and after making the reservation, he printed and signed a letter informing us of our reservation. The bartenders were friendly and attentive, especially Jonathan. The only problem we had with the staff was that it took about 10 minutes to store our luggage after we checked out Monday morning. But when we got back that afternoon, it took less than a minute to pick up our luggage. The doormen were fabulous as well, and welcomed us back every time we walked into the hotel. All in all it was a fantastic trip. I thought the room was a good size for NYC, and loved that it had two double beds. There were a few small chips in the bathroom floor, but for the price I didn't mind. If I had paid $300+ for the room, I may have had an issue with them. One additional thing, the bathroom sink is interesting. It was the cutest sink I have ever seen, but not very practical. I washed my face one night and the water splashed all over the counter. Also, at least in room 5205, we could only get hot or cold water in the sink, not warm. The shower was fine, but every time we washed our hands we had to choose between scalding hot or icy cold water. Oh, and there is a charge for internet in the room, but you can get free wi-fi in the lobby and bar.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful first stay at a W hotel”
Reviews.Author: swimmy4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our anniversary at the W New York in Times Square. I have previously stayed several times at the Westin Times Square, and I love the Starwood brand, but I had never stayed at a W. I was worried that it might be too "hip" for someone like me from a small town, but I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The management went out of their way to make our anniversary a wonderful one. Dealing with valet parking was easy, and the breakfast at the restaurant was one of the best breakfasts I've ever had. The location can't be beat in terms of convenience if you're seeing a show. The rooms were like something from the future. I'd never seen a sink where the water came out like a waterfall! Rooms in New York are small, but nothing too tiny, particularly if you are used to staying in cruise ship cabins and things like that. The W Times Square was a great place for an adult weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Hot & Cold”
Reviews.Author: SuperModo
Reviews.Content: Online special~Buy two nights get one free Non Smoking - "Cool Corner Room" - Requested a high floor * Catch: Prepay...No refunds 1) Check - In Flight delayed resulting in a late arrival at the hotel (1:30a.m.) Hotel advises they are sold out of rooms on high floors, but assure us one will be available the following night We get to our room and find it is a Smoking "Wonderful Room" We contact the front desk and they tell us they are sold out Slightly problematic when you have prepaid for a room that is double the price of the accomodations you are being placed in The Mgr on duty got involved and said there was nothing on our reservation associated with a Cool Corner Room, just their basic room We had to produce our confirmation email and proof of payment Upon review they took care of the situation and promised an upgrade the following night The following night we were moved to a high floor Cool Corner Room, however that is what we had paid for...so there was no upgrade involved, we were just moved to the room we reserved *** The Cool Corner Rooms & High Floors are a MUST *** The view was stunning!!! 2) Room Service Outrageous Prices, but Delicious Food 3) Hotel Bar $20 dollar Festive Concoctions, but very Tasty 4) Doormen/Valet Outstanding Very accomodating and helpful Use the Hotel's Acura if available...very convenient and comfortable ride 5) Check out Flight delayed Accomodated a late check out Smooth process

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not for families”
Reviews.Author: Srg_Brazil
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is unbeatable, but the rooms are very small, not to families. Rooms are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Useless service, really good location.”
Reviews.Author: SparklyFlyingUnicorn
Reviews.Content: The location, right in Times Square, was great. Broadway shows, shopping, and general sights were right outside. The service, on the other hand, was sad. We stayed in a Fantastic Suite, which was quite nice, with two TVs, two bathrooms, and a nice view. The service, on the other hand, seemed to be made up primarily of friendly but slow college kids. One the second night, we called down to ask for some hypoallergenic pillows, as one of us is allergic to down feathers, and a duvet for the sofa bed. We were told by the Whatever, Whenever service that this was no problem. Nothing came. The next night, we called down again and were put on hold by Jared, who was very friendly but seemed to forget us, as we were on hold for 30 minutes before giving up. Trying again an hour later, Jared offered to send some up right away. A few minutes later, the phone rang again. It was Jared. He called back by accident. OK Jared. Eventually, a bag ambassador, or something to that effect, handed over two more down pillows and no duvet. However, as he was busy texting, we decided to call again, since he didn't seem to know what was going on. The man came back up the next night and crossed the living room into the bedroom to hold up the pillows and insist that they were in fact, hypoallergenic, going to far as to insist we feel the difference. So never mind. Down pillows it is. Asking for taxis, too, is pointless. The door ambassador, as they are called, stands around looking friendly. Ask for a taxi and he will stand on the side of the street looking perplexed. One of us points out a free taxi. Another says, no, it's off-duty. He turns, and says rather snootily, "That's because it's off duty". Thanks. Eventually, we sneak off to hail our own taxi, and he returns to the warm foyer. As there are revolving doors, and he does not call taxis, his primary duty seems to be smiling as we enter the hotel. You should also be aware that staff does no help with bags. Checking in, we bring our own bags up to the room, and checking out, we bring them down to the taxi. The location is great, it's worth mentioning that the service at the hotel's restaurant Blue Fin, was very competent, and the rooms are nice. Just don't expect much from the easily confused staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stijnec
Reviews.Content: Spend four nights at this great hotel, located in the middle of times square. The actual entrance if on 47th street, just off Broadway. The entree looks very nice with the waterfall, and from there you take the elevater to the "living room" on the 7th floor, where you have free wifi. The hotel is on walking distance to all midtown attractions, we only took the subway for a trip to lower Manhattan. Had few interaction with staff, be they all appeared very friendly and welcoming. Would certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and good views”
Reviews.Author: joeyboy79
Reviews.Content: Stay here on business, quiet expensive rate but the room is quite big for NYC and large bathroom also. Early checkin granted which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: sun_worshiper14
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i our in our 20's, visiting New York to see the sights and shop! It was our first trip to New York so we were unsure where the best place to stay would be to ensure we were in close vicinity to all the attractions and shopping!! This hotel turned out to be perfect, every thing was in walking distance - empire state, broadway shows, central park, shopping etc. (so great for tourists) The hotel its self was trendy yet welcoming. The room was small however comfy- with a brilliant bed! (the bathroom walls are glass so you can see everything - might not be the best hotel for new couples etc) The hotel does have a restaurant which we heard was very good, we did not get the time to try it out as there are so many restaurants surrounding the hotel. I would recommend this hotel 100% if you are visiting New York for the first time and want to be close to everything....it was a great base

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, location, etc.....”
Reviews.Author: ncmattnc
Reviews.Content: We took our girls, ages 9 and 6, to New York City as a Christmas gift. We arrived the day after Christmas and stayed for two nights. We had no problems and were well pleased with everything about this hotel. I have read in reviews here that staff were not friendly. We never experienced this. Staff wishes us a good day as we left the hotel and welcomed us back. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. We had an excellent view of the city from room 3908. The location was awesome. We were steps away from everything we wanted to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at The W Times Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: courtneyandolive
Reviews.Content: I couldn't be happier about our recent stay at the W Times Square Dec 17-21. Our stay was perfect from the minute we walked into the beautiful lobby. We were greeted right away...check in was a breeze and our room was ready earlier than expected..an added bonus. Throughout our stay, the W staff were super quick to accomidate any request we had. The hotel itself is gorgeous, trendy yet cozy, and located in the heart of Times Square. I cannot stay enough positive things about The W and look forward to a future visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price - ideal location”
Reviews.Author: cheddywigginton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the W Times Square for 4 nights from Dec 3 - 6, checked out on the 7th. From the moment we arrived the staff was very accomodating. The location (if you want to be in Times Square) couldn't be much better. We had a corner room on the front part of the hotel. View was great. I was surprised by the lack of noise we heard in our room - being on Times Square I expected more, but didn't notice it at all. Only compliants - water flow in the shower was a bit weak and not much room to store you luggage.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sel7Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of Thanksgiving, and had a great time! I was a bit worried after some of the previous reviews I had read, but was pleased with the hotel. The reception was really nice, and always had flowers and candles everywhere. We found all the staff to be really helpful.
