The room was bigger than I expected, and I loved the bed, it was so comfortable! It was modern and had a huge plasma TV. The one thing I would say was the door and one wall of the bathroom was kinda see through and when the light in the bathroom was on you see the person in there! This didn't bother us too much, but if you're going with friends this could be a bit embarrassing! We didn't hear too much street noise, except one night but that was because they were setting up the seating for the Parade the next day which went past our hotel. I can imagine you can hear street noise from most places you stay and being in the city its what I would have expected. Overall we were really pleased, you don't spend too much time in the hotel as you're out and about, but to come back at night and lounge around it was great!

Reviews.Title: “The W is a the best Hotel we have ever stayed at in New York”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell2112
Reviews.Content: I travelled to New York at the end of Nov 2009 for my Sister's 21st.. 12 of us altogether.. The Hotel upgraded us as soon as they heard our stay was for a special occasion. Well what can i say, we were upgraded to a Suite, it was out of this world. Everyone from the doormen to the Porters to all the Staff who we met durning are stay were fantastic, so helpful, and also just want to thank Rachel who organised everything before we travelled, she is such a credit to this Hotel.. It is definitely by far the BEST Hotel we have ever stayed in, in New York... We all agreed when we go back, we wouldn't stay anywhere else but the W..

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: cassiope
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and very trendy. It is in the middle of Time Square so it was great for jet lagged kids to have some fun at 11pm local time. The rooms are very nice with nice views. Only small thing you may need to know is that there are no baths, just showers (we were in one of the suites with two bathrooms but both had showers), so after a long flight this may be a consideration. Very nice hotel with great location nonetheless, we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Should Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: Rappongi27
Reviews.Content: This hotel had potential that it failed to live up to. We stayed over Thanksgiving 2009 and had mixed views about the hotel. On the positive side, it has a great location. If only they hadn't moved the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade route (certainly not the W's fault) we would have been looking right out B'way at it from our room. Even so, a very very short walk to the parade so that was fine. The decor and vibe is of course designed to be "hip." That is the W's thing. But I think some of the staff are a bit too impressed with just how hip and cool they are, and have lost all warmth and caring. What on earth is the point of having 3 folks at the front door if 3/4 of the time they ignore you when you come and go? In most hotels where there is a doorman, someone opens the door and greets you or welcomes you back. Here that was only done occasionally. The room was designed to be nice; with a "living room" that had a pull out bed and a very nice bedroom area. The bed was among the most comfortable I've been in. But, what first class hotel actually has a door missing between the two rooms? And, when I questioned it, nothing happened for 2 days. Then, when someone called to find out if we were satisfied with the service, they tried to explain the lack of a door (there are two doorways to the bedroom area; one door was there, one was not), they tried to explain that as on purpose and a part of the remodeling program. Please people: the hinges were still there.. there was supposed to be a door there, and my wife and I would have prefered the privacy that imparted as the rest of our family was in the outer room. I did not mention to them that a plate or cover was also missing in the shower, but you'd think they would find that by themselves. Also in the poor service department, we had asked for an additional roll-away bed. It never showed up; but our daughter decided the couch was ok so we let that pass. The 2 TVs in the room were both nice; the one in the living room area had a blue line that showed up intermittently; they were unable to fix that, apparently. The fixture in the baths were pretty cool; the room had 1-1/2 baths, I think they really ought to line up the water connections the same way so that hot /cold is in the same direction for both faucets; it wasn't a problem for us, but someday could lead someone to get a scalding if they think the water temp goes the other way because of the other sink's connections. I usually grade hotels not just on is it wonderful, but based on the value and what it purports to be: a fabulous Motel 6 may have no amenities, but if its clean, well located, and well maintained etc. its going to get a very high grade. Here, this is a hotel that purports to be first class and charges as if it were. I would go to the Sofitel rather than here on a return trip, as this just wasn't in the class that it purports to be. Nothing dreadful, but enough not really right that it should have been better.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in the Centre of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Ozziegirl007
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel it was different but in a good way! The entrance is small but creates a calming and welcoming effect with water cascading down the walls. You take the lift to reception on the 7th floor and the mood is definitely very relaxed. The interior is very modern and with dimmed lighting creates an ultra cool chilled atmosphere. Check in was quick and friendly and we soon found ourselves in our "Wonderful Room" which proved to have the best bed I have ever slept in!!! We ate at the hotel's restaurant Blue Fin on one occasion and found the food and general ambience to be excellent, although the service was a bit on the slow side. On the whole this was an excellent 4 star hotel in a prime location with friendly staff and a great atmosphere. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ambers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for 4 nights and had a great time!! We had a "wonderful king" on the 21st floor which was very trendy and pretty spacious with an amazing comfy bed!!!!! Location is fantastic Its bang in the middle of Times Square!!! The staff were really helpful and friendly too!!

Reviews.Title: “My family and I had such a great stay at this trendy hotel--we felt like celebrities!”
Reviews.Author: SarahJLV
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the W Times Square in July. The location is perfect--right in the hustle and bustle of Times Sq but located on a fairly quiet street near cute restaurants and delis. The doormen are so friendly! We loved walking through the waterfall-adorned ground entrance. Once you enter the lobby, you feel like you're in a trendy club, but it's definitely not pretentious. All the staff were very nice and accommodating. Whenever we had a request, they responded right away. The rooms were decently sized (this is New York City), and quite chic. The views were amazing. We had a delicious dinner in Blue Fin (the restaurant located downstairs). MAKE SURE you save room for the warm cookie plate! They're the best (so is the seafood). The concierge were also very knowledgable and patient with our lack of NYC knowledge and we could have spent loads of money in the W store. Finally, you can't beat the Bliss bath products and the glass-enclosed showers!

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous hip hotel right in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: cyrillesleyfabio
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and can't speak highly enough of teh place. Got a great deal via Hotwire (<$200) which really helped. That said, the entrance hall under a glass ceiling with water tumbling onto it was very cool, the lobby on the 7th floor was very hip, with a great bar (expensive, but very generous pours), free wifi, a great shop and heaps of attentive and very helpful staff. We stayed on the 24th floor, and the room was great - only possible downside was that you could hear the bustle of the street and honking horns below, but that is one of the joys of Times Sq! Times square had a little too much bustle for me and next time I would probably look to stay further south, perhaps in the meat market, but in truth this was one of the best hotels I have stayed in for the money and location - thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Best Place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: mainpa
Reviews.Content: This is the coolest, hippest hotel I've ever stayed at. Wonderful bars and restaurant -- superb cocktails and seafood. The lobby is upstairs --you access it from elevators that open onto the street. The staff is great -- very friendly and courteous. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Great amenities -- loved the TVs --and the view. I spent Christmas there last year -- and am going to New York again this Christmas but must spend time with relatives. Wish I could go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sassyVirginia
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter to NYC for her 13th birthday. She had never been to NYC. We had a WONDERFUL experience. This hotel is luxury. My daughter felt like a "movie star". The staff here is unbelieveably helpful and friendly. They remembered that it was my daughter's birthday trip and from check-in things were amazing. Special presents in the room for my daugher, a great view of the city, birthday cake and cards!! They answer every question promptly and professionally. I cannot say enough about how wonderful our experience was and how great the staff was. Hotel is quiet and a GREAT location. Walked to WIcked, basically walked everywhere!! Felt extremely safe here too.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAF84
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the W Hotel Times Square. I came in on a Friday and left on Saturday. Positives: -Cool/Trendy Atmosphere -Fairly quick check in -W Bar is nice, good place to hang out for a bit -Rooms are nice (had a king size bed on the 14th floor) -Awesome soft super comfortable bed -Shower head provides the most delicious shower I've ever taken (I really don't know why this shower stood out compared to the many different hotel showers I've had) Much more room than the Hudson hotel (my Sis and her bf stayed there and had that as a big complaing) -The concierge service was exceptional in providing information -In addition concierge helped me out with tying my tux tie. -By far my favorite thing is that everyone who answered the phone when you called from your room or who called to your room from the staff greeted you as an individual. It did not feel like you were just another guest, it actually felt personalized. At the end of the day, once you get up to high end hotels, it's things like these that make a difference ("Sorry to wake you from your dreams Mr. _____, but it's time to wake up, would you like me to call you again in a few minutes to make sure you're awake? - wake up call). Negatives - Ipod dock does not charge iphone/ipod just plays music (forgot my charger so it's really my fault) -My room faced Times Square but was blocked by billboards. -

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosRaurell
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying at the W before I actually got there. My experience differed, however, from that of those who give it favorable reviews. The hotel entry area and 8th floor lobby are very sleek and trendy but the rest of the hotel -- most notably our guestroom -- was very dark and needed some updating. The paint on the ceiling in the bathroom was peeling away, the furniture looked extremely worn and I found the art and color scheme in the room a little depressing. The room was cramped and offered no good storage space for our clothes and other articles. That resulted in a lot of clutter for the length of our stay. The TV kept switching on its own from whatever we were watching to the annoying hotel channel on which pay per view movies are advertised. I was in NYC for the marathon and had looked forward to soaking in a bath after the race. Unfortunately, the room offered only a shower. Room service was too overpriced (e.g., about $50.00 for a small breakfast, most of which was concealed in fine print delivery fees, service charges and tax) to order anything and the lobby bar was pretty much the same (we paid $33 for two simple drinks). At $75 bucks for our four night stay, we elected not to spring for internet service. At $400+ a night, I think the W could provide WiFi for free. The best part of the W was the bed. It was cozy and comfortable, but that's pretty much it. In a nutshell, I think the W times Square is way overrated. For the money (about $1700 for four nights), we deserved better than what the W delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fasta
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and really couldn't fault the hotel, staff or rooms. We had a corner room on the 56th floor and the views over Times Square and the Hudson River were amazing day and night. We dined at the Blue Fin restaurant for breakfast each day and it was really good, better than any of the others nearby by a mile. We also had dinner one evening upstairs and it was also very good. The location just cannot be beaten, walking across the road to the theatre was so good and all the tourist bus etc stop very close too, as well as the subway stations and taxis. We will definitely stay here again we we next visit New York.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality hotel right on Times Square”
Reviews.Author: SandgrounderSydney
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel if you want to be close to the action of Times Square but surrounded by the quality, peaceful luxury of a five star hideaway. Nothing was too much trouble for the concierge from locating hard to find seasoning at a local deli to sourcing a particular vodka a local bottle shop. Beds are huge and very comfortable and the ipod docking station is a great touch.

Reviews.Title: “Whenever, Whatever as long as you have lotsa WDollars:)”
Reviews.Author: AlohaHana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Wonderful suite and it was wonderful and sweet. The hotel is trendy. Loved the decor. Comfy beds. The suite had a separate living room big enough to have 10 of your friends hang out comfortably. The staff was eager to help and not a bit stuffy or snooty. This hotel has a hoping bar. They also have an Acura MDX for guests to use. They tell you that it's is offered to guests in a first come first serve basis. We found out that it was first come first serve to the highest bidder FIRST. They do nickle and dime you in this hotel, but that is to be expected in hotels in NYC much less in the Time Square. It's unfair to rate this hotel poorly on the basis of that. When in NYC, expect to spend, spend spend. Another example is that my husband and I wanted to have our own fridge for water and soda, they charged us $50.00 for the baby fridge. I loved my stay here. But if you decide to stay at the W in Time Square, prepare to part with a lot of your W$$$.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: The4fortysomethings
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel. NO complaints at all. We had a fabulous room on the 51st floor. 4 of us staying in one room. We got extra towels and toiletries within 5 minutes of a telephone call to reception. We also got a wine cooler and extra glasses within 5 minutes of checking in. The two concierges who we dealt with were very good and the restaurants were unbeatable. Try Benjamins steakhouse for a great steak and great service. All door staff were extra helpful and even let us use the hotel car & driver to take us to a concert. All in a all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, decor. Poor service”
Reviews.Author: AC182
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of its great location and funky, cool decor. It was my girlfriends first time in New York so I wanted it to be special. Firstly this is a really cool hotel and the lobby area and overall ambience is fantastic. Unfortunately there were a few issues that left us having a less than fantastic experience. I paid extra to be upgraded to a "cool corner" room expecting to have 2 windows, I had also specifically asked for a view of Times Square which I was told by reception at check in I had. Instead we had a "corner" room on a lower floor and hence had 1 window and a view away from Times Square, this left us wondering what we were paying the extra money for? On complaining to reception we were told we couldn’t be moved for a day and since we were only there for the weekend we thought it wasn’t worth the hassle of moving. We were offered a bottle of wine to appease our pain which were happy to accept since we were heading out for dinner that evening and thought it would be nice to have a couple of glasses in our room. Unfortunately after 24hrs (yes hours) the wine had not arrived. On contacting reception I was told somebody would contact in room dining personally to ensure the wine was sent up within 30minutes... 2 hours later still no wine. I contacted in room dining and they knew nothing of the request so obviously once again reception had forgotten about our order. By this time I was feeling very angry, got changed and physically went down to reception to complain, they seemed pretty disinterested with the issue. Fortunately a girl named Kelly in in-room dining sent a bottle up + some extra's without even knowing what the original problem was. On the whole we loved the hotel and location, would stay here again but would make sure we asked for specific details about our room and location.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed!”
Reviews.Author: Losttouchwithreality
Reviews.Content: Lobby smelt like an indoor pool Chewing gum on wash basin in room Postage stamp sized towels Only 1 bathrobe No room service between 1 & 5pm Not cheap, but with so many great hotels in NYC why go here

Reviews.Title: “Glad I went back to the W Times Square!”
Reviews.Author: Ndfeed
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the W Times Square (6/10 - 10/10). I went back just for the view and the great beds, so I was hoping to be lucky again and get a corner room. However no corner rooms were available. I was first put in a room on the 30th floor with basically no interesting view, just the hotel across the street. I did put a request for a room change in, and the staff was most helpful and friendly to try and find a solution. I was then, after the 1st night, moved to the 48th floor, not in a corner room but nevertheless a room with a great view. So: staff = friendly and helpful Rooms: newly redecorated. I love the style, I'm a fan. I must say that in my first room (30th) there were some minor issues, the rooms look new but not 'finished', and my towel had a small hole in it, as did the sheets, nothing major for sure, and I wouldn't complain about it. But it's just not something I'd expect from a 4-star hotel. The room on the 48th floor was impeccable though. Location: perfect!!!! Concierge/doormen: very helpful and not 'snobby' at all :-) Safety: as a female travelling solo, no issues, safe location! I truly enjoyed my stay and will go back for a fourth time if I get the chance! Thank you guys, N, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “W TIMES SQUARE”
Reviews.Author: VHPMcQ
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel with "Bliss"ful bathrooms!!!! glamourus bar but shame about some of the views. Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place To Spot Tourists Who Want To Be Fashionistas”
Reviews.Author: Pete312
Reviews.Content: I know what I'm getting when I stay at a W hotel - - high design, very busy lounge/lobby, a good-looking client base and service that is more attractive than helpful - so the Times Square W meets my expectations. Don't get me wrong - I like this hotel, but maybe in the way I like Vegas. I can do it for 2-3 nights then I'm worn out. The rooms are small but decorated to feel much bigger. The baths are perfectly fine - but again - very small. Room service is to be avoided and the staff is friendly and pretty...just not that "with-it". The bar becomes a scene at night and I must say the bartenders are actually quite good. If your in NY on business and need to stay in Times Square you should try the Marriott Marquis or the Westin Times Square. If you are simply in town for a big city weekend...the W Times Square will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and classy”
Reviews.Author: acc7
Reviews.Content: def a very pretty and livable hotel; state of the art rooms; nice lobby; great location; lots of food nearby; public transportation and taxis accessible. we were here for our friends 40th birthday, had a wonderful time; no one bothers you unless you want to be bothered. i would highly recommend you staying here for leisure and business. very modern and up to date; very sheek

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: munnifar
Reviews.Content: Mu wife and I have the last years in october gone to NY to shop and have some time without our two lovely kids. This year we booked W at Times Square. We booked a "Fantastic Suite" @ 650 USD a night. The suite was actually a living room and a "sleeping room". It was fitted with a wonderfull bath room with WC and as well as separate WC room connect to the ling room. This was a very good room. The hotel is ideally situated ! As a european I am used to have a shaver outlet in the bathroom - However no european plug were here - I asked for one plug and got one for the price of USD 10,-. This is a high price for a service that you would consider included. Every morning a complimentary newspaper were delivered ! However internet access costs USD 16,95 each 24H. I think the hotel better save the paper and have free internet - Which becomes more and more common. The internet speed were slow 400K/400K But the hotel is wonderful and so is the staff !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful everything..”
Reviews.Author: flu209
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend with my wife, it was the first time since our son was born 4 years ago that we got to spend a weekend away on our own. In my wife's own words, "You hit it out of the park." From check in to check out, the staff was unbelievable and anytime we needed anything the staff was at our door within seconds. As far as the room is concerned, I agree with the other reviewers that it's more suited to romantic partners than family. We stayed in a spectacular room on the 54th floor overlooking Times Square. You could see Central Park in the distance and the Hudson off to the West. The room was very clean, no issues at all there, very sexy, the frosted walls surrounding the bathroom were very cool (and a big reason why it's not such a great place for families) and there was an immense smoky mirror on the wall above the headboard. Lighting was also very cool and so was the furniture. The waterfall sink in the bath was really neat (hard to pour water in the iron but the rain shower has a stream setting), and the shower was more than roomy enough for two with cool blue lighting. When we entered our room they had covered the bed and entrance with rose petals (as per my request), but they had forgotten the 6 chocolate strawberries I had requested. When I called down not only did they have them up in 10 minutes, but they removed the charges for both the petals and the strawberries from my account. When we noticed there was only one bathrobe they had someone up in 5 minutes with another one. My wife needed a dress pressed prior to us heading out to 21 for dinner, and even though she was past the deadline for having a garment pressed and returned same day, they whisked it away and it was waiting for us in the closet when we got back from a few hours of strolling around CP. The Bar downstairs is also very neat, and hopping at night, wish we would have gone there instead of wasting $40 on two drinks at Gilt. The room service was DELISH. I cannot recommend this place enough, yeah, it's in Times Square, but it's centrally located and you can walk to most places. My only complaint is that they need to invest in some new shades..I like it when I can kill the amount of light that comes into my room, and although it wasn't horrible, I've stayed at Hamptons that have better shades than the W. Great hotel, very sexy, wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, trendy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ngburton
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed 3 nights at the W Times Square in August. The hotel location is great and the views are amazing. We are old for this hotel (50 somethings) but really enjoyed the vibe of the hotel-made us feel young again! Service was great and the rooms were on the small side small but comfortable and ultra modern. This is the second W hotel that we have stayed in (the other one was in Scottsdale) and we would definitely stay in another one again.

Reviews.Title: “The location was in the center of excitement and non-stop people watching!”
Reviews.Author: SJCTravel
Reviews.Content: We loved the fact that the hotel was centrally located and it was a perfectly quick and short walk to the Good Morning America studio, which was perfect for us since we had tickets to the show during our stay. We were upgraded to a slightly larger room upon our arrival, due to our anniversary celebration, which was a nice touch. The hotel's amenities were average, but nice. The bar beverages were a tad over-priced, but what isn't in that area? We took full advantage of the hotel's concierge staff, as we had lots of questions and places to go. The staff was very knowledgeable and not always friendly, but helpful. We liked the fact that they issued umbrellas to their guest upon exiting the hotel during rainy days. We ate in the hotel restaurant a few times for breakfast and lunch. We were particularly impressed, especially since I became ill after eating a late nite dinner most likely due to cross contamination. Overall the stay was pleasant, but the hotel is a bit over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly
Reviews.Content: Spent five days in NYC over 4th of July weekend. My sons, ages 5 and 9 were super impressed with tthe W, as were the grown-ups. Absolutely no complaints! Staff was wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, excellent views, but no free Internet?”
Reviews.Author: bdfan
Reviews.Content: Funky lobby with interesting lighting. Pleasant staff. Good-sized room (for NYC) with outstanding views, large windows and a comfortable bed. Thin walls weren't exactly soundproof however. Exercise room could use a few more machines too. And what's up with paying $450/night and not having free Internet access (either wired or WiFi) ? Hmph.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time at the W hotel Times Square!!”
Reviews.Author: Torbinho
Reviews.Content: Located on the perfect spot, around the corner of Times Square, the W hotel at is just magnificent. We had a wonderful room (I believe one class higher than a standard room) and that was great! Young and enthousiastic people are running the place. It made our trip to New York even more unforgettable. Thé perfect place to stay in New York if you consider yourself hip and trendy, as the hotel is exactly that! Thanks W New York for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful service but v small room”
Reviews.Author: shinty911
Reviews.Content: very helpful reception staff greeted us on arrival. The decor is modern, minimalist, very tasteful and relaxing. The location is fantastic on Times Sq as advertised. We stayed in a quad room but all rooms are the same size apart from suites so it was cramped. The rooms are supplied with excellent toiletries. All in all I'd stay there again but we'd go for 2 rooms which would make it pricy, and perhaps we'd get better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but worth it. Everything attended to!”
Reviews.Author: Emmyx2
Reviews.Content: Fanstastic may be overused, but it is the best way to describe the W Hotel Times Square. Everything was attended to. Doormen at the street were friendly and helpful. Check-in was smooth. Given late check-out, upgraded to suite and treated like royalty - for no good reason other than I was a guest. Views are amazing, location outstanding for mid-town. If this is your first time in NYC, indulge and spend a few more dollars to make a lifetime memory!

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: primarycolors4u
Reviews.Content: Our Trip started from Buffalo NY as we are from Hamilton, ON it is cheaper and faster to fly from Buffalo....Great Flight from Jet BLUE only took an hour each way....landed at JFK 15 mins got our luggage and off to the private town car to WNewYork Times Square. We arrived at approx noon our room wasnt ready not a big deal took our cell # and stored out luggage and off to enjoy our adventure. As this was an Anniversary present from me to my Husband....I had asked for a bottle of sparkling wine (and the hotel gave us chocolate covered strawberries for free) in our room for when we arrived.....Jason you are terrific the Whatever/Whenever service The Hotel called us then we checked in was smooth. I really dont understand the neg reviews....I wasnt expecting an overly spacious room as I have read about how small rooms are in NYC but our room was nice and spacious. The elevators ran smoothly not an issue of waiting to get to our rooms. I like the idea of using the room card in the elevators as a security measure as the Lobby bar....(the Livingroom ) is open to the general public. Just everything from the cascading waterfall as you come into the hotel the elevators to the 7th floor (lobby) was fantastic....as our first time in NYC we had a FABULOUS time!!! The Staff went out of their way to be of help with any concern or question that we may have had.....so a BIG thankyou to all the staff from the Doormen to the bellhops to the front desk to our Maid. We will most definately be staying here again when we return to NYC and we WILL return too much to see and do when we only had 4 days in the Big Apple!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: dandylion77
Reviews.Content: Fab hotel in the heart of times square. the views of the square from the rooms are amazing (as long as you don't suffer from vertigo!). Bliss products in the bathroom & really comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and beautiful hotel in dynamic Times Square!"”
Reviews.Author: GO35jip
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Times Square is a fantastic hotel beginning with the striking cascading waterfall entranceway to the incredibly comfortable and wonderfully decorated yet functional rooms. Though set in the heart of Times Square where options for food and drink are plenty, the W Hotel offers the fantastic Living Room Bar and Blue Fin restaurant. The service and staff at the hotel are top notch. They are knowledgeable and truly aspire to create the best Whatever/Whenever service for those staying in the hotel. If you are looking for a hip hotel with staff prepared to cater to your needs all set in a prime Manhattan location, then this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “The W Times Square is what a W should be”
Reviews.Author: kismet71
Reviews.Content: Business travelers - even those very loyal to Starwood - know that W's can be a mixed experience. Some of the original W's are getting a little long in the tooth, and others mix four parts of attitude to one part of services and making a comfortable, welcoming experience a challenge rather then the norm. At the W Times Square, the "attitude" part is left out and the "service" part is left in. From the front door to the top floor, I consistently find a welcoming attitude and, when the occasion calls for it, quick help with a question or request. The views are great fun, as is Blue Fin for any meal - but make a reservation as this is a popular place (sometimes even for breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Trendy...”
Reviews.Author: travelindb
Reviews.Content: The W is located in Time Square so the location is excellent. When we entered the "Living Room", there was a wait to check in. There was never quite enough people at the front desk. (Same at check out.) The Living Room itself was very trendy and cool with the fresh flowers and contemporary/loft feel. We enjoyed drinks a few times in the bar. They are expensive and the waitresses were a bit snotty, but that is what you expect in NYC. The room itself was nice. The room wasn't dirty, but not as clean as I would expect i.e. a bit of dirt build-up in the corners. We had two free nights so the value for us was excellent. If I had to pay full price, I would have been a bit disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in the Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: showbizandi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Times Square over the past 5 years and 2 years ago I discovered W Times Square. From check-in to check-out my experiences have been nothing but good and on the ONE occasion I had to complain my issue was dealt with speedily and correctly. The staff are your typical new Yorkers and that's normally bad BUT they all have the 'W' way, Wonderful, Warm and Welcoming. The rooms are all well appointed and come with Bliss bathroom products, so no need to bring your own. There's a gym, a spa, an Apple mac in reception and a small shop. It's a really nice hotel in a great location, I've recommended it to 4 people (families too) and have never had any complaints, so give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to New York. Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hitcher13
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the complaints about this hotel. My wife and I enjoyed our stay in this hotel. Very good. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. We were in New York to celebrate my wifes 40th birthday. It was a huge success!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: jillmill38
Reviews.Content: This upscale hotel was a refreshing getaway from the crowds of Times Square. The waterfall effect as you enter the property was a unique experience.As you entered the hotel, the hustle and bustle of the city was left behind. The staff was very courteous, friendly and fun. The view from my room was spectacular...full length glass on two sides! The room decor is contemporary yet comfortable. Loved the Bliss toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel, Awful Service, Dirty & Over Priced - Worst Hotel We've Ever Stayed in”
Reviews.Author: HoneymoonTraveller9
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst hotel we've ever stayed in and we've stayed in some terrible ones before. We stayed there for 4 nights at the end of our honeymoon and it was a disaster from start to finish. We had booked a "Spectacular Room" but I assure you that it was anything but spectacular. The toilet had not been cleaned properly and every surface had dust and grime from the previous guests. They agreed to move us to a different room. As with the previous room the new room wasn't very clean. All the fixtures and fittings were also badly finished, and rather than feling classy and contemporary, the room felt very flatpack. There were sharp corners everywhere, wires and leads coming out of everything and gimmicky lamps that were difficult to turn on and off and did not light the room sufficiently. The hotel is marketed as being trendy and cool. It fails miserably in this respect. On arrival we were told that as it was our honeymoon, they would like to give us a bottle of champagne on the house much to our delight. However, it did not arrive. We enquired when the complimentary champagne would arrive but it still did not come. At this stage it became a matter of principle and after 6 embarrassing attempts over the 4 days we finally received a $5 bottle of sparkling wine when we returned to our room late on our last night there. A cheap bottle of sparkling wine in a hotel that charged us $24 for 2 vodkas and diet coke was a bit cheap. The staff were incompetent, ranging from the check in clerk to the door staff to the bar staff. The concierge was to his credit, at least appeared to be helpful despite the fact that he was unable to have a bottle of champagne delivered from the bar to our room in under 4 days. The straw to break the camels back came on departure when our luggage was being taken into storage for a few hours before we departed for the airport. Our ruck sacks and suitcases were simply left unattended in the lobby for 3 hours and not taken into storage as promised. Anybody could have taken all of our belongings. The hotel was staffed with people more concerned with acting cool and making you feel like you should be serving them than the other way around. It felt like the hotel was run by summer students rather than highly trained staff. In all, this was an absolutely terrible experience that I would not wish on any other human being on their holidays.

Reviews.Title: “this is the most welcoming hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: stan1979
Reviews.Content: Over the course of the last 20 years, I have stayed in hundreds of hotels, but this is by far the most fantastic staff in any hotel I have visited anywhere (including some of the fanciest in the world). If you ask for it, they will try to accommodate you in any way they can. They are gracious, thoughtful and industrious. While I am a Platinum member of the Starwood Hotels and get particularly great treatment, I have never known any other hotel that bakes me chocolate chip cookies on arrival, makes sure I have the right number of pillows, hangers, electric outlets, water and lightning (their rooms can normally be a little too dark for me). The rooms are always comfortable (I often get upgraded to a suite if available): great beds and pillows, nice Bliss products and all the electronic amenities you need (like ipod decks, dvd players and good wireless and wired connections). While Times Square might not be everyone's first choice of location, it is easy to get anywhere in NY quickly and is certainly the most convenient place for theater, many restaurants, Central Park, a variety of museums and all public transportation. The restaurant downstairs (Blue Fin) is very good and the bar scene on the Lobby Floor is very lively. While the Four Seasons might be somewhat fancier, and the Ganesvoort a little trendier, the W Times Square will ensure you have a reliably great experience with all the luxury and hipness you need.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 Diamond Hotel but met my basic needs”
Reviews.Author: govgilly
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at a W hotel. I love the look of the place and the staff seemed ok. I have heard the W was the new best luxuary hotel, but it did not win me over. I understand now that the W brand is considered an upscale hotel and is not luxuary. It just seemed to be missing the little things. I guess I am spoiled. No turndown service and it just felt like it was way understaffed. Not a bad hotel just not a top notch place. I don't think I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved to modern design. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: mommadr
Reviews.Content: Fun place to stay...close to Broadway theaters and Restaurant Row. Right beside TKTS sales in Times Sq. Rooms were small but more interesting than traditional decor. Concierge was a great help.

Reviews.Title: “FANTABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: frequent_fam_travel
Reviews.Content: Loved the W!!! Won't stay anywhere else in NYC if traveling for pleasure. TKTS access is the best and makes the trip. We had an amazing room (although small be warned) on the 54th floor overlooking Times Square....what could be bad? The decor is amazing yet not overdone or cheesy. The hotel felt intimate because the staff is amazing and super helpful and upbeat even though it is a huge property and very big city. Can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, the new room design is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: DaniGirl99
Reviews.Content: I stay at Starwood hotels often, and have stayed at the W in Times Square often for business and pleasure. I was there for 9 days, and I have to say the service was incredible! The staff was so friendly and personable. The new room decor is very nice and very functional! I loved the little chaise lounge next to the corner window overlooking Times Square. The bed was so comfortable! I loved everything about the upgrades. I highly reccomend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, great service, loved the room.”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: Ask for room 4812. It's a corner room, overlooking Times Square. The room was spacious and the bathroom was roomy. Unlike the W on Lexington, I prefer this location. Concierge Michael was extremely efficient and gets and A+. The hotel is walking distance to all Broadway theaters and some pretty good restaurants. Blue Fin in the hotel is also superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.. wish I could have used more of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: girizarry
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is certainly a different experience. Don't expect your bags to be taken to your room as they assume you prefer to take them yourself. From the moment you arrive you feel you have arrived to a night club with bouncer at the door and everything. The hotel has a very modern feel, the room was clean and with great decoration. Bathrooms were very clean. Although the description when booking said "dramatic views", when we arrived it was a view of the Marriott. The only negative thing about the room was that one of the bed pillows had an chewing gum sticked to the side. (kind of gross).

Reviews.Title: “This place was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: mandy_loves_2_travel
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled with my sister-in-law and our 2 daughters, 9 & 12. This hotel was fantastic as far as location, size and staff! From the time we walked in the door we were impressed with the staff and the "hipness" of the hotel, the girls were very impressed with the lobby!! The doormen were fabulous, and greeted us with huge smiles when exiting and entering the hotel. The staff is what made this place so very special. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking, and I WILL stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy & Chic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ckcarr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as the first leg of my honeymoon with my wife. The hotel was recently updated and have reasonable size rooms for New York standards and is in the midst of Times Square and very close to all of the popular Broadway shows. The hotel is very trendy, staff were welcoming and the amenities were good. The hotel bustles with night life every day of the week. I would definitely stay here again next visit to New York, highly recommended for quality, service and location!

Reviews.Title: “NOT A TYPICAL w”
Reviews.Author: Kgear
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several W hotels over the past several years. They are typically modern sleek, cool and clean. This location came up short. It seems liked a typical hotel that tried to convert to a W without a fulls cale restoration. My room even had a note saying "we hope you enjoy the recently updated room" - yet it wasn't updated It was an old dark hotel with newer paint and furnishings but it was clearly apparent that it was not a full scale restoration. The bathroon floor had old rusty bolts sticking up through the floor (presumably from the prior confirguation), the toilet was old (with paint splattered on the tank from the recent paint job). The room was slightly smaller than I am used too. A nice flat screen. Overall a decent hotel but not a typical W. The bar was just OK (no food). There is no restuarant except the Blue Fin on the ground floor - seven floors below the lobby. Overall an average NY hotel, I was disappointed given hwo much I typically like W's. Wired INternet $17 per day.

Reviews.Title: “W Time Square- What a Wonderful Weekend”
Reviews.Author: LeChatRouge
Reviews.Content: I was initially skeptical to book a room here because I had heard that the rooms were extremely small; but I was pleasantly surprised! The room had more room than expected, with enough space to actually move around without walking into furniture(a rarity in NY). The room was one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in, the room attendant did a fantastic job! Whatever/Whenever Service was also very prompt, especially for a busy rainy summer weekend. The staff members encountered in the public areas were also friendly & helpful.The location is right in the middle of the action, but also close enough to walk a few blocks to some of the best and most affordable eateries in the city(9th AVE). The ambiance of The W TS is really geared for younger hipsters, but you cans till enjoy your stay there without being part of that generation. I will go back!

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel in New York Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Quest1Canada
Reviews.Content: The W does not stand for Welcome. Worst experience with a Hotel I've ever had. Need not say much about the Hotel except AVOID it.

Reviews.Title: “Wife's Birthday Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: prettyboi
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square is everything my wife and expected. We're a young trendy couple, and felt right at home! Anyone who complains about this hotel is simplyy nit picky because it couldn't be more perfect (modern, clean, great staff, location)!!! It is expensive, but you get what you pay for. Nothing is free here, including wi-fi...we paid $45 for 3 days of internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vibe”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in Times Square for 4 nights. The Staff were friendly except for one concierge, named Jason. I asked hows your day? and he replied "tired" with attitude. Then It seemed like it was a burden for him to help me out. But the other staff and concierges were all fine. This Place is steps from 2 metro station and Broadway Plays. 10 min train to SoHo, 15-20min train to Brooklyn, 10mins to Central Park. The area as you know is super touristy, but the hotel itself takes you away from the mayhem. The Bar has a very nice eclectic feel, the rooms are spacious with great views. We had a view of the Hudson. As with all W's, the toiletries are amazing. If you get a good rate.. this is definitely the place to stay in Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Enjoy Beauty of New York”
Reviews.Author: misiaChicago
Reviews.Content: Great Place to Stay in the center of Times Square...Very easy access to trains, broadway, plenty of great restaurant with walking distance. There is a friendly atmosphere and it is also clean and inviting to spend more hours at the hotel. Our stay was exceptional, everything ran smoothly and all the employees who we encountered at the W went out of their way to help if needed.

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shaicris19
Reviews.Content: I must say this pictures from the website had me anxious to go. when we arrived the staff were wonderful. I planned a special bday surprise and had limited time to do all the running around. I called the Whateer/Whenever desk and the lovely Crysis got me Wish to come true. They arranged and picked everything i requested and kept me informed and offered suggestions...I am still floating off of my experience there and can't wait to go back. This hotel decor will take you away and the staff are the best. Trust me.....go and see. They are a little expensive compared to some, but they offer so many deals and discounts and the stay is well worth every penny......Thanx

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bktravelgal
Reviews.Content: Unless you are dying to stay in Times Square look elsewhere. This W is ghetto compared to others I've stayed in. They longer have a spa which is sad because it was great little gem with excellent therapists. You can get much more for your money and better quality at other NY hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: christianj
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Times Square on several occasions before. I have to admit that the last time I stayed I was not completely satisfied and really felt that the rooms needed to finally be renovated. This time around the rooms are FINALLY renovated and I have to say I really like the new feel. IMHO they should have changed out the vanities in the bathroom but I still like the overall redo. Location is good if you are in town for sightseeing or shopping but not ideal if you are looking for something quite of course. Only service issue I had was with the bellman who still seemed to think he was a model only working there to chat and pick up the girls staying at or walking by the hotel. Aren't those guys supposed to help guests and actually take care of peoples luggage and hail cabs? Not the ones working when I was there. Other than that a great stay but I really wish management would hire some decent bellman because this has been an issue for quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Defines What "W" Hotel Really IS!”
Reviews.Author: Doraemon79
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quite time with your family or children. This is not the W for You. If you are looking for a fun atmosphere with updated rooms and chances to meet some hot (random) people while you are in town, this is the place to be. I love this W. I mean really, its NICE. This is how W hotel is suppose to be. Hip, Trendy, good night/bar scenes. Service is however hit or miss. Some people are VERY nice yet some are the typical W wannabe attitude (esp during afternoon shift, the welcome desk folks are pretty whatever). The hotel renovated last year so everything is still very new. I forgot the name of the designer but its to my liking. Oh yea, the welcome desk is like a nice bar feeling with the lights n all. Check out the concierge desk's tabletop glass too! It was designed by some MIT guy. Gonna check it out. They have W store in house too for those who likes W stuff. In house restaurant Bluefin is very popular restaurant in time square area and I think its reasonably priced for a place like this. There are also cheap pizza places located on 8th. Ave. The Room: Upgraded to Cool Corner room on 48th Floor. Able to see time square from my window! woo! Everything is brand new, the moment that you walk in, you'll realize this W is "Not your typical type of hotel room" type of room. Its very hip! I liked it from the moment that I walked into this room. Being in the corner I also get to see more of the time square from my room. Hooray! The Bathroom: Voyager Shower, means, you can see people's shadow while they are in the bathroom. This will be kinda annoying if you are travelling with your family. Not an issue if you are traveling w/ your lover or solo traveler like me. However, the soundproof for this hotel is bad, esp when I had a connecting room. Good thing is that my neighbor went to bed early. Gym (AKA Sweat): Very spacious with latest workout equipments. They have a shower too but they don't have any sauna or jacuzzi or pool on-site. Acura Service: Its there, but they didn't set up a table like other W's. Its first come, first served based. Great place for stay, first time visiting NYC (location, location to the subway, location to the time square). Must try to stay here once to experience the real W Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “W is for "Wonderful"”
Reviews.Author: djpiglet
Reviews.Content: We were a little hesitant about making a reservation at this hotel because of some of the other reviews, but we were very pleasantly surprised. We had a wonderful time at the W Times Square . Our room was beautiful and it looked like it had just been renovated! The little chocolates that were left in the room everyday was a very nice touch, along with the note from the General Manager on our first day. We also noticed that we never hear the housekeeping staff, but the rooms are always clean. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel were very accommodating and we felt like they genuinely cared about the quality of our stay. There was one staff member in particular who helped to make our stay extra memorable. Gil (I think one of the security staff?) was especially helpful and went out of his way to make our stay more special. We felt like VIPs in the hotel and also that we had a friend who would take care of us. We've stayed in many W's over the years now and the service in general is very good, but the service at this location was outstanding! We couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Leave the chaos outside, enter into an oasis.”
Reviews.Author: katetx
Reviews.Content: Ok my husband had just given up his corporate apartment in Murray Hill so he booked the W at Times Square just for something different. I will also say that he is a road warrior and is top tier on most hotel chains. Times Square is the last place that I would choose to stay because it is just ground zero for tourists at all times of the day and night. I personally don't like walking outside to a sea of people. Murray Hill is more residential and worlds aways from this chaos so that is where I am coming from. As soon as we arrived at the W, we were greeted outside by very friendly staff. You enter and then go up the elevator to the reception area. In the same area is a bar with lounge music and lots of people. Ok so not really quiet, but honestly it was not annoying. Front desk people were great and were extremely helpful. Our room was a corner one and had a great view of Times Square below. Noise was very minimal. I loved the grey/taupe walls and the cool colors used to accent. room was quite striking and not jarring (in other words very easy on the eye). The bed was super comfortable with ample pillows.Very cool and comfy I wish I had a bed like this at home. I really could have just taken my favorite books and spent the entire time in bed reading. There was an Ipod doc/stereo for your Ipod. How great is that! Lots of room for laptops and other electronic devices. I was most impressed with the W's security as my room key somehow stopped working. The room was in my husband's name and so security went up with me. I must say that I was very impressed that they were careful to make sure I was who I said I was. The security man they sent up with me was extremely professional and courteous. He did his job! When we checked out I saw the same officer and he remembered me by name. I actually would stay here again, yes someone who did not want to stay in Times Square. By the way the rate we got here was much better than the W at Union Square. If you want something a little different but don't want to sacrifice comfort, give the W Hotel at Times Square a try. It was well worth it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel blighted by a receptionist.”
Reviews.Author: nmmt
Reviews.Content: Having a mindset of never dwell on a problem, I would never usually complain. However, on this occasion I think I might issue a warning. After a full day and half a night of travelling to get to NY, bartering with a receptionist was near enough the last thing we wanted to do. How disappointing it was to arrive at the hotel at 10.30 in the evening (3.30 am London time) only to be told that our room, which my boyfriend paid extra for, had been ‘given away’ to an overflow customer who had originally booked another hotel. I’m not sure what warranted the priority of this other customer, apparently booking and paying for a room in advance does not ensure that you can actually stay in it. Instead we were told to stay in a downgraded room for the first night and that we would be moved to our proper room during the following day. However, this might have been an issue which I could have come to terms with if there was a degree of remorse shown by the receptionist and perhaps a refund of the difference, maybe even an upgraded room, sadly it was not to be. After suggesting that we were not particularly happy with these arrangements we were offered credit for the ‘Blue Fin’ restaurant. This we declined as we were not certain that we would eat there. Next he offered us a complimentary drink each at the bar. After bumping this up to 4 complimentary drinks, we settled. It’s just a shame we didn’t get the apology. Some might think me prude, but when it comes to bathrooms, I might be inclined to favour comfort over style or at least a goodly amount of both. When contentment in the bathroom is forsaken for a glass wall, I would suggest that the design was perhaps not as well thought out as it could have been. I can see how some might see it as ‘fun’ but mostly I found it off-putting. However, it is not this to discredit what otherwise was a good hotel. The doormen were friendly and attentive. They helped with our bags and called for a taxi for the return journey to the airport. The location and the view from our proper room was amazing. The bed was unbelievably comfortable and spacious and the room itself was clean and stylish.

Reviews.Title: “Brighter lighting in rooms, please.”
Reviews.Author: jlsglendale
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at the W Times Square, loved the floral scents, the hip decor, the fun cocktails in the Living Room, the wonderful toiletries, the location. All in all, nearly perfect for our business meeting, especially when it came to relaxing after the meeting! Only one suggestion, more lights in the room, please. It is nearly impossible to get any work done with the dim lights provided. I had to raise the shades, just to read the hotel guide in the room. Business travelers who want to look at documents in their rooms should consider bringing along their own lights.

Reviews.Title: “Bouncers on the door!!!”
Reviews.Author: restinpeace
Reviews.Content: I was on a short break with my girlfriend. The hotel is in an amazing location although it took some careful dance moves to get from the taxi to the hotel entrance with our baggage. You then had to negotiate your way past the bouncers on the door, through the disco and the beautiful people and finally you made it to reception. Very nice staff who happily upgraded us from a Marvelous room to a Fantastic room. Apparently they are identical although one was on the 12th floor and one was on the 51st floor. The room was ultra modern and in my view the designers have tried too hard. Too large cases and no storage space at all. One small drawer and several fake drawers which were sealed shut. I did complain but apparently all the rooms are like this! Great design with no thought as to the eventual user. We had to complain about the cleanliness on more than one occasion however the staff were quick to help out and send someone up to sort the problems. Very noisy location and with the window open, well what would you expect for Time Square! First trip to New York and absolutely loved the place. Less enamored with the hotel though. After a busy day sight seeing etc, I needed a little tranquility on my return to the hotel and the W didn't offer this. Not a complaint, simply an observation.

Reviews.Title: “Style over Substance - with great location.”
Reviews.Author: LeedsWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my heavily pregnant wife at the end of April. We booked with Amex so we got upgrade on arrival, stay 3 nights get 1 free, free breakfast,early check in, 4pm check out, a $85 credit for the blue fin restaurant/bar and a limo from JFK. When we got to hotel there were no door staff to help with bags or point us in right direction. We quickly found check in on the 7th floor. This was smooth and he told us how to get to our room on the 52nd floor. The room looked very good, great view but had absolutely no practicality. The size of the room was fine, but the wardrobe was tiny and there was just no draws to put anything. There was plenty of space where storage could have gone, but the room was too trendy for its own good. We phoned down to say we were not happy and very quickly the service manager arrived. She admitted that although the rooms had just been renovated, it had not been done particularly well and most people do complain about lack of storage. She said most rooms would be like this but she would upgrade us to a suite if we liked. We did. We had to go back to reception and get new rooms keys. When we found our new room the service manger arrived with a bag of gifts and a hand written note congratulating us on our future arrival. A nice touch. The suite was great, very large, 2 big wardrobes and 1.5 bathrooms. The main bathroom was tiny though. The living area toilet was big but had no where to hang a towel. Overall a good room but needed more lights. Far to dark at night time. In summing up the rooms they look great but they are not designed for someone to use them. The free breakfast had to be taken in the room and on the sixth day was starting to get boring. I used the gym most days and although it is small it has very modern equipment and was always quiet. Because we stayed 6 nights we had 2 $85 credits at the blue fin. We used one for a set menu meal which was very good and the other for Friday night cocktails which was better. I did have to remind them of the free nights on check out, but the staff as usual were very good. I did also take advantage of the free Internet in the lobby, no need to pay for it in your room, if you are just checking emails and i also had quite a few of the welcome drinks. I would recommend this hotel, but pack light and you don't really come to New York to stay in your room do you?

Reviews.Title: “Good with minor issues”
Reviews.Author: ZMR
Reviews.Content: If you after being in th eheart on Time Square, you cant go wrong with the W. Rooms are very well refurbished and chic. Very hip. Service was excellent overall, though a few pointers about the room....1) ensure you get a corner room ( better views and more airy) 2/ bathroom is tight 3) Walls extremely thin ( could hear our neighbors having a fight!!). Otherwise couldnt really fault hotel and staff

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, friendly staff and great food.”
Reviews.Author: rbp2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Times Square for several months a few years back and always liked the hotel. I stayed there again this weekend and the experience was noticeably improved (again from a already high standard). The staff was very friendly and helpful (biggest improvement from prior stays), the food (dinner and breakfast at Blue Fin) was outstanding and the room was comfortable and well designed.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel designed like a club!”
Reviews.Author: Royish
Reviews.Content: Location Location Location. Heart of Times Square. Walking distance to everything- to Broadway, Hell's Kitchen, MOMA to Central Park. The hotel is designed like a club- a fabulous bar with great martinis! This is a great business hotel. Each floor is in a different theme colour, and the rooftop is a great place for a typical new york party. Slightly overpriced, but if you want location- this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Trendy”
Reviews.Author: LineS
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in W Times Square for a family birthday and Broadway show with my two children and parents. This hotel is very cool and trendy with a fun entrance and check in area/lobby. When we tried to check in several hours before check in time, one of our rooms was ready. However, when we got to the room, my parents weren't happy with the location next to the elevator. When I went downstairs to the desk to ask for another room, the receptionist not only politely moved us but made the effort to find us connecting rooms and actually upgraded us to a corner room with no extra charge. My parents were thrilled with their corner room and we all loved the newly redone and trendy details in both rooms. Later in the evening we spent some time at the extremely cool bar in the hotel which was fun and the next morning ate a delicious breakfast at the restaurant downstairs. Valet parking was convenient and fast. Location is smack in the middle of Times Square and while this is convenient and fun it is also extremely noisy (even on the 48th floor) so keep this in mind. This city really doesn't sleep, people!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing, best choice we could have made!”
Reviews.Author: RANKCO
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I took a long awaited, very special trip to New York and were recommended The W at Times Square. Well, it was everything, and more, that we expected. She, 16, and myself wanted to stay at a trendy New York Hotel, in Times Square where we would be central. It was simply amazing! The service was impeccable, friendly and outgoing staff, and the music to die for! I wish I had bought all their CD's! The beds were extremely comfortable, the view of Times Square was delightful! The only complaint we had was the lack of lighting in the room, however, they were keen on supplying an additional lamp which made the difference. The restaurant had the best breakfast as well! What a great experience! Highly, highly recommend this hotel! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous service (nice location)”
Reviews.Author: katydoo
Reviews.Content: This was a special birthday weekend trip to NYC. A special room (glass corner room) was chosen and paid for- a ton of money was spent! We got there and the room wasnt ready- ok fine- however when we asked to leave our bags with them as we had a show to catch- what a mess. We sat with several other guests all waiting for the "bag guy" when we approached the front desk again to say we are running late- "no you must wait" after more time went by we approached again- hoping to sit at the bar and wait " no you must wait by your bags" What? what is this airport security?? what a joke- the front desk should have just given us some damn tags and let us go on our way!!! When we came back hours later- were the bags in our room? No. We had to call for them. When the bell boy showed did he show us around our room? No. Several hours later we accidentally discovered the fridge, a hidden shelf panel and the rest (?) of the amenities we were paying top dollar for. And very funny- there was a housekeeping cart outside of our room all afternoon and all night long!! We could have been at the Howard Johnsons for what we experienced and saw.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: emilylovesny
Reviews.Content: i am pretty young and love staying at the new and hip W hotels. The bell hop staff in the front is helpful from the moment you step out of the taxi. the rooms are pretty high up (i was on the 42nd floor!!) and have a great view of times square! the room was nice and so was the bathroom. the bathrooms are filled with bliss products (a hip new york spa with quite pricey lotions, shampoos etc). the windows and walls did a great job at blocking out the loud noises of new york at night. i would live there if i could!! one of the best hotels i have ever been to! [:

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect...”
Reviews.Author: Caro646
Reviews.Content: After a short stint in a budget hotel, we decided to splurge for three nights in a suite at the W. The room was beautiful and the views were great. Unfortunately, we had a terrible stay to say the least. The service was so bad; I could not believe we were paying for it. The front desk staff was great, but the room service attendant and the restaurant staff were the rudest people we had ever encountered. It’s like… Do they know they work in hospitality?!!! I could not believe it when our food came cold from Room Service and the server is arguing with us telling us it wasn’t. We go to the restaurant and the service was slow and the server was very short with us. I wanted my money back! We got home and could not understand how we could have gotten better service at an economy hotel than at the W. I wouldn’t pay top dollar for that place, ever!

Reviews.Title: “Living Room Experience”
Reviews.Author: raulojeda
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel experience was absolutely exceptional; however their external partners such as the Living Room were not as exceptional. We were humiliated and accused by a server of ‘stealing’ her cell phone, when I and my partner are paying $400 per night. We are offended to say the least! The value of the phone is not the issue but the rather the nonresponsive attitude of the Manager of the Living Room, Lindsey. Although she made us feel like everything was fine and she understood that the phone was near us and we simply surprisingly handed it over to the server, we were asked to leave like criminals at the server’s request. We have never in our lives been so humiliated as tonight. We came to NYC to celebrate my boyfriend’s birthday and I was so sadden by the situation that I was ready to check out and leave the hotel immediately, however, Vitaly Panov, Hotel Manager, listened to our side of the story. He was kind enough to explain that the hotel has no control of the concessions such as the Living Room, owned by Randy Gerber. As SPG members, we know Starwood very well and they are very lucky to have Vitaly on board. I hope in the future, the hotel has some control of these concessions so that guests are treated with respect and are not subject to the mistreatment, humiliation and arrogance of the Living Room. Please note that the only reason why we will stay for the remainder of our stay in NYC with the W is due to Vitaly Panov.

Reviews.Title: “For Location Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Toopicky
Reviews.Content: This is now my 3rd stay @ W Times Square and apart for the renovated rooms pretty much everything remains the same. Okay so the rooms may not be kitted out the best, poor lighting, not enough wardrobe space or hooks in the bathrooms & still no coffee/tea making facilities in the room.The bed is still the best I have ever slept in, even better than my own. The noise from Times Square on the 45th floor is nothing to lose sleep over. The location is excellent, central for most attractions and tourist sightseeing, The staff are friendly & helpful, The bar is still hip & makes a great place for cocktails. Stay here if you want a Times Square loction and be in the centre of the action. Don't stay here if you are on a Business Trip ∧ need to work in you room.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Middle of Times Square, Expectations Met”
Reviews.Author: GSH81
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to NYC, have some money to spend and want to stay in the Mecca of all tourist zones... the W Times Square is for you. This is a great hotel and has everything you'd expect in a W, although scaled down to a "Manhattan Size". You're not going to find huge rooms here (outside of the suites) but if you are in NYC and spending a lot of time in your hotel, you're not optimizing your trip. The fitness center is adequate and the staff and service is standard. This is not a "blow you away in awe" W like some of that brand can be, but compared to other Times Square options, this is definitely the hippest and trendiest chain I've stayed at. They're is nothing wrong with this place, however if you need peace and quiet, you might want to look elsewhere... there's always something going on if not in the hotel, then on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Simply lovely...”
Reviews.Author: llapa00
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference and this hotel was picked by a colleague for its location and fair price. I was thrilled---always loving the W brand , this hotel did not disappoint. First walking in, the floral scent is lovely and inviting. I love the modern design, water features and fresh flowers everywhere... The reception area and bar have a cool, modern edge. The staff were very friendly and helpful (storing luggage and help at concierge--aka "whatever" desk). Our room was a good size for NYC (2 beds and it fit luggage!). It was modern and clean. Bed and linens were top rate. The bathroom was complete with tub, shower and fantastic Bliss products. Location is great for the tourist and Jatvis conference attendee. Yes, there is some traffic/siren noise, but common anywhere in NYC. Overall, I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel wish i was there now”
Reviews.Author: redditchbunch
Reviews.Content: we travelled to the w with our two teenage sons for our sons 19th birthday First impressions the elevator area with waterfall was great.The checkin very fast and we were quickly in our 31st floor room great room, nice size ,comfy beds and very clean.The lobby bar is lovely candles everywhere and lovely smelling lillies,gets very busy and is a little exspensive.The hotel is situated ight on times square couldnt be better. All the staff were very helpful.We visited all the usual places empire state,central park ,greyline tour ,hms intrepid thats great but make sure you allow at least half a day.we also saw the nicks lakers game at madison square gardens the lads loved this.We used the theme resterants planet hollwood,hard rock cafe and espn zone thats great with kids.If your travelling to newyork a must is the purchase of a newyork city pass it saved us a fortune. When we return to newyork well definately stay at w i would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overdesigned and too cool staff”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - I like W Hotels and stay there quite frequently (Hong Kong, Seoul, Montreal etc.) but the W Times Square in New York has been one of those experiences you don't want to repeat. The first room we got has been so small that 2 persons couldn't unpack the suitecases, store the clothes, have breakfast... Further the bathroom has been so much overdesigned that they forgot to fit enough lamps. For my wife it has been impossible to do make-up, for me shaving has been a problem. So, since I've got a Platinum SPG card, I called and complained. The y promissed a bigger Suite for the next day, okay, fine. When returning from restaurant we saw that they forgot the "turn-down-service" (which you can expect at approx. US$ 400/night). We've been informed that the W isn't star rated and therefore we can't expect 5 star service. "Turn-down" they perform only on special request and automatically when you're Platinum SPG member (which I am - but still they forgot). The next day we were moved to a nice Suite. But again, the thing has been so much overdesigned that they forgot the light switches. So for switching on/off the light you have to go to each and every lamp to switch it on/off... And again, the light in the bathroom has been too little, everything too dark! Breakfast (in-room) has been included in our package, that's maybe why the croissants always had been from the previous day... But the juice (freshly squeezed) has been perfect! Another positive feature of the W is free-WiFi at the bar/lounge (which is quite crowded and noisy) - but who cares, it's free - while in the room you have to pay. The problem started the last (3rd) day. Again they forgot "turn-down-service" and in the morning they even didn't bring new shampoo... So I called and the lady insisted that they performed turn-down-service, that she had been present in person, that they exchanged towels and put chocolate. I informed her that neither there're fresh towels or shampoo nor chocolate. But she insisted. Anyway, after a while, she told me that we'll get shampoo in a moment. So I waited 15 minutes before I called again. She said "immediately" and I waited another 10 minutes, sitting on the sofa at the entrance door. Then I called again and she informed me that the person had been there, knocked - but I didn't open. I told her that I'm sitting by the door, no TV, no radio, no iPod, no drugs, asked her if she has a wrong room number. She confirmed the right number and told me she'll call back. 5 minutes later she called and told me that the shampoo is now standing in front of the door. I opened - and guess what - no shampoo. 5 minutes later really somebody came, knocked and gave me a shampoo... More than 30 minutes waiting, wasting, for shampoo! I think the problem is that at the W Times Square the staff wants to be sooo cool, too cool to perform service. Nothing is really serious -and that's a problem for business travelers. W at Court is fine, W Times Square a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get any better”
Reviews.Author: patriciaSouthSheilds
Reviews.Content: As we arrived at the W Times Square Hotel we were greeted by an over head waterfall, which was stunning. You have to go in the lift to take you upto the reception area. When we arrived it was abount 7pm on a friday night and the reception/bar area was buzzing with people. The decor was very modern but cozy aswell. The staff at the reception were very friendly and helpful. As we got out of the lift to go to our room the corridors were decorated in gold, which loooked very luxurious. As we entered the room were very pleased at the size of the room (compared to the W on Lexington avenue), we had a very large window with a chaise lounge next to it were we took advantage of the spectacular view of times square and the hudson river. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was to a very high standard also. You could not have asked for a better location, we were right next to the tkts booth and everything else times square had to offer. When i go back to New York i wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Style, but a bit more substance needed”
Reviews.Author: Heidbummer
Reviews.Content: Yup, it looks great. (Very) Comfy bed, clean, clean, clean. Love the toiletries. Great (24 hour for those with jetlag early wakening) gym. 2 minutes to Times Square subway and a panoply of subway lines to the rest of Manhattan. Handy indeed. And very close to the E line at 50th St straight out to the JFK airtrain if you want to avoid that big cab fare to the airport or touring umpteen hotels to pick up fellow passengers. That costs, and the costs are about average for the size of room we had in Times Square. You want cheap? You'll be walking a lot further. So, a great looking hotel in a brilliant location. BUT If you want a bath (not just a shower) make sure you ask for a room with one when you book (and online booking may not tell you). After a long day in the snow and minus 5 a shower doesn't always do the job. And you'll be living out of your suitcase. One clothes drawer and one shelf in the cupboard. We travel pretty light, but 2 people for 5 days with very variable weather means SOME luggage. And there's nowhere to put it. Ignore the "table reserved" signs in the lobby bar. They all are, and it's just to keep interlopers at bay. Don't expect rapid service in the bar either. Overall: a good hotel, which is a little up itself, but if you want facilities and location it ticks all those boxes. I stayed in the Times Square Hilton 2 years ago and the W is better on many fronts. If I were staying in Times Square again I'd use the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great vibe”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld006
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Love the Vibe, love the location. The only drawback was the tiny little rooms. My wife and I stayed at all of the W in New York over the years but this one is a ittle cramped for my style. The bar and lobby bar is great place to hang out and have drinks, a great launching pad for the night! There's nothing like checking in, leaving your bags with the bell hop and getting a much needed drink post travel drink in the lobby as they bring your bags to your room. The club was a nive place to hang out at the end of the night as well. All in all, if you want to be in the thick of time square and don't mind with the bright lights, the traffic noise from your small room, this is the best place to stay in the area.
