If you want the ammenities of the W, much larger room and a much quieter stay, try the W Tuscany, or the W Court. They are side by side near Grand Central and worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staf”
Reviews.Author: alexk50
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned this Hotel has a great location. The only issue was the bathroom which is funky and lacks privacy. This was an issue since our son ( age 22 ) was with us. The staff was great, I left my favorite pair of sandals and when we called after our cruise they sent them home to us. I was so happy.

Reviews.Title: “Whatever Whenever says enough”
Reviews.Author: mjhamilton5
Reviews.Content: What a perfect way to spend our anniversary. This was our second stay here and remember exactly why we returned and why would not stay anywhere else in NY ever. The hotel is first class in everyway. Very modern in every way. Awesome flat screen and a bed that will make you never want to get out. We were really taken care of. Any request I had they went about and beyond to accommodate it. The service was amazing. From the awesome guys outside in the cold, to the front desk and concierge who helped me with all the details of the city. Thank you W for making my wife and I's anniversary weekend perfect. See you soon. Mike Hamilton

Reviews.Title: “5 strikes and your are out!”
Reviews.Author: SmrtJim
Reviews.Content: Within 24 hours, five strikes against this property which in the future, I will certainly avoid and suggest you do the same. For the hustle and bustle that is Times Square NY, the hotel property itself was very pleasant, clean, and modern. There were a few issues that I have yet to get over, even though three weeks have passed since our stay. W Hotel touts itself as a trendy, and dare I say sexy, contemporary resort. For me it was far from that. The purpose of my stay was a romantic pre-Christmas stay with my girlfriend prior to the family fun and chaos that Christmas brings. Upon arrival we checked in to the hotel and went to our room. The room was clean, trendy, and simple. We booked with our Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) points and paid an extra amount of points for an upgraded room. For an upgraded room, it was not worth the investment. (Not the first strike, but worth noting) We asked for a better view room to overlook Times Square which was available but they wanted $50 more for the night to move 4 rooms over. The hotel was rather empty and as a SPG who paid an upgrade points already, I would have hoped they would upgrade for no fee. Not the case so we declined. (Strike 1) After a hectic morning of travel, we just needed to take a rest before we hit the town and fell asleep immediately. Within 40 minutes or so of falling asleep, we were woken up by a loud knock on the door. Upon answering, we met a gentleman asking to change lighbulbs. Yes, woken up about an hour after checking in to change lightbulbs! For a hotel that claims to focus on comfort and the guest, this was not a good start. (Strike 2) We then went to the concierge for advice on broadway plays. Although polite and friendly he was not well informed. In fact, he mis-informed us about the showtimes for the play we wanted to see and we missed the deadline for the reduced price tickets and had to skip dinner to make the earlier showtime. A high end trendy hotel with a misinformed concierge? (Strike three) Then, after a wonderful night on the town, late into the evening, we had a wonderful nights sleep in a very comfortable bed. Then, it got worse. We were eager to sleep in and enjoy the serenity of the pleasant room and cozy bed, however, at about 8:30 am there was another knock on the door to wake us up (again). Half asleep I went to the door and found the staff member chose to wake us up and let us know there was a newspaper at the foot of the door. Waking guests up at 8:30am to tell you about a newspaper....Absurd! (Strike 4) The fifth and final strike was the worst. It was about 10am that same day. There was a brief knock at the door and then immediately the door flung wide open. This time, a staff member, who never waited for us to answer the door, rudely and ignorantly barged in the room and interrupted "an intimate moment" between me and my girlfriend. Extremely embarassing. We still have no idea why he just barged in the room. We remain shocked, embarassed, and angered by the experience. My girlfriend was extremely embarassed and ran to the bathroom crying. I did call the manager immediately and she was very polite and apologized. My SPG points were also refunded. Three weeks have passed and I am still disappointed in the stay, the staff, and the embarassing experience and this is why I chose to write this review. 5 strikes in one 24 hour period for a property of this caliber is simply unacceptable. This hotels claim of being trendy and sexy is true but the staff is poorly trained and inexperienced which can lead to missing a broadway play , scalping expensive tickets, missing dinner plans, and a crying girlfriend in the bathroom the day before Christmas. My recommendation is to consider the few other major hotels (i.e., Mariott or Double Tree) within a block of the W in Times Square and avoid this property until the staff can be suitably trained on guest relations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent night stay”
Reviews.Author: charck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Times Square for one night on December 17, 2008 and was very happy with the experience. Valet was easy at the entrance on 47th St. (It is $65 (large car/suv) per 24 hours no in/out). Check - in was very quick and we were upgraded to a suite with Times Square views. It had two bathrooms, a wet bar, pull out couch and separate king size bedroom. The mattress was very comfortable as was the room overall. It had dual climate control zones and two enormous LCD tvs. We called housekeeping twice for pillows, etc. and they were brought up in minutes. Our room was on the 20th floor and did not have any problem with road noise - honking cars, etc. So many other reviews mentioned this, but it was not an issue for us. Also, in the lobby there was not loud music playing and it actually had a calm vibe to it during the day. When we returned late that night there were definitely people at the lobby lounge/bar but it still seemed pretty low key. We had an excellent breakfast in the hotel restaurant. The pumpkin ginger pancakes and smoked salmon platter were both great. All of the hotel employees that we encountered were pleasant and helpful - from the valet attendant, to housekeeping, to check-in, to restaurant staff (especially at the restaurant - it was very busy when we came in for breakfast (it was filled primarily with what looked like local businessmen and a few hotel guests), but the restaurant manager (seeing we were hotel guests) was very attentive and made space for us after a few minutes wait) As we were leaving we did notice that they have something called the Acura Experience or something like that. It's hotel sponsored program that provides free rides around the city in an Acura SUV, I think. We definitely would have made use of this if we had known of it. Also, at check in the hotel receptionist knew the pull-out couch would be used, but this must not have been communicated to housekeeping because the pull-out was not set up at turn-down. We had to call for extra blankets and pillows. I know this is minor, but it's so nice when these things are remembered by staff and I'm pleasantly surprised. The rooms were pretty dim and the opaque wall/divider between the bathrooms was a little odd, but other than that I have no complaints. I would definitely return to this property and recommend it strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: neilandbev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time in New York and the W Hotel was perfect in every way. The room while not spacious was clean, cool gadgets, priced right and a perfect location. The Blue Fin (part of the Hotel) was also great for people watching and a great selection of food. My only complaint maybe a recommendation for a restaurant by the concierge. They recommended a steak house called STK, it was awful! The service was well below par for a restaurant like this and the food was mediocre. However, one restaurant that you might want to try is West Broadway. It’s a relatively new restaurant and is geared to organic foods. The service is fantastic, food phenomenal and reasonably priced. For breakfast try the Blue Fin or Stardust diner just up Broadway from the W. Overall I would say our stay at the W was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: jspyron
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our mothers to NYC for Christmas and stayed at the W Times Square. The hotel is very trendy and hip and I can say all the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The hotel is a little dark but not so bad you cant see anything. The rooms were good size for NYC, clean and comfortable. The only complaints really were that there is only one drawer in the whole room to store your belongings. There are some open shelves to sit stuff on but sometimes you like your stuff out of sight. The second complaint is the bathroom and lack of privacy. The bathroom is basically a frosted glass enclosure and while you cant exactly see through it you can hear everything through it and it is definitely not exactly private. For married or longtime couples its no big deal but for some it could be uncomfortable with the lack of privacy. Overall it was a great stay and alot of fun, the rooms are clean, modern, great beds and tv's. Oh and the minibar can get expensive so read the details of all the charges before you indulge.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: BenDover2u
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and our two boys stayed at the W right before Christmas and really enjoyed it. Yes it's dark and everything is very modern but that is the theme of the hotel. If you are looking for warm and elegant stay somewhere else. I did not find anything confusing about staying here. If you don't know where something is, ask or read the guide in your room, duh! Twice, I called the whatever/whenever line and got a response right away! If you are expecting perfection when you stay at a hotel, you will always be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel Times Square Unaccomadating and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Phillytrvlgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I take a vacation to NYC every Christmas as a romantic getaway. We have always been very fond of Starwood Hotels so we decided to try the "hip and well designed" W Hotel in Times Square. While checking in the staff seemed very attentive but this quickly changed after we got into our room. The room looked like an IKEA showroom with very cheaply made furniture and decor. Most items in the room looked worn and with chips in the glass tables and the toilet paper holder practically falling off the wall. When I attempted to use the restroom we found that the glass sliding door was not attached to the wall in the correct way so we had to have maintenance sent to correct the problem. Then my husband and I attempted to get ready for the night and while blow drying my hair the entire room lost electricity. We immediately called down to have this taken care of and had no electricity or response to our situation for at least 25min. The hotel was also very loud and we found it hard to get a good nights rest while there. It also seemed that the hotel was extremely understaffed for the busiest time of year. There was only one concierge and two bell hops for the entire hotel. Every time we tried to used their "great customer" service ,in which they boast with a catchy marketing phrase "whatever, whenever", we sat in lines. The hotel is extremely overpriced for what you get. There are many other nicer hotels to chose from in New York. My husband and I would not stay here again. Our stay in the W Times Square actually put stress into our vacation which was supposed to be a Romantic Getaway.

Reviews.Title: “great beds”
Reviews.Author: kwill4u
Reviews.Content: The "W" Hotel is great ,after reading alot of negatives about this hotel,The beds are great,the service is wonderful,the rooms are clean,the doormen are miracle workers,and the staff is very helpful . I am not a cry baby nor do i demand alot of attention but our nyc w hotel times square stay was great.we ordered room service 1 night and it was easy to order over the tv menu and surprise it was hot and delivered fast to our room within 30 min.The W is a wonderful place and i can't wait to return thx w and nyc we had a great time and we will be back soon ,ken w.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: lovelytam
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the 'W' from thanksgiving to sunday 30th november. There were mixed reviews on trip advisor and so i didnt have my hopes up too high but i was very impressed! The main lobby is on the 7th floor and we had no trouble getting lifts up and down (only once did we even share a lift!) - the lobby is very trendy and a bit gloomy really (everything is very dark in this hotel) but it looks good! Hotel staff were very friendly (and the men were really rather good looking haha!). We arrived at 7.30am on thanksgiving morning and although our room was not ready they were happy to take away our bags and the room was ready by 11.00am. We had a spectacular room on the 53rd floor with two double beds and a view towards central park- the room was compact but had everything we needed. The bathrooms are very strange - they have dark frosted walls which you can see silhouttes through once the light is turned on! Was not good on the privacy front and took a while to get used to but we found with the smaller light on you couldnt see quite so much and you didnt feel quite so exposed! not the best design for a bathroom i have come across! Room was quite stuffy and we found we needed the window open to get some fresh air in but then you could hear all the times sq noise but i guess that is to be expected! As for the room the beds were very comfortable but the lighting is terrible - its was really hard to do your make up in the evening and i had to do the make up and check it when i got to a better mirror in the restaurant to make sure it looked ok! We ate breakfast in the restuarant Blue Fin and one lunch - was a little pricey but very nice and a good place to get a table on times square where everywhere else is a wait! Overall i would stay in this hotel again, the location is great, the staff friendly - i would just bring a curtain for the bathroom and some lightbulbs for the room haha!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissPrecious
Reviews.Content: When making my reservation I requested a newly renovated corner room and upon check in I was granted my requests and later discovered that my room also had a partial view of the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade, which I was planning to see anyway. That was so awesome! I didn't even have to stand in the cold to see Snoopy!! The room was beautiful. The size was average by New York standards, in my opinion. The furniture was brand new, contemporary, and functional. My fiancee LOVED the HDTV, and the king sized bed was amazing! It cradled me to sleep every night in under 10 minutes! I didn't find the stuff snooty by any means. They were all very nice, helpful, and seemed geniuinely happy to work there. I did notice that none of them work name tags, just a little "W" pin on their shirts. We did have one little issue while we were here. I brought back some pizza from my hotel room and called the Whatever/Whenever desk to get a microwave. They said they did not have them available to put in guests rooms, but the young lady said that she could connect me to room service and the could heat it for me. But when I spoke to room service, they said that they do not reheat outside food because it is a health hazard. She said that they will only reheat it if the food came from the hotel. When I asked if they would reheat food cooked by the hotel even if the guest had eaten from it, she said yes. That part threw me off... it's a health hazard if it was prepared outside the hotel and untouched, but not if the hotel prepared it and you've EATEN off of it??? To me, it sounded like someone didn't have their facts straight. Anyway, after going back and forth with the front desk for 10 minutes or so I finally laid in bed and enjoyed my hot New York pizza. Ahhh... After reading a lot of reviews on here, I thought that the place would be so dark that I wouldn't be able to see 2 feet in front of me. I read all this garbage about not being able to see the buttons on the elevator and not being able to navigate around the room after the sun goes down.. Not so for me. I mean, the lobby was a little dim, and the room was maybe a little bit dimmer than your normal room, but not by much. It was nice to me, very relaxing. All in all, I loved this hotel. I'd definitely recommend it, and I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great location in the heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: oliveerpent
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel choosen for our incentive (group of 102 persons) In the heart of the city of NY, Time square is the soul of theaters and animation. Lights everywhere, noisy but it's part of the location! The hotel is very nice, very design with a vey "people" bar during the evening. The rooms are quiet even with view on Time Square (We were on the 26th floor) and the service is perfect. A place to be despite an expensive rate!!

Reviews.Title: “W Times Square "The Best"”
Reviews.Author: OCGAL11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a reservation for another nearby hotel, we checked in and when we saw the room we checked right out! We had read mixed reviews about the "W" but decided we wanted to stay in Times Square. When we walked in the hotel we were greated by the most wonderful staff. We explained to the manager that we were not happy with the other hotel and would like to see a room at the "W". She gave us a tour and showed us a beautiful room. We were able to get a great rate through the internet last minute. We stayed four nights and had the best time! The staff at the "W" is incredible, their motto is Whatever- Whenever and they mean it! The rooms are newly renovated and tastefully decorated. They are smaller, but this is New York in Times Square!! I would highly recommend this hotel to any of my friends and hope to stay there again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: yellowdogluke
Reviews.Content: My expectations were not high after reading some of the reviews here. That being said, I was pleasantly surprised and wanted to share my experience. This was my first time staying at any W hotel, and the staff made me feel welcome immediately upon arrival. I was concerned that I may not be trendy enough to feel comfortable here, that that was not the case. The check in process was friendly and efficient. Every interaction with the staff was positive, and I did not experience any of the aloof/pretentious behavior others have mentioned. I was a bit surprised, in a good way, but the size of the "Wonderful" room. I was concerned that the lowest room class would feel cramped and claustrophobic, but there was actually plenty of room. This is not to say the room was large (this is still NYC), but I have stayed in other hotel in NYC that were half the size. The room was super clean and comfortable. Despite being newly renovated, the room already showed signs of wear. I suspect they are not using the most durable materials, but this would be expected in an ultra contemporary decor that will probably look outdated and need to be remodeled again in 3-4 years. The room was on the 21st floor, facing north, overlooking Times Square. I will agree with the other reviewers in saying that there are times when street noise makes it way into the room. This is usually police or fire sirens. I work in a NYC highrise, and the noise level is no worse in the hotel. Please understand this is Times Square, so if you are looking for a quiet hotel, this is not it. The staff were attentive and friendly. The TV remote in my room was missing, and within 3 minutes, I had a new one. A few minutes after that, I received a call from the Whatever/Whenever desk to make sure the remote issue was resolved. We ordered room service breakfast one morning, it arrived hot and fresh, but was overpriced. The only thing I would change is the the frosted glass bathroom wall and door. Privacy anyone? Not in this bathroom. Overall, it was a good experience. I got a ridiculously low price through the Internet. I can see how some who pay $500+/night would be put off by the lack of bathroom privacy and the low-quality materials used in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: chooochoootrane
Reviews.Content: I had a great room at the W hotel when I went there on business. It was spacious and clean and had a lovely ambient atmosphere. Room service was great as was the Blue Fin bar. Staff were accomodating and friendly. As a matter of fact, i left my purse in a cab and the doorman ran after the cab until he was able to retrieve it......now that's service! I would definitely reccomend this hotel to young New York first timers as it is the center of everything! although, possibly not to everyones tastes...quite young and funky. Very similar to Malmaison in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: ladyBoo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the W Times Square. The location is good but that is all that is good. It is so dark that after a couple of days you will suffer from SAD 'seasonal affective disorder', with every single light on in the room it is not possible to read or make-up ~ not just a bit dim but DARK. We found the concierge to be snotty to the point of rude ~ he clearly didn't know the slogan WhateverWhenever. Our trip was to celebrate my daughters 18th - I am surprised to see that others received some acknowledgment of their celebration because despite wearing a badge most of the day not one person said 'happy birthday. Our room was small and the beds were nothing special for the money. The en-suite had a glass wall and door leaving nothing visual, auditory or aromatic to the imagination ~ the perfect recipe for holiday retention. Despite requesting a high floor, the 30th floor was not high enough to get away from the street noise. The final part of our stay was spent at The Affinia - where we had a spacious suite for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for OW”
Reviews.Author: geoffandjo
Reviews.Content: From the moment of checkin everthing was great! The 41st floor room had a great view over Times Square. The room was like new, very clean and spacious considering it was Times Square. The staff made us feel special and we even received free birthday cake. Would go back tomorrow if we had the funds!

Reviews.Title: “the hottest spot in Town”
Reviews.Author: boluuk
Reviews.Content: This is realy a nice and viby hotel. Staf is fab and the rooms are amazing. Specialy the sky line of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: vanessm
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with co-workers for a few days and it was fantastic. I will admit, rates are a little pricey, but the location was amazing. Right in Time Sq! With the said, you would think to expect a lot of noise, but you could hear a pin drop it was so quiet! I'm not sure what rooms other individuals who have posted reviews stayed in, but we were in one of the newly renovated rooms. Decor was hip and clean, and rooms were small but it is also to be expected of NY. We even saw a few celebs at the Blue Fin downstairs! I would definitely stay here again, but would only recommend this hotel to individuals willing to drop their dollars. Not a place for budget travels.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced! Rude Staff! But Cool Decor”
Reviews.Author: JesseDaly
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel - the decor is cool, one of my favorite restaurants is on the first floor - BLUE FIN (GREAT)...but IT IS OVERPRICED! The rooms are quite small, but still nice. The bathrooms are BADLY DESIGNED! You have no choice but to flood your bathroom. The shower is designed with 1/2 a pane of glass - leaving half of the shower open with a very very small splash to contain the water. Everyone I know who has stayed here FLOODED their bathroom, So Lay Down Towels. FUN FOR 650 A NIGHT, HUH? The front desk staff is RUDE and not helpful when it comes to problems. It has a great location and cool decor...GO ELSWHERE UNLESS YOU SCORE A GOOD DEAL!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amandalapp5982
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so overpriced. The room was small, smelt and felt dirty. We had a hole in the closet door, dust and rust on everything metal, the carpet was damp, and the room smelt like cigars and smoke. My fiance and I laughed when we walked in the room. We paid 800 dollars for nothing. The room was so small. Also, breakfast was 24 dollars for an egg omlet. I would rather eat at a local McDonalds. Please, dont waste your money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A budget motel would have been better...!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotterboy
Reviews.Content: This W certainly doesn't live up to the usual W reputation! The only attractive thing was the lobby. From there on it was dark (so dark we struggled to find our floor button in the elevators and find stuff in the suitcase in the room!). The service was very average - we waited in the room for over 20 minutes for our bags, then called the concierge to ask where they were to be told the bell boy was on his way. 10 minutes later nothing's arrived so we decided to go into town without waiting for the luggage....only to discover the trolley with our bags still waiting in the lobby!! In the end we took our bags off and took them to our room ourselves - hotel staff saw us do but no one asked any questions or offered any help! We stayed on the 25th floor but it was still so noisy it felt like Times square was inside our room. The hotel should seriously consider changing the windows to proper double glazing. The only nice thing was the Blue Fin restaurant - if you are a fish lover, it's highly recommended. The Whiskey club was fun too, but full of teenagers who were extremely annoying at times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, fun atmosphere, but loud in the morning”
Reviews.Author: FloydtheFeline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for business and when I arrived, was very impressed by the décor and hip atmosphere. The room was clean with excellent amenities (love the Bliss products, flat-screen, beautiful bathroom with wonderful shower). The bed was beyond comfy! However, the morning was really loud: I know the hotel is in Times Square and so I expected some street-level noise. What I didn't expect was the sound of dishes being collected...at 7 am. And the sound of these dishes breaking. And the sound of a cart being rolled down the hallway. And the sound of construction causing the side of the building to shake and make a loud, repetitive squealing noise. Overall, I high recommend the W for a chic and trendy hotel, in the heart of Times Square with fabulous bars (with comfy seats) but I wish that the mngmt were a little bit more mindful of noise early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Experience”
Reviews.Author: NYProud
Reviews.Content: Dark, dingy, cramped, loud and poorly kept property. Way overpriced. Small cramped rooms overfilled with crappy furniture. Claustrophic dark windy corridors. Three different elevator banks poorly marked, very hard to find, ridiculous layout. Loud club music in lobby - even in check in area. Staff young and offer basic, not exceptional service - especially for these rates. Loud, noisy, dirty intersection in Times Square. Only stay here when all other Time Square hotels are full. What a wasted opportunity! Not up to standard of other W Hotel properties - they need help to figure this mess out!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun!”
Reviews.Author: GoodTImes2008
Reviews.Content: FUN! Had a Great weekend with 4 Friends and the W helped make it happen! Beautiful views and fun Lobby bar. Rooms are a bit small, but who stays in their room long in NYC anyway??? Look forward to their renovation. I will be back! I don't recomend for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: kluedtke
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Times Square for business for one night. Overall, it was a decent stay but not as good as I had expected given the price. The decor is very modern like most W hotels but it almost felt like the hotel was trying to hard with the black walls and doors in the hallways (creepy!) and black comforters. The kaleidoscope in the room for looking out the windows was a nice touch and as always I appreciated the high end linens and down comforter. The bathroom was spacious by New York standards and I loved the Bliss toiletries. I accidentally left a pair of pants (blended in with the black comforters...) and called immediately the day I checked out to see if they could be recovered. Three phone calls after that and I never did get the pants back. :( Disappointing to say the least. Pants and black decor aside, the location is stellar - just off Time Square and convenient to the subway too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and reasonable with their specials”
Reviews.Author: Somalley
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend and found the hotel and staff to both be very good. Staff was very helpful and informative with regard to sightseeing locations, how to get to them, and approximate cost depending on transportation. Room was clean and in great condition with a great view of Times Square. Would highly recommend. Some reviews mention that the rooms were small, but it's NYC and we were able to have 2 adults and 2 children in and did not feel cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: captain77
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel Times Square is in the heart of Times Square in Manhattan. It is very convenient to many Broadway theaters and great restaurants. The hotel is very urban chic, with good friendly service. The rooms are somewhat small, but are cozy and nicely kept. The elevators are fast, which is important for such a high rise. The rates are very reasonable for this quality of a hotel in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish”
Reviews.Author: pommychick
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the W TImes Square last summer and was impressed as soon as my car pulled up outside. Immediately greeted by the professional but very friendly and helpful doormen. The lobby is incredibly stylish - the sort of place that would feature in a scene of Sex and the City. Secure lifts to guest rooms with a key card needed to gain access to guest floors. Room itself was decent, perhaps a little smaller than I would have liked, but nothing worth complaining about. I wasn't too sure about the bedding material and have to question whether or not style is more important to the hotel than comfort. Whenever I returned to the hotel at the end of the day, the doorman recognised me and always greeted me. After a certain time at night I saw some people being asked on the door for their room keys, which is always good for security. I can see how the hotel could give off a pretentious air as it does bear some resemblance to a New York City nightclub, but hey - you pay for security and I suppose to an extent some exclusivity! Think this is very much a young adults hotel - there is constant music in the lobby and with the lighting around the hotel it feels like being in a club, even in the middle of the day! I really enjoyed my stay here, and loved the style. I look forward to returning here (or I might try out the W in Union Square next time as I am getting very sick of Times Square!)

Reviews.Title: “Very cool experience - treated like VIP's”
Reviews.Author: MadMax1971
Reviews.Content: You feel like you're visiting a nightclub when you arrive here and true to form, when you get to the check-in on the 7th floor, there's the W bar about 100 feet behind you. The service was excellent as the atmosphere is very casual but professional - they treat you like they're happy you're staying there. We had a flight cancellation and missed out on stand-by for the next flight home, so obviously we were pretty tired and pissed off by this point - 11pm (10 hours in the airport). The gentlemen at reception realized this and made us feel welcome and relaxed. We didn't have any bags (Delta held on to them) so we had no toiletries with us. Within 5 minutes of getting into our room they had delivered two sealed black paper bags, which were his and her toiletry packs with toothpaste, deodorant, hair products, razors and shaving cream. The room is small but decorated very well - very modern. Sliding door from washroom with frosted glass. Shower needed to be sealed as the water basically poured out through the glass door - had to use 3 towels to mop up. This is located right in Times Square but for the night we stayed there, it didn't feel like it at all. Obviously, walking distance everywhere and restaurants all over the place (chain and others). Would definitely go back here!

Reviews.Title: “too dark”
Reviews.Author: uxj
Reviews.Content: I've booked this to be close to Time Square for New Year's Eve (you need to book a restaurant table to get access without standing in the cold for hours). Food in the hotel restaurant was creative and good. The hotel room was surprisingly spacious, but the whole hotel is incredibly dark - some may consider this stylish, but when I have difficulties finding the right button in the elevator, I draw the line. None of the computers in the business center worked, but concierge was very helpful in printing my boarding pass. Overall not a bad hotel, but there are better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible W New York Hotel”
Reviews.Author: masonNewYork
Reviews.Content: Horrible, horrible, horrible. Dark corridors. Dirty carpets, and dirty walls. Noisy very noisy. Can't wait to check out after a night's stay

Reviews.Title: “Urban cool, but looking tired round the edges”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: Located right in the centre of Manhattan off of Times Square, The W clearly positions itself as the epitome of cool. Certainly, your welcome experience bears this out - the beautiful water feature as you enter, the stunning lounge area on the 7th floor and the genuine easy going and friendly welcome from the staff (who are, of course, way better dressed than you are.) Beyond the lobby, others have noted that the decor veers toward the dark and the industrial. The corridors in particular are like peculiar black holes; mildly off-putting, but the general calming effect does make some sense - and it's unlikely you'll spend much more than a few seconds in those areas as you're passing through. First impressions of the room itself were positive - if you can get over the fact that the room itself was disappointingly small for the price, but overall, the 'cool' vibe carries through - flatscreen HDTV, glass desk, views over Time Square, mood lighting and so on. The bathroom is well appointed with a great shower and refreshingly, a good set of toiletries, including a decent face wash to clear off all that New York grime. The bed was simply one of the best I've had in a hotel - and it needs to be, with the hustle and bustle of Times Square outside doing their best to keep you awake. Alas, after a short while of being in the room you begin to notice that the shine and gloss wears thin quite rapidly and it's clearly evident that the rooms are in dire need of a major facelift. Wallpaper peels from the corners of walls, dust is collecting on the skirting board, the air vents haven't been cleaned in months. The taps in the bathroom are dull and tarnished; the sink has cracks from years of use. The lamps are yellowing, the cover of your complimentary 'soothing' CD looks like it was found at the bottom of the bargain bin of the Virgin Megastore across the street. In a low key hotel at a cheaper price, you'd probably let these things pass - but in a premium hotel at a very premium rate, the lack of attention to detail was unforgivable. Clearly, the rest of clientéle - a mix of fashionistas, media types and "Sex in the City" wannabes - seemed happy enough, but then again, they probably weren't fretting about who was footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “W Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: VegasBizTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Perfect W experience! Great location, helpful staff, great room!

Reviews.Title: “One of the hotel features: overbooking”
Reviews.Author: john_mitchell_g21
Reviews.Content: This review will be very short. We were 2 couples and decided to spend a weekend at the W for a birthday event. We get there to check in and the receptionist tell us to come back later because the rooms were not ready yet. We called before coming back and we were told the rooms were clean and the keys were ready. As soon as we got there, they finally tell us they had a computer problem and that all the rooms suddenly happened to be all taken. What a service.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1011
Reviews.Content: The room is one of the smallest I have ever seen. They make the Microtel seem spacious. It's hard to pull off the modern contemporary look when the property is so dated. It has that 70's style of "contemporary". The location is unbeatable. The price is outrageous even by New York standards. The only thing positive I can say is that the Blue Fin restarant was great. Excellent food and great service at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: pop10
Reviews.Content: I was booked in this hotel by Starwood Corporate after my original stay at the Sheraton Manhattan at Times Square went all wrong (see my post there for full details.) Having stayed at many W hotels in the past, this one ranks up with one of the best. The suite I was in was absolutely beautiful. It had a very large bedroom, 2 full bathrooms, living room, two large screen tvs, multiple sound systems... the works. The best part of this room is that it is the only room with a full balcony. It has an amazing view, and is perfect for anyone looking to entertain up to two dozen people comfortably. You are separated from all the other rooms, so you can be sure your partying will not disturb any of your neighbors. Also the balcony comes in handy for those who smoke, as all the rooms are non-smoking. The club in the basement of the hotel is okay, tho never drew a very big crowd. There is a great bar in the main lobby area of the W (3rd floor), and a great place to unwind. The restaurant has some great food (sushi blend), but expect to pay the usual NYC fares. The room service is on par with the restaurant, and can satisfy almost any need at anytime. This goes along with the W's motto: Whatever, Whenever. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking to stay in Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaBender
Reviews.Content: I am originally a New Yorker, so going back and seeing how Times Square has changed in 30 years is great and I Love N.Y. The past few years we stay at the W-Times Square-used to stay at the Paramount now the W. When it opened;WOW.!! This year it just started to seeem like it needed a bit of work. The carpet had small stains, the rooms hadn't changed in at least 3 years, and the bar that we love (BLue Fin ) which has a great corner view jutting out onto Times Square and all enclosed in glass needs to replace the chipped glass chair stools. Honestly I love this hotel, I go every year but would hope Management recognizes it's time for a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “W Times Square is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: castut
Reviews.Content: The main purpose for my trip to NYC was to see "Grease" at the Brooks Atkinson theater, with Taylor Hicks in the role of Teen Angel. After weighing the options (closeness to the theater being foremost), I chose W Times Square. And I am so glad I did! The theater and the hotel are in the same block. This is a very hip place to stay, located in Midtown and the Theater District. Though the hotel and most of the nice eateries around it are pricey, it was worth it. Also, it is convenient for sightseeing via the hop-off/hop-on double-decker bus tours - there's a stop right around the corner from the hotel, by the Roxy Deli (the size of those sandwiches!). The W staff was fantastic. My room was quite comfy. As I mentioned, it's a "hip" hotel - mostly a young crowd, so the "living room" (the lobby) was a bit noisy -- but all of NYC is noisy! I really enjoyed my stay, and I look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “W 4 me!”
Reviews.Author: Lilianne
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a long weekend at this hotel, and what a fab time we had. The hotel is situated right in the hub of Times Square. Thought the noise would have been a problem but as we were on the 25th floor and facing one of the side streets, this was unfounded. The room was a twin room with two double beds and an ensuite bathroom. It was a fair size for two people and I could have lived with it longer, if I had the chance!! Fresh towels were provided daily and the bar was stocked well, if a tad expensive. The bliss products in the bathroom were replenished daily and were brilliant. The staff were excellent, friendly and courteous at all times. The bar was a bit expensive although very chic so we preferred the bars out on the square and surrounding areas. Only ever ate breakfast in the hotel and it was okay, plenty of it. We would return to this hotel again as we loved it, the location and the big comfortable beds.......

Reviews.Title: “chi chi hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: SSfamily
Reviews.Content: I am a little old for this brand of hotels but have stayed at this w a few times recently. GREAT LOCATION! GREAT FOOD! You take the elevator up to reception which is a few floors up from the ground. Check in is usually pretty crowded. The on site places to eat are some of the best in area which is packed with hotels because of the theatre district as well as midtown location. Rooms are on the small side but very well designed and comfortable. The hallways are too dark for my taste but it seems to be part of what w defines as cool. Not a lot of benefits for business travelers but the hotel clearly targets young professionals with its bar scene. they have dvd's for borrowing as well as a diverse and tasty room service menu. All in all a nice and comfortable place

Reviews.Title: “It's Alright”
Reviews.Author: hi3655
Reviews.Content: I only live a few minutes away from Times Square and every now and then I will go online and check for hotel bargins. The W comes up often. So my girlfriend and I will check in and be tourists for the night. It's always fun. I like this W but I will pass along some tips. First it is noisy. Expect to hear a drunk or two in the hallway. Second if you have a corner room facing Times Square it will be bright. The hotel needs to install blackout shades badly. Thirdly, it is not as happening as it was a few years ago. The class of people seems to be going downhill quickly. It went from supermodels to baseball capped punks with their girlfriends overnight. ( The W is building in Hoboken. That either means Hoboken is cooler than I thought or that the W is not the brand it used to be). The positives about this hotel? It still has great Time Square views. The staff is still good. The rooms are still cool.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Be”
Reviews.Author: Toe-Knee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel twice - once on pleasure for 5 nights over Thanksgiving in 2007 and once with business for 3 nights in March 2008. My wife travelled with me on both trips and absolutely loved the hotel. The rooms are not large, but I only have the rooms in Asia as a comparison, so they could be large by New York standards. They are equiped with shower, great Bliss tolietries (which are one of the reasons my wife loved the hotel - she has been dedicated to their products ever since), coffee machine and probably the best in-house movie system I have come across. This is great if you want to chill out at night with the Mrs. The mini-bar is expensive but as you leave the hotel on the left hand side is a deli which can serve you breakfast, beer, evening meal or whatever you want, so to be honest we never had to use the mini-bar, if I wanted a drink in the room I just brought up a couple of beers on the way in. As other reviewers have said the lobby area does become a bit of a club/bar at night but this is part of the appeal of the hotel. You have to use the elevator to reach reception and the lobby bar is basically in an open-plan area by reception. There are no windows to the outside so you may feel that you are drinking at 1am when actually it is only 10pm outside. The waitresses are HOT! It is not cheap but not outrageously priced either. The gym is quite small but functional. We ate in the sushi bar on the groundfloor and it was excellent, the bar at the front of the hotel does an excellent seafood platter and combine this with a nice bottle of Sauvignon-Blanc or two and your afternoon is just about full, (as are you). The staff are quite young and very helpful. Friendly, informative and they seem to be genuinely interested in you as a customer. At no point did I feel obliged to tip, to be honest it was a pleasure to do so. The elevators are operated by key-card so security is good. I am one of those people who has to have a window open at night, New York is noisy so if this is you be prepared. If the window was closed the noise was negligent. The hotel is on Times Square which is bright but the blinds on the windows are good. As you would expect there is a good selection of bars and restaurants in the area but the best we tried was Budda Bar in the Meat-Packing District, (take a taxi), it was unbelievable. We also had a great meal in Grand Central Station, I'm sorry but I can't remember the name of the place - its looking over the main concourse. Overall, if you are looking for place to stay as a tourist then I would recommend the hotel. If you are looking for a hotel with large public areas then you may want to try one of the Grand-Dame NYC hotels but you may pay a high price. I would certainly recommend the W Hotel and hope to go back some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great classy place”
Reviews.Author: RedRaider05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 5 nights and absolutely loved the W. It's a great classy place to stay. We had a corner room with views of the Hudson and uptown. Slightly small rooms, not unlike any other New York hotel. Room was always clean. Room service breakfast had amazing Belgian waffles and we got a free bottle of champagne complements of the staff for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Fast”
Reviews.Author: OneTraveling
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square has a great location if you're in the city for theater. Other than that, there are problems... This was my second stay at this property, but the first since 2004. The entry to the hotel is on 47th street, and is only an elevator lobby that takes you up to 7 which is the main lobby (or Living Room) as W likes to say. During the daytime, the lobby is a nice enough space with check in located off in an alcove. At night, the lobby turns into a nightclub. A source of revenue for the hotel - but very limiting to the paying guests who have no public area within the hotel to gather or relax outside of the room. There is also the Whiskey Bar separate from the Lobby on street level (part of Blue Fin Restaurant, I think), but the W feels they also need to turn the lobby into a nightclub as well. It seeems to work for them as it was packed and loud every night. For the hotel guests, it was annoying. The rooms are small and with exception of those ending in 10 or 11, have very limited views (facing either Marriott Marquis or an office building). Rooms ending in 10 & 11 face Broadway north toward Central Park, and if you are on a higher floor, you may even have a Park view. Actually, the rooms ending in 11 seem to have a larger floorplan with a sitting area. There are only 10 rooms per floors with 57 being the highest floor. What I noticed on this visit was how the rooms have aged - not very well. I didn't find them to be dirty, as I had read in previous reviews. Everything was nice & clean. But they did seem very dated. The W is marketed as a trendy, boutique hotel. And they also try to sell a luxury image. I found this hotel failing both categories. The furnishings in the room were pretty beaten up, and just seemed cheap. The 'chair' they use is a white leather-like cube with no arms. Basically, it's an ottoman sitting in the corner with absolutely no function as a chair for lounging. You can physically sit on it, but not for long as it is just not comfortable. Which leaves the bed as the only place in the room to sit. If this were a less expensive property, that would be one thing. But the prices are quite high and this hotel participates in several luxury hotel collections (Amex Fine Hotels being one), which indicates a certain level of luxury and services. With that in mind, I have rated this property with only 3 stars. I'll list a few positives and negatives that stood out: The Good (in addition to location): + Bell Staff were very attentive and seemed genuinely interested in guest service + Nice flat panel TV's with nice range of channels (though only a very few were HD) + A good deli next door, which proved necessary as the Blue Fin restaurant only opened for limited hours. It had good selection of food and reasonable pricing + Comfortable Bed The Bad: - Rooms were small & furnishings were greatly lacking - Very small bathrooms - Lots of noise coming from hallways into the room (seemed like much of it was hotel staff servicing rooms during the day) - No climate control in the rooms (Forget the thermostat on the wall) - Limited usable public space and restaurant choice SUMMARY - Great location for theater and a nice, comfortable bed for sleeping. Not especially trendy, aging fast.

Reviews.Title: “A 'W'onderful Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: SarahBella
Reviews.Content: I took my Mother to New York for a weekend for her 50th Birthday and I really wanted to splash out and stay somewhere very nice and with a good location, and The W was just that! The staff couldn't have been any nicer and wished my Mother a happy birthday apon checking in. Later that night they even sent up a piece of birthday cake and a card. That was the icing on the cake for her. (no pun intended :P) We were on the 46th floor ( In the 'Spectacular room) with a view down onto Times Square, the noise wasn't bad at all since we were so high up, and the room had blackout drapes so all the blinking lights and lit up signs didn't bother us during the night. The beds were oh-so-comfy, and we loved the music that was always playing in our room. We ordered room service for breakfast on both of the days and it was delicious! So well prepared and presented. A real treat :) The check in lounge on the 7th floor was fab, always someone around to help us with our luggage, or questions about the city or simply getting us a cab. (Which can sometimes be a hassle downtown) Anyway! The W was a wonderful choice and we can't wait to have another girls weekend and go back sometime soon :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel despite where it is”
Reviews.Author: Londoner5870
Reviews.Content: I confess: I hate Times Square. It's over-rated and it's impossible to move without falling over particularly dim tourists. I only stayed there because it was convenient for the meetings I was having, and I generally like the Starwood chain for decent hotels and relatively reasonable prices. But The W is actually pretty good. I'm (just) 50 but I liked its modernity and it's well-designed. The rooms aren't particularly big but they're nicely laid-out; and the staff are generally friendly and welcoming. The $8 bottle of water at bedside is one of the less good ideas and they deserve to lose a rating point for that alone, and people who don't like big cities may have found the neon creeping through the blinds at night a bit of a distraction. But generally I liked the corner room I was given --- view of the tacky Square on one side, and the Hudson out to the west --- and I found the food at Breakfast good though certainly not cheap. Overall it was above expectations, and I'd go back on a business trip - though for a vacation I might head either north or south for a touch more civilisation on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough.”
Reviews.Author: janedoe2008
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm not a huge fan of the whole W concept so I may tend to have a negative bias. The negatives first: This hotel tries SO HARD to be hip that it's almost laughable. However, I don't think people who are really hip would ever actually stay in a Times Square hotel. Much less a hotel that is only moderate to high priced by NYC standards. Browsing the gift shop is kind of a giveaway too. Pretty low-end merchandise. The room we had was quite small and the bath room was tiny. The bathroom had a sliding door with a frosted glass panel. It served a dual purpose of seeming hip, while helping to mitigate the tightness of the bathroom. Supposedly our room was an upgrade (and it was a corner room) so the regular rooms must be even smaller. The room was nicely furnished except for some random, cheap-looking throw pillows. Almost all the surfaces in the public areas are black or charcoal gray. This color scheme, combined with the cheesy mood lighting makes it difficult to see. It's annoying, but the W in Murray Hill is even worse as far as that goes (and not as nice in other ways, too). I agree with the other reviewer who said that the bathroom wasn't as maintained as it should have been. If I'm going to have a room that small I want it to be a jewel box. The lobby is an elevator ride up from the front entrance. Then you go to a separate elevator bank to get up to your room. The floors are mislabeled, so that it seems as though you are on a higher floor than you really are. This is only a minor inconvenience. The positives: We had a pretty nice view. The Bliss products that they stock the room with are nice. There is a restaurant right off the front entrance area that is supposed to be pretty fun. There was a pretty long line at check-in and it was handled really, really well. It went quite quickly and the desk staff was friendly and efficient. The bellhops were terrific. Friendly and fast. The concierge was nice, but not all that helpful. He didn't have knowledge of our requests so it was frustrating to watch him surf the internet slower than I could have. However, our requests were probably not standard and we were in a rush, so I can't really fault him. He did the best he could. Housekeeping was also very friendly. Quiet in the halls and they would immediately push the elevator button for you if they saw you coming. A little thing, but evidence of training. Overall, it was a small, dark hotel with trendy decor that only partially distracts from it's shortcomings (lipstick on a pig). But it has a surprisingly nice and professional staff. I would not be disappointed to go back for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Too hip for its own good”
Reviews.Author: AAMiles
Reviews.Content: This is a hip, contemporary hotel in a great location. It is not terribly user friendly. The elevators are dark, and almost all guests (comedically) search for the button to their floor. The lobby/lounge is so noisy and dark (again) that you can't really hear or see. There's public internet access during the day that disappears once the bar starts going. It's a great place to hang out and people watch, though. The food is generally very good, and the bar is overpriced and the service indifferent, but you still don't mind because the crowd is so interesting. The front desk staff is very good and friendly. The wait staff feels like they're doing you a favor by waiting on you. The room I had was spacious and comfortable. My colleague was not so lucky with a cramped and musky room. Expensive, hip, attitudinal. It's a fine place to stay in Times Square, but I'd suggest other parts of the city if you want a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “More Style than Comfort”
Reviews.Author: evans045
Reviews.Content: The W hotel has a great location in Times Square and is hip and stylish, but when my daughter and I stayed there for a shopping and Broadway weekend, we weren't that wowed. First of all, the bathroom was not all that clean, especially on the floor, around the tub, and in all the corners. When you're going to have a white bathroom, it better be clean. We also didn't like the design of the bathroom, which was walled off by white, plastic translucent walls that are far from light- or sound-proof, which creates a lack of privacy as well as a problem if someone is trying to use the bathroom while others are sleeping. I think they were going for some kind of modern look, but I'd far prefer standard, sound-proofed walls! In the sleeping area, many things seemed grimy, dusty, or sticky, including the phones, tables, remote controls and radio. I don't think any of these items had been wiped down for quite some time. The room was quite small, but I would expect that in Times Square. I booked on hotels.com, and paid extra to be put on a higher floor, but didn't get that. The front desk said I needed proof that I had paid extra and hotel.com's receipt is suspicously vague on details, so I had no recourse on this matter. Traffic noise is definitely a problem unless you are on one of the top floors. As to the amenities outside of the room. There is only one lounge area, and it is basically a bar. Not family friendly, and not comfortable if you want to hang out or wait for someone. Also, there was not always a doorman, and on the day we checked out there was no one to help open the door (our hands were full) or to help us flag a cab. All in all, it didn't seem like a very friendly or helpful place, especially to families.

Reviews.Title: “Very so-so”
Reviews.Author: bmm727
Reviews.Content: To be fair - all of the hotels in Times Square (and NYC generally) are massively overpriced and not very nice. The W is no exception. Location is excellent - right in the heart of Times Square...however, the rooms are small, in desperate need of fine touches, the bathroom is old and not very clean and the water pressure is horrible. Internect connectivity is so slow its almost useless. On the upside - the staff is competent if a bit lacking in polish and the bar area of the lobby is a great place to meet people and hang out with your friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for Times Square. Check in was quick, employees were friendly, room was clean, bed was comfortable and the view west was great. Little advice about the bed. What appears to be a padded head board is actually two removable pillows. We didn't realize this until like 2 in the morning when our feet would hang off the bed. So if you think the beds are short they aren't, the head board pillows take up 5 inches of the length of the bed. Second thing, the bottle of water beside the bed has a label on the top "This bottle is provided as a service to our guest. If the consumed a charge will be billed to your room. For your convenience our staff will refresh daily." The bottle of water is $8.00 bucks. [Side note, I have worked in the hotel industry before... sometimes these bottles will have been in the room for months before they are replaced. Unless the bottle of water is complimentary I would suggest not to drink it.] Other than that it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky”
Reviews.Author: lostinpok
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a company event and were thrilled to stay in such a nice place. We had a corner room (2501) with a great view overlooking Times Square. The room was good sized and clean, though there did seem to be hair product or lotion or something on the bathroom sink. The bed was great, very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful enough. The hotel is very secure, you had to use your door key to go anywhere in the elevator and there were lots of staff around. We had a great time at the dance club Whiskey, located beneath the hotel. Though trendy and modern, the place IS dark. The elevators and hallways were incredibly dim. The shower and toilet were pretty noisy when used, but we didn't really hear noise from the rooms around us. The only real issue we had with our stay was discovering a rattle in our car exhaust that wasn't present when we left the car with the valet service. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fan-Tas-Tic”
Reviews.Author: viveleww
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, excellent view from the rooms. We loved the design and the lobby lounge. Staff is very friendly, breakfast great. Especially the door team is great! Rooms small, especially the bathrooms but very well designed, nothing is missing, w had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Trendy, But Very Small Rooms. Older People (45+) Do Not Go Here”
Reviews.Author: tahsir21
Reviews.Content: this was located in a great area. just walking distance from the center of times square. i really liked the location. i did not like how the hotel was so dark all the time. i especially didnt like howsmall the rooms were. the bathroom was 3x3 and the bads were super small.. I do not recommend this for older adults. i would highly recommend for 21-35 year olds. nice furniture

Reviews.Title: “Dark, but funky!”
Reviews.Author: mithu1974
Reviews.Content: Conde Nast Traveller magazine UK edition April 2008 (page 44) gives a description of a hip New York hotel that is so dark the reviewer cannot find a thing. I'm fairly certain he was describing the W Times Square. The walls are all black, and the lift buttons are extremely difficult to see. If you suffer from poor vision, looking for a family hotel or are just plain old, you should probably give this a miss. Luckily my wife and I have excellent vision and are under 40, and we had a great time. The W is achingly hip and makes no apologies for it. The main lobby has a huge stylish bar filled with the young and beautiful of New York which made it quite noisy on the Friday eve we arrived, but I prefer to think of it as full of life. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. We were booked into the 'Wonderful' Room which is their smallest, but they put us into a corner room with great views, and provided complementary cheeseboard and wine. The room was quite small, but in the middle of New York I had no other expectations, neither was it particularly noisy even with the window open. Seriously, I don't understand people who complain about outdoor noise and lights. You are in Times Square, for crying out loud. You don't like noise, stay out of the city, it's as simple as that. I would point out that clothes hooks in the bathroom were seriously lacking, and the bathrooms could do with a touch-up, but nothing deal-breaking. The location is unbeatable, the metro is right across the street and the half-price theatre ticket booth is just around the corner. The concierges are friendly and informative, pointing us toward the best restaurants and bars in the area. There are 2 convenience stores within a 5-second walk of the front door so you can stock up on treats and drinks, rather than the high-price minibar goods. BTW the tapwater is perfectly drinkable, for all those bottled water snobs out there. Later during the stay we moved up to one of the suites on the 53rd floor, fantastic views from here, nothing rivals the Manhattan skyline at sunrise from a King-size bed! We had breakfast at the Blue Fin restaurant twice and it was excellent both times. Much pricier than the nearby deli, but you get what you pay for. We paid about £175 per night and I would definitely check in here again, in fact I'm very keen on checking out other W hotels in the future. Special thanks go to Walter at the front desk for his good cheer and top-class service, and Dana in the Spa for a great massage. In the end, it's the staff that make the hotel wherever you are, and I have no hesitation in recommending the W. Unless you are allergic to black paint, that is.

Reviews.Title: “W times square stands for Wonderful !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hygienist
Reviews.Content: March 16, 2008 Just returned from New York city, to see a broadway show and other attractions, this hotel was fabulous, great location, The hotel staff were fantastic, the hotel is very modern. The room was spotless and a decent size. we had two double and were very comfortable. We were in walking distance to every where we wanted to go. By best friend and her daughter who is fourteen and my daugher who is 13 years old absolutely loved it here and had a great weekend that they will always remember.!!!!!! .

Reviews.Title: “lots of style not much substance”
Reviews.Author: craftymichelle
Reviews.Content: Lighting too dark - even could not read the lift numbers to get to our room. Room was small and dingy (all grey and monochrome). No bath only shower in the room we had. Hardly any space in bathroom for toiletries. Not much space to hang clothes.NO TEA OR COFFE SERVICE IN ROOM and BREAKFAST NOT INCLUDED in our v. expensive room rate. Room service charged ridiculous prices for delivery to room then we had to tip the delivery person as well. All US taxes add a big amount to what you see and what you actually have to pay over. This hotel looked fabulous but the small details let it down. we stayed 3 nights and on our first morning were woken by bedside alarm clock (set by previous occupant) for 5.30 am (we could not find any instructions to turn it off so evenutally had to move bed to unplug it!) .. Very thoughtless of staff not to cancel this sort of thing given they pride themselves on doing whatever / whenever! Ordered room service pizza one night which was DREADFUL - really bad that you can't get a decent pizza esp in New York - we did complain and they (begrudgingly) refunded our account for the value of it but not the point as it spoiled our night

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Krissy7159
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your money saying here. I am a travel agent and have been to New York City on many occasions. I normally stay at the Crowne Plaza Times or Marriott Marquis; however, I wanted to try something different. At check-in everything was fine until we headed up to our hotel room. As I entered the room, the vast space portrayed by images on the hotel's website were merely an illusion. The rooms were very small. The Crowne Plaza and Marriott have much more hotel space and are just as expensive as the W. The staff was rude and the bathrooms were dirty. I complained about the situation at hand and the staff correctly moved me into another room. Although this new room was just as dirty. Neither would I book any of my clients here nor would I ever return to that hotel. Trust me, if you stay here you will be VERY disappointed. Please, do not waste your money on this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: CPLeary
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W hotel for our anniversary. We were greeted in the pouring rain by one of the valets carrying an umbrella who helped us with our bags which was not easy. We were directed to go to the Lobby which is on the 7th floor. Check in was quick and we were able to get in our room right away. The room is a decent size with Bliss Spa amenities, flat screen, view of Times Square (blackout curtains so you can sleep at night) and a very comfortable bed. We went to the Lobby Bar for a drink and Blue Fin to grab lunch. Service was amazing and friendly. The location is perfect for shopping, going to the theater or just about anything. The only thing I have to complain about which is very minor, but how about updating the hair dryers! :) I would suggest bringing your own. Overall a fantastic stay. I think I found my new home when I stay in NY!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: David_Butler
Reviews.Content: I originally wanted to stay at the Westin Times Square but due to a sudden price increase looked elsewhere. I had read some pretty mixed reviews about the W Times Square but how wrong they were. We arrived at the hotel November 15th 2007, around 1:30pm and were greeted from the moment we stepped out of the cab; asked if we wanted our bags seen to which I declined and were told that the check-in lobby was in the 7th floor (I think!) how anyone can not know this is beyond me considering it tells you in the elevator! The downstairs and check-in lobby are beautifully decorated, upstairs had a nice atmosphere and there was someone at each check-in point for which we waited only waited a few minutes. Asked why we were in NY etc I told him it was my girlfriends birthday and were given a corner room on the top floor of the hotel with great views and offered a bottle of champagne. The room itself is very modern, was clean and everything in working order, the bed was amazing and didn't want to leave. Minibar is a ripoff but what hotel isn't? We ate in the Blue Fin restaurant downstairs for both breakfast and dinner and both the food and service was fantastic. Only went in the lobby bar once just because we spent most nights out and about or were too tired, it was quite lively but not overally so and had no problems then or any other night with the atmosphere or outsiders. On check-out I filled in the quick form and left our bags with the desk while we spent the rest of the day out, on return out bags were promptly returned and we left the hotel in a taxi treated as well as when we arrived. Although perhaps slightly geared towards younger couples of singles we saw plenty of mixed age groups including families with children, overall we had a great time and would definatley stay again.

Reviews.Title: “W is for What a rip off”
Reviews.Author: porscheturbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business. Lobby is on the 7th floor and the rooms are TINY and not very clean. For $369 plus tax they had the courtesy to charge $8 for a bottle of water. A rip off even for Manhattan standards.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary design but outdated building”
Reviews.Author: KandDinDC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent three evenings at the W Hotel Times Square in New York. We are frequent travelers who prefer upscale hotels with excellent amenities. Having stayed at several W Hotels before (including another W Hotel in New York), we were excited about our upcoming stay. Our rate was approximately $400 per night but included a bonus third night free. The hotel is in an excellent location in the heart of Times Square. The check-in service was quick, though it can be a bit like trying to order a drink in a crowded club (the desk is located just across from the hotel’s very active bar). You also begin to notice how dark everything is, including the lobbies and the elevators; if you are a person who craves sunlight, your time here will not be pleasant. Once in the room I found it to be an acceptable size (based on NYC standards) and nicely finished. The furniture is contemporary and sleek with a touch of ‘wow’ factor. The bathroom is well done but lacks privacy. Only a thin plastic wall and matching door separate it from the rest of the room, offering little barrier to light and sounds. Also, the bed used is a far cry from the Heavenly Bed used in other Starwood offerings, offering a surface far below most pillow top mattresses. One item that came to be an issue during my stay was the temperature and ventilation control for the room. I’ve read other mentions of problems here on the site and it seems to not be an isolated issue. You may have no problems at all in your room, or you may find yourself in a mini-sauna for the durations of your visit… it’s a gamble. Another issue this hotel does it’s best to deal with (and gets mixed results for) is the noise level. Double-pane windows keep much of the city noise out, but thin doors mean that you will hear the neighbors as they come and go. Mixed reviews also have to go to the hotel staff. Nice touches abound (such as cupcakes and hot chocolate at the front desk) but a lack of willingness/ helpfulness in addressing problems result in low overall marks for service. After staying in some excellent W Hotel/Starwood properties, as well as some other good NYC hotels, I can only recommend the W Times Square to those who wish for easy access to the hotel’s on-site nightlife. Despite the convenient location and ultra-hip decor, it cannot make up for the glaring problems at the high price level.

Reviews.Title: “liked but getting aged”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: like this hotel been there several times must say first time was opening year so it made a strong impression in us loved the bar/rest at street level and lobby/bar also expensive gift shop, still listen very often to several cd bought there rooms little small but liked the bath window connected last visit room looks very worn think it needs a full rebuild in order to keep the original level its a trendy/worn hotel for young people location is unbeatable in times square

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Worst Staff”
Reviews.Author: tkimomj
Reviews.Content: I planned my NY trip 4 months ahead and I made my hotel reservation 3 months before. Everything was going fine, made my confirmation call to make sure my reservation is good.... however when my friends and I arrived at the hotel, the staff (not kind, no smile) began to look for other available rooms on her computer. Later she was saying, "We ran out of the rooms you reserved, if you like to get the room you reserved, you have to wait till we give you a call" When I asked her how long, she just said we have to wait till they give us a call. (wow, unbelievable) What is the point of making a reservation? Yes, people make reservation so that they do not have to wait for their room at arrival. Still at this moment, there was no apology from this staff. After complaining for 5 mins, I was able to talk to their 'manager' and he was busy trying to explain what was happening instead of apologizing. After another complaining for 5-10 mins, the manager ended up calling the cleaning lady to clean up our room in hurry. 3 months ahead-Reserved room, not ready? Never seen this before. After 40 mins of waiting in the lobby we were able to get our room. On the 3rd day, at 2 am in the morning, fire alarm goes off and put all the people in panic. Couldn't sleep. Service- zero Staff- zero

Reviews.Title: “Wow or Waste of Time?”
Reviews.Author: kim4
Reviews.Content: WE booked the "W" then I looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor . As they were mixed I felt nervous that I'd booked the right hotel! We arrived and all the doorman were brill ( Thankyou "TJ") The hotel is very modern and contempory. You walk through the lobby and get the lift to the 7th floor where the reception is! We was told that our room was on the 40th floor. We had to put our room card in a slot in the lift then press our floor number. I dissagreed with other reports that some thought this was too much and a pain! I loved the extra security as we were 3 women alone and knowing that you could only use the lift if you had a room key was a comfort! We had a fab room on the 40th floor overlooking "Broadway" which was great! The room was modern, very comfortable beds with everything we needed and quiet, we didn't have any noise at all! .I agree with other reports that the corridoors are dark,as they're keeping the flow of the modern feel, and if you suffer from poor vision then perhaps this isn't the hotel for you! All in all would I go back? Yes I would! My 15 year old daughter would love this hotel ! It's perfectly placed for all the shows which are within mins walking distance! The "Blue Fin" restaurant is good with live "Jaz music" and the hotel bar is buzzing!

Reviews.Title: “A Hip Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveller12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the W Times Square in December. We picked this hotel becuase it was hip and modern and felt that it would provide the experience that we were looking for, while costing the same as other hotels in the area. Loved: - the location in Times Square, within walking distance to Rockerfeller Center (Top of the Rock, NBC Studios, Saks), 5th Avenue, Radio City Music Hall, Broadway , MOMA etc. and many great restaurants (Bobby Van's and Carmine's) and shopping - the bar on the 7th floor was always busy with hotel patrons and the after work crowd and a great place to hang out after dinner. - the hotel was clean - the music in the elevators and in the room (CD) - the comfortable bed! - the big shower - the complimentary Bliss bath and body products! - the view from the 39th floor of the Wonderful room After reading the reviews, and looking through the pictures, we were prepared for what we got- it's not luxurious, but it definitely has a young, hip feel to it. This is not a classic hotel- the hallways are black and the reception is on the 7th floor along with the bar- so it's really important to decide what type of experience you are looking for. This hotel may not be ideal for older travellers looking for a contemporary experience and those with kids. Overall, we were very happy with our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fading Fast”
Reviews.Author: 8Track
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the W Times Square probably 20 times over the last three years, and reluctantly, I have decided not to go back until they renovate or make changes. Here are the key problems: 1. Rooms have deteriorated badly. They have become markedly dirtier, and are fraying everywhere. Desk chairs are broken, and furniture is chipped and worn. Lightbulbs don't work, and walls are scuffed. Hall carpets and walls are dirty, so it is probably a good thing they have very dim lighting. Many rooms smell of smoke. 2. Despite my going there very frequently, and being an SPG premier member, I never receive any benefit from the hotel -- in contrast to the W Union Sq, which upgrades me and provides little comps. Every time I go, it is like the first time I have ever been there as far as they are concerned. 3. Don't bother with the Whiskey, downstairs, which is ten years past its prime. The best things about the place remain the sushi and food at Blue Fin, and the location. Options have expanded in the Times Square area, however, so I would look elsewhere. If you like W hotels, the W Union Square is the best one they have in the city by a longshot.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay at another W”
Reviews.Author: CantabCambridge_MA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night over Thanksgiving. This was apparently our 5th stay under my name as the hotel gave us a small gift marking the occasion (a set of thick cards covering walking tours of different parts of NY -- very neat & useful). The rooms are small but the interiors are arranged well enough that they are quite functional. I find the W beds to be very good. Not so much for the sheets & duvet -- which are good but nothing exceptional -- but for the firm mattress.
