We were celebrating our 10th anniversary & the hotel staff surprised us with a corner room on the top (57th) floor. Stunning views! They also had a small plate of chocolate-dipped strawberries in the room with happy anniversary written in chocolate -- a very nice touch. We didn't stay in the room very much or use the hotel's facilities extensively on this stay. I used the gym, which is small but has well-maintained equipment. (We've eaten breakfast, lunch and dinner at Blue Fin in the past and enjoyed the food. I actually look forward to room service at this hotel as the quality is good and the selection extensive.) The doormen & desk staff were friendly & had no attitude whatsoever -- rare in a somewhat stylish hotel in NY! The location is a plus or a minus, depending on what one is looking for. It works well-enough for us -- we can walk to the park & get downtown easily enough via cab. We'll surely stay again, though we wouldn't bring our daughter along due to the small rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Starwood or W standards”
Reviews.Author: klincali
Reviews.Content: The staff was not very friendly although the security & concierge were helpful. The rooms were worn out, small, with bad lighting. I stayed at another W Hotel in New York and it was much nicer. I would not stay here for the price. It is a 3-star hotel at best for a 4-star price, and given W's 4.5 star reputation, it was a huge let down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelsQld
Reviews.Content: I think your experience at this hotel is really the luck of the draw. It's in a fabulous location, obviously, but very different. The lobby is on the 7th floor, elevators open out into what we dubbed as "the dicso". Very funky, dim lighting, vibrant reception staff. Trendites everywhere. We had two different rooms, as due to flight changes, they couldn't add another night onto our original eight-night booking. We had to have separate bookings - & a separate room, which we found a little ridiculous with today's technology! The promised 'personal transfer' of our baggage after the first night into the new room never occured. By 4pm, no move, no new room etc. After shaking them up, we were eventually moved to another room nearby on the same floor. The elevators and corridors (as per other comments), are certainly very dim. Our corridor (37th floor) always smelled badly of old kitchen/garbage smells. On a positive note, the beds and pillows are fabulous and very comfy. On the negative side, our room was extremely stuffy and the aircon had one temp. "Hot and Stuffy"!. We complained several times but it was never fixed, or perhaps could not be. Therefore, we had bad nights' sleep as it was so warm, but to open the window (which we did often) was extremely noisy with the traffic and continual sirens from the street below. Also, in our 8 nights in this room, three bulbs went, bedside and two in the bathroom. We had to continually ask for them to be replaced, one in the bathroom was never replaced and it is so dim in there it made it even dimmer! Also, there is very little place in the bathroom or the room for that matter to place your goodies. Shelfless, modern, grey, clutter free design I suppose. No sofa or comfy chair to sit on - only your bed. As I noted above, your experience here would be luck of the draw as a girlfriend who travelled with us had the opposite problem with her aircon in her room, 10 floors above. It was blowy and cold! It's a fine place to stay if you like the dim, mod look, location is great, clean, staff friendly and bright (you don't get this from too many New Yorkers it seems!). Just bring a torch!

Reviews.Title: “overrated, worn out and dirty”
Reviews.Author: molar67
Reviews.Content: We've had a corner room (3907) for several days just before New Year's Eve. The room has W's typical bed, which was quite comfy. The flat-screen TV was also OK, decent choice of free TV and pay-per-view. The concierges were helpful and friendly, though you have often to wait 10-15 minutes. However, that's about all the praise for this hotel. Now for the bad part: The walls are really really thin, so if your neighbour is coughing, you'll check if he might be standing in your room. 3907 is right next to the ice-machine and the ice-machine-room-door is not closing properly, so you'll hear quite some banging. The bathroom is tiny and hasn't been properly cleaned in ages (water stains everywhere). The TV-sideboard has a 5-inch-gap between the drawers and the mini-bar - that gap was probably the dirtiest place I have seen in any hotel in the past few years. The glass-table was also as dirty as one could imagine it to be; the fingerprints that were there upon arrival were still there upon departure. Many people bring pizzas or coffee from the neighbourhood into the hotel, so don't be surprised to see all the fast-food junk in the corridor (and don't let me even mention the smell). W makes a big deal about its design - don't let it fool you. Design translates here into minimalism in all aspects, not into quality. I believe that there are better hotels at much better rates, even considering the W's prime location. And, lest I forget: We've left our luggage for storage (our flight home was only in the early evening) and had to learn that they were unable to retrieve it. After some searching, it turned up: dumped and unattended in a darker corner of the lobby. Not something you want to see if your laptop and other valuables are in the trolley. No excuse from the staff - they couldn't have cared less.

Reviews.Title: “W must stand for the "Worst"?”
Reviews.Author: Philee48
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at the condition of this place. I've had very nice experiences in the past with hotels in the Starwood chain so it was unbelievable to me that there was mold in the shower...:disgusting "crud" around the baseboards , a light fixture in the shower that was hanging off the wall.....and the room was so hot we couldn't sleep. They were nice enough to bring us a fan and tell us to "just open our windows"......a great idea for a restfull night in the middle of Times Square huh? No question, it's very convenient to theatre and good restaurants but so are lots of other places . So, if you are over 25 and not into the "disco-prison" decor, I'd advise avoiding it. There are lots of places near by, for less/or the same money and a lot cleaner and comforting after a great day in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Worn Out”
Reviews.Author: Opinioned_traveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation with our three children. The W Times Square is not a great place to be with young children and we would discourage any family with young children from staying there. We were quite disappointed with the lack of cleanliness at the W Times Square. The bathrooms were filled with grime and grit. The rooms were dusty and the furnishings were tattered. Even though we complained, it took about three phone calls and 48 hours for the bathrooms to be cleaned properly. One of the light fixtures in the room was missing a bulb and it was never replaced during our stay. We did, however, find that the concierge at the W was extremely helpful and had good restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for Way Cool!”
Reviews.Author: Tashatart
Reviews.Content: We were unsure whether to book the W or the Sofitel in New York for July 4th weekend. In the end we chose the W for the location. We were not disappointed! The hotel is super cool and in quite a nice spot in Times Square. The front desk upgraded us to the top floor corner room with a great view of the river - for free! They were so nice. The room was clean, a comfortable size and very trendy. Its a great place to stay if you want something different and fun. Good counter/desk space for a business traveller and enough of the noise and bustle for a tourist. BTW - go to the bar on the same level as the front desk. Awesome martini's and even those who don't drink can appreciate the ambiance. We had family come to meet us and they arrived early so they could hang out!

Reviews.Title: “Ultra modern and very dark!!”
Reviews.Author: CookieKent
Reviews.Content: Hotel W Times Square is a great location for being fairly central for everything you need. This was my 11th trip to NY and I have to say by comparison, the worst hotel, I would not go back. However, the bed was very comfortable with nice feather pillows etc (but you get that now in Marriotts and Milleniums aswell). The view was ok (get better views at the Millenium UN Plaza) The whole hotel was very dark, black corridors, walls,ceiling and floor, bedrooms had all grey walls, woodwork and duvet covers and the rooms had seen better days and needed a bit of a revamp (not nearly as good as the Hotel W in San Francisco). If you like a bath check when you book as not all rooms have bath tubs, also Times Square has LOTS of flashing lights and again, you may want to either pick a quieter location or check where the room is. Overall it was ok, but have stayed at better hotels for the price and personally it was all a bit to grey for me!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and experience”
Reviews.Author: MikeOxford_CT
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 1-night visit in the middle of December to experience NYC and see all the sites during the holiday season. It's certainly a must if you are going to visit NYC. The lobby was sleek and stylish and the front desk was helpful. The rooms are great and even have the heavenly soft beds (haven't slept that good in a long time). Our view over looked the Reuters building (NYC skyline) and you can see Times Square but understand you are about a block away. Probably the only time I had no problem with paying (over $300/night) and this hotel is definitely worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: DirtyDiva
Reviews.Content: As I sat in the lobby waiting for the front desk to sort out my payment, I took in the sights of the extremely fake porters complimenting all the women who came in and fishing for tips (they preyed mostly on the older crowd who looked like they had money). It was quite sickening. When I finally got to go to my room, the door was directly across from the elevator (I'm talking, step out of the elevator, take one step and have your face in my door.) The hallway was black with very bad lighting. Definitely form over function - have your key out before you get off the elevator. In the room, the furniture was old and battered and the sink had huge cracks in it. The bed was very comfortable but that was the ONLY saving grace and definitely not worth the $600 they were charging per night. Hopefully I won't have to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced worn out hotel”
Reviews.Author: trrbostn
Reviews.Content: The hotel is over priced and run down. Our towels were frayed, dead roaches on the floor and on our bed, chrome racks in the bathroom rusty, bathroom vents and the floor were dirty. Furniture worn and overall a poor experience. My wife and I will never go to another W Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “W-onderful Time”
Reviews.Author: GeneDC
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a busy pre-Christmas get away with my 5 year-old son. The W was perfect! The location excellent for the shows and access to all the NYC Christmastime events. I wouldn't necessarily think of this as a "family" hotel however, it worked for us. Room was comfortable, amenities were all from Bliss. Hotel staff were gracious and overly outgoing to my son. The Blue Fin restaurant at breakfast was delicious and reasonable for a NYC restaurant. I thought this was superior to the W New York.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern decor in awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Angemade
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on the room, which is regularly around $500 and we paid $279. The location, of course, is great. The hotel is sleek and modern which I prefer. The entry is cool if a little small, and the lobby is, too. The room was a decent size and very clean. The design is trendy and unusual. I would stay again for the price, but wouldn't pay over $500 for this room. Everyone on the staff was very friendly-someone even came around just to make sure we were enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: pdrcpa
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the worst hotel for the price I have ever stayed in. I planned a surprise birthday weekend for my husband and another couple and decided to splurge and get the "fantastic suite" for each couple at a price tag of almost a thousand a night with all the tax and fees. To begin with, we were not able to check into our room until after 4 which was a serious problem as we had formal dinner reservations with a coctail party beginning at 5pm. It wasn't until I was nasty that they miraculously found the rooms were available. I had explained the same earlier in the afternoon and they said it would be no problem, but they kept moving the checkin time in 30 minute increments. Second, there was no coffee pot in the room! So the first morning when I looked around to make some coffee there wasn't a pot. I called and was informed that I could get it from room service. I figured that with the $5 delivery fee plus tax and tip it would have cost $20 for the pot of coffee. Ridiculous! Third, the rooms were so dark (supposedly romantic) that you couldn't even read a book. The elevators were so dark that you had to use the brail to figure out which button to push. Fourth, while I understand that they were trying to increase security, you had to use your room key to go up in the elevator. This is okay but they didn't work half the time. I tried to go down 2 floors to have coffee (from Starbucks) with our friends and had to go down to the lobby and be escorted up to my room, show ID, before I could get a new key. What a pain. I guess i could go on and on about the uncomfortable furniture, the bathrooms where nothing would stay on the sink or back of the toilet, but I guess I have said enough. I will NEVER stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and expensive with fabulous view”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly attracts a different crowd than other touristy hotel. The accent here is on the hip and cool. You can feel it the moment your cab stop at the front entrance. The service is a polite and friendly manner. The lobby is located on the 7th floor in a multicolor bar on the right and the 4 check-in desks on the left. My SPG status scored me a corner room on the 48th floor which a separate rows of speedy elevators brings me there in an ear-popping instance. The elevator and hallway is club-level lighting using spot lights, good for eyesights training. Unfortunately, in the her speedy time to get off the clock, the check-in lady has given me the wrong key to the wrong room. Another speedy ride down the lobby took care of it. My WOW Fabulous room or whatever it is called is well as hip as the entrance. The dark spa-like tone is accented with some trendy touch here and there (white reading couch and red fluffy pillow). The room is larger than the usual NY room but just by a tiny bit. The two large windows flanking each corner provides good daylight to fill the room. The business desk gives a partial direct view down to Broadway (and the building in front) on one side and a great view to the Hudson river on the other (my favorite view). The windows can also be opened (limited) to remove stale air if needed. The room is equipped with a clock-CD alarm and a nice 32" LG LCD screen with more HD programming than I have seen elsewhere. On the bad side, the wall is paper-thin and when you have noisy neighbor, the street sound is next to nothing. The W bed is fabulous, it tied with the Westin Heavenly Bed as my favorite. Turn-down service is performed every day around 6-7PM and the "Not Now" sign is observed. The bathroom is either an exercises of industrial coolness or just trying too hard to be different. I feels that it is more on the former, the attention to the details are not there: the sink is cracked, the shower leaks, screws are exposed. This is not the level of a $600/night room should look like even if it is in the middle of NY. The saving grace is the bath amenities, the Bliss products are superb. A warning for bathtub lovers, there is only standing showers. On the service side, after check-in in, I was thirsty and found that the VOSS water bottle seal has been broken but the bottle is full. I think the previous guess decided that the $4/bottle was too expensive after using it. I called down to the guest service twice but no-one answered, so much for the whenever-whatever service. I let the check-in desk know the next day and by the time that I left, the same water bottle is still there. On my third day, the ice-machine next to my door broke down and spill water all over the front of my door. A call downstairs and a noisy fan was put in to dry it up. The only thing is that they did not shut it off and I had to come out around 11PM to pull the cord so that I can go to sleep. The Blue Fin restaurant serves decent food. I once forgot my wallet on the table while going to my room to get my phone and my waiter noticed it and hide it for me, nice service here. Location wise, it is one of the hot properties in Times Square but getting a cab in rush hour can be a killer. In short, if you want a hip weekend stay, this may be the place for you. Otherwise, there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Cool lobby”
Reviews.Author: katiew73
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from 4 days honeymoon in New York staying at the W Hotel on Times Square. We got an upgraded room on the 53rd floor which had dual aspect windows overlooking Times Square. The room was fantastic with a huge bed and the bathroom was really cool. The only problem was the noise of the air-con units from the other hotels, it was really loud and with the sound of the traffic as well, ear plugs were needed. I know that Times Square is loud, but be warned! Don't expect too personal a service as the lobby has a very popular bar in it which non-guests use a lot, but the staff were only to pleased to help and we also got a complimentary bottle of champagne as it was our honeymoon. It wasn't cheap because of it's location, we paid $500 per night, but it was so handy for Broadway shows and shopping and you can easily see the big W on the side of the hotel if you can't remember the block number! Bags can be left before and after check-in for as long as needed and if it's raining they'll loan you an umbrella for the day. All together a very good place to stay, if a little pricey, but if you're only staying for a few days then it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Bring a Flashlight”
Reviews.Author: DexterGarner
Reviews.Content: The Fantastic Suite was a bit shy of fantastic. My wife and two daughters stayed for three nights. The location of the W is a big plus however it is unlike any hotel i have ever stayed in. The check in lobby is really a bar. The check in desk is tucked behind a wall in the bar on the 7th floor. It is so dark, it was a hit and miss in the elevator of over 50 floor buttons to choose from. The halls are a total black out. The rooms are very dark also especially the bathroom. The rooms were not very clean either. The bed was so uncomfortable it was hard to sleep. However if highlighters, scotchtape and a stapler are something you require during your stay they were in the room. The guys that worked the street door were great but from there on I would not reccomend this place. I will not stay there again. If you do bring a flashlight or learn braille.

Reviews.Title: “expensive frat house”
Reviews.Author: cdoull
Reviews.Content: Toronto/Canada Just came back from three nights at the w times square for which I paid 569. a night. The location is great . The entrance small but nice. There the positive ends. The staff are like the cast of a bad play. With the exception of one very nice young women at the concierge desk. THE ROOMS ARE FILTHY! The first room we were given had a broken door, dirty floors and and an unclean sink and toilett. Sent us up to the 54 th floor with an adjoining room door where we had the privledge of listening to a couple argue and vomit one night and have noisy sex the next. The lobby or living room as they like to call it is a noisy dark bar filled with people who drink to the point of vomitting. The decor is cheap and unattractive with a side of uncomfortable. The robes are cheap nylon blend and seldom laundered. The bathrooms are the dirtiest I have ever seen in a hotel. Overcharged me on my bill. We didn't try the restaurants but they were always empty even when other places had line ups. This is the worst hotel I have stayed at in any country. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Very chic”
Reviews.Author: youngaussie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my girlfriend during one of our first stays in New York (decided to look into the Westin after). The hotel is extremely chic and very trendy! Starting from the entry lobby off Broadway in Times Square (very, very, very good location!!) to the lobby upstairs... This hotel knows how to be trendy and elite! The room was standard, but a corner room. It had a very modern Japanese feeling to it. Everything was jet black, including the dark hallways, and quite small feeling. The music CD provided was a nice touch and provided good background music during time in the room. The one thing that I didn't like was the bathroom. The walls and door were made of a thin Japanese paper like material that didn't block sound and was just translucent. The bathrooms were by definition, "chic," but wish they were more practical. The drinks in the lobby bar were very good. A good place to grab a drink to start off your big night in the city. Concierge was pretty helpful, although he always seemed busy. The check in people were fast and did a good job. I would recommend this hotel to young, hip couple-travellers, but families and tourists should steer clear! For the same price you could get a room at the Westin that's 2x larger.

Reviews.Title: “Wicked W”
Reviews.Author: Mkeyl
Reviews.Content: A five night visit to New York with our twin daughters to congratulate them on A level success before they go off to University. I researched lots of hotels and as their reaction to the W was "wicked" sounds like I got it right. (Funny how our language is changing.) Minimalistic design is the current trend and is quite appealing, particularly with the younger generation. Reception at the door very friendly, staff at front desk efficient and helpful, other staff we met just the same. First impressions really good and remained so throughout our stay. Our bedroom was large, the attached living room with sofa bed large also, good facilities, impressive view of Broadway, very well positioned for easy access to all the sights. New York certainly knows how to take your money from you. The W is priced similar to most NY hotels of this standard but it's expensive nevertheless, we didn't use the restaurant because of cost but it was also more fun to dine out especially with such a great choice of deli's nearby. If you stay in Times Square you've got to like lights, crowds and music but it's a fascinating place to be and the hotel provides a very modern, sophisticated and quiet retreat. Go for it! Mike Bayliss Cheshire. UK.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: JEZEBELNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: We are just an average couple, both work very hard, vacations are few and far between and we had a great time at this hotel. After staying at cheaper hotels in Manhattan in the past (bear in mind high rate where we come from would be $120/night so we thought $200 wouid be sufficient - NOT!!), security was a big thing for us and we felt comfortable at this hotel. We read that the rooms were small, but we found them average size. Staff were VERY friendly and accomodating. We are not pretentious and certainly not hip, but we had a great time :).The bed was great, the cleaning staff were immaculate, the Bliss bath products were lovely and we had a pretty good view of Times Square. If you are a fragrance person, you will appreciate the cool aroma of gardenias (??) after a long day of trapsing a not always "rosy" smelling city. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “very modern”
Reviews.Author: katOhio
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great modern hotel. Everything is a little dark because of the style but this is a happening hotel. The bar in the Lobby was awesome. Good location and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and were very pleased with the staff responsiveness to all requests. They have an excellent can-do attitude which was refreshing. The rooms are small with minimalistic decor. The bathrooms are very tiny- with a stall shower and no countertop space for personal toiletries. We found space for our stuff on the rack below the sink. The bed was very comfortable, decent closet space with safe, and the Bliss amenities were excellent. The location is terrific located on 47th just off Broadway so everything was accessible by foot. The only problems we noted were the connecting room doors are very thin and we heard every conversation held next door- and the dark hallways and elevators, while attractive made it difficult to navigate. We'd stay there again, but would suggest if you are older and/or have any vision problems e.g., reading menus in candlelight, you'll have problems in the elevators and hallways so consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tries Too Hard to be Hip”
Reviews.Author: Journalistical
Reviews.Content: My 20-something wife and I stayed here for a weekend getaway to celebrate her birthday, and were very impressed with the location and friendly service. Unfortunately, even with these factors working for it, W New York - Times Square tries too hard to be trendy and ends up pulling off a forced style that's neither cutting-edge nor inviting. The hotel's futuristic "living room" felt more like a nightclub than a lobby, and the pulsating techno music and light show blasting on the suspended pillars only added to this effect. Another thing that hit us as soon as we walked in was the floral air-freshener scent permeating the entire building. This might have been pleasant were it not so overwhelming. After discovering that our room wasn't ready at check-in, we left our bags with a polite concierge and walked around Times Square. The desk associate said she would call me when my room was ready, but after 3 hours and no call we headed back, ready to take whatever room they had. A high-speed elevator sped us to the 44th floor and discharged us into a dark, spaceship-like hallway with black walls and extremely low lighting. It was like walking into a laser tag building. I was hoping our room would be more inviting than the hallways, but the steel-gray color scheme and cold metallic accoutrements made the already tiny space feel closed and uninviting. One of our pillows was stained and dirty, and the chipped paint and worn fixtures throughout hinted to frequent use, infrequent maintenance or both. All services inside and outside the room will cost you a pretty penny on top of the mint you've already paid for the room itself. Even the bottled water, which is free in most of the lower-tier Sheraton hotels, was $6 a bottle. Yikes! For a hotel rated so high by Starwood I expected much more. On the bright side our "spectacular room" view lived up to its billing, and the shower was great. The location is superb, but for the price there is better to be had in midtown Manhattan. I probably "W"on't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NEohiotraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel alone frequently and I love this hotel. I love the corner rooms for the great views, the VERY comfortable bed, the great shower and just the location for a little times square mayhem. I've stayed here several times and have never been disapointed. I'm not sure if the average family would appreciate it, but I love the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an experience of Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: soluck
Reviews.Content: Me and my family have just returned from a 9 night stay in the 'W' Hotel in the middle of Times Square. I have to say, that despite some of the reviews on here, I found it an absolutely fabulous stay and none of us wanted to come home! The maid service, concierge assistance, decor, quality of the rooms and the staff in general were all absolutely fantastic. The only down sides I can think of where when we received a phone call on around the 7th day to ask if anybody had been smoking in the room as the smoke detectors had been activated. We mentioned that none of us had smoked or ever smoked in our lives, they still proceeded to charge £200 to the account. We realised this under the 'account review' facility on the television in the room and we quickly alerted this to their attention and they quickly removed it. However, they had put it under the subject of 'restaurant charge' which I thought was rather sneaky, so make sure you check your account quite reguarly and make sure your stay is totalled up correctly. Also on the last day the toilets blocked in both of our rooms but the maid service was quick and it was fixed within the hour, so that wasn't a problem. On regard to the room, the showers also slightly overflowed in both rooms, but only slightly and bath mats are provided. It was my mother's and my birthday whilst we was there, and we received a teddy bear, a bottle of champage, balloons and two slices of cake which was very generous of them. I think this may have something to do with the fact that my father had had a lot of contact with one of the staff prior to arrival asking questions about New York in general as it was our first visit. Her name was Lydia Chaperone and she was incredibly helpful and made our trip perfect for us. She is definitely a credit to the hotel, so I would always ask for her assistance. Kelly on the concierge desk also got us into some great restaurants and shows during our stay and gave us some great advice which would benefit us financially instead of simply thinking about the hotel's income from ticket brokers etc. The location of the hotel is fantastic - right in the centre of Times Square and a couple of blocks away from Broadway. I can't really comment on the value of the hotel, as my father and mother paid for a suite and then from the points earnt at starwood hotels, they paid for our room with those. I personally think you get value for money as the rooms are quite big for a city and the staff were absolutely brilliant. However, my father suggested that next time if we were to come again, we may rent an apartment as it would most likely work out cheaper, but for first time New Yorkers, it's a great way to get a feel for the city and they guide you along the way with the best things to see and do. Manhattan is an absolutely fantastic place to be. It is the ultimate city in my opinion and I have visited many. Central Park provides a calm from the hectic city life and places such as Soho and Greenwich Village are not too busy as the main areas too and are great for a coffee and a walk to get a feel for New York. The people were very friendly too. All in all a great break and such a refreshing taste of life. If not a little crazy! But that's the way New York is, and that's what makes it so special.

Reviews.Title: “The W Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: KikiPeepers
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to The W in Times Square and had a great time during our first trip to New York because of the excellent service there! The first and best thing I have to say about the hotel is that the staff is so friendly and very accomodating. I had Michael at the concierge desk helping me, and together we planned the entire trip and he took care of arrangements for everything - even VIP seating at Yankees Stadium! Even an odd request for a restaurant that has white truffle macaroni & cheese didn't phase them, they had a list for me the next day. The maids and front desk clerks are all very polite and professional as well. Two different nights they sent us bottles of champagne with chocolate-covered strawberries, on the house, and they also had a great doggy nanny service (yes, they take pets!) The rooms are small (we got an upgraded room but it was still tiny), but we knew NYC hotel rooms are tiny going in and the way they have the rooms decorated, they feel a lot bigger than they are. We had huge windows overlooking Times Square, and the room has block light walls and mirrors all over to give it an open feeling. The room (and the hotel) are decorated beautifully ... very modern and trendy, yet somehow classic as well. They were working on their lobby/living room but even through construction it is a stunning space. And the rumors are true - the best beds EVER, you are surrounded by down and the sheets were divine. Very soft, after a long day in the sun walking it was nice to slip into those cool sheets! Now to the (minor) negative things that prevented me from giving a 5-star rating - our air conditioning went down to 65 the first night, but after that it would stop running if we turned it below 69. We like quite a chilly room (especially with the heavy comforters on the bed) and the AC didn't really seem to keep up all the time. Another complaint is we saw a silverfish in the bathroom, it ran under a barely see-able crack in the floor before we could kill it but that was the only one we saw. Surprised us because the room and hotel look immaculate otherwise. Our only other complaint would be the noise - we were given a room right across from the maid's closet and in the mornings all we could hear were them constantly opening and closing the doors, getting stuff out, talking, vaccuuming, etc. There wasn't a lot keeping hallway noise out of the room. Also, you can hear the traffic from the street below. It never kept either of us from sleeping, but very light sleepers may want to be aware you will faintly hear honking and sirens all night long. Overall, not bad - we'd definitely stay here again but would request a room far away from elevators and maid's closets!

Reviews.Title: “Very Cheesy”
Reviews.Author: DonkeyMan
Reviews.Content: Aside from the "trying way too hard to be trendy" atmosphere, the things that really make you roll your eyes are upstairs past the "living room" (aka lobby lounge). From the peep show motif hallways (black walls, black carpet, black ceiling, and black lights), and the hotel ammenities book in the format of a Benjamin Moore paint sample book to the Ikea gray on gray room furnishings and everything categorized under a "W word" ... the only ones that constantly came to mind was WHY and WHATEVER. The minor irritations are magnified by the annoying trendiness of the hotel .. such as, no turn down service: Leave your room a mess at lunch time .. the same mess will be there when you get back after dinner. No fresh towels, no straightend out bed, no mint on the pillow, no music playing in the room, etc - you know, the kind of thing that EVERY hotel on the planet does as a basic service. The room wasn't very clean especially the bathroom and the noise in the hallway was like having no door whatsoever. So, basically ... the W is all style and no substance. And the style is not for everyone and definately not for me.

Reviews.Title: “The W marks the spot.”
Reviews.Author: GoodTexN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located ideally in the center of Times Square. The only problem with being so centrally located is getting to it by car. Once we got to the hotel, traffic diversions caused my wife and I to travel in circles for about 30 minutes until finally landing in the hotel's very tight driveway. I would suggest leaving the car at the airport and having a taxi or subway take you there. Besides... NYC is a great city to enjoy on foot, especially when your hotel is located near everything. You must proceed to a higher floor to check in. The lobby is adjacent to a super cool dance club/martini bar with music blasting deep bass notes that cause your body to magically start swaying from side to side. The clientelle of the club look to be straight off of a runway fashion show. I must admit my wife and I were a little intimidated by them, but secretly we could not stop staring at the beautiful people surrounding us. The rooms are like many we have seen at the W hotels, only slightly smaller. The contemporary furnishings are surprisingly comfortable, and the ultra modern bathroom fixtures are a lot of fun to figure out. The bed in particular was "heavenly" as described by the bellman who took us to our room. The staff of the hotel are very knowledable and less snooty than some we have experienced in NYC. They seem to genuinely care whether the customers are enjoying their stay and they time in NYC. We have stayed at hotels that provided much more in the way of amenities, but the W is what it is. A hip, modern, hotel. If you are into this style, then give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish experience, but not relevant for a stay in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: marcstrauch
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel at the Times Square is directly located on Broadway and 47th Street at the heart of the Times Square. As described already in other reviews, the hotel is very stylish, with the reception and lobby on the 7th floor. The regular rooms are going to the 33rd floor, above you have the upgraded rooms with very stylish names. The hotels interior is mainly styled in black, with the exception of the entry on the ground floor (water fall above your head) and the lobby on the 7th floor. I got an upgrade and styed for two nights on the 35th floor. The rooms are spacious with a king size bed, a large office desk and toilette/bath room. Thw room had two huge mirrors, a FlatTV and a nice shower behind a glas front. The rooms pretend to be very stylish, but made on relatively cheap materials from my judgement. Internet is not for free, breakfast I have not tried. The hotel owned restaurant 'Blue Fin' serves good fish food and was over-booked. Overall, a good hotel, but with 330 Dollar for a night not necessary cheap. For a more typical hotel experience, better try the Crowne Plaza, one block away and proper hotel feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveler36
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with my stay at the W Hotel Times Square. Bit of an understatement, actually. I was apalled by the hotel and the attitude of the staff. During my stay at the hotel, employees of the hotel came in, had sexual intercourse, and left a used condom in my room while I was out. I found the used condom. Hotel staff responded by trying to tell me it wasn't a big deal, and person at the front desk thought it was hilarious. I spoke with the Hotel manager, Ana MacDiarmid. Although they know the people that came into the room having done an electronic lock inquiry, they have not taken any disciplinary actions on the employees. They offered me 2 free nights as an "apology". Needless to say, their apology and their behavior leaves a lot to be desired. I've also filed this with the Better Business Bureau and the New York Department of Consumer Affairs. I am debating whether to file with the New York Department of Human and Health Services. I would avoid this hotel for any kind of stay.

Reviews.Title: “can't beat location”
Reviews.Author: gatito22
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little uncertain if I had boked the right hotel for us. But upon arrival I could not have been more pleased. The customer service is exceptional. The location in times square, broadway and subway was great. And our room was well maintaned, with a fantastic view. And yes the halls and elevator are dark, there are young(30ish). people everywhere and the lobby fills with them but not so much that it was ever a problem. we are in our 50s and never felt out of place. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: nu1ni
Reviews.Content: The Spectacular room, which we had booked ( above 32nd floor), wasn't ready at 3:45, so we took a room on the 21st floor. The room was nice, and we got a thirty dollar discount for taking it. The big problem is that the walls are paper thin. Our neighbors got in while we were taking a nap. We heard, very clearly, that they were planning to attend a show at the Majestic Theater. After that, we heard them making love. None of this was loud. It was all in regular voices - just things I would prefer kept private. I'm sure they would have , too. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “would rather stay at the marriott”
Reviews.Author: tcebo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was way tooooo modern for my taste. It definately had a cool entrance with the water walls but the overall feeling is bleek at best. The hallways and room walls are VERY dark!!!!! The almost pitch black halls to your room have very tacky electric blue lights over the door. When you go in, the walls are covered in dark grey paint. The furniture was cool to look at but very uncomfortable. The bathroom was absolutely the worst I've ever seen!!!! 2 of the walls are glass shaded walls and has a sliding door. There is no privacy whatsoever!!! The shower was completely see through, all glass doors that don't lock, so the water goes all over the floor no matter what you try. Aside from the obvious very overpriced, the luggage was an issue. We asked the desk to hold our stuff, we waited 10 minutes and asked again....finally the girl behind the desk took it...but they take it to another floor in heaps, so you check it but then they leave it unattended until someone comes to take it downstairs. Most hotels have a convenient room by the desk so you don't have to wait. It was completely unorganized. Definately a nice place, just not my cup of tea AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: “wow times square”
Reviews.Author: matnkel
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the W in one of the fantastic rooms for a week in june for my 30th birthday, with a slice of cake waiting for us in the room it was a treat and then a bottle of champas on my actual b.day they added that personal touch, we felt the service was great , the location was amazing and yes as a lot of reviews had said the loby music was loud and dim lighting but if its too loud your too old! we thought the place was excellent by far up there on the top 5 places we have stayed in the world and we travel a lot! for NYC the room size was very good, and spacious, the only negative being the bathroom was hard for for my wife to do her makeup no bench top but it was way funky! We ordered breakfast in bed although pricey it was very nice as was the loby bar for a cocktail prior to heading out for the night. all in all i would HIGHLY recomend the W times square.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rockthisway
Reviews.Content: This is truly the best hotel I've ever stayed at, for numerous reasons. The service was excellent, the room and view was beautiful, the modern deco of the entire building was fantastic, the bar/lounge was great, and the food was delicious. I went to New York City as a graduation present, and my mom just happened to mention that to one of the women who worked there. After we got settled into our room, that same young woman came up with a balloon and package of free souveniers for a graduation present, along with a handwritten card! It really made my trip. The room had a sort of modern art theme, and had two rooms (since we booked the large suite.) The view was magnificent. The beds were very comfortable. The art and setup of the room was unlike anything I've ever seen before. Even the minifridge was neat; it had all different types of snacks, products, even a tshirt and teddy bear! I admit they were expensive, but if you're the type to splurge every once in a while, it's for you. The furniture is both comfortable and creative. The room overall is just incredible. The lounge had a bar, and a bunch of cozy areas to sit and chat. In the evenings it's very busy (which is good if you want to meet people), but during the day and before 6:00 it's a quiet area to relax in. You could just sit there and look at the cosmopolitan modern decorations and furniture for hours and never get bored. It also has free internet acess, whereas in the room there's a fee. The lounge and lobby is on the second level; the first level is an entrance with water on the roof and walls (very worth seeing!) The room service, and everything else about this hotel was excellent! I give this hotel 10 thumbs up, if I had that many thumbs. If you can afford to spend some extra money, you defininately should consider the W in Times square.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy With The W's Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JLC740
Reviews.Content: I arranged for my daughter and a couple of her friends to stay here in April. I paid for the room 1 month before they arrived. I called a week prior to their arrival to make sure everything was in place and reserved a limo for their transfers from the airport. To began with a Sedan picked them up, not a big deal, but at the end of the stay my daughter was billed for a limo. She complained and they removed the charge. She also was charged for snacks that she didn't eat that was also credited. However, when my daughter arrived she gave the front desk her debit card for incidentals, they assured her there would only be a charge if she indeed used any of the services in her room. Her debit card was immediately charged $1500.00. I called and was told this was "common practice in the industry". My daugher was told by the front desk the maximum amount charged should have only been $200 and they would take care of it immediately and call her bank. It took 6 days to finally get a credit of the $1500. Meanwhile, I had to transfer the funds into my daughter's account to cover her while she was in New York. I emailed the W and called them twice during this ordeal and was assured this would be taken care of immediately. It still took 6 days...

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBeloHorizonte
Reviews.Content: The hotel´s entrance is really cool. The lobby is nice as well and for those who like staying in nosy places it´s the right hotel. But, when you get into the room, it´s a disappointement. The room is so small and the the room service is not so good. It´s not a great deal, I´d rather stay at The Palace NY.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: 1Honeymooners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Memorial day weekend. The location of the hotel, view from the room (Hudson River ) and staff were all great. But the room left a lot to be desired. There were stains on the blinds, the sink was cracked, the shower door didi't shut properly allowing water to get all over the flooor, and you could tell where they patched the shower. Tile/stucco actually stuck out from the rest of the wall. The shower head and pipe actually came out of the wall. Not to mention that it is quite small. I figured for $430 a night we would get something nice and spacious, I guessed wrong. Totally not worth it. Also the halls and elevator and dimly lit, in fact you may need to bring a flashlight into the elevator so you can see which floor you are selecting. The bar area is nice and the drinks are good, but over priced.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, small rooms, semi private bathroom”
Reviews.Author: snuffpele
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through American Express Platinum Services. We knew that the rooms were small, but were anticipating that the upgrade through AMEX Platinum would offer a larger room. When we arrived we found out that in fact all of their rooms were the same size, except suites, and that the upgrade was considered a higher floor. Also, breakfast was to be included which only ended up being a continental breakfast.with really lousy prepackaged muffins. Even though we were upgraded to the top floor, 57, we heard both street noise (sirens day and night, from the firestation located 2 blocks away) and noise from the ice-maker outside of our room. People were also partying both in their room and in the hallway and one could hear maids talking and doors slamming while we were in our own room. The so called bathroom was a frosted glass sliding partition, which offered very little space or privacy, In summary, this hotel is very overpriced, overrated, and we would not recommend it or consider staying there again. Laura Phoenix, Arizona P.S. If you want a very nice hotel in the time square area, I recommend the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Bar or Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_Paddy
Reviews.Content: We chose the W Hotel Times Square to finish off our three stop honeymoon to the US. The hotel is perfectly located in Times sqaure and the entrance to the hotel is very impressive...... like being in a waterfall. Our check in was fine and the receptionist was very pleasant. However, several other members of the reception staff were pretty unhelpfull on several occasions. It seemed to be a problem for them to change travellers cheques and they imposed a $200 limit per room per day (which doesn't go far in Manhattan). On one occasion I was told that they didnt have much money so they would rather not change my travellers cheques. They did change their mind however when I persisted as it was our last day and we needed the cash for a taxi to the airport. Our hotel room was very comfortable and had impressive views of the Hudson River from one window and Times Square from another. The room had everything you need but was a bit small. However, I believe that all Now York bedrooms are small. The hotel was very trendy and had a really good vibe. It seemed to be the place to be in Times Square. However, it did seem to be that the focus of the hotel was on the bar(s) rather than the hotel guests and bedrooms. This, in my opinion, should be the other way around. I would certainly recommend the hotel, but if you are more on the mature side, it may not be for you. Also, if you dont walk around in Hugo Boss, Prada or Gucci, prepare to be looked at when you enter the hotel after 7.00pm on a weekend as everyone else seems to! Overall, the W Times Square wasn't perfect but it was very good and I would certainly stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Broadway theatres, functional, but not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: Departures_YYZ
Reviews.Content: I would generally approve of the hotel, but some technical caveats definitely apply. My wife and I stayed 4 nights (Thursday to Monday in mid-May, 2007). First of all, I booked through the Starwood hotel chain website, which seemed to make sense after poking around for endless hours looking at various hotel and booking options. The comparatively reasonable cancellation policy on their website appealed to me, and (prepare to contain yourself) you can redirect your Starwood points, or whatever they are, to certain other loyalty programs like Aeroplan. So I’m sure I saved two percent on the whole deal, and all those hours of travel surfing were not in vain. Note that to do this, you have to sign up in advance for a “preferred guest” card that they mail out to you, but it’s free to sign up. Anyway, for what was ostensibly a better than average room (i.e., corner room on 38th floor looking west across the Hudson river) we forked out $429 a night (plus taxes made it around $490 a night). Having never been to NY before we had no idea if this represented a “value proposition” when compared to other similarly pricey hotels. The hotel is newish, though the odd sign of wear is now visible. The staff did their jobs well on the few occasions we had to actually interact with them (ee.gg., at check in, to get a cab, breakfast servers in restaurant downstairs, send up a guy with replacement room key when ours did not work, leave bags behind for the day on our day of departure, buying stuff in the trendy hotel shop). The room was clean, large enough not to bump into things, the tap water was quite drinkable, the shower had good water pressure, there were lots of towels (some of which can be sacrificed to keep the shower from soaking the whole bathroom floor), the king bed was comfortable, the flat screen TV hanging on the wall had numerous channels and a DVD player (who stays in to watch videos whilst in NY, anyway?), there was a little el cheapo CD player, two nice comfy robes, and also an astonishing array of “W” brand crap that you can buy, laid out right there in the room like so many bags of chips. And, of course, an over-priced mini bar. We really did enjoy coming back to the room after pounding the NY pavement all day and falling onto the big plush bed, though I appreciate this sounds cheesy. Note that you will need top quality ear plugs at this hotel. The north end of Times Square is right below you, very brightly lit, full of much honking and many all-night sirens, and as a bonus the clowns down the hall on Saturday night will try to drain the ice machine (at least I think that’s what they were doing), shout at each other, and then lock themselves out of their room, in which room there may be a roommate, but there is only one way to find out if they are in there. Mind you, once you block out all the noise you can really appreciate the nice bed. We had the feather pillows, and they were a touch squishy, good for stomach sleepers, but I think next time I’ll ask for foam. Basically it is a good hotel, but I don’t quite get who the target market is. I am assuming the hotel is probably too expensive for most youthful lounge-and-club hipsters at whom the incessant sound track in the common areas seems to be aimed. The lighting in the elevators is so dim I actually had to bend over to read the numbers on the buttons (there’s brail on them, though, so I had that to fall back on). The hotel’s location is ideal for catching Broadway shows nearby, and quite central for most of the top 10 touristy things. Most people there looked as I imagine we did – vaguely annoyed with day 3 of the whole tangerine wheatgrass cool-as-zen “W” scene, but also happy to be in NY and able to afford a good bed and good ear plugs. Other things in NY that warrant special mention: the Staten Island ferry (seems to depart on the hour and half hour, great views, it’s free, but they make you get off and then on again at the Staten Island end before coming back to Manhattan); the view from the top of the Rockefeller centre (a swift $17.50 each plus tax; maybe go at odd hours so as not to line up; good shopping nearby); and in the far-from-free category, attending the Metropolitan Opera (buy your tickets way in advance from the Met website for box office pick-up, and then phone to make a 6 p.m. reservation at the very nice Gran Tier restaurant that’s also in the opera house (note that the restaurant crowd is dressier than average NY opera attendee) and then before finishing your very nice dinner, be sure to arrange for your waiter to pre-order your intermission chocolate soufflé (we found the house champagne was quite doable with it) and then go back to your table at intermission and enjoy it while the mob lines up at the bar. And note that the ladies room at the Met will have a long line just before show time so get the female in your party in line maybe 20 minutes before curtain.)

Reviews.Title: “Check you Bill!”
Reviews.Author: InigoMontoya
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced. Worse part was that on checkout, a mysterious $65 dollar charge appeared from hotel bar. We were never there, and the front desk staff made us feel like we had to prove to them that we didn't make the charge. I guess guilty until proven innocent is the motto there. Ruined the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little tired...”
Reviews.Author: Auntbunny
Reviews.Content: I agree, you can't beat the W Times Square for location. We have stayed at this property numerous times on our trips into NYC, but I have to say the hotel is beginning to look a little time worn. The first room we were given was right next to a hallway ice machine that had overflowed and soaked the hall carpet so the room had a very strong mold smell. The second room was far better, but still when you turned on the sink there was a moldy odor. The towels, when wet, released a distinctive smell of smoke. (Like the people in the laundry smoked while cleaning the linens!) The furniture in the room was nicked and beaten up like you would see in a college dorm. On a positive note, the beds are comfortable and the pillows divine. We were on the 23rd floor and it is quite noisy at night with emergency sirens. Service was attentive, and we easily managed to get a third night even though the hotel was sold out. The front desk kept us in mind as cancellations came in. We had dinner at the Blue Fin and the service and food were top notch. I do like the Times Square location, but find the Renaissance to be a better deal across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: asdgjkdhjk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 4 nights (3rd May -6th May). I was originally assigned a corner room with a connecting door - which you should definitely avoid - I could hear every conversation happening in the connecting room - and my neighbours were talking in a normal volume. I requested another room and was moved straight away. My new room was on the 43rd floor with a great view of Times Square. Very New York - but if you are particularly bothered by noise and light - it might not be the best place for you. I was awoken early on Saturday morning by a very loud concert in the middle of Times Square and the room is lit up by very bright lights on the side of the building, lighting up giant billboards. I didn't mind too much as it was part of the experience of being in such a great location - and the room did have blackout curtains. Other great things about the hotel were the great trendy atmosphere, comfortable modern rooms, relatively well equiped gym, friendly staff, good security (won't let anybody up to the lobby on the 7th floor without a key at night), great comfortable bed, really cool bars and high definition televisions in the rooms. All in all - a very enjoyable experence.

Reviews.Title: “trendy but cheap”
Reviews.Author: stmcki
Reviews.Content: very trendy hotel. club music piped in everywhere, in the lobby, elevators, hallways, and in the room. Tip - cd's are available for purchase in your room, bring your laptop instead and upload the songs for free. furniture and fixture were old and cheap. door was very thin and I could hear everything in the hall. White furniture showed signs of age and wear. bathroom looked either trendy or a temporary structure. staff was friendly and helpful. food was excellent. sushi restaurant downstairs was very good (pricey, but I grew up in Japan, where sushi is like hamburgers, everyday food not cool food). there's plenty of light in the room, but everything else is darkly lit like a club. bed was comfortable. felt similar to sheratons' beds, not as plush as westin. location is great, right off times square, couldn't be better. i didn't get too much street noise in the room, but again, lots of hallway noise. for the same price, maybe a little less, go for the westin times square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Trendy Hotel for 1st Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: vaughnms
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful service and satisfaction. My wife had stayed at several other W hotels and since I was planning a surprise trip for her to NYC for our 1st wedding anniversary, I thought the W Times Square would be a perfect fit. I got very lucky finding a promotion on the hotels website where if you bought two nights you would get a third for free, so even though the rooms were a little more expensive then what I wanted, it ended up being about the same as paying for three nights at a different hotel. The experience was amazing from the time we walked in the door. I had line up some special services through W's "Whatever, Whenever" service and it payed off bigtime. They had chocolate covered strawberries with wine in our room upon arrival. In addition they place rose pedals throughout the room and at my request with the help of the Whatever, Whenever service, they had a special song playing on the CD player when we arrived. The wife loved it. They also upgraded us to a nicer room on the 48th floor. This was a corner room with a view of Times Square and the Hudson River and unlike some of the other reviews, the noise from below was minimal. The bed was as advertised and the pillows were unbelievably comfortable. Our bathroom was small but nice and all of the products provided were great. Our room was spacious and very clean. The lobby of the hotel is very chic and trendy with low lights and a very busy bar. The entrance was cool with the waterfalls overhead and the staff was extremely nice. The hallway to our room was a bit dark as were the elevators but went with the hotels decor. The only part that we were disapointed with was our experience while eating at Blue Fin, the hotels upscale restaraunt. The food was mediocre at best and the portions were small, but the atmosphere and staff were great. We constantly visited the little store right next door that offered great food 24hrs a day and was a wonderful place to grab breakfast before heading out to sightsee in NYC. Overall the experience with the W was outstanding. I would reccomend it to anyone who is into modern decor and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome View of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: TXfriend
Reviews.Content: Awesome view. Great Hotel. Beautiful Water Feature in Lobby. Great Times Square Location. Walking distance to Broadway shows. Great Breakfast. Extremely comfortable bed, linens and pillows. Very clean. Pricey gift shop. Ultra modern but not too overdone. Very serene for the hustle and bustle on the square. Flat plasma tv. Impossible to figure out alarm clock/CD player. Bar very crowded & trendy. Lobby & check-in crowded due to location of the bar. No Gideon Bible.

Reviews.Title: “W is for Waste of Money”
Reviews.Author: m1118
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I have stayed at the W Times Square while covering the New York Auto Show every year for the past four years. I always knew that the W was more about style than substance, but my recent experience there assured that last week would be our last stay there. The rooms were okay, stylish but with beds that were way too small. The real problem came with the conference room we reserved at the hotel to use as a work base. They had promised a conference room with a T1 line where we could do post-production work. But when we got there, there was no internet line at all, and what they ultimately hooked up was no better than bad dial-up. The person arranging the room did not have a clue about internet connections, which would be fine in 1997, but not in 2007. And then, they lost the video deck that had been delivered to the hotel for us, so we were at a standstill for four hours. They did apologize but in an utterly lackluster way, like they were used to screwing up. The best they could do was offer some free food, which wasn't much comfort given that we had to stay up until 3 p.m. to make up for their mistake. And when all was said and done, they tried to charge us for "package handling" for the equipment they lost. And they acted like they were doing us a huge favor by not charging us for the room that we ultimately couldn't use. Now, if you are at a restaurant and they forget to bring the entree, are they doing you a favor by not charging you for it? Anyway, I did try to follow up with a manager by phone, but she never bothered to call me back after an initial conversation. Lesson: If you want silly style, think W. If you want employees who are on-the-ball and professional, you should probably look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the Wow?”
Reviews.Author: doris74
Reviews.Content: We did 5 nights here in Feb for a long weekend and were disappointed with some aspects of the W. The location is great to get out & about from, there are a few subway stops nearby & cabs right outside plus Times Square is just around the corner. I would say that most of the money has been spent on the communal areas & the room we had left a lot to be desired. The entrance is very impressive with the waterfall that cascades over the glass ceiling is cool. The darker than dark lifts and bar area are uber cool too. We had a quick dance in the lifts inbetween each floor, on our own of course! It was all very Sex in the City stylee with a price tag to match. Your looking at around $12 a drink, which soon stacks up if you are thirsty & want more than a glass of ice. We have stayed in NYC before & are aware that space is at a premium so I wasn't expecting a big room. I was however hopeful of heating in the winter & also a quiet room at night. There was a massive aircon unit in the corridor outside out room that clanked & clunked all night long. The room itself was a little bit tired, considering this is referred to as 5 star, it isn't. There was a stain on the quilt, the bathroom had bits of mould on some of the grout & was freezing to step out of the shower into. The bliss toiletries were nice & were replenished every day. The gym has an assortment of free weights & a couple of cardio machines, there are no showers/sauna or steam. I had a deep tissue massage while we stayed here & felt the benefit the next day, in fact I'm still feeling it now after 7 weeks. I would recommend a trip to Michael if your back/shoulders are knotted, he put me through pain but it was worth it! They have heated massage beds, which was a first for me but v.nice. The restaurant has a good menu & is worth a visit if you can't be bothered to venture too far. As someone else has mentioned, there is a deli about 2 doors up the road (going away from Times Square) and I would highly recommend it for coffee & breakfast, cold drinks to put in the mini bar (the mini bar is a rip-off $12 for bottled water) and the selection of hot food etc is fantastic. If I had a deli like that in London I would stop shopping/cooking. If you carry on walking in the same direction across a couple of blocks you will end up at Hells Kitchen, there are loads of places to eat round here we tried the Chelsea Grill which had a nice vibe. I could go on & on about the great places to eat in this big city, but thats for you to find out or have fun trying! Overall the W was ok, if I'd known how over-rated it is I would have booked something else.

Reviews.Title: “12 Night Stay - Good W”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a 12 night stay at the W Hotel - Times Square. In comparison to the other W in the City, this one is the better hotel. The lobby is new, the carpeting in the hallways clean, and the room overrall is modern, hip, and neat. Housekeeping and turndown service is inconsistent. On some nights they would come and on some nights they wouldn't. The food here is incredibiliy expensive, and why would anyone need to order room service in Time Square in beyond me. At night after 10pm all hotel guests require a key to enter, so security made you feel safe. On Thrus - Sat the hotel lobby is packed and very loud (full of twenty something drinking at the bar). One major complaint is that the front desk gave me the run around for upgrades using SPG pts. They told me to contact SPG telephone line but when I called, they told me to contact the front desk since I have already checked in. ... I gave up. the workout room is your standard W Hotel workout space... about 6 treadmills and a few machines. Enough for a quick workout. If you score a room on a high floor (goes up to 54th flr), there's a good chance you'll be able to see NJ, the hudson river, and the entire city. Internet service was $17 per 24 hr. or $6 for 30 min. Overrall this is your above average NYC W Hotel. In comparison to other hotels in the city within the price range, it is good.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect New York W Weekend”
Reviews.Author: DCUnited
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W over a weekend and actually loved it. I had been to the hotel lobby bar for drinks and have admired how stylish it is. Staying at the hotel was even better. I booked a superior room which is a step above the basic "wonderful" room. The room was quite roomy with a partial view of Times Sq. There was an HD flat TV. As usual the bed and bathroom were high-grade Starwood quality. As with other Ws, the Bliss bathroom products are some of the best I have seen. As guests of the hotel, we didn't have to pay the $20 cover charge at the Whiskey club downstairs which was a nice extra (even though the club was on the cheesy side playing mainstream hip hop for a suburban looking crowd). So why 4 rather than 5 stars? Mostly it is an issue of price. The $450 price tag for a nice room - while OK for NYC these days - does not feel like great value. You could stay at a Four Seasons in Istanbul for this kind of money. But then again, as New Yorkers like to say, nothing compares to NYC. And no boutique chain compares to the consistent quality of the W.

Reviews.Title: “Too much effort on OUR part...”
Reviews.Author: Pamgoes
Reviews.Content: First, for a NY hotel, the price was right. The room was clean. Scents are used on the rugs,etc. when cleaning which could cause those with allergies to have some problems..I requested that the spray not be use in our room. The location, on Times Square, was wonderful. Problems came up when then sun set....the exterior hotel lights, glaring directly into our upgraded, 36th floor corner room made it seem as if it were still daylight...and the bank of 12+ floodlights stayed on ALL night!. Walls are paper thin..so if noise and outside sound are problematic for you...better to stay elsewhere. Room proportions are miniscule and austere..gray is the color of the day. Check in was easy and friendly, but the promised wine (to celebrate a special occassion) and the turn down service and special 'amenity' were nowhere to be found. Concerns were noted and staff did bring a bottle of wine, albeit the wrong kind. For my money, we will try another hotel next time...this one was just too much work!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: lawrenson71
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked this hotel for my 40th Birthday treat! We trawled the internet wanting to stay in a nice, central, comfortable hotel as it was a special occasion and the W Hotel did not disappoint! We stayed in one of the Spectacular rooms as all the Wonderful rooms were booked. I emailed the hotel and asked for a nice room as it was my 40th and when we checked in we found ourselves up on the 56th floor with great views of Broadway right up to Central Park! The room was spacious (which we were not expecting) with the comfiest bed I have ever slept in! In fact, to say we were in the City that never sleeps, we slept better than we do at home - it was delightful! On our first night, a complimentary birthday cake was delivered to our door, which was a lovely touch. The rooms are cleverly designed and yes, they may not be overly plush, but they are done really well. The walk in shower was fab and the complimentary Bliss products each day were great! The hotel bar is very cool and I felt very "Sex in the City" drinking my Cosmopolitan!! I would definitely recommend the W Hotel, we thought it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: BluEyedFF
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to W Times Square. I was disappointed with my first (about a year ago). But I am all for second chances. This time, they came through with flying colors. The staff was much friendlier, the room was not the size of a closet. My only complaint... I had a corner room with a SE view... there was construction happening on the roof of an adjacent bldg. Very unsightly, but not the Ws fault.

Reviews.Title: “Seems to be for businessmen/designed by men?”
Reviews.Author: LinFromNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night. We liked certain things about it such as the cool waterfall effect as you walk in, the bed was comfortable, the large HDTV was great, the elevators were good, and the staff and service was attentive. Check-in and check-out were done very expeditiously. The room was clean, and plenty of plush towels were provided. We asked for a wakeup call and received it on time. We ordered breakfast to be delivered to the room at 8 AM, and our order arrived a few minutes early and was perfect. The food was quite good. What I did not like was that this hotel seemed to be designed for the business traveler, and I thought the room was not female friendly. We were there to attend a big family party. I was rather taken aback to find that, although the bathroom was rather large, there was a lot of wasted space in it. It needed more hooks and shelves. The thing that bothered me the most was that the sink had almost no room to spread out my makeup items for application, there was a makeup mirror but it was mounted way too high for a woman who is, like me, average height (5'4"), and the lighting in the bathroom was way too dim to see what I was doing! They provide nice, plush bathrobes, found in the closet, but there was no hook to hang it up in the bathroom. (The bathroom had a pocket door instead of a regular door.) The room itself had several lights, but all of the lights were dim. We find that to be very annoying. The room was very small, hardly larger than the king-sized bed, with decor that was kind of austere and high-tech, not at all comfortable or homey. There were 2 chairs in the room, but neither one was comfortable. Our room was obviously designed for very short stays! We never would have wanted to stay in that room for more than the one night. The decor gave us an uneasy, edgy feel instead of the relaxing effect we had been needing & hoping for. We heard a LOT of noise from the hallways late at night. A drawerful of snacks is in the room; I had to stop my husband from taking any because he did not realize that we would be charged for them....he thought they were included in the price of the room! No way! A plus is that right next door there is a nice deli with all kinds of food, snacks, sandwiches and drinks available. I had a roast beef sandwich from that deli and it was great! The bottom line is that we would not stay here again due to the negatives that I mentioned..

Reviews.Title: “Cool Sophistication”
Reviews.Author: halycon-1
Reviews.Content: I just joined Trip advisor and I am finally writing my reviews.....we stayed at W in Dec 2005. This hotel is so hip I feel like I was 28 agan, it is not cheap but the location is amazing. We had a corner view watching the big New Year's Eve celebration. It was my wife''s 40th and they really made it special for her. The place is minimalist and the service was great.. They did not get over the tip like other hotels but you still felt special. If you don;t like loud music or dark corridors, this is the wrong place for you. But to feel young again, definitely worth it. The lobby is fun, just to hang around and sit in one of the comfortable square seats. The rom was very clean and again, minimal but useful. I love the bathroom and the modern design. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for what is up w/ this hotel?”
Reviews.Author: travelsavvytexan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a cross between a nightclub and a college dorm. All of the lighting in the hotel was either fluorescent or neon, walls painted black, club music pumping 24/7- hence, the comparison to a nightclub. The actual room we stayed in truly looked like a dorm room w/ a king sized bed. Furniture was sparse and not well made, with the exception of the bed which was quite comfortable. The bathroom was tiny w/ a shower only, a shower which was not enclosed I might add, which led to a wet, messy bathroom floor. WIth the W, I expected minimalistic but serene luxury. Needless to say, I was quite disappointed w/ this location.

Reviews.Title: “The emperor has no clothes”
Reviews.Author: Candid_Canuck
Reviews.Content: I kept hearing about Starwood's hip W brand hotels, and decided to try one out on a trip to Manhattan. This place was a major disappointment--haughty, unfriendly (but really beautiful) front-desk staff; dim-almost-dark hallways and elevators; and a room that smelled strongly of mildew, as if the carpet had been washed and never properly dried out. When we waited for the elevator to go down to the lobby in the morning, the elevator door opened on a guy and two girls still wearing their clubbing togs from the night before practically doing the nasty. My husband and I figured out right then that we are clearly outside the W demographic...we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonaustralia
Reviews.Content: I booked the W Times Square for a surprise birthday trip for my boyfriend's 30th. Got a good room rate on Expedia but was slightly concerned about some of the reviews on tripadvisor - however, I needn't have worried at all - the hotel was everything we could have hoped and more. Staff were super-friendly and went out of their way to be helpful throughout our stay and the hotel is incredibly stylish and brilliantly located in the middle of all the action. I contacted the hotel a few weeks before our stay to organise a birthday cake to be delivered to us on arrival as a surprise - the cake arrived right on time and was exactly what I wanted. I also asked for a room with a view of Times Square and not only did the hotel oblige but we were upgraded to a corner room with stunning views. The room was spotless and stylish and the bathroom was lovely, with gorgeous Bliss Spa products. We only visited The Living Room during our stay and not the Whiskey Bar but we absolutely loved the Living Room and the cocktails were top-notch (much better value than in any comparable bar in London too!). Had breakfast on our first day in Blue Fin and were v. impressed with the food and service. In summary, the hotel was a gem and we wouldn't hesitate to go back. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: kwman
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our second stay at the W Times Square. The first stay was outstanding and the second just as good. Staff can not do enough to help, the atmosphere is electric and the food is of a very high standard. After staying at this hotel last August, it has made every hotel I've stayed at since look very boring. The room decor is very modern and clean. The Bliss products smell beautiful (lemon and sage) and the maids always stock the room every day. The dark corridors mentioned in other reviews are correct but it just adds to the atmosphere of the place. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will stay here every time I come to New York.

Reviews.Title: “incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: christicbo
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. The service was wonderful- everyone was friendly and helpful. Employees were willing to take the time to give us helpful advice on restaurants, etc. The rooms were impeccable. Everything looked very new and had a modern flair.
