This is the nicest place I have stayed in New York (I have also stayed at the Renaissance Times Square.) The size of the room was quite adequate- we had space to move around. I was able to request a room with a view- we had a view of Broadway below. I was also able to request a room with a bathtub- most of the rooms here only have showers. There was only one chair in the room- at the desk. This presented a small problem when we ordered room service because one of us had to sit on the bed and the other in the chair and eat at the table provided with the room service. We were in a bit of a hurry but I am sure they would have provided a chair if we had time to request one. The rooms were elegant and a soft cd is playing when you walk in, and plays constantly throughout your stay (there is a cd player.) The hotel also hosts a restaurant- the blue fin- which was also impressive. The atmosphere was like a los angeles scene but also very relaxing. The food was incredible. I ordered the filet mignon, medium well. It came out perfect. I often have problems with medium well steaks in even five star restaurants, but not here. Every portion of the meal was wonderful- down to the dessert. Much thought went into the preparation and creation of each course. The Whiskey Nite Club is also in the hotel. Even on Sunday, this place was a place to be. It has a unique atmosphere and a vip section one can reserve for parties. The music is basically top 40 dance music, with not much variation. It was worth checking out. There are not many seats there, so be prepared to stand. There is a coat check for $2 per coat. As for some other things about the hotel- it is in a great location. The valet parking was worth it, but was expensive- $62 per night. It goes on a 24 hour basis- so if you arrive before check in, you can still check your car and have until the same time the next day to get it back. However, there are no in-out privileges with the car. The room-service breakfast was good quality as well. It was expensive- we paid close to $100 for breakfast, and each only had one basic meal with only one extra juice and one extra order of bacon. That included the tip. We had a slight problem with the bill- we were charged for an umbrella from the mini-bar that we didn't take. A short call to the hotel remedied this immediately. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in New York. You can't beat the accommodations, the staff, the luxury, the location, and the atmosphere. After coming to this hotel, we will probably always stay here when coming to New York. We will also check out other W hotels worldwide when traveling other places!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad”
Reviews.Author: WishWeCouldSeeItAll
Reviews.Content: Once again I went with an American Express "Fine Hotel" - and once again dissapointed. Firstly, I believe I read their website, and about how they're all about the linens and beds... I don't know if I've slept on such a horrible, hard, uncomfortable bed! I don't have exceptionally high standards when it comes to beds, but this was just rock hard. The room was OK, stained carpet, torn furniture, etc. It was clean, and it had everything you needed, so if you don't mind those little things, then no big deal. We were on the 37th floor, and the traffic was still quite loud. If it bothers you, I'd request a higher floor. The 37th Floor was not quite high enough to avoid the flashy billboards (er, video screens) from Times Sq. As to Location, fantastic. You're right there, in the middle of it all, and I'd recommend it for young couples/singles, but I wouldn't recommend it for families. Check-in/reception is actually on Level 7 - You take the elevators up to Level 7 (every time), and from there you take your designated elevator to your floor. Food was good, but certainly not worth the expense, and well, you're in NYC - get out there and hit one of the many, MANY fabulous restaurants. I would recommend any of my single friends to stay, but I've actually stayed at The Time, a couple of years ago, and I would recommend that first. It's also in the mix (just off Times Sq), and is quiet, well appointed, and friendly. Speaking with Concierge, and Reception is extremely difficult as afternoon turns to evening. They're right in-front of the bar, in an wide-open hard-walled area. I found it rather unpleasant coming back from a full day in the city, and having all that noise to deal with in the 'lobby' of my hotel. My final thoughts - too expensive for what you get, unless you have money to burn, I'm sure there are better options (including The Time).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel provides a life changing experience”
Reviews.Author: richiehayes2000
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Love NYC and this is the best yet. This is our 3rd vist from the UK to NYC and I can't see any mid priced accomodation getting better than this. Let me spell it out. Room rate was excellent, and on arrival asked about the possibility of a free upgrade to a corner room and was granted my wish - was not a problem at all. Was very pleased and for no extra charge. Mentioned at check in that it was my wife's 30th and in the time it took us to have a brief drink in the bar before our baggage was taken to our room, complimentary champagne and chocolate strawberries had been delivered to our suite. I was delighted at this attention to detail and swift thought and practice - excellent customer service. We recieved nothing than top quality service from every member of staff at this establishment. I recommend this hotel with my word, and on that you have a promise. With my word in mind, there were just some minor points that did cross my mind - and that is all they did. Although we had a room on the corner block facing Times Square, I wondered what value and view would be offered by accomodation at the back of the hotel. The Ice machines were noisy - and I mean noisy. Not a problem for us at all but those poor peeps in the two rooms in between the ice generator must have been cursing.... Drinks are expensive - and I mean expensive. I don't mind shelling out for ambience but $44 and tip for 2 glasses of wine and a sprite did make me wonder. However - this is class. From start to finish. Already looking at the photos and the memories are already bringing a lump to my throat - 2 days after we have got back to the UK. Trust me - this is an experience, and for the persons looking for a more trendy, relaxed and informal but edged stay, this is perfect. Thanks to all at the W at Times Square - We truly loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it baby!”
Reviews.Author: MICHELIN-STAR-CHICK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in Dec 05 but only just signed up to do reviews. We have been to NY every year for the past 8. The W was our favourite hotel yet. We have previously stayed at Essex House, The Bentley, The Edison and Portland Square. We had a fantastic room on a high floor on the corner overlooking the Square. The room was cool and the bar even cooler! The place is really trendy and modern and we loved it. Sink a few cocktails and you are guaranteed a wonderful time. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very cool”
Reviews.Author: psu86
Reviews.Content: What a cool hotel! Check in was super fast! Its a sleek reception area next to an ultra modern bar called the living room. The room was spectacular. Great view, unique furniture! The westin bed was super comfortable.Flat panel plasma tv. One of the best showers ever. The bath products were first rate. Everyone that worked at the hotel was firendly and helpful. I will stay at this hotel again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveler213
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels and I RARELY designate an "Excellent" rating as I feel that there is always room for improvement. However, I think that the W TImes Square has it right. The hotel itself is in the perfect location. Close to many midtown office buildings and smack in the middle of Times Square with great views (from certain rooms) of the "crossroads of the world". The staff could not be more friendly. It is so nice to encounter staff members at an upscale hotel that do not act stuffy and better than everyone else. I had fun with one of the doormen picking on some of the more stuffy guests as they walked into the hotel. The bell staff is wonderful, the front desk assigned us the perfect rooms and even made the extra effort to get them adjoining which only took an extra hour past check-in time and even called me on my cell phone to let me know the room was ready. I came back to my room to find a welcome amenitiy of wine and fruit and was just made to feel welcome in every aspect of my stay. This hotel is fantastic and well-worth the room rate. I hope that in choosing this hotel, other travelers will have the same positive experience as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: arnop
Reviews.Content: I've never been to a W hotel before so this two night stay @ The W Hotel Times Square was nothing I could've imagined. The location is great but if you like quiet places, don't try Times Square obviously but it was fine for me. The lobby is great and check-in was one of the fastest i've ever seen. The corridors are very dark like other customers wrote on their reviews but once you get into your room, is spectacular. We had a room on the 50th floor with a great view on times square and even if the room wasn't very big, we had enought place for two. Glass desk with broadband access and HD LCD TV on the wall was very nice for me who wanted to work for a couple hours every night. Anyway, we paid 500$ for a night and even if it's a bit expensive, the hotel is awesome and i'll definitely go back there when i'm back in NEw York.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, great hotel with beautiful people abound!”
Reviews.Author: applauso
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? This is by far one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It has raised my expectations of what a hotel should be like. To make a long story short when we checked in,there was a small mixup because another guest in the hotel had the same last name. The problem was quickly resolved and we were put in another room. Two phone calls later apologizing for the mixup, we were told that we would be moved to suite the next day. An executive suite on Times Square???!!! Yeah, that would do. To top it off, the devestatingly handsome man than checked us in sent complimentary fruit and champagne to our room. The W definitely made us feel like we were on vacation, VIP style! Even the concierge was great in giving us suggestions for dinner/lunch places, and any other questions we had. They even printed out our boarding passes so we wouldn't have to wait at the airport. The Lounge was always happening and the hotel was in the middle of everything. I went with 3 other friends and we had a blast. I could see how this wouldn't be a family hotel, but for us being in our late 20s-early 30s.....it rocked!! The Whiskey had good music, but the crowd was a bit sketchy. Walk a little out of the Times Square vicinity for better food choices, don't get sucked into the tourist trap of Olive Garden, TGIF, and Applebees! Upon returning to Texas, I realized I had misplaced my bluetooth headset. I sent an email to the hotel, which was replied to the next day saying that it had been found in our suite. To my delight, I received it the next day, free of charge. I honestly couldn't have asked for more from a hotel. I have travel frequently, but have yet to encounter a hotel with such great customer service as The W, especially the W in Times Square. I came back to Houston raving about the hotel, I don't think we could ever stay anywhere else...we got too spoiled!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: leafer516
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights before departing for Italy. Room very comfortable, bed great. Location excellent, plenty of restaurants, in between Times Sq. and Ninth Avenue. Was not at all noisy and lobby quiet. We did not experience what the other reviewer did. Only minor complaint would be that the hotel too accessible from the outside with so many exits and entrances and no one guarding or checking.

Reviews.Title: “In need of rennovation and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Evie_Peanut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W from 10 - 13 Nov as a few days sight seeing prior to the start of a business trip. We booked a "Fabulous" corner room for $539 per night less taxes, which turned out to be far from it's description although it was on a corner. The room was in dire need of decoration, drab and small. The bathroom was mouldy and had a strange smell. Directly outside our room was an ice machine which made a terrible crashing noise every 10 minutes and leaked the whole time we were there. We reported this twice as the carpet outside our room was drenched. Unfortunately we had a connecting door to the room next to ours which meant we got to hear ALL of the 4am - 7am party the occupant decided to have with his mates on Saturday morning. We did complain to the hotel the next morning and were given a 50% discount for that night's stay but were not convinced that the occupant was properly dealt with. The Blue Fin restuarant offers great food and the bar area is very trendy but, for that reason, very busy. The concierge was helpful in recommending restuarants and advice on how to get around. In all we would not choose to stay here again and did not feel that we were really getting value of money. If you can afford these rates then there are better alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the W Times Square”
Reviews.Author: kel110661
Reviews.Content: We booked The W for a girls weekend hitting concerts, theatre, and shopping . We come up several times a year for both business and pleasure and are quite at home here. Was a little concerned about staying right in the heart of Times Square (touristy, crowded) as we usually stay down in Soho. But we got a great deal through Starwood so decided to check it out. I'm glad we did. From the moment we arrived, great, great service. The bell staff was attentive and polite the whole stay. The front desk was wonderful, even with a busy lobby of people checking out all at once. We arrived 6 hours before official check-in simply hoping to stow our luggage. They asked us to wait in the Living Room where we surfed the free wi-fi while they coordinated with the cleaning staff to have our room ready as quickly as possible. We couldn't believe it when they came to get us in less than an hour. The room was definitely NYC small. Almost too small. And the bathroom was a tight fit. But the furnishings were chic and the beds incredibly, incredibly comfy, the amenties top notch and the view spectacular. The hallways were a bit dim but never a serious problem. Someone had mentioned earlier about the confusion over the elevators. I'm not sure why since it only took one time for the staff to show us the details and even when coming in late at night with a few cocktails under our belts, we zipped up to our rooms without getting lost. The Living Room in the p.m. was a blast. Lot of people and good music. We ended up talking to a group of people at the bar who turned out to be a favorite band of ours. Small world. Drinks are a bit pricey but no surprise in NYC. Bar service started out great but by the end of the evening the bartenders were obviously just phoning it in and preferred to chat amongst themselves rather than take drink orders or ring up tabs. Whether you stay here or not, you MUST eat at the Blue Fin in the hotel. EXCELLENT seafood and sushi-very fresh. (We are from a coastal area and are very picky about our seafood.) Service was fantastic and the scene was great for people watching. We had a dinner and two lunches there and were never disappointed. Don't miss it. Maid service was efficient. They came a bit early one morning though in their defense we forgot our do not disturb sign. Once we put that up we weren't bothered at all. And our room was clean when we returned from shopping later that day. The Club downstairs was ok-crowded, music not to our liking but we really didn't spend much time there. Make sure you have a full wallet. A round of shots can set you back serious money. Check out was slower than check-in. The guy seemed new and made several mistakes. But as always, attentive, professional and very nice and very genuine. We never got an attitude from anyone there except a little from the bartender that one late nite. In a nutshell, we'd go back again due to the great service, the incredible beds and the Blue Fin. Weaknesses would have to be the location and the tight room. We really prefer Soho/Village.

Reviews.Title: “W stands for WORST”
Reviews.Author: annejb
Reviews.Content: Bring a flashlight, bottled water and ear plugs. The joint is tragically hip -ultra dark common spaces, blasting rock & roll in the check in area. 6 oz bottle of water is $8, (note, there is no price on it., guess that wouldn't be very hip.) A very unpleasant place to stay especially if you have been traveling half a day and are on a business trip. Great place to stay if you are 18 - 22 years old and want to feel like you are on a bum drug trip.

Reviews.Title: “NOT all that is cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: FM2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. While we were in NY for business, we wanted to stay in a location where we could take in being "tourists" in the evenings after work. It took us several weeks trying to find the right hotel (since there are SO MANY in NY and can be overwhelming to choose), and this one came recommended. Our first impression of the hotel was cool, hip & trendy. We're in our 30's and, being in the fashion industry, we felt this was a very unique hotel and felt right at home....UNTIL......we realized that the hotel is all "hype", and no substance! The rooms were small, but that's expected being that it's NY. But what really got to us was the PAPER THIN WALLS...even the walls WITHIN the room (ie. walls / doors to the bathroom). The door to the bathroom is like one of those japanese paper-made sliding doors that doesn't even close all the way so you literally have no privacy whatsoever. We could hear EVERYTHING that was going on next door on both sides of our room. Conversations (at normal talking level..in other words, they weren't talking loud or yelling), TV, the water running...even VERY PERSONAL situations if you know what I mean. It was very difficult to sleep at night! Other frustrating things about this hotel: the hallways are pitch black w/ these funky blue lights or some other dim color lights; You have to take 2 elevators to get to your room; We needed assistance from the bellman 4 times during our stay, and each time (and I'm not exxagerating), we had to wait at least 10 minutes to get someone to help us; and when they did finally come to help us, they acted like we were bothering them! One of us in our group even tried to get one of the bellman's attention and the bellman walked away to a room and slammed the door on our face!! Lastly, the guys outside helping you to get cabs NEVER greeted us unless there was a door they could open or some way they could get a tip from us.... It was disgusting. Positive point: the staff that worked at the check-in counter were all extremely helpful & courteous! Whenever we needed help with our room key, or with Fed Ex mail, or even needing an umbrella (it started pouring outside on 1 day)...they went out of their way to assist us promptly. So kudos to them! They made our stay bearable. But overall, what I initially thought was a cool, friendly & service-oriented hotel, turned out to be so not what I expected! The W / Times Square Hotel just comes in a "pretty package" w/ great marketing...but the service overall is not acceptable and the quality of the hotel is mediocre. Frankly, I think they try WAY too hard to be trendy....that they forget that all their guests want is to be comfortable, feel pampered....& feel right at home. For us, it was actually "work" to stay at this hotel and NOT very comfortable at all! We will never come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - hotel is okay”
Reviews.Author: vivetsandys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before and returned because we had a great view from our room. We did not have a great view from our room this time and we were not told of any extras. The rooms are small but they are nice. The location is outstanding but I can do without the W attitude. The staff really do believe they are doing you a favor by doing their job which is kind of disappointing. My second visit to this hotel was a substantial drop off in quality of service and attention to detail from my first visit. In the end it was nothing special which was kind of a letdown after such a positive first visit.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but service is terrible”
Reviews.Author: US/UKTRAVELLER
Reviews.Content: Nice enough rooms, ok hotel but everything there costs a fortune (someone else has commented on the $49 croissants!) and $17 a day for internet access in the room. Service was dreadful, maids ignored do not disturb signs, concierge was never there and getting a taxi out of the doorman was near to impossible. Not sure I would return in a hurry - there are other hotels which are just as nice for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Pity about the Room”
Reviews.Author: flytoomuch
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days on business. Unfortunatly the room we were given was opposite the lift - thankfully I still had my earplugs!. Included in the rate was a "breakfast" that would have cost $49 a day - a LOT of money for a muffin, toast and a glass of juice!. Staff were standoffish and the bathroom "walls" well pieces of corrogated plastic were a little thin for my liking. The Bliss toiletries were nice, and the food at the seafood restraunt on Street Level was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, hip, but complicated hotel”
Reviews.Author: xtos
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Hotel stay was great. I took my significant other there for his birthday during the labor day weekend. The lounge and bar area is so cool, and the music playing all around just makes you feel great. The room size was average and the decor in the room was cool, but simple. The views are minimal due to the location and other high rises nearby, so don't stay here for the views. The Blue Fin restaurant is excellent, and the breakfast is especially good there. Service is also great. Unfortunately our Hotel room wasn't ready to check in until 5pm, and we arrived there at 2:30pm, but other than that all went well. They were booked solid the night before and simply couldn't get our room ready in time. Understandable for this busy part of town. It was a bit of an inconvenience, but we stored our bags and went shopping downtown to pass the time, and then were called when the room was ready. The elevators in the hotel are not well designed. You need to take two separate elevators to get from outside the hotel to your room, and finding your elevator is not easy. I don't know why they designed it this way, it was a mistake. They should try to fix this if they can. Valet parking was good, as were the other services. Overall a great place to stay if you want to be in the middle of everything. It is by no means quiet, but it's Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Palce to stay”
Reviews.Author: kiki4u
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the W time square it was clean close to all the action and I really enjoyed the staff and the bar and resturant. I was did not like was the spa! a bit under kept and the services was not up to par. otherwise Great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lovemonterey
Reviews.Content: This was a GREAT property. We stayed on the 57th floor with an amazing view of Times Square. We traveled with 2 different families and the adults and kids loved it equally!!! It is rather dark in the hallways and lobby but it is supposed to be that way. The beds were very comfortable and the location was great to take in a show or wander the hustle and bustle of Times Square. My only complaint was the noise on Saturday night. The traffic and city life was extremely loud even though we were on the top floor. I had to wear ear plugs to get a good nights sleep. Sunday night was very quiet and the ear plugs went in the trash. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Complain”
Reviews.Author: kingdave19
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at the W Hotel in Time Square from September 22-24, 2006. I have to say that I rather enjoyed my stay. The hotel is very well located in the heart of Time Square. We walked back from Central Park and it took us about a half an hour. The bar at the hotel is very modern and nice. The staff was rather pleasant as well. The rooms were typical W rooms. Very new & modern, although these are a little older than I am used to for a W. Overall I would say that it is a very nice hotel if you are looking to spend some time in the center of Manhatten. Beware though as like much of New York, it is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rooms a bit small”
Reviews.Author: oundine
Reviews.Content: Great Location if you're a tourist - you can walk to many of the area attractions. The subway is also fairly nearby opening up the rest of the city for excursions. Bar area was spacious and very hip with nice decor. Hotel security was definitely present in the lobby area checking to make sure only guests entered to the elevator area. Everything else was a bit small - not surprisingly but clean. Rooms were, again, a bit small but the beds were comfortable with nice robes. Good water pressure from the shower although lighting was a bit lacking. Rooms were clean and noise level was low (was at the end of the hall). Elevators were small and could get a bit cramped if you have a lot luggage... although we rarely had to share. Parking - be prepared to pay $50/night for valet parking. Street parking can be hard to obtain. The surrounding area had restaurants from a deli to higher end restaurants depending on your budget. The lighting in the streets were adequate and comfortable to walk around at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kappadog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the time of our life in New York City and staying at the W was a highlight. The energy of the lobby bar (which we only walked past) and decor of the entire hotel was modern, well thought out, and very aesthetically pleasing and stimulating to your senses. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Julia was fabulous as were the guys on the 3rd shift doorman staff. They kept us entertained with friendly conversation as we waited 1 hour for our 4:30 AM car service which arrived at 5:30 AM. New Yorkers really are the best! We loved the bed, Bliss products, location, activity, staff, and again, did I mention the ultra hip modern decor throughout the hotel? Oh, and the cookies served in the afternoon were very good. The tour buses leave from across the street and Broadway shows are right around the corner, location-location-location!!!! Please ignore the bad reviews unless you are known to have really bad, drab taste. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “WOW W!”
Reviews.Author: ellafushi
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York. Me, Hubby and Baby (18 months) Uncle and Grandparents too - We Loved it! Yes its Uber trendy, however, fitted us well. My daughter asked me why the TV was on all the time - it was the view over Times Square and Broadway that she was looking at. Now at 3 she stills remembers it! Well placed for visiting all we needed to and the concierge and Door personnel were fantastic - understated but seriously clued up. The aspect of the W outweighed any 'minor' imperfections for us. A great time had by all - really pleased we got to stay at W for our first venture into NYC! Oh - and yes, Sage and Lemongrass products from Bliss have become favourites, we were impressed by the toiletries too!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not the best”
Reviews.Author: cynderemy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel is in a great location - right in Times Square and close to transportation. The hotel was ok. I've stayed at better ones in NYC. It was very dark and dreary. We didn't have any problems with noise or our room. We just thought is was a bit stuffy for a W hotel. Stay at the Westin a few blocks away - it's much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: ewatts74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W in Times Square for a long weekend and we were pleasantly surprised considering some of the reviews that I read here were not so good. The staff at check-in was very friendly. We checked our luggage and the front desk took my cell phone to call us when our room was ready. We walked around the corner and were about ready to order lunch when they called! We ate lunch and then went and checked in! It is always nice to get settled in as soon as you arrive. We were given a great corner room with a large window looking out on Times Square and another window facing south with a slight view of the Hudson river. Our room was on the 30th floor. Nice clean room with robes and bliss bath products were great. Before we left for the evening, I called the front desk to let them know that our sink was not draining. When we returned to the room, there was a note from maintenance that it was fixed. We never had another problem with it. The beds are extremely comfortable!! We were not disturbed by traffic noise or outside lights. I asked for a late check out because we didn't leave for the airport until 4:00 pm and it was sweltering outside. We wanted to have a place to go rest and cool off. Instead of checking out at 12:00, we were allowed to keep our room until 2:00 which I was really grateful for!! The concierge was able to print out our boarding passes for us too. If you want to stay right in the heart of Times Square then this is the place for you! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jessmatt
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a 3 night stay at the W Times Square. We booked on hotwire, but were treated like we paid top dollar for this stay! Staff was overly friendly and helpful. We arrived at 11:00am and were given a room without having to wait. My children, ages 10 and 12, loved the room, especially the plasma screen TV. Beds were very comfortable and the room was not too small as I have read in several other reviews. Would definitely stay again! ( And no problem with a request for two beds.)

Reviews.Title: “W Times Sq. in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: RickInPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Times Square for the first time July 21-23. As a frequent visitor to New York and a loyal Starwood member, I felt this hotel and location were excellent. The highlights: - If you like the whole W "vibe," this place will be right up your alley. The street entrance is a trippy, artsy light and water scene that sets the mood. Elevators take you up to the 7th floor "living room," which is dimly lit and comfortable with fun couches, light projections and a nearby bar. Check in was quick and friendly. - Rooms decorated very modern, flat screen TV, full mini-bar, desk facing the window, overlooking Times Square, extremely comfortable bed and pillows. Shower was all glass - no tub - and quite roomy. Not great water pressure....but hey, you can't have everything. Bliss bath products were a nice treat. - Location is perfect if you're seeing a show (all theaters are within a few blocks - easy to walk anywhere), catching the subway (stations for Blue Line from JFK @ 50th & 8th.....or all lines a few blocks down the street @ 42nd St.), or just walking uptown or downtown. Very centrally located. Big plus for me was Starbucks only steps away from the front door! Really had no complaints about this hotel. Best rates can be found at spg.com...search AAA (if you're a member - they asked to see my AAA card at this hotel) or promotional rates. Standard rates are very pricey, even for New York. The only caveat is for those not familiar with the W. This chain is targeted to a hipper crowd. This ain't no Marriott with a floral bedspread, plastic shower curtain and a coffee shop. Furnishings and bathrooms are very modern (the bathroom door was frosted glass and slid closed on a track) and hallways are moody and pretty dark. Also, since you're in Times Square, there's bound to be honking horns from gridlocked traffic in the streets below and LOTS of flashing lights from billboards coming in through windows if shades aren't drawn - I love the sights and sounds of the city, but some may not appreciate that. If you get a decent rate, splurge for the W Times Square!

Reviews.Title: “Honest Reivew”
Reviews.Author: BrewCity
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a weekend trip to NYC for my 26th b-day. This was our first trip to NYC but we have traveled to many other large cities in the US. I have to admit that I was a little nervous about the hotel after reading what many others wrote about it on this site. We arrived at the W around noon on Friday and the check in was fast and friendly. We had a room on the 40th floor with a view of Times Square. Our room was clean, and more spacious than I expected. We loved the bed and the robes! The Bliss products also were a nice touch. He had arranged to have a birthday surprise waiting for me that night which consisted of rose petals leading to the bed and then a big heart of petals on the bed. Also, there were chocolate covered strawberries and champagne waiting for us with a nice card. (This was complimentary). This is an example of how they go out of their way to make your stay special. Also the next night a bottle of wine was sent to our room. (also complimentary!) All the workers were friendly and very helpful. We both enjoyed our stay at the W. The location was great for us first timers to NYC. We didn't hear much from outside while in our room so I don't know what others complained about. There are areas that this hotel could improve upon (not the the service) but overall we really enjoyed it. I would definately recomend this hotel to friends. I would also suggest contacting the hotel to see if you can get a better rate than the internet, and if not, see what they can do for you to make your stay more special. For what we paid I feel we got a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “What an absolute dive”
Reviews.Author: BondGirl99
Reviews.Content: This hotel and the services it offered were so bad, it is hard to know where to start. The rooms were very small and the bathrooms minute. There were stains on the bedspreads and the carpets were very tired. The noise from Times Square was dreadful and could be heard on the 46th, 51st and 37th floors (we moved three times to try and find some peace and quiet). The rooms that have connecting doors to another room must be the worst. There is no sound insulation whatsoever and we had to call security at 4am to ask them to speak with our neighbours to turn the TV down. The hotel is under-staffed. Our luggage took a long time to arrive and on departure, they could not find where they had put our luggage (it had been in storage). The lobby (7th floor) was heaving with piles of luggage everywhere and noone was there to help. The only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast. Food was fresh and the service was reasonably prompt. Then again, for US$39 for two smoothies and two toasted bagels, it should be. An absolute dump. It should be closed down, given a thorough cleaning, hire more staff to look after guests, get double-glazing (at least) and get rid of connecting doors. New York has a tremedous choice of hotels, so avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “Second and last time at this joint”
Reviews.Author: herculepoirot
Reviews.Content: If you look closely this hotel is a haven for pretentious people who want to stay and play in Times Square. However, it doesn't take a trained eye to see the service, food and housekeeping is below moderate yet you can say you stayed at the W Times Square...BIG DEAL. New York City is full of truly quaint, exceptional hotels that cost the same and provide a much better level of service. It really seems that W is all about the bars and their stupid lifestyle stores-- they've really lost their way when it comes to accomodating business or leisure travelers -- so why give this hotel anymore of my money? You don't get much in return...not even a glass of water with your room service order...that needs to purchased separately from your minibar, folks. Ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Value Yes, Nice No”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was at the W Times Square for business. It is a great location for pleasure but it is very difficult to find a quiet spot or an outside cafe. My room was near the elevators and I constantly heard noise in the hallway and elevator music. I did not feel as if I had any privacy. My room was very worn with the most unacceptable issue being a stained bed skirt. I think without a renovation it is a three star at best. I paid $270 including tax, high floor and nice view, so I consider it a value. And last but certainly not least, the staff was wonderful and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location/ little value”
Reviews.Author: wileySanDiego
Reviews.Content: Clearly you are paying for location- it is really really good. The hotel is too pricey for mini-box sized rooms. Make sure to get a room away from the elevators and make reservations for drinks. Multiple elevator changes makes it a long time to get to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a really high floor and a very good view even though I booked it a few days before and it is the memorial day weekend. The boutique style hotel looks very sleek and the room look fantastic. It was very pricy and I do feel like there should be more they can offer. Wierdest is they don't have wireless internet. Shouldn't this be a standard to modern hotels? Everything else are very satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BeforeSunrise
Reviews.Content: The W Times Square has a downtown feel with the convenience of being near the theater, shopping and many tourist destinations. It is consistent "W" fare, which means cool decor, swank lobby bar and great service. I recommend as your home base for a fun NYC trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay for your precious $$$”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the reviewers had a terrible experience. We didn't have it so bad but we did have our issues. The bathroom was not really clean, we felt quite uncomfortable we sprayed everything with lysol! the room was dark, no view to speak of, the bed was comfy with plush pillows but their were stains on the sheets & the bed covers were kind of dusty, our room was by the elevator also, room svc was so slow, we also didn't get a nytimes each morning. at $380 per nite, "what should we have expected from a 1st class NYC hotel?!" Must admit the living room lounge was a kool place to hang out (JW blue was $40 a glass!). Staff were quite friendly, Jana our concierge quite helpful. Kate the bartender de-gorgeous! Those were the redeeming value of staying here in the heart of times square. If it wasn't for the staff from the concierge, bartender, doorman & local beat cop recommending Raku down the block for sushi, it would have not been a very good stay at the W. But the sushi at Raku was excellent - so thks to the W-staff, one last saving grace. But I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Relieved - it was a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Screen name cant think of one
Reviews.Content: After reading the views I too was wondering what we had let ourselves in for. Yes the place was very modern and dark. It is by not means a traditional hotel but we enjoyed it. Our room size was fine the bed was very comfy (maybe a little bit short for US standards) especially the pillows and since back home I shall buy one from their website (as I do miss it it was sooo comfy). We were on the 36th floor so not very high and had a view of another hotel but if you looked sideways you could see times square and on the other side the sea. We arrived in the early hours and in the room a light was on for us and also the cd was playing music. On arrival at the hotel you walk passed the concierge desk on the right with the restaurant on the left. It has the water running on the ceiling and looked very impressive. You take the lift to the 7th floor where the main reception desk is together with the lounge area and shop. You then take another lift to your room. We did not see the whisky club or the spa area as we were out sight seeing all day. The bliss collection they supplied to use in the bathroom were fantastic and you could buy them to take home from the hotel's shop which certainly did have some unusual items. I would have liked to have seen a few womans personal items in the bathroom but never mind. The sink and tap had seen better days but I feel that perhaps the quality of the make let them down unlike the shower which had a good well known company name and this worked wonderful and could copy with the constant use. The food in the hotel was good but very expensive. I did have one complaint as one morning after being seated in the restaurant we waited for 15 mins until I got up to ask for the menu. He said he would bring it over which he did. We then waited another 5 mins without being served and a woman came in and was seen to straight away. We then walked out and complained to the Manager. The concierge, Gilmar, was wonderful. He was so nice and helpful and told us everything we needed to know giving us leaflets with vouchers in for free gifts and money off items. I did find the lounge area to be a bit intimidating as in the evenings it was full of people and very noisy. However, one evening we went in there for a drink and found it fine. I would come to this hotel again if it was just my husband and I. I would not feel it is the right hotel to bring my daughter. While we were there (Mon-Sat) it was mainly business people. I feel it is a very business like hotel which showed in the bedrooms that had pc, printers, paper etc. Everyone there was very nice especially Gilmar and the location was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Far above the rest.......W surpasses!!!”
Reviews.Author: CaptainJJG29
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our weekend at the W times square. After reading all the reviews, I have to admit I was a little concerned about taking the trip to the W, but all my fears were dismissed as I arrived at this great hotel. To start, the location is great. It is smack dab on times square and broadway...just perfect. The lobby was very cool and somewhat trendy with dim lights and funky seating. The check in process was very quick. We arrived early and left our bags which was not a problem and were given the option of a call or text message when our room was ready. And like they said, when the room was ready we received the text message. The room was great, we asked for a view and had a great view of broadway and times square. It was a beautiful room, far bigger than what others had mentioned. Very funky bathroom with glass shower and sliding doors, loved it. Also the bed was amazing and mirrors covered much of the walls, with a huge flat screen in the middle. Overall, the hotel offered everything and more. I would highly recommend the W times square to anyone who wants the complete chic New York City experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good compromise”
Reviews.Author: reading222
Reviews.Content: I can't beleive that there are 100 better hotels in NYC. Some of the reviews are off the mark. If you are easily offended by some quite dull dance music in the lifts and black walls in the halls, then maybe you should stick to the dull multinational chains in the area. The customer service was great and the entrance, lobby and bar, were quite cool. We found the staff friendly and not at all snobby. Our room was not to the same standard but it had a great view. Some of the fittings in the room are ageing and some of the tiles in the shower (with a door in our case) were loose. Also the hotel bar does get busy, with lots of non-residents which was annoying. Overall a good choice for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - But is it worth the premium???”
Reviews.Author: H&DVB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel during Dec 2005. Although this is a good hotel in a fantastic location, we did have some reservations. We arrived at 9.30pm, after a 12 hour journey. Our first impression was a little disturbing, as the reception basically was like walking into a trendy nightclub, in full swing. Don't get me wrong we are only young, but this did feel intimidating whilst we just wanted to get to bed! We requested a non-smoking room - but ended up with the opposite. We were advised that the hotel was full, so there was no chance of changing (probably as we were on a discounted rate). Our room was beautiful and trendy, however it was very dark, as there were only wall lights - useless for make up application. We overlooked this as our view was fabulous - full window overlooking Time Square. Our bathroom was poor (bath didn't hold water properly) and there were signs of neglect (i.e. cracked tiles). If we had paid the full rate we would have been gutted, as I have stayed in far better 4* Hotels. The location was perfect for us to explore New York, so the Hotel did not spoil our fun. To be honest we would have probably been ok with a 2-3*, as we spent most of our time out and about. Tip - make sure that you visit customer services in Bloomingdales / Macys to get a discount card, if you are out of state.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!”
Reviews.Author: karendew
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the W Time Square was wonderful! We are four women ages range from 27-45. We all loved it!. The staff knows how to treat each and everyone of their customers like VIP's. I couldn't get over how attentive they were to our needs. We were on the 19th floor and were very happy with our room. Hotel is very close to Brooks Atkinson Theatre. Club Whiskey was great...talk to James and get into the vip section where dancing is lots of fun! I am a hotel snob and have stay frequently at Bellagio and Venetian in Las Vegas as well as Paris and Cannes Chic hotels. This is a FUN hotel! I am already planning my next trip...starbucks is directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad.......”
Reviews.Author: BdavisB11
Reviews.Content: Im not going to create a long winded review but i'll touch on some important issues with my stay on 2/19/06. First - the guest rooms are very small - as is typical in NYC - they are decorated in dark gray colors and the furnishings have a very cheap - IKEA feel. My sheets and duvet cover had rips/holes in them. Blue Fin was a great place to eat with very good food - athmosphere was great - modern with excellent lighting. Late in the evening we went to the club downstairs - THE WHISKEY. We had been there earlier at around 5pm just to go in and check it out. As soon as we walked down the stairs there was an overwhelming smell of TOILET BOWL in the place. It smelled like the bathroom at the port authority - it was bad - we were going to have a drink but we told the bartender about it and just let - it was BAD. Later that night we returned, curious to check it out and see if they did something about the doo-doo smell - and they did - it was fine. BUT ....Let me just tell you that the crowd was HORRIBLE - i couldnt believe the quality of people in this place - it was like all the misfits who couldnt get beyond the ropes at the better clubs. Maybe it was a slow night and the bouncers at the door by the street were ushering in whomever they could find walking by with a "no cover charge" deal just to fill the place up- i dont know - but when we got there were had just come from eating dinner at SPICE MARKET - (great place by the way - very chic and trendy) and were at the club across the street "ONE" (another great place) - no one at the whiskey was dressed well by NYC club standards - there were a lot of un-cool - very un-hip chubbies on the floor - one woman was wearing nike sneakers with MOM JEANS - ....there were some thuggish looking guys dancing with their coats and hats still on. Its was so bizarre....it was like watching a bunch of townies from oklahoma out for a big night in "the big city" - all excited to finally be at a GEN-U-WINE CLUHHBBB! - HORRIBLE AND NOT COOL! i swear i wish i took pics to post in this review - wouldve been funny to show these people....if you ever go there, watch out for the ass smell - lol! dont say i didnt warn you!

Reviews.Title: “If you only read one review on this hotel....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Giselle Bavaro. That is the only name you need to know if you're thinking of having a function and staying at the W Times square. Giselle is the area manager for the W and my wife and I recently had our wedding there. We planned it for a year from the other side of the world and Giselle made it run like clock work. All the hotel staff from the doormen, the conceirge, check in, wedding staff...the nicest hotel staff I have ever come across. Forget these reviews about 'dark hallways' and 'disappointing rooms'. The hotel is in the centre of the universe and what a vibe. Get a suite and I promise you won't be disappointed. I cannot thank the W and Giselle enough for making the weekend stay as memorable as it was. It's 2 months later and they're still sending us gifts overseas! Their service extends beyond what you'd expect and that's what makes the W experience one of the best. Stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always stay at St-Regis or W's whenever possible, and after reading some of the reviews in here I was a little concerned before I left for a 5 day business trip on which I brought my family with me (kids are 7 and 5). Our experience was great in every way. This hotel is trendy, very hip - if that's not for you don't come here. But I absolutely loved it and the kids were treated extremely well by the staff. We did have a little issue with our first suite, and they didn't even bother trying to fix it - they just upgraded us in a matter of a few hours. The hotel manager actually came to talk to us directly to apologize... he didn't need to because we understood the situation but it was a nice touch. We have already booked our next 11 days trip to NYC at this hotel in March... I would actually live here if I could :-)

Reviews.Title: “W = Waste of time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have been a fan of other W Hotels. The one in Time Square is a bit cheap and disappointing. When booking would have been nice if they notified us of the planned construction that was going to start on our first day. Massage in spa was excellent... only couldn't really relax do to the hammer and chiseling 3 floors below.... not their fault. BUT the rooms very small, not impressive. The heat you turn it up a bit you boil... down a bit.... you freeze. The shower tiles were broken so after every shower you have a flood in the bathroom. Decor in rooms very dated... seemed they tried too hard, but then again so does half of NY, so once again can't fault them. One last thing, the music they play in the hallways day and night to creat atmosphere I guess... you can hear it in your rooms when you are trying to sleep. If I had to recommend a W in NY it would definitely be the one on Lex.

Reviews.Title: “hip w”
Reviews.Author: noseaii
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the w times square dec 3. I used starwood points so the room was free. This was a very busy weekend in ny. Our room wasnt ready when we arrived about 4 pm, but we checked our bags, given free drink vouchers, and they called us on our cellphone when the room was ready. They had a nice warm beverage and cookies in the lobby. Everything about this hotel was very hip. I suppose you would either like or hate the decor, but we liked it. The room was nice, quiet , good shower and the usual great starwood beds. Service was good,informal. We dined at the Blue fin attached to the hotel and the food was very good(wine is pricey however) A .very good stay

Reviews.Title: “W disappoints”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked the W for a romantic weekend getaway. Our past W experiences have been great. This one has location, a fun entry, a neat lobby and bar. When we got to our room it was a let down. I am sure it once was a nice room but honest to GOD I think our room was used by a local fraternity for 6 months. The walls were banged up and the sink was cracked. The TV center / bureau draws were not the same style as the room. Maybe the original that went with the room was broken in a brawl. We changed rooms and found the faternity used multiple rooms. There must be better for the price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place to stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: lifes2short
Reviews.Content: OK, as mentioned it's got the great location, it's definitely hip and the bar is a great hang out space. Did I mention the (female)bar staff is gorgeous? Check in is very quick and efficient....I always ask for a corner room, which has a great view of Times Square and is very quiet as well. I like the decor...it is very modern and "cool"...you feel like you're staying a contemporary NYC apartment. The bed is very comfortable, the rooms are always quiet (well insulated for sound....important to me), the elevators are quick, there is a CD player and DVD player in the rooms, mini bar......hey it works for me!

Reviews.Title: “W = Wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from NYC and we stayed the W Hotel. This hotel is right in Times Square and was a fantastic location to get around all of the sites. This hotel is ultra contemporary and is very clean and the rooms were of a very high standard. We emailed prior to arrival to request a Times Square View (we did not pay for this) and upon arrival this was granted. The staff are highly professional and polite. We cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of parade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "W" during Thanksgiving and were overall pleased. There were some exceptions, however. The shared experience of the W might be too much of a shared experience when it comes to bathroom activity; the bathroom's partitions are constructed of something resembling rice paper. There is no exhaust fan which can be handy at times. The second issue I had with the "W" was when I requested they remove the mini-bar contents. The mini-bar is on the lower open shelf of the dresser in full view and much beyond the temptation of my 14 month old son. I was informed they would charge $35 for the accomodation. Since we were already paying right at $600 per night this "convenience charge" seemed excessive. The room was small, the halls very dark and the bath towels similar to those you might find at a Motel 6. The view, however, was fabulous and we were right in the middle of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds, great location, poor receptionists!”
Reviews.Author: Irish_view
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the W Hotel in Times square on a first trip to New York. I was a bit concerned having read previous reviews (after I'd booked) and true enough, the corridors were dark, the lounge music loud, and the smell from the scented candles a bit overpowering. I had asked for a corner room but this was not honoured. Our room was on 51st floor where we looked directly across into the Marriott where the rooms looked a bit more spacious. On the plus side, the location was fab and we were able to enjoy the thanksgiving day parade at close quarters. The bed was extremely comfortable, which I was very grateful for after a hard days sightseeing, and the bathroom products were first class. However I did feel that the hotel is badly let down by the desk staff who gave the impression of being too cool to deal with customers. I had to ask three times before one lady fully explained where the concierge was, why couldn't she do it first time without making me feel stupid (even if I am)? I've never seen a concierge sit in a black suit at a table with a laptop before, I thought he was a business man. The Concierge was extremely helpful though, and the maid who serviced the room was great as well. Given the excellent customer service I experienced everywhere else in New York, its a pity these desk clerks were the exception to the rule. I don't imagine I would return to this hotel as I'm sure there are plenty that are equally nice but a lot more welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BUT KIND OF DIRTY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nov/2006 NOT 2005 - Site won't let me select 2006. Urine smell in bathroom, bathroom not cleaned well - yellow line across shower curtain which they exchanged after complaining. Maids not doing their jobs cleaning batroom. Bed was excellent and the rest of the room was fine. Would stay there again, but bring my own LYSOL!! Good location.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 10 minutes on the phone for US$125 which I didn't find out until leaving when my total phone bill was $800.....this used to happen a decade ago....not now with the most competitive phone rates....kept charging me for crap breakfast service even though they promised it would be free !!! dark & dirty is how I would describe it no matter what the view is like !!! I will not stay in any W or Westin Hotel again and I think Starwood Hotels (HOT is the equity ticker) is a BIG SELL.....

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! The rooms were small and in bad condition. There was a big stain on the wall. Mirror was broken. The chic was all cheap. There was almost no service. The lobby/lounge on the seventh floor was just plain obnoxious. I feel so ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Take a torch”
Reviews.Author: Yorkieboy
Reviews.Content: OK, the corridors are not quite that dark but the black paint and dark carpets that seem to be the signature of the modern designer hotel are strongly in evidence here. We stayed two nights having had to relocate from a nearby hotel because they were full when we decided to extend our stay. The room was clean and very pleasant. Well equipped with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was a shower room. The shower was excellent although it partially flooded the rest of the bathroom. Oddly the walls of the bathroom were made of translucent plastic - a triumph of style over substance - and of possible concern to the more prudish. The bar was excellent and popular - a bit like the Sanderson to those who know that London hotel - and the staff civil at least. The hotel could not be more centrally located but I think the hotel is still quite expensive for what it is though and while you could be assured of a perfectly pleasant - indeed enjoyable - stay here unless I got a very good rate in the future I could not say it was good value or that I would hasten back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend trip at the W Times Square and it was disappointing. The room resembled something designed by Trading Spaces...trying and failing to be chic. The staff appeared to be overworked and under trained. We frequently visit upscale trendy new venues and this just missed the mark. Keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Bad”
Reviews.Author: gugu
Reviews.Content: I had the worst experience at the W Times Square. I wouldnt know where to start complaining o I better leave that. In NY you have plenty of hotels - but dont book this one. Marvin

Reviews.Title: “over-rated”
Reviews.Author: jwu19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 other girlfriends out on a girls only trip. The first problem we ran into was that they had "misplaced" one of our reservations for a room with 2 beds so that 2 of us had to stay in a room with a single king sized bed. They wouldn't even compensate us for the trouble. The hotel decor was very modern and reminded me a bit of that commercial where the older couple is in a very chic and modern hotel and they couldn't figure out how to work the shower. It wasn't that bad but you get the idea. We ordered room service one night and when we finished we put the table out in the corridor because it was bulky and took up a lot of space in the room. In the morning it was still there! The lounge was packed every night on the weekend with all sorts of trendy looking young people. I admit I'm just not into the trendy scene but it seemed like the sort of place where you go just to be seen so if you're into that sort of thing this is the place for you. I would have preferred something quieter and a little more grounded. But that's just me. The thing I liked the most about this hotel is that it's right in the heart of Time Square which was fun on weekend nights and we didn't have too much trouble with traffic noise in the morning. Oh, and the pillows were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Tried to rip me off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: checked in ,wih a confirmed room and confirmed corpoate rate- but the hotel was overbooked, so they tried to jack the rate ....be careful, check you bill ! rooms are dark and in need of maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Steps Away from the Center of the Universe...”
Reviews.Author: GrandOhioTraveler
Reviews.Content: Recommended for: couples, singles, groups of friends, 20 to 30 somethings, business travelers looking to go out at night, fashion-conscious individuals, fans of W Hotels in general Not recommended for: 50 and up (I would not recommend this hotel for my parents, in their early 70s), tourists, families (unless you have a fashion-conscious teenage daughter) What's good: sleek, modern entrance and lobby, 2 complimentary drinks at their bar, spacious rooms complete with very long vanity mirror, comfortable bed, large bathroom with complimentary Bliss bathroom products, large shower stall, excellent views of Times Square, chic Blue Fin restaurant, GREAT location in the heart of Times Square What's bad: yes, you do need to put extra towels on the floor as the shower water does leak out; dark hallways? (that's too, picky, IMO--how much time does one actually spend in the hallway anyway?) Looking forward to going back and also trying another W hotel...

Reviews.Title: “In the mix”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 3 nites at The W where my husband and I found the staff to be extremely accommodating and professional. Kudos to the concierge for some great restaurant recommendations. Centrally located and an easy walk to restaurants, the theatre, Central Park, Rockefeller Center and more. Comfortable room with stylish appointments. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: nyckk
Reviews.Content: We were overall dissapointed with this hotel. Given the W name, we were hoping for a better quality experience. The rooms were very small but clean. One of the most annoying features was that the doors don't close softly, but make a horrible bang when closing. We were looking forward to sleeping in on a Sunday, and it was not at all conducive to this. The location is very nice though, and the staff very freindly.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish location”
Reviews.Author: jokemuc
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the W for tow nights. It´s a nice stylish and busy hotel. The size of our room was ok, but some paint a new furniture are necessary if they would like to play in the 5 star league. If you don´t want to pay $ 7.00 for a beer from the mini bar, next door is a deli store 24/7.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, overrated, uber-trendy”
Reviews.Author: dino007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Times Square for 4 Nights during July. We booked a Urban Suite for about $550/night! The hotel is very minimalistically designed, and very hip. The bar in the lobby is uber-trendy and the cocktails are great, however service wasn't very good. On weekends the bar pumps, particularly on Saturday nights. If you don't mind coming back to the hotel from your night out, and walking into a "Nightclub-esque" scene, this is for you. If you want a relaxed, non-intimidating stay, I recommend you stay elsewhere. This hotel is aimed at the 20-somethings. When we went to our room we were VERY DISSAPOINTED. The whole room looks extremely cheapely built. The partitions seem to be made of the cheapest, thinnest wood available. The sliding doors on the bathrooms aren't attached properly. Our shower door was missing. When we asked them whether the showers were supposed to have doors or not we were told "some do, some don't". (i.e. If it came off, we didn't bother to put it back!). There isn't a bath, so all you can do is shower, in the door-less shower, and have water spray everywhere, resulting in you having to creep into the corner of the shower in order to not make a mess. Highly irritating. The basins in the bathrooms are simply "floating" basins with no room on the sides for the soap or anything. This also results in splashing on the floor. The lighting in the both bathrooms was terrible. On a more positive note, the bath products provided are VERY nice, from the salon "Bliss". The bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect if you're from out of town and want to be in the centre of the action. However, I would recommend staying somewhere a bit more quiet, and don't want to be in the "theme-park" part of New York. For first timers, this hotel's location is perfect, for the veteren traveller, perhaps Soho would be better. The best part of the hotel were the concierges, particularly Jonathan. Very friendly and a star at an otherwise average hotel. Extremely helpful, made all out restaurant reservations for our entire stay and managed to get us into some jam-packed places that normally require a month-in-advance reservation, such as Tao, which I highly recommend to anyone seeking an awesome vibey night out with great food and great music! In conclusion, if you are young, flashy, trendy, don't have particularly high hotel standards, and have a LOT of money to throw around, this hotel is for you. The only reason I would want to stay here is because it's so trendy, but it's not a good hotel, you have been warned! If you are a bit older and require a more relaxed and luxurious hotel, stay elsewhere. I found this hotel to be terribly overpriced and felt ripped off. For $500+ a night, I expected a bit more than a nightclub with cheap rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place has all the hype, but little to support to it. We stayed for one night and found the staff to be nice, but not responsive nor responsible. The room itself was just okay and not very clean. For example, we had a small off-white chair in the corner that looked like it was donated from the Salvation Army--not what you would expect for $350. This has all the bells & whistles of a supped up Howard Johnson. Having stayed at numerous 5 star hotels, this place cannot compare. The one pleasant surprise was that there was no extra charge for the air you breathed while staying in the room. In addition, they attempt to extort $6.50 for a bottle of water (that is apparently considered an extra for a $350 room). If you prefer living in lighted surroundings, please be sure to bring a flashlight as there two 30watt bulbs in the entire room. Finally, our call to retrieve our car went completely ignored & we had to wait outside for 30 minutes. If you are used to staying at top notch establishments, do not stay at the W. For this price, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "W"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, very hip, comfortable beds and great nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it....”
Reviews.Author: hotelscout
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a birthday celebration in New York and wanted somewhere a bit different to stay. I'm pleased to say we found it here - very trendy place with nice rooms and great service. Good bathroom products (Bliss) and really comfortable beds and pillows. We had a corner room which was an upgrade with two windows over Broadway which was superb (if you like to look down on the action which we do!). Good size TV and DVD / CD player with films and music to loan. Good cocktails (reasonably priced for NY) and the Blue Fin restaurant has a great atmosphere and good food. Wine can be a bit pricey but there are some good choices at the lower end ($38). Some comments on this site about the W hotel are a bit negative - yes the corridors are dark, and the decor is minimalist but this is all down to personal taste. It suited us just fine but if you're a chintz lover then you'll hate it. The staff recommended some good restaurants for us and booked tables etc. and everyone was really helpful. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W on Times Square July 29-31, 2005. We had a suite on the 28th floor with great views of Times Square. Room was very clean, housekeeping was quick with request for more pillows, towels, shampoos, etc. Loved having Bliss products supplied by the hotel! Incredible bed with down comforter, our suite had two bathrooms, both were very clean. We'd absolutely love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Aging Fast”
Reviews.Author: alexhhannah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W in Times Square a couple years ago when it first opened and it was amazing. Fun, chic and great location. Stayed at it again a week ago and it is really aging fast - the hip, cool furnishings in the rooms are dirty. The room we stayed in had a plugged sink and one of the mirrors were broken. (We did not report it as it wasn't worth wasting our time on since we had limited time in NY). The staff was hit or miss. For example, check-in was fine but the bar staff was rude and complained about us ordering a mixed drink (the relatively common mojito) that was a 'signature' drink because they had to go to the other end of the bar to make it (for a $12 drink!). Also, for a "hip" hotel it was a joke to see cleaning supllies (mop, bucket, vacuum) out in the bar on a Saturday night at 1 am when the bar was still open and packed....don't get me wrong - this place still has a fantastic location. is still nice and quiet compared to the chaos in Times Square and still often aims to please but the hotel is really declining fast - lets hope not all the "Ws" get this way as this location used to be my gold standard for a 'W'.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, responsive staff”
Reviews.Author: chris_schene
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat: close to everything and near beautiful central park. The staff was very responsive to any request we made. As an SPG gold member they upgraded me to the 49th floor and we had an excellent view of Broadway. A bit dark (they need backlighting on the elevator numbers: we old guys can’t read the numbers) and a good tourist hotel though not great for business: The cramped business center almost seems to be an afterthought and the room desk was not particularly useful for actual work. Very nice workout center: each workout machine has it’s own TV, ear phones, weights, water. They play this ‘modern” background music constantly and it eventually gets quite old: change up a bit. On balance, we enjoyed our stay though I think equally nice and well located hotels can be had for about 50-75 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and dark”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in April. It is is right in the heart of Times Square which was great for a newcomer to the city like myself, however, I don't think I'd want to stay on Time Square again as it is far too busy. The hotel itself was okay, although overpriced (although maybe that is what you have to pay to stay so centrally in NY). The positives about the hotel are: it had a great gym, bed was comfortable, room was quiet and the bar area was quite cool. However, although the hotel was stylish (had funky music playing in the lifts and reception area) most of the staff were unfriendly and pretentious (with an air of superiority - they sort of made you feel like they were doing you a favour by serving you). Also, the decor was very dark (black corridors and grey walls in the rooms), and it was beginning to get slightly shabby (the bathroom in particular could have done with a re-paint). I certainly would not stay at this hotel if I had children. Overall, I don't think I would stay at this hotel for future trips to NY as it was a little overpriced and felt unwelcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: PeckCheck
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights at the W Times Square, and though this is purportedly the "flagship" for the W chain, we found it somewhat "dirty" for lack of a better word. Call me picky, but I don't particularly care to see large brown stains of indeterminate origins on the blinds, and I don't want to see trash beneath the bed. The hotel needs a little more upkeep. ln the upside, the hotel is in a great central location, and though it is in crazy Time Square, it was remarkably quiet. The lobby area is the typical uber-chic W style with a happening bar scene. The staff was helpful and the concierge was helpful, though they could not get us a reservation at PerSe... (apparently takes an act of God)

Reviews.Title: “Consistent and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels, up and down the scale... I have to rank this hotel as one of my favorites because it's consistent and the location is convienant (heart of times square, never short of a cab, expensive/cheap food can be found around the corner, starbucks and mcdonalds around the corner, etc). I typically stay away from modern Ian Schragger type hotels (HATE THEM)... so despite the modern/hip decor at this hotel, I like it because it's a new hotel compared to the other two W hotels on the east side (renovated apartment building). Those rooms are tiny and the fixures are OLD... at this location, it's modern, clean and comfortable. The rooms are comfortably spacey (not large but decent for NY), the beds/comforters always meet expectations, the service is good... the concierage always makes good restaurant recommendations. The only negative is that the lobby acts as a bar (during the weekends it gets pretty crowded). The music can be loud but it doesn't carry to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: brucergoldberg
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the W hotel in Times square. The hotel was a very nice hotel and most of the staff was very friendly. There were a couple things we didnt like about the hotel - when we got there our tv didnt work, and we could not get our door to stay closed. they had to come up and fix both. Not a big deal but just wanted to point them out. The bathrooms are tiny, no seperation between the toilet and the shower. So very little privacy. The shower door sucked and every time we took a shower the bathroom got water everywhere. Our main complaint was the rudeness of the bartender in the main bar. The gal kept making our drinks wrong according to the drink menu and when we finally brought it to her attention she became even ruder. At $12.50 a pop, we were not very happy. We had to get the bar manager involved who offered very little except to remake our last drink (we spent $300 at the bar over 3 days which isnt a ton considering the drink prices) The next day i spoke to the hotel manager who was very apolgetic and credited our drinks from the previous night. The bar manager told us the bar was a seperate entity and not part of the hotel, which we really could care less about, we just wanted hassle free service. The hotel staff was amazing. They were all so nice. The door guys were always so friendly, and the concierge made reservations for us in some of the nicest places. We had a blast. I worked out every morning in the hotel gym, which was full of basic precor equipment, and had lots of cardio. We had a massage and a facial, the massage was nice, the facial was not so great. We dropped about $1,000 the whole time we were at the hotel as it was our anniversary and the only complaint we really had was the rudeness of the hotel bar girl with long frizzy hair LOL There is a great deli next door with cold drinks, great food, and open 24 hours. Also a starbucks about 300 feet from the front door. There is also a roxy deli about 4 stores down, a planet hollywood with a great bartender (we went there after the w hotel girl was rude to us), and walking distance to some great places. If you have any questions drop us a line. Also I buy unwanted american air miles if anyone has any. good luck

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Quiet in the Heart of Times Square”
Reviews.Author: ajcharleston
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the W hotel. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and quiet. It was amazing how quiet the hotel is compared to the noise and action of Times Square. The location was very convienent. The decor was modern featuring darker colors, which I found quite pleasing (especially after having my senses assaulted by the HONKING and blaring lights outside). The staff was friendly and greeted us each time we left and returned to the hotel. I did not have any problems with the staff as everyone was very accomodating. I searched long and hard for a hotel within this price range that would offer the convienence and cleanliness. The W is a good place to stay. Upon return I would like to stay in a different area besides Times Square (though it was a good experience as a first time visitor to NYC.) Greenwich Village and SoHo as well as the business district would be a nice place to stay. Good luck on your travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned having stayed at the W for 5 nights . Although there were a few teething problems with my requested room , these were soon resolved to our satisfaction. Infact the hotel and staff couldn`t have been more friendly and helpful. I thought the hotel was excellent value as they let my 17 year old daughter and friend stay in the room with us for free. I booked direct with Starwood using the internet special rate and i would certainly reccomend this hotel if you are looking for something a bit different . The location is excellent if you like to be in the "hub of it all" . Credit goes out to all the genuine friendly staff who made out stay a pleasure .

Reviews.Title: “Too Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. I liked the theme and the room was ok although for the price very small. I expected alot more for what I payed for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great.”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc210
