Reviews.Content: Location is good.Hotel staff has an attitude, maybe that 's normal at a W Hotel. Hotel is very dark, and rooms are not as clean as one would expect from this chain. Also disputed a charge added to the bill that was in error. This was removed but showed up on card again a month later. There are better places to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I certainly would not stay at the W again and am sorry for my bad experience. I felt the room was not exceptionally clean, which I would have expected. Also, they really could lose the comforter covers - they are silk and would never stay on the bed, just slid right off if you moved. Also, the temperature of the room could never be adjusted correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but felt a bit dirty”
Reviews.Author: dhemmert
Reviews.Content: It was not an awful stay, but it felt like the room was dirty. Wtih all the black paint, it was hard to really see how far it went. The staff was nice and the location was good. Overall, I had a nice trip, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, little bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at W Times Square from April 21-24, 2005. We were really looking forward to our stay there since this hotel has the best location in all Times Square! Last year, we stayed at W Lakeshore in Chicago and had the best weekend of our life, so we were looking forward to this weekend as well. The hotel is very nice, although I'll have to say that the lobby is too bright and is not cozy at all. In addition, if you want to use the gym and are staying in the upper rooms, you need to take 2 elevators to do so. The good thing is that you can waive the $20 entrance fee for it's lounge if you are a hotel guest. Overall, the hotel is great but I'd rather return to the one in Chicago (watch out since there are 2 in the area) than to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, staff has never heard of the Starwood promise”
Reviews.Author: fdipace
Reviews.Content: It's a shame this hotel has a wonderful bar and rest. However for the price I would avoid staying here if you are bothered by heat when you sleep. The hotel rooms have only heat during the winter months and A/C in the summer. Unfortunately for me during March the temperatures went in the 60's. The sun heated the hotel all day making the room temp reach the 80's. The hotel did not have enough fans for all the requests by guests. When I complained to the front desk they said I was one of many guests who complained but there was nothing that could be done. (I have no idea why they didn't just turn the A/C on). Anyway I reminded them of the Starwood promise such as a free room or extra Starwood points if not satisfied, the girl at the front desk pretended like she had never heard of it. There are much better places to stay in Times Square for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very chic....loved it.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family(mom,dad,sister, and myself)just got back yesterday from our first trip to NYC. I just loved this hotel. It was very chic and trendy, and decorated very nicely. The beds were beyond comfortable, the staff was very, very, very, very friendly, and it's in a great location. I was in awe from the moment I stepped in the hotel. The rooms were not exactly huge, but still a good size for New York. I will definetly stay there the next time I go to NYC!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel puts you off New York completely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel unwelcome in a foreign city, this is the hotel where you should stay. First, there is the check-in from hell. I was at first refused stay in this hotel because my room was paid for by Starwood points!!!! (That already defeats the purpose of collecting points for free stays by choosing Starwood hotels over other chains.) Check-in staff and in particular, one Nick Ivezaj, seem to have had their training in a military camp. Never have I encountered such unfriendly, arrogant and impolite staff. Secondly, the standard of cleanliness leaves much to be desired. The hotel also runs out of toiletries, I believe, in a bid to make you purchase the full size products they have on sale in the bedroom. Thirdly, it is a badly-lit hotel where you can hardly see anything, especially in the common areas. If you want to experience the feeling of staying in a bat cave, that's the place to go! Lastly, but most importantly, I was charged incorrectly for meetings/conventions expenses, when I was there on holiday for the Easter break and certainly not on business. So beware of extra charges on your dedit/credit card statements when you get back home. It seems they will do anything to get extra money from you. So avoid this hotel by all means when staying in New York. There are hundreds of other hotels which are much better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the W Times Square for 1 night. We had a GREAT time. The staff were excellent, from check-in to housekeeping to concierge - it was flawless all 'round. Gone is the typical 'W' attitude I've seen elsewhere, and there was a genuine desire to have guests comfortable. We got a corner room on the 57th (top) floor that was "Spectacular" (their description for it. It really was - we asked for the upgrade and somehow got it. The room was large for NYC, with great sound insulation. The bathrooms were a tad tight, but modern and efficient. The room furniture was extremely modern and funky. The bed was excellent, perfect sheets, comfortable pillows and a lovely bed spread. Each room had an iron, awesome bath robes (really comfortable!), and plenty of great bathroom 'Bliss' products (which are displayed prominently in your room for sale - a tiny bit disappointing). The location is brilliant, right on Times Square, the downstairs bar is a happening place (recommended for 20-30 yr olds). Definitely 5 stars for me. Would stay here again for the location, quiet rooms, and fantastic beds! (photo I took attached)

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Erik_the_Viking
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3-day stay. My 10-year-old daughter and I were doing a father-daughter Broadway trip. This hotel is nicely designed inside and out, and the great location is self-evident. It is clearly aimed at the 20-40-year-old set, but the staff were delightful in their interactions with my daugher. The big burly too-cool ultra-hip staff always had an extra wink or grin for her, even as they were trying to look cool to the other clients. The service was commendable in all aspects. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to Midtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Exceed all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Times Square for 3 days. Check in was fast and efficent. We got a corner room on the 46th floor with one window that gave us a view of the Times Square tower and the other window of Uptown and the Hershey store. Large for NYC, EXCELLENT BED, and great sound insulation. I could never hear the elevators and our room was right behind them nor could I hear conversations from the room next to us. All the complaints about lack of counterspace or water spilling out into the floor of the bathroom due to the lack of a complete door didn't affect me. PLenty of counter space and water wasn't splashing out. If you need more counter space don't bring a palooza of stuff and if your water spashes out, what are you doing? Flailing your arms? Cab and elevator service were fast and next to the elevators on the floors they have cute little TV's that play MTV but have no sound. Would return again in a heartbeat. Plus you can't beat location like that. (For us it, perfect view, close to subway and literally across the street from where Aida was playing.) A+++++

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Digest
Reviews.Content: Stayed in New York a number of times and would recomend the Hiltons over the W. We normally do not stay in Times Square due to the horrible traffic and touristy shops, ie, Hershey, wax museums you get the picture. The hotel rooms at the W are small, typical of most NYC hotel rooms, it was very clean and the view we had was pretty good, not all rooms have a nice view ask to stay in rooms ending with 12. The rooms even above the 42nd floor were noisy. The heater system was on and did not convert to A/C. This means you had to open your window to the noise of Times Square. The rooms and hallways are dark and are painted gray which gives the place a modern club feel if this is your bag. One of the concierge gentlemen was very helpful, the other needed therapy for his poor attitude. The other staff people were excellent. Towels deliverd to the room were quick. The lobby, as most hotels in times square, is small and crowded. You have to transfer elevators twice to get to your room, check in and the bar is on 7th. The decor of the hotel I would call modern with an edge of tacky, but clean. Most rap stars would consider it classsy. When checking hotel rooms ask for the size of the room by sqare footage, the Hilton Times Square, the Ritz at Battery Park and some of the newer hotels have larger rooms. Stay at central park, upper east side it is much much nicer and you can get to times square if you want to catch a show. Do not use carmel car service, the car into the city was nice the one going out was filthy.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel - Times Square”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a difficult review to write. The hotel on it's own is wonderful. The beds are so comfortable, the rooms a bit small but nice, and we had a tremendous view from our room on the 54th floor. We did not have any problems with any of the staff at the actual hotel, they were friendly and accomodating. We encountered only one problem while we were there. We were blamed for making too much noise and a hotel representative came to the room and was actually quite rude about it. Well, it wasn't our room, we were asleep, it was the next room, we were the ones that made the call! After bringing this to their attention, we were not even given an apology for their staff's behavior and attitude. The problem is with the support or lack their of of the STARWOOD group and their telephone and customer service people. They were terrible, rude, and never addressed some problems we had with the allocation of our STARWOOD Points and a couple of issues. The problem was so bad that my company cancelled our account with them. So beware! Summary: The hotel is nice, good location and comfortable. The staff is good, the support before and after will be nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: MartinShaw
Reviews.Content: W-Hotel Times Square has a fantastic location and for a first time visitor to NY this hotel offered us the complete NY experience. The hotel definitely leans towards the late twenties/thirties age group and has a lively bar in the hotel lobby. The greeting at reception and the help we received with room service was superb and the concierge was extremely helpful and even called through 20 Irish pubs when trying to locate me a place to watch the Ireland v England rugby match at 10am in the morning! The rooms are good sized and the beds are fantastic. My only downside was the bar in the hotel. The girl serving our table actually complained when we only gave her a $4 tip for two drinks! I explained that we were planning on spending the evening in the bar and would probably order 6 or 7 drinks throughout the evening and if she expected us to tip her $4-5 each time then she was mad! I then realise that nobody in NY does anything for you through politeness as everyone is expecting a tip! That really took the shine of an otherwise superb stay

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if you don't mind noise.”
Reviews.Author: marksw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for 4 nights Christmas 04. I was going to stay at the Plazza but after reading reviews on here it was the only hotel i could change to at short notice. Overall it wasn't too bad, i had a average sized corner room looking onto Times Square, my only real complaint about the room is that the walls are paper thin, someone from cali said "good soundproof rooms" i'll guarantee you this hotel has no such thing, you can hear every single word spoken within 10ft of your room, they should supply ear plugs, as it's obviously a young/vibrant location, it would make the rooms far more restfull. The staff were ok, i'm starting to see a trend with usless check in procedures, i emailed and rang ahead of my visit to confirm i would be arriving early from the UK and would like early check in, i was told this would be fine. Arriving at 11:30 am our room wasn't ready unitl 4pm, this would never happen in any hotel that valued their customers. Concierge was unhelpful, the bar was quite good, however they kept reserving most of the seating area every evening for what looked like friends of the security/bar staff. Above all the location is fantastic, taxi's were always outside the Blue Fin restaraunt was very nice, if not over priced, (even for NY). I won't stay here again unless it's for a very good price and i take ear plugs, i feel there's better hotels in NY in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 6 night stay. Got upgraded to a corner room on the 47th floor. Had great views of the river and the skyline on one side. The other side was another hotel. Bathroom seemed to have been a little worn out and the shower did tend to splash out a little (though a floor mat solves the problem). Room itself was an alright size. Bed was a little short for some reason, though really comfortable! Check in staff was very helpful though concierge did seem a little strange stand-offish at times. Bell hops and door men were practically ignoring people. Overall, a great hotel for singles/couples with the buzzing lounges and superb location. I really enjoyed my stay here and would definitely stay here again. The redeeming factor for me was the view, without it I wouldnt know how chuffed I would have been with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Depressing Techno Rave Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My son and I had reservations for 4 nights at the "W" in a "spectacular" room. We arrived at 11:30 am and asked to be placed on a priority check in since we knew we might not be able to check in that early and I informed them we had a 5:30 dinner reservation. ( Check in is 3:00 pm ). I had reserved a non smoking room with 2 double beds 2 months out. The check in clerk said " your room will not be ready until around 2:00pm. We have you in a king size bed "smoking" room. I informed him I had asked for 2 double beds and a non smoking room. He said " Do you have your confirmation that shows proof you had asked for a non-smoking room with 2 double beds ?" I produced my copy of the "W" 's email and it did not state smoking or non-smoking. He said well if you "had" reserved a non-smoking room it would have said so. He said we can move you to a non smoking room tomorrow but you will have to stay in a smoking room tonite. I have never had a desk clerk "question" my integrity and insinutated that I was trying to deceive him !!! This is customer service ? We then spent the next 30 minutes trying to locate a luggage check, since they dont check it for you at the desk. I approached the one person that I saw manning the luggage cart and issuing claim tickets and she said, " Im sorry you will have to wait until I return". She returned 20 minutes later and was mobbed by all the other people waiting in the lobby! Why should it take almost an hour to check your bag? We lfinally checked our bags and went out on the city to have lunch and returned to the hotel at 3:00 pm to find our room not ready. The lobby was filled with about 70 -80 other guests "waiting" for their rooms also. Techno -new wave music blasts 24-7 in the lobby and elevators so much so its very difficult to even hear the check in clerk or concierge. The lobby is one small dark very very loud bar. At 4:15 pm our room was still not ready so I asked to speak to the manager. (It seems they hate when you ask that.) The desk clerk disappeared for about 10 minutes and returned with a reservation for a cheaper room than what I had reserved. I took it. She said that it was a non smoking with 2 double beds and was $289. So at 4:30 pm I finally was able to check in and get dressed for a 5:30 pm dinner reservation. No one offered to show us to our room which is not easy to find given that the corridors walls and ceilings are painted black making it very hard to see where you are going and the room numbers. All weekend we smelled cigarette smoke coming through the adjacent room door and bathroom exhaust. The closet was no more than 2 feet wide ( and this included the ironing bd ) The room was equally small and very dimly lit with no where to open your suit case except the floor. The walls and doors are poor construction. You can hear everything being said in the adjacent room and hallways. The beds are great but what good is that if you cant sleep due to the noise and smell of cigarette smoke ? At check out, they charged me $309 for my room instead of the $289 they had written on my check in card. This is the worst property I have ever stayed in and will never stay in a W hotel anywhere. If this is indicative of the Starwood Properties then I will avoid those too. There are much better and cheaper places in New York that have real "cool" appeal. Try the Chambers Hotel for true cool appeal and an incredible restful sleep and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful buzzy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillHarpenden
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night break in New York staying at the W Hotel Times Square. Fabulous hotel - very buzzy especially at night in the bar on the 7th floor. The hotel was brilliant and the staff could not have been more helpful. The room was a delight - we were on the 33rd floor with a view over part of Times Square and the neon lights. Loved everything about the holiday although our legs were aching with all the walking we did. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be in the centre of Times Square and within walking distances of lots of attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Miro127
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the W Hotel in Times Square. We are from the area (husband works in Manhattan), so this was more of a simple night away from home for us rather than a "big trip to the Big Apple." The room was clean and the staff was friendly. I particularly liked the Bliss bath and body products, the complimentary cotton bathrobe, and the comfy down comforter. If you're from out of town, this is a great location, as you're certainly in the hubbub of it all. Excellent access to all the major tourist attractions. I would recommend this hotel mostly to the younger folk (under 50), as it was a bit trendy and chic, with dark hallways and low lighting in most areas. However, not a major issue at all.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had in New York - and I've stayed around. From the welcome at the entrance to the minute we left, everything was great. The rooms are very nice and the location is perfect. The people were so friendly without being over the top and everytime I saw someone they would say hello and ask how I was. The hotel is very clean and overall a pleasure to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week - the whole experience from start to finish was pretty flawless! Room was big by Manhattan standards and beautifully furnished - I guarantee you will have the best nights sleep of your life in the huge marshmallow beds! Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel has just the right mix of being fashionable and stylish without being pretentious. Breakfast in the adjoining Blue Fin restaurant is a must. And if you want an easy night of people watching with great food, drink and service, start off with cocktails in the 7th floor lobby bar followed by dinner in the 400 seat Blue Fin restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarapup
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the W Times Square twice - once in July, 2004, and a second time in January, 2005. Was very happy both times, and got a great government rate. The front desk staff is very professional and friendly. The rooms are large as NYC goes, and they sample Bliss products, which are fun. The rooms are clean, and the housekeeping staff is vigilant and polite. Concierge quite helpful. There are subway stops all around the hotel, so you can quite easily and quickly get anywhere you might wish to go. There is a 24-hour hot deli right next door, which is great! (Try their breakfast sandwiches - they are wonderful). I agree with the poster who said that this hotel is probably not the best selection for those with children - but this is a great hotel for singles and adults. The bar is hopping! The fitness room is a bit small, but the treadmills and elliptical trainers each have their own tv (although not all were working when we were there), which is a nice diversion. Also, if you become a Starwood Preferred Member (it's free - sign up at the front desk), you can get airline miles, which I use. I will happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I took my wife the NYC for our 10th anniversary. The room was fantastic and the service was great. You have to be careful of some of the concierge recommendations for restaurants. They are more interested in the 'scene' than the cuisine. Rooms this big at this price are hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “W Times Square is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: philatravlr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Times Square 7 times and each and every experience was amazing. I was there most recently from 01.13.05 - 01.17.05. Everything about the hotel is first class. Which is all the more amazing given that it is right in the middle of times square, which at times can border on over-the-top tacky. The rooms are well appointed and extremely comfortable and now feature Bliss bath products. The staff is super friendly and professional. The Living Room bar is very hip and the bartendars are great. Lastly, the Blue Fin has excellent food and is always bustling. Can't think of one negative thing to say about the place other than your best bet on rooms would be to request a room without an adjoing door, these rooms are more sound proof than the ones that have a door adjoining another room. Stay at the W and enjoy. For great dining options in the area, try Marseilles on 44th and 9th, Etcetera Etcetera on 44th between 9th and 8th [this place is brand new and the staff is a blast, espcially Joe] 44 and X on 44th and 10th and Thalia at 49th and 8th. For Bars and Clubs try Xth Avenue Lounge [Tyler rocks], Therapy and Barrage. Xth and Therapy are somewhat mixed, Barrage is mostly gay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: LAGIRL74
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to be in the middle of it all.. nice, BIG soundproof rooms, good service, wonderful ammenities, beautiful bar, it's like being in your own little world right in the middle of it ALL! ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to the New York for my daughters 21st birthday, staying at the 'W' Time Square, and we all agreed it was a wonderfull experience, the Manager, and all members of staff were very helpfull, from booking very good resturants, to giving directions and getting cabs. Its very central for very good eating places / bars, and site seeing, we ate in the Blue Fin, highly reccomended. The beds and pillows were the best ever, also the rooms were very clean and classy, with a good mini bar, I would suggest staying on a high floor, as this gives you less street noise. When we go back to NYC, it will be on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Don't break anything!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, good rooms, service however left a lot to be desired - concierge was rude as were the lobby staff unwelcoming but have to say all the housekeeping staff were excellent, - and if you break anything you will be charged believe me!! So if it happens, get an invoice and check your rights!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having visited New York City on several vacations (and roomed at a different hotel each time), I stayed at the W-Times Square for the first time during my most recent NYC visit (12/19/04 through 12/21/04) and fully endorse the entire W experience. The ambiance – lighting, décor and aroma – is chic yet not gaudy. The employees seem genuine, friendly and quite helpful. The location is superb as most everything generally considered “touristy” (e.g. Theatre District, Radio City, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, Empire State Building, and Times Square) may be reached by walking, which is the best way to see New York anyway. Appropriately, the NYC finale is the return to the tranquility of a peaceful oasis with a well-stocked mini-bar and truly heavenly bed that makes for an exceptionally restful slumber. Definitely a place to lodge at least once, the W-Times Square is the place to which I hope to return for future NYC visits.

Reviews.Title: “The beds are the only good thing about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle92010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W times square from 11-20 thru 11-26. I actually purchased the hotel on Starwood.com, and im a Starwood preferred guest, so I would of thought I would of gotten a better room on a high floor, but I was placed with-in the first 5 floors. The room was small but worth it for the comfortable Heavenly bed. We were the only ones on the floor, except for Wed. night. You could here the neighbors talking the walls are so thin. Needless to say, it was the only night we had neighbors, so I shouldn't be complaining but BEWARE****the walls are very thin at this hotel***** Location was ideal (right in the middle of Times Square), yet one must go thru 2 elevators to get to actual hotel room. 1st elevator brings you to the lobby, and from there you hop on another elevator to get to the room. The staff, doorman, bellhops, were great, as for the reservation check in clerks, they were sooo snobby, it was hysterical. They all acted like they were so refined and well-educated, dressed in their black outfits with little W emblem pins on their shirts/coats....This isn't Broadway, its a hotel!!!!! Oh and might I add, we requested a late check out (we called the previous night...starwood preferred guests get a 4pm late check out upon request) and when we got back to the hotel, we were locked out, and due to this we almost missed our town car to the airport, since we had to get another key made up. Anyway, if the rate is right I might stay here again, solely for the bed which is nice after days of walking.

Reviews.Title: “This is supposed to be a hotel? I thought it was a warehouse!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was, without a doubt, one of the worst W Hotels I've ever stayed at. You enter from Broadway into a small room and take elevators up. The entry-hall way was somewhat beautiful, but this was decieving. The elevator music, to say the least, is intrusive and loud. The lobby, on the 7th floor, is REALLY dark. Its really depressing. The lobby, which is really just a bar, is crowded with drunks who are shouting like no tommarow. Definitely not the place for a family. If you can find the elevators without using a flashlight, you are taken up in a dark elevator to your room. The hallways are painted black and dimily lit, not to mention small (about 7-8ft wide). I would never stay here again! (Stay at the Marriott a block down... Its by far a better hotel).

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisalisa77
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W in mid October. First time in the Big Apple, I couldn't of asked for a better hotel. It was chic, trendy, upbeat, the best hotel I've stayed at anywhere by far! Very boutique and very sophisticated, good-looking people everywhere and definitley the place to be! Cool decor and VERY informative, well dressed concierge staff! I personally enjoy a more boutique like property with a party scene and if you do, this is the place to be. I stayed at the Marriott down the street my last night and was not impressed, not compared the the W Times Square. Rooms were funky and oooh so comfortable and the spa was great! HIGHLY RECOMMEND to the chic clientele only!

Reviews.Title: “W must stand for wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After arriving to the airport in palm beach I realized that I had forgotten my credit card, and had very little cash on me. I knew that the hotel would need a copy of my cc to check in. Once i explained what had happened. The hotel then allowed me to write a check for my three night stay there, then allowed me to write a 200.00 check a day for cash. They saved my life. Not to mention the service was great!!! And the conceirge got me into every trendy club without standing in line. The view was great the room was great. At times I found my self not wanting to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff.. i loved this W!!”
Reviews.Author: placebo_it
Reviews.Content: Don't care about reviews talking about W Times Square as a bad hotel.. try this amazing W and you'll have a wonderful stay!! I loved this hip hotel.. it was my first time in NYC and W is the perfect starting point for a tour of the city! The staff is really kind and helpful, Blue Fin restaurant is definetly tasty (maybe a little pricey, but dining in Times Square is an experience which worth every penny) and the rooms are sooo nice!! I loved the dark colors inside the hotel, the lobby and the music playin' all around the hotel!! Thank you W for making my trip to NYC an unforgettable experience!!

Reviews.Title: “not worth the star rating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a long weekend with some girl friends. It is well located and the bar is good (if noisy and somewhat pretentious). However, for the price ($500 per night) the room was cramped (not unexpected for New York but if there are 3 people sharing you would expect sufficient towels...) and the service was the worst I've ever seen in any hotel anywhere (and I'm including bargain basement hotels in central paris here..). Slow, unable to understand your requirements (we had a booking for 4 people and they tried to put us in a double room). On the plus side, the room was clean, nicely done out and their was sufficient space etc in the bathroom for toiletries (complimentary stuff is very nice). You're paying for the name and location. Better off booking somewhere else where you're not paying for the "image" and attitude

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed overnight on 9/25/04 because we were celebrating my birthday. I totally DISAGREE with all of the negative comments about the hotel. I am originally from Manhattan so I am very familar with what goes on in the Big Apple. Now for starters, if you are a person who is somewhat LAID-BACK, New York City is not the place for you. Perhaps you should consider staying at one of the Sheraton Hotels located a few blocks up on 7th Avenue. Those hotels are very laid-back and cater to the people on business trips or someone wanting a more quiet atmosphere. We previously stated at the Sheraton New York Hotel and Towers and we were BORED. It was just too quiet for us. The W Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square which is visited by thousands of tourist daily. There are so many people everywhere and a lot of energy. Me and my hubby are party people so we enjoyed the energy. We have stayed at several Starwood Hotels and I found the W Times Square to be more elegant and full of ENERGY. The staff is very nice and very attentive to the guest. I loved the decor of hotel as well as the room. I was impressed by the decor in the room as soon as I opened the door. The room has unique decor with beveled mirrors and a kingsize bed with comfortable pillows and a goosedown comforter. We slept so good after dinner and a show at Caroline's Comedy Club. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who loves the party scene. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Targets the >35 Crowd”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Crystal chandeliers, polished marble floors, and heavy draperies do not exist here. If you want these, choose the St. Regis. The W is simple, sleek, and refreshing from the potted grass near the entrance to the cascading sheet of water in the elevator lobby. Black, white, silver, and grey furnishings would be admittedly dull if not for multicolored mood lighting everywhere in the lobby and large windows that frame the NY skyline. Modest-sized rooms, typical of New York, feel more spacious at this hotel thanks to a mirrored wall behind the bed in each room. As for the "open" shower, mine was actually enclosed by thick glass doors. What sets this hotel apart from many are the youthful amenities in the rooms. My room had a DVD player AND a VHS as well as a cd player with jazz collection. Silver pencils, compact pens, and sticky notes with a "W" punched out could be found on the glass and steel desk. Besides the typical minibar, a full drawer was stocked with everything from a W umbrella and camera to W thongs and a variety of munchies. Perhaps the best thing about this hotel was its "newness" with none of that typical stuffy odor so frequently found at hotels. If you're young, hip, and adventuresome, you'll fall in love with the W. More traditional types will find plenty of other alternatives in NY.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say this hotel is great. The staff, location, room, and bar were all excellent. Most of the negative comments I have read from other people on this site are from people being overly picky. I have stayed at great hotels all throughout the world and this one is great. It is not the Four Seasons, but for the price (I paid $164 a night) it is very nice. Once we checked in they gave us a free upgrade to a spectacular room. I highly suggest requesting room 3501 if you want a king size bed. It has a GREAT view of Times Square as well as the Hudson River. The rooms are a great size for NY. I have stayed at the Hudson hotel and those rooms are closets compared to the rooms at the W. The work area is great if you are going for business. Overall, this place lived up to the expectations and I really enjoyed the great service from the staff, however, I would have to say the concierge staff was not up to par with the rest of the staff. The front desk and the gentlemen at the front door are great.

Reviews.Title: “Edgy!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not my speed but it was a great experience. My rooms were directly accross from the elevator and I never heard it once. I stayed in both a king and 2 doubles. The rooms were fresh, clean and a very decent size. The plastic desk desk chair is not the most comfortable nor is the upholstered chair, but the beds are terrific. Kudos to the staff, their appearance is that of a typical New Yorker clad in black but they are awesome. The valet parking at first appeared steep, but relative to the area it is worth the few extra dollars for the convenience. Word of caution, in case you didn't know, the electronics stores around times square are scam artists and your best bet is not to go in.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have chosen a little more carefully”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I brought my mom to NYC for the first time and wanted a hotel that was nice and close to the action. It was definitely close to the action and a great location (all the theaters are right around the corner and the circle line tour bus begins its tour here), but I was not really impressed with that much else. Trendy to say the least. There must have been a rap or def jam award ceremony or concert or something there, because the hotel was full of guys with lots of gold jewelry with their pants down to their knees and lots of pimped out cars and trucks. Not the hotel's fault, but when you go for trendy - be prepared. We went for the "Spectacular" room and both laughed when we saw the room, because we couldn't figure out what was so spectacular! NOT WORTH THE $ for the UPGRADE. There was NO ROOM to even walk around. The breakfast we ordered arrived on a table that wouldn't even fit past the entryway! We had to improvise a place to eat on the bed (one item at a time). There is no place in the bathroom to put anything, so be prepared to get dressed and put on your make-up in the room - somewhere - good luck. The lighting is so dim, and the walls are so dark that its hard to see anything. A few positive things: I can say is that the bedding was incredible. The feather bed, down comfortor and pillows made for a sound, restful sleep. The aveda products in the bathroom are nice. The service was great. I however, would not choose this hotel again. I would go for one of the other W hotels in town.....

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at three different W hotels, and I must say that I have been repeatedly disappointed. Given what is pictured on their website, I had higher expectations. Of course, it is safe to assume that they feature their nicest rooms online. At this particular W, there were HUGE bubbles of paint pulling away from the wall in the bathroom, I would assume this may be due to not having any sort of fan to rid the closet, posing as a bathroom, of steam. Lets just say that you don't have any privacy, as the bathroom walls are constructed of what seems to be a fogged PVC plastic, and if this is your first travel experience with a boyfriend/girlfriend...well you figure the rest out. And, though rooms are typically small in NYC hotels, this was bigger than most for a deluxe room. I do agree that they didn't use the space very well, in that you don't really have adequate space for a closet or any room to place anything anywhere else in the room because of the bulkiness of the low dresser which holds the tv. I thought the decor was terrible, and bordering on motel. The beds were comfortable as to be expected, however the decorative pillows on the bed were sort of scary, in that they appeared to be badly stained by who knows what. The lobby level was very nice/funky (which I dig); however, the halls are beyond dark, and good luck if you have the slightest vision impairment, black hallways with dim light doesn't mesh well. I must say, however, that the staff service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Entry Level Boutique Experience”
Reviews.Author: Seadevi
Reviews.Content: This hotel does live up to its 4 star rating and the W brand. I would rather stay at the Millennium Broadway Hotel two blocks away and save myself $100/night for a comparable experience. Celebratory things about the hotel include comfortable bed, stylish fixtures, and modern colors and design. The central location is both a curse and a blessing. Most locations were a 20 minute cab ride away and for longer trips, it was easy to take the subway - since all the major subways have stops at Times Square. The drawback however is that times square is beseiged by tourists night and day. Also, if you occupy one of the middle floors and draw your blinds, animated graphics and neon pelt you at every turn. The lobby bar was stylish but uninviting. Room Service was courteous, reliable, and the cuisine was tasty. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms were extremely small - but this is typical of Manhattan hotels. The wireless broadband service was on the fritz when I stayed there last week, though the wired broadband connection in my room worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated already”
Reviews.Author: Mike55129
Reviews.Content: The decor that must have been cool and trendy in the early 90's now seems dated. The W is showing its age. But the bar is still hopping!

Reviews.Title: “A reality check - this is not great”
Reviews.Author: koalahead
Reviews.Content: I wanted something special for a stay in NY. I lived in NY for 2 years, and have visited maybe 50 times in the past 15 years or so (staying in most Sheratons, Westins, St-Regis, Best Westerns, Days Hotel, W Hotels, Howard Johnson, Hilton etc). So as a visitor and resident, I think I know NY better than the average bear. The location in Times Sq is good - however it can be TOO close and in-your-face at times. The hotel was expensive, and I expected something special - unfortunately what I got was much, much less. The room was very small (that's not just NY - I expect it there - but for the price I expected a hell of a lot more), and the soundproofing terrible. That is probably my main gripe. The gap under the doors (main and particularly adjoining doors) is large, and allows complete transmission of noise. Imagine you have just flown into NY from Sydney, HK or London, and you want to sleep. Well no way, because each voice, TV channel etc. is so clearly audible that you can join in the conversations. And I mean, you can hear EVERY single word clearly. This includes conversations outside as people wait for the elevator, walk past the room, or the staff use their mobile phones (they mustn't be able to use them elsewhere except when away from managements prying eyes). I did complain - and they were well aware of the door gap / poor materials and noise problems and said that a renovation was overdue. This is a fairly new hotel - just what were they thinking ? Also, the reception area is also a bar - which might as well be Grand Central Station or Times Square inside your lobby. Seriously, there are hundreds (no exaggeration) of noisy drinkers there in the evening all crowded in. You have to shout at the reception staff to be understood. In a nutshell, never again. It may be trendy, but I think W Hotels really take the mickey out of you - charge you heaps and underdeliver. Don't be deceived in thinking you are trendy. By all means visit the bars downstairs at street level, but leave the hotel lobby bar and the hotel itself alone. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “For party-hard Brits”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My partner and I enjoyed a short break in NYC over the Easter period and upgraded to a W suite that had jaw-dropping view over the Times Square area. The staff were extremely courteous, particularly the door-men who were also on hand to assist. The rooms weren't exactly pristine but the lobby bar is a fantastic place to relax with drinks. Couldn't fault the Blue Fin restaurant either. However, the concierge service was definitely lacking - especially in a hotel that supposedly prides itself on getting what you want, when you want it. An example being the woefully sparse CD collection - we gave them three choices but none were available. Also, avoid the night club - overcrowded, banal crowd embarassed by the other amazing places in town. Would recommend the W to a young, hip couple who want to party in a central NYC location. Just don't believe ALL the hype.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel in Times Square”
Reviews.Author: Annabelle1116
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W Hotel in Times Square in May, 2004. It was fabulous! Very modern, very classy. I picked this hotel because it was in the heart of Times Square and it's location turned out to be excellent. Everything was within walking distance. We had a wonderful time at this hotel and were quite impressed with the cleanliness and stylish decor. The beds were very comfortable. Found plenty of restaurants in the area that were priced right. Would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a luxury hotel that's in the middle of all the action. Noise was not a problem. Pick a higher floor. Bathroom had a tub, not a shower so the floor getting wet was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familyoffour1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights beginning May 14/04. We chose it because of the location (across the street from TKTS, and near lots of theatres). The decor is certainly different than typical hotels. My husband enjoyed the "funkiness" but I was less impressed. The room they initially gave us was very noisy, so they moved us to a higher floor (44th, an accessible room) which was better. The furniture needed painting and the bathroom had no counter to put anything on. The sink even had nowhere to put the soap, so it kept falling into the sink! Don't they think of these things? The room was a bit dark. The service was okay, but the concierge we asked for help was not overly helpful. Overall I was not impressed. We also stayed at the Westin Essex House for 3 nights for only slightly more money and it was much more luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “A different type of hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrea
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this property in December. The bed was simply heaven! However, I would of prefered a bathroom with some room to store my personal belongings. The shower had no door therefore water ended up all over the floor. Was quite uncomfortable as the "frost glass divider" and not a wall divided the bathroom from the bedroom area. Hey, I am used to my privacy without anyone having to see my silhouette as I utilize the restroom. We ordered room service which was quite expensive, but it was a nice change. Overall it was clean, but did not like the black walls throughout the entire hotel. It as though they went so high tech that they forgot about convenience.

HotelInfo.Name: W New York - Times Square
HotelInfo.Address: 1567 Broadway at 47th St, New York City, NY 10036
